Reviews.Title: “Another fantastic stay, always glad to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Slowhand1527
Reviews.Content: Stayed from a Wednesday through Sunday and have nothing but praise for this hotel. The staff always take great care of me and I am able to get a wonderful room. Any events scheduled here work out great. All of the staff, valets, guest services, and even those who run the snorkel booth are so inviting to their guests and helpful. I got some good tips on visiting the North Shore which were wonderful. I'll be back again next year if at all possible and already looking forward to it again.

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a Life Time.”
Reviews.Author: Doxa1
Reviews.Content: We just where there with our two daughters in August and it was a trip of a life time. The hotel was very clean and tranquil. We did not spent a lot of time in the hotel as our fantastic valets told us all the local spots to eat, tour, hike and where to get puffy's. The valets were the absolute best!!! The down side, absolutely no night life. The pool bar closes at 8 and the bar tender made sure you knew he was doing you a favor by getting you a drink at 7:45. This happened two nights in a row. The disney hotel was hopping so we slipped in over there. We had 2 beautiful rooms, private safe lagoon with sea turtles that swam with you and a monk seal posing for pictures that made our trip relaxing and exciting at the same time. Our daughers who are 17 and 21 could not believe what a great time they had from skydiving to jumping off the rock formations in the North Shore. FYI rent snorkling equipement in the city for the week it will save you money and you will have them for the impromptu stop along the way. Overall I don't think I will ever have another vaction that will be this magical again.

Reviews.Title: “They remembered after 2 1/2 years”
Reviews.Author: billyjeanne
Reviews.Content: Knew exactly which room we were in 2 1/2 years ago. Well maintained and staffed. Especially Stephanie by the pool and Rachael at the bar. Special thank you to Jana who seemed to be everywhere and doing everything. Remembered us for the entire time were there and arranged for cookies the night before we left. Have to admit we were somewhat concerned with Disney next door. Try the north section of the hotel, but we had absolutely zip problems while there. Worth every penny spent in many ways. Look forward to our return. Hopefully soon, but NJ to HA is a long one.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it better than I thought I would”
Reviews.Author: JLFERG
Reviews.Content: I was afraid when my husband booked this it would be too crowded with families with small children. We were using points for a free night and I was pleasantly surprised by the size and location of our room and how quiet it was. The rooms are tastefully appointment with a kind of Key West vibe (plantation shutters, a giant lanai, wooden ceiling fan) and a huge (two sinks on separate sides of the room) bathroom with large sunken tub, separate glass shower, and water closet for the toilet. We had a view of the surrounding hills, which in my opinion is better than the pool view. This hotel has decent restaurants; a fascinating water feature full of stingrays, hammerhead sharks, sea cucumbers, starfish, and colorful fish; and a relaxing lounge. A paved walking path along the ocean is a great place to exercise and to watch the sun set.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: nursewebb
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a full week from 26th Aug til 2nd of September. We were upgraded to an ocean view view and were more than impressed on arrival to our room. With a large lanai that included table seating for two and a sun lounging chair. A large bedroom with two double beds (would have been awesome if they were queen) a mini lobby area and a very large bathroom. Not since the Ritz Carlton in Naples have we been so impressed with the elegance of a room and hotel vibe :) They have just upgraded to digital tv so the selection of channels was not so good. Was excited to see HBO listed in tv guide but was not available (finale of True Blood) Fast internet but not cheap, complimentary in the lobby and lovely seating available for this. Complimentary at the pool and lagoon too (wifi taps into Disneys free wifi) Agree with previous reviewer in regard to Spa calling daily to offer specials, was never there when they called but wasnt necessary. Husband used fitness facility once and said was better than most with 6 treadmills and other equipment, Tennis courts also avail. but not used. Pool side food and drinks reasonably priced. Pool not overcrowded like the Disney resort seemed to be. Didnt eat at the restaurants but def would not recommend the hawaiian bbq available across the road at the local stores. Taco place was ok and reasonable price. Check out the weekend special for car rental at Hertz (on site) if you didnt rent a car already. I would definately rent a car if came to stay out in Ko Olina area again as there isnt much happening out there. Staff were all helpful and friendly particularly the servers at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: ejhnsn20
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with a private lagoon was just the way to go for the first leg of our honeymoon. My husband upgraded our room and we ended up on the 17th floor with a fantastic balcony view overlooking the lagoon and ocean. The room was great with a huge bathroom, separate shower and tub, toilet separated by a door. We had more than enough space and the balcony also had a sitting area with couch. The hotel is next door to the Disney resort but wasn't a bother because I think most families stayed in the pool area there, however, that's not to say there wasn't a lot going on. Great walking paths around the lagoon and the additional three that connect to it. There was not a lot to choose from as far as restaurants in the near area of the hotel so mainly stayed at the resort. The food was good, breakfast was the usual buffet, we did the healthy start for $18 a piece each day. My only gripe would be the seafood buffet on Saturday night for $50 each. This was ok, however, when we got up for breakfast the next morning at the same restaurant it was like looking at leftovers from the night before (even the dessert was out). Probably something a lot of restaurants do but it couldn't have been more obvious and it was going for 5 bucks cheaper... Just not my cup of tea. The hotel is definitely off the beaten path so something to take into consideration if you plan on staying here. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay here and the staff, mainly Jan, was very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “THE STAFF AT JW IS AWESOME!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: solrock
Reviews.Content: I am sorry I took so long to write this review. I came with the fast enterprise group back in May this year and it was most of us first trip to hawaii and we had a ball. Big up to the mgmt for accommodating us while we were there. I would like to make mention of some workers(hope they are still there) who made my trip great. Emily from the Pool and beach team had the smile to make your day right. She was always nice to talk with. Carlene was the first person I met and was a good hostess, she also worked pool and beach. Yuko from the concierge displayed top customer service. She has a never so no attitude to the guest and she is a number one marriott/ritz carlton ambassador. Rory the food and beverage supervisor is a world class worker. Has a supervisor he was very active in every area. It was a pleasure to see rory work. He seemed to have the respect of his staff and they all support him whether it was pool and beach or the bar. Kudos, high five and First class to Rory. Taz is also a good contribution to the poolside entertainment. Thanks once again for making my vacation awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful First Class Hotel in West Oahu....”
Reviews.Author: Kesslane
Reviews.Content: Beautiful elegant, understated, but high-end hotel. Great service. Quiet, beautiful beach. Next to the new Disney Hotel so you can go to the character breakfast if you want. Staff was very responsive. Shark pool which the kids will love!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, classy resort away from the chaos in Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: NWTraveler25
Reviews.Content: A great hotel for travelers looking for a true resort-like experience on the island of Oahu. Although it's a great place for kids and families, it doesn't feel chaotic whatsoever. The Ihilani Resort is located 20 miles west of Honolulu in the recently developed Ko'Olina Resort area. Although most Oahu tourists stay in the Waikiki area because of its reputation and central location, I feel that the Ihilani (and other Ko'Olina resorts) offer a more relaxed environment away from the chaos. Some may be weary of its location, but the hotel is actually conveniently located to almost everything you need. The hotel is near a private beach, across the street from a shopping plaza that has a local grocery store (that doesn't rip you off), has a spa on site, and a golf course nearby. It is also located next to the Paradise Cove Luau, which is another place worth visiting if you want to experience a typical Hawaiian luau. And as long as you don't travel during the weekday work rush hours, traveling into Honolulu is only 30 minutes away. I feel it's definitely a better value for what you pay for as opposed to staying in Waikiki where all the prices are hiked up for hotels that are much lower quality. The hotel itself is very classy and clean. The grounds are beautiful filled with ponds that house a variety of animals including sting rays and baby hammer head sharks. The room we had was modernized and quite spacious. Even though we were on the 4th floor, we still got a great view of the ocean. I also suggest getting a room with a lanai so you can enjoy the sunrise/sunset from the comfort of your room. There's some renovation going on throughout the property, but I believe most of the rooms have already been renovated. One key factor to note is that the beach located right outside of the hotel is very clean and not as crowded as other public beaches throughout the island. The beach is actually 1 of 4 man-made lagoons in the Ko'Olina area (Lagoon #1). Although all of the lagoons are open to the public, there is only one major parking lot for beach-goers located near lagoon #4. Therefore, the majority of the public goes to Lagoons 3 and 4. Thus, with the Ihilani being located near lagoon #1 (shared with the Disney Aulani Resort next door), the majority of the people at the beach are fellow hotel guests from one of the two resorts. In addition, you are also able to rent kayaks, paddle boards, and snorkel gear nearby if you want to enjoy some activities as well. I know that the term "man-made" may sound like a turn-off for some, but it really doesn't feel man-made at all. You get an authentic beach experience similar to any other beach you are looking to visit in Waikiki. It's not a bad thing, especially if you have kids because you have the piece of mind that the beach is safe and less dangerous than other areas around the island. Unfortunately I didn't get a chance to go golfing or visit the spa, but the golf course is within close proximity and the spa is on site. The restaurant is a great place for breakfast (they are known for their malasadas or aka "Portuguese donuts"). However, there is a small shopping plaza conveniently located across the street with an ABC Country Market and a couple of restaurants. The ABC Market actually reminds me of a mini grocery store that also sells sundries and Hawaiian gifts to take back with you. Amazingly, the ABC Market does not hike up its prices even though its the only market in the Ko'Olina resort area. I know the prices may seem unreasonable, but cost of living is high everywhere you go in the island because of the shipping costs that get passed to the consumers/residents. I usually don't give 5's across the board, but this hotel exceeded my expectations. Being a Starwood loyalist, I usually hesitate when I have to venture outside of the Starwood family. However, the service was great, the atmosphere was outstanding, and I feel I got great value for what I paid for. I highly recommend this place to any travelers looking for a relaxing resort-like experience. I do have one suggestion to management. The beach area does feel segregated between the Ihilani guests and Aulani guests. The segregation is not so much of a problem, but it does seem like the Aulani guests are the "have's" and the Ihilani guests are the "have-not's" when it comes to the cabanas and beach chair setups. I know the Disney Aulani resort is a new resort, but Disney does make it a point to make their guests feel "elite" even on the public lagoon. I suggest upgrading your cabanas and beach chairs and maybe even adding more to the beach. When you are in the ocean and look towards the hotels, the "Ihilani side of the beach" seems sparse compared to the "Disney Aulani side of the beach." Don't sell yourself short or make your guests feel like they are getting a "lesser experience" than the guests next door. The Ihilani Hotel is actually much more classy and it should feel that way even on the beach. It's not a big issue, but I do worry that guests will start comparing the Ihilani to the Disney Aulani Resort next door and that would be unfair because the Disney resort is the new shiny object, but does not really hold up to the Ihilani when you take a closer look.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a quiet area”
Reviews.Author: Robin T
Reviews.Content: Just what you would expect from a JW Marriott: beautiful hotel, excellent service, high (but not unreasonable) prices. We (Dad, Mom, 14-year-old son) spent five wonderfully relaxing nights at this hotel. The room was spacious and the views were lovely. Ko Olina is a rather remote area, and you will definitely want a car to get around, as there are only a few large hotels/timeshares in this location, and no independent restaurants or stores. There can be some noise from the Disney resort next door for a couple of hours some nights, but generally this is a very quiet area. The pool is relatively small and boring for such a nice hotel, but that is a minor complaint, especially with a beach a few steps away. I recommend the Hokule'a bar for reasonably priced evening meals.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond my expectations”
Reviews.Author: mahika33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from staying at the JW Marriott for 5 nights while celebrating our 27th year anniversary. After reading a few of the reviews, we were concerned in choosing this resort to spend our anniversary at. However, it surpassed our expectations. It was a marvelous resort. Just like many others have stated on their reviews, the room and bathroom was huge for a standard room. I am a very picky person when it comes to where I stay, and I was so well pleased with it. Everyone we encountered at our stay was just awesome. The moment we checked in we were greeted by a traditional Hawaiian aloha by the valet and it never stopped. We had a great experienced checking in and was even offered an upgrade by a sweet man whose name I think was Jason. He let us look at the each room before we picked the room we wanted. I must also mentioned all those complaints about noise from the Disney resort is insane. We never could hear anything. We even walked in front of that resort and still couldn't hear noise. The lagoon area was great and was never full. The only drawback to staying at this resort is the traffic to deal with when wanting to go to Wakiki. I am from Dallas, so i really did not want to fight traffic on my vacation. Lol.... However, to rebuke that one complaint i must mention it seems to be closer to the North Shore then driving it from Wakiki. So it really is a trade off for us since we go to both of them while visiting Oahu. Honestly, I could keep going on and on about all the great things this resort has to offer. I know we will definitely stay here again when coming to Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place!”
Reviews.Author: Juan C
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I were sent to Ko Olina for work, and I booked our stay at Ihilani. Ko Olina Resort is amazing! The staff and service at JW Marriott was top notch. Upon checking in to the hotel, our room preference (2 beds) couldn't be met, but the young lady at the front desk upgraded us to an ocean-view room with a free roll away for our 3 day trip. While we waited for our room to be made up, we had lunch at the Poolside Grill and Bar. The food was delicious once we were finally attended to. For dinner later that evening we ventured over to Ushio-Tei. Service there was top-notch! We were greeted and sat by a friendly (and beautiful) hostess, our server was attentive and gave suggestions. We opted for the dinner buffet and it was quite good at a fair price. My favorite part of the trip became breakfast which we enjoyed everyday at Naupaka Terrace. Service was great and price was more than fair. Throughout the course of our stay I visited Poolside Grill for drinks and we visited Hokule'a in the evening for nightcaps. I enjoyed jogs to the marina and back at dawn and then the resort's fitness center for weights. Great location and beautiful setting guarantee I'm going back next year!

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott's Jr. Suite better than our Ko'Olina villa experience”
Reviews.Author: sassypowers
Reviews.Content: LOVED this beautiful resort. It's simply gorgeous everywhere you look, and yes, I've stayed at JW's in DC, Times Square NY, Orlando and Miami FL, California, Las Vegas, and Charlotte NC. There are several restaurant choices, all of them very good, with the buffet one average. the bar drinks and servers were better than the Maui Marriott Ocean Club or the Ko Olina Beach Club which were also part of this same aug. 2012 visit. We were upgraded to a jr suite due to rewards status for a small fee, and if I had SEEN this suite prior to arrival, I would have chosen to stay here instead of the Ko Olina Beach Club Villas the remainder of that week. The two resorts are within walking distance to each other, with the disney auilani's hotel in between as well as a few beach coves with gorgeous lava rock formations and crashing waves out at sea. This hotel has a beautiful main entry common "lounging" area, and business cafe to work or catch up with email/facebook where you're almost outdoors. there were several locations of fish, palms, flowers, including small hammerheads, tropical fish, star fish, and stingrays. the room overlooked these areas, with abundance of trees/birds beyond them, and the beach beyond the trees. The room also had screen slider, wooden shutters, and glass slider for three options. the beaches/coves are so clean and beautifully landscaped, with truly GORGEOUS views. we saw fish and sea turtles with our snorkeling equipment (destined for Maui after visiting Pearl Harbor). Azul restaurant was our favorite. Food and service at Azul was awesome. Everyone in this hotel was accommodating and friendly, and the check in had especially fantastic staff, again, better than our MVC experience at Ko Olina Beach Club later that week. This jr. suite is absolutely huge, with two double queens, two small chaise chairs, two huge flatscreens, desk, and the bathroom was bigger than my master bath at home. there was a dressing area with two gigantic closets and a privacy door to both the rest of bathroom and the rest of suite. then the bath itself followed after that with two separate sinks (his and hers) beautiful tiled showers and bath and water closet separate. I loved this hotel stay, it's location, it's ammenities, views, landscape, and facilities (I visited the fitness area, spa, and basketball on 6th floor of a completely separate building). the jr suite is like 700 square feet.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel we expected”
Reviews.Author: TaraQu
Reviews.Content: This is one of the very few beach resorts in Honolulu if you want to be away from the crowd at Waikiki Beach. It is an adult resort and the Disney Resort next door is for kids. It is quite far away from the airport comparing with the hotels at Waikiki. The fare was $80 each way.

Reviews.Title: “Second time at the JW Ko Olina, good not great”
Reviews.Author: sandnsun61
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had stayed at the Ihilani back in 2006 and liked it so much, we decided to return for my 50th Birthday in December 2011. The rooms have been updated and we had a wonderful view of the ocean and thankfully, NOT Aulani. Although we had a lovely room, it was plagued with ants in the bathroom and entryway. We did notify the hotel but the ants never went away. Not a deal breaker given we were in the tropics, but it was annoying never the less. Otherwise, the room was spacious and the coffee maker a welcome addition. Lastly, the staff was very responsive and we had wonderful prompt service throughout our stay. The grounds are still nice but many areas are showing their age. Aside from that, the arrival of Aulani is a big negative. Aulani is big, brown, massive and very un-Hawaiian. If we had been in a room overlooking that brown monstrosity, I would have requested a move. Ko Olina used to be a nice retreat from the hectic Waikiki area but now, not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management and Grumpy Employees”
Reviews.Author: Ben G
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Ihilani Resort and Spa for many years, and the management has done a poor job of keeping up with the times, The rooms have become worn out and a bit grungy. The food in the restaurants haven't changed in years, and has gone down hill. The employees especially in the restaurant and pool area have become grumpy and uninspired. Yet, they continue raise there prices with no improvement in the in rooms, food and service. We are now looking at Disney next door.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great escape from Waikiki congestion”
Reviews.Author: IrelandfanUsa
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another trip to HI and our 2nd stay at the Ihilani. It is a lovely and gracious escape from Waikiki's intensity but still on Oahu and close enough to tour the island's many attractions, i.e., Pearl Harbor, the north shore, ECG.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for couples, not so hot for kids”
Reviews.Author: RoadWearyWoman
Reviews.Content: The property is beautiful and well-located, now sharing a private lagoon with the new Disney resort. We got a complimentary upgrade and had a stunning room overlooking the pool and ocean. The one drawback was learning that they had JUST cancelled the kids club. Our five-year old had fun, but there were no other kids his age to play with. Other than that, it's a perfect romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Chargers_rule
Reviews.Content: Hotel is away from the busy and crazy Waikiki area. We did not have any issues with the noise from the Disney Hotel nor did hear about anyone else complain out it. Pool area was a little small however my kids never complained and that is the most important to me. A little known fact the hotel has a toy chest full for toys for the kids to use at the pool and beach. Hotel rooms were big and clean, No issues that I can remember, Would I stay here again? YES however I prefer staying on the island of Maui

Reviews.Title: “Great property!”
Reviews.Author: TNTBAMA
Reviews.Content: Staying in Ko Olina was a great decision on our visit to Oahu! This location is great for families not interested in staying near the chaos of Waikiki. Our room at the JW Marriott was much roomier than we expected. We loved how quiet it always was, and the views at sunset were amazing! Lots of photo opportunities by the ocean at this property. The beds were comfortable, and the bathroom was huge! My wife loved the sitting area outside the bathroom that she claimed as her hair and makeup spot. The balcony was great, and my kids enjoyed the room's technical amenities (all lights could be controlled from the room's VOIP phone). The staff was wonderful, even handing out free snacks/drinks/treats to our kids at the pool. The fitness center was small but stocked with many weight machines. There was a lap pool, tennis courts, and basketball courts as well (tennis rentals were reasonable for some family fun). Parking was pretty steep but secure. TIP: Disney's Aulani Resort is next door within easy walking distance! We walked all around the Disney property and took pictures, had our photo made several times with Disney characters, ate lunch there once, and did the character breakfast. We bought some souveniers and had a great time at the Disney property without the expense of paying twice as much because we stayed next door at the JW! For those with families, I highly recommend walking over to get photos made and have a meal or two at the Aulani Resort. All the more reason why I definitely recommend staying at this JW Marriott property...

Reviews.Title: “WHY DO PEOPLE LIE ABOUT THIS RESORT”
Reviews.Author: TONY O
Reviews.Content: I paid for one of the best rooms in this resort . I paid for it upfront one I get to the hotel and they had booked the wrong room. Luckily I had printed up my receipt which clearly showed what room I paid for. The room was great but the phone on the desk never worked . After 3 times complaining about it I finally explained to them the battery it was a cordless phone was probably dead and needed to be replaced. The worst part of the hotel was the DISNEY RESORT next to it . EVERY NIGHT they had some sort of outdoor concert . If your looking for a peaceful quiet vacation THIS IS NOT THE RESORT FOR YOU!!!!!!! I will NEVER come back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful; it that is what you seek”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGuy2000
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. The rooms are huge and the views fantastic. Our family stayed here one night until our kids, 6 yo girl and 9 yo boy demanded that we move next door tempted by the Disney Resort facilities. And there lies the tip if you are a family. Buffet dinner and breakfast were very good. Great for a night or two or for a quiet escape from Honolulu at the end of a Hawaiian holiday. Easy 25 drive to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Where you can get away from the craziness that is Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: midori_puppy
Reviews.Content: This is definitely one of the most luxurious hotels that I have EVER been at. As you enter the hotel there is a revolving door with a really cool sculpture in the middle. Then as you leave the lobby there are the pools of fish, manta rays, and sharks. The hotel room was BEAUTIFUL and like all the other reviews the bathroom is HUGE. There was a sink on either side of the bathroom. There was a shower and then a bathtub beside it. The shower was pretty big with a shelf you could sit on. Lol, I don’t think that I have seen a sewing kit in a bathroom in forever. They had one in the Ihilani bathroom. The lanai was HUGE as well. As you enter the lanai. Ours had a table and 2 chairs to the left and a couch to the right. There was room for another table as well. Very spacious. The couch was huge, You could probably fit 4 maybe 5 people on it. The cushions were quite comfy as well. We got an ocean view room and WOW the view was breathtaking. I would LOVE to wake up to that view every morning. The lagoon was awesome. You share it with the Aulani and the Marriot Vacation Villas or something but there is a TON of space and even though there were lots of people, there was room for everyone and you didn’t feel crowded. If you head into deeper water, there is a man made reef where you will find lots of fish and turtles. The first day we went, the water was calm and perfect for snorkeling. The second day the water was more rocky and therefore it was hard to see the fish. On top of the that, the sand was soft and not full of rocks that will hurt your feet like the rocks at the beach in Waikiki. The pool was okay. On the small side, you aren’t going to get much exercise swimming from 1 end to the other. The 2 containers of water with pineapple and grapefruit was always full and nice and cold. The only other downside was that we were a group of 2 adults and 2 children and they gave us a room with a king bed. So we had to request a rollaway which was a twin side, so still 1 child still had to sleep in the bed with us. I really would have liked to have a room with 2 beds but oh well. If you want to get away from the craziness of Waikiki, this is where you should head. It was nice and quiet and yes there was a lot of people but not AS much as you will find at Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel away from the city”
Reviews.Author: quirkygal
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have been visiting the lagoons at Ko'Olina as day trips since she was little. It was our second time staying 2 nights at the JW Marriott Ihilani Resort and Spa, and all I can say is that I would have liked to stay longer! We stayed in an ocean-front room and the room itself was absolutely beautiful! The beds were so luxurious and the bathroom was lovely, with a soaker tub and separate shower and a room for the toilet. The lanai was large and private, overlooking the lagoon and giving us a wonderful view of the ocean. The fruit boat with warm banana bread at Naupaka Terrace is delicious! We ate burgers for lunch at the Poolside Bar and Grill, and it was decent, and sushi for dinner at Ushio-Tei. While there, we had a fabulous time at the spa and we participated in some of the many on-site activities. During the morning aqua-jog in the lagoon, we were delighted to get to swim with a sea turtle! We had to check out the new Aulani Resort, and I must say that Disney has once again done a fabulous job and it is certainly a destination for a family with young children. While some reviews complained about the noise, it wasn't an issue for us, and the only noise we heard was from the neighboring luau close to the finale. If you are going to Ko'Olina, keep in mind that it is a self-contained resort area removed from the city. If you are expecting an abundance of shopping and restaurants, staying in Waikiki is the way to go. Ko'Olina is a perfect place for a peaceful getaway to enjoy relaxation and sun. My only disappointment was that we had to leave far too soon...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful honeymoon destination”
Reviews.Author: Jared J
Reviews.Content: I went here with my new wife on our honeymoon. The service was excellent and I enjoyed every minute of our trip. Things are slightly expensive here such as parking, but I feel like that just comes with Hawaii and the fact that this is such an upscale resort. I look forward to the next time I am able to come to Hawaii as this resort has sealed my love for this state!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - "Meh" Resort area”
Reviews.Author: newsanchor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two nights, June 29 - July 1, for a two-day run through Oahu before heading for a longer stay on Maui. We chose the Ihilani because Waikiki doesn't appeal to us, and we wanted to take a peek at the Disney Aulani resort next door. The Ihilani resort was quiet and beautiful, with huge, well-appointed rooms. We were bumped up to an ocean view without being charged because the front desk clerk originally put us in a room that we THINK was already occupied. For some reason, the dead bolt was on the door, so we returned to the front desk and were moved to a better room. We had a chance to stroll the grounds and sit by the lagoon for a bit, and found everything to be beautiful. It's clear the Disney resort next door kind of overwhelms what must have once been a quiet, isolated Ihilani experience. It wasn't really that way any more. Lots of action through the day in the lagoon that is shared with Disney, and lots of noise coming from next door, too! Still, the Ihilani delivered a 5 star experience. The reason we only give it a four-grade is that Ko Olina itself was pretty - well - lame. If you want to eat there, the choices are extremely limited... Pretty much just the expensive hotel offerings. The tiny shopping center across the street is half-empty, with nothing for tourists but an ABC Convenience store, a taco place and an ice cream shop. There is also apparently a Roy's Restaurant on the property, but that's it. Shopping is non-existent. You can drive a few minutes down the road and find all sorts of chain restaurants in Kapolei, but if you're looking for variety, or even much in the way of character, Ko Olina is not the place to find it.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience you can count on!”
Reviews.Author: Maggie C
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to this property. The first time was with just me and my husband, and this last time was with our teenage boys. We stayed here for 3 nights after 5 nights in Waikiki. The bustling Waikiki experience I think is a must for all teens...but a perfect compromise is ending the trip here. A lot has been made of the noise from the Disney resort Aulani next door and I was a bit apprehensive about it because when I stayed here previously it was so peaceful and relaxing. However, I didn't find there to be much of any difference. Yes you can hear some of the festivities from the resort in the afternoon - sing alongs and cheering, etc. But it wasn't excessive and most importantly at nighttime it was as quiet and romantic as ever. The cove is now shared with the Aulani resort, but it doesn't affect availability of any lounge chairs and I felt the swimming/snorkeling was as good as ever. The hotel itself is kept spotlessly clean, and all of the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Our last visit was 7 years ago and with this visit we saw no compromise in quality or wear and tear. Our rooms both had a gorgeous lanai, along with the view they were spacious and had a chaise lounge along with two chairs and a table. Beds are extremely comfortable and the bathrooms are a dream! The grounds are gorgeous, there are stingrays and hammerhead sharks along with koi that swim around throughout the property. I recommend asking when feeding time is and trying to be there, it's great fun to take pictures. The only negative I can say about this property is the pool. It's kind of small and shallow all the way around. It's definitely pretty and the pool bar is awesome - the bartenders are the best and will take good care of you. The food offered poolside is better than most places. But, there's no denying that the pool area as a whole is kind of "eh..." However, you have the gorgeous ocean and beach right there in front of it so all things considered it's not that important. The location is a drive from everything, I would definitely recommend a rental car. Restaurant options are limited once you're off the property (unless you have a car...Kapolei is only a few miles away and there are all kinds of restaurants there) but overall if you are going to Oahu and want to escape from Waikiki Beach...you couldn't do better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: Thusknight
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott Ihilana for a July 1 wedding. The resort is beautiful, the service excellent and the rooms are very well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: Misse H
Reviews.Content: We were a bit skeptical about the hotel prior to our visit based on some of the posts here, but we were very pleased! We arrived after four days in Waikiki because we wanted to end our trip on a calmer quieter note and we got it! It was a very calm and comfortable atmosphere, where the staff was pleasant and willing to assist whenever we needed. We had no issues with noise from Aulani or from room neighbors. Yes, Aulani was a bit loud in the afternoons for a short time, but so what! The beach was great, sand and easy in and out. There was plenty of seating at the beach and pool. We ate dinner at Azul one night, Naupaka Terrace for breakfast each morning and pool service for lunch and drinks. All gave good food and service and they were a better value than I expected we would find at the hotel. There are only a few options for eating on property, but several more close by. We LOVED Roy's which was a short shuttle ride away. The room was very spacious and well maintained. The bed and linens were very comfortable and as I said, no noise from the rooms next door to speak of! :) The lanai was spacious with a chaise, a t able and two chairs. We had a lovely view. The bathroom set up was perfect for two friends traveling together as we did not want to invade the others space, but we had to get ready at the same time. It also allowed us to get up during the night to go to the restroom without disturbing the other person. We went for a massage at the spa and it was wonderful. The spa is a very comfortable and well equipped space. It was a great massage! My ONLY real complaint is the lack of a shuttle to and from the airport. We spent $100 getting from Waiki to Ihilani and another $100 getting to the airport. I guess maybe we should have rented a car, but who wants to drive on those crazy highways? NOT US! I would definitely go back. As far as all of the negative posters go, I have to believe they did not do anything to improve their own situation. If you have a problem you should speak up and allow them to fix it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: GCheek
Reviews.Content: I've stayed on business twice and both were 14 day stays! Wonderful customer service and very relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort”
Reviews.Author: mollylovesit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in June 2012. Ihilani is where the locals go for a staycation (this we learned from multiple locals we encountered at the hotel who were from the Honolulu area and were looking to get away). It is away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki and Honolulu and is the place to go if you are looking for a relaxing trip. We had booked a King mountain view, but when we checked in they didn't have any available so they offered us a king suite or double ocean view. We went for the ocean view, and I couldn't have been happier!! The room was amazing! There standing shower and separate tub, and 2 sinks with mirrors. The toilet was in a little room by itself, so you could continue to get ready in the morning or go to the bathroom without disturbing anyone else. All of the lights are controlled through the phone interface, as well as the Do Not Disturb for the maids, which was a great touch. There is also a large desk if you need the space. Both double beds were extremely comfortable, but we slept in 1 together, which was big enough for the both of us. The lanai was amazing. It overlooked the private cove and pool below and was wonderful to have the doors open to hear the ocean outside. There is a lounge chair outside, as well as a small table with 2 chairs if you want to enjoy coffee in the morning or a snack later on. We had no problems with privacy and were very comfortable in our room. I was a little unhappy with the lack of dining choices available on site, but we weren't at the hotel that often so it wasn't really a big deal. The terrace that they have the breakfast buffet is really expensive. We never had the buffet, but did order off the menu, and the food was pretty good, but there weren't any other cheaper or faster options at the resort. The bar at the pool serves lunch, which we had one day and it was really, really good, and a bit cheaper than the terrace, although it still had resort prices. I would recommend eating there if you have a chance! The last day we were at Ihilani we saw the small coffee shop in the corner of the lobby that seems hidden behind the concierge desk. They offer coffee, pastries, snacks, and fruit at pretty reasonable prices, and I wish we would have known about them sooner so that we could have utilized the on-the-go coffee bar more! Our room did not have any information about on site restaurants or their hours, so it was pretty much a guessing game as to what type of food was offered, when there were open, and when they were located. The first night we were in Oahu we had drinks and dinner at the Lounge at Ihilani because everything else was closed. The bartenders were wonderful and the whole bar had a Casablanca feel to it, with the open windows and ceiling fans. My husband and I both had a burger and they were hands down the best burgers we had ever had. Definitely try the bar food! We also never saw any vending machines on the floors, so I'm not sure if they have any. That was a little inconvenient, but we managed. The cove is absolutely beautiful and great for snorkeling. The waters are very calm and it's a large enough area that you don't feel as though you're on the beach with 400 other people. We enjoyed the time we spent down there and loved being so close to it. Aulani is the next resort over, but I never heard much of a ruckus from the resort. We walked over to see it (it's impressive!), but their guests didn't seem intrusive on the cove or with noise. The hotel is a short walk to Paradise Cove for a luau, which is really convenient and fun! Parking was $35 a day, self or valet, so we always did valet. Parking price was way, way to high, but it's Oahu, so what can you do? Anyways, the service was always wonderful and the hotel is absolutely beautiful, We would definitely stay here again when we come back to Oahu!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooners Don't Bother!”
Reviews.Author: CARH0630
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here for 4 nights for our honeymoon. We are gold members and have had wonderful experience at the JW in Cancun and Orlando. We are sadly disappointed in this property. We realized we made a mistake when we arrived and our room was not ready. We upgraded our room to ocean front. However, the balconies our not private at all and if you don't close the shade your neighbor can see directly into the room. The service is horrible! I got carded at the pool restaurant and was told to go back to my room on the 15 floor to get my ID. When I finally got back the waitress treated me like I had a fake ID and gave us a hard time for a freakin Mai Tai. I complained to management but at that point my lunch was ruined and this was not the experience I was hoping for on our honeymoon. The Disney Hotel next door is loud and you can hear them on the microphone during the day and night. I really wished we had stayed on the north shore at the Turtle Bay Resort. Don't waste your time here it is not worth your time or your money.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: kitegoddess
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the end of our honeymoon. When we arrived, we were upgraded from our Deluxe Ocean Front room to an incredible Ihilani suite (1102)because they were running short on king sized beds. The room was amazing, with balconies off the bedroom and off the living room. The living room balcony was absolutely enormous, with a table for dining, lounge chairs, a sofa, and two large round chairs big enough for 2 and great for night time star gazing. So, the room was amazing. But the side of the hotel we were on faces the pools at the Aulani Disney Resort, where they seem to regularly have people screaming into microphones during different poolside activities. Certainly not the Marriott's fault, just something you should be aware of - ask for a room on the non-Disney side! The cabana-chair rental on the beach was $25 for a half day, $40 for a full day, which we thought was totally reasonable. They have drink / food service at the cabana chairs, so you can have drinks delivered. We thought the staff throughout the hotel was very friendly and helpful. That being said, I really didn't think the hotel was worth the $500 price tag. I try to stay at Marriotts wherever I go, and I picked this hotel because of the awesome experience I had at the JW in San Antonio - this one really doesn't even come close. The pool area was fine - small. We ate at the pool bar - nachos and burgers - they were fine. Had dinner at Azul - not impressed at all. So overall, it was fine, but we won't return. We had a phenomenal stay at the Grand Wailea on Maui the two nights before we came here, so maybe our expectations were just set too high. :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property! Hope to visit again!”
Reviews.Author: TriniTravelingGirl
Reviews.Content: Apologies for the older review! but wanted to share my experience.. (Visited April 2008) Stayed here for my cousin's wedding and I really loved this property.. It was my first time on O'ahu....and we had come up from 6days in Waikiki..... so this was a welcomed respite from the crowds and shopping. Check in was smooth.....and our room was lovely... large balcony looking over the ponds/garden....immaculate room....large bathroom.....had a great soaking in their tub.....and room service was perfect... had an awesome breakfast on the balcony with my girls...that I still dream about.....my macadamia waffle was so light and delicious..hmm..... Only stayed here for 2 days.. so I really didn't get to explore the property as much as I liked to....but the pool area was small/medium....staff offers you scented/cool towels for your refreshment.....nice touch... the private lagoons were gorgeous....and were not crowded.... and the shops on the lower level were very nice to peruse.... found some great soap items...and gifts for close family there...... My friend and I became addicted to the home made choc chip cookies in the gift shop!! OMG...... we came down 2x a day for them.... look for the big glass jars in front of the cashier.. you have to try them... we even came down on our last morning..for the first batch..to take on our flight home....lol.... My cousin's wedding was perfect in every way..... it was on the grounds of the property....in the afternoon......set up was flawless....and the staff were always around to assist....we danced till 2am....and walked barefoot back up to our suites.... I will definitely visit the Ihilani on my next visit to O'ahu for a few more days...so I can really stretch out and enjoy all of their amenities.....but for now...I only have good things to say about them!

Reviews.Title: “Four Thumbs WAAAAAY Up!”
Reviews.Author: K W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW for a week in June 2012. We read Trip Advisor reviews for months as we booked our trip and up until the date we left. Let me be the first to tell you that any complaints people have written about this hotel are just absurd! This was a beautiful hotel that set the perfect mood for a romantic getaway for two! Take advantage of local snorkeling tours, surf lessons, and luaus. There is so much to do right in the area and shuttle services are provided by each of the companies as well. Here are 10 thoughts I wanted to share with everyone to give back for the awesome advice we used before our trip. Hope you find it helpful! 1. Upon arrival we were given a complimentary upgrade to a deluxe ocean view room (much appreciated after being up for almost 24 hours) because we are platinum members. 2. Staff was super wonderful from the moment we arrived. The person who brought us our room service the night we got in was so chatty I thought we could share a drink on the balcony like girlfriends :) 3. The pool area is small but perfect for a lazy afternoon lying around poolside (anyone disappointed and looking for waterslides and multiple pools should have booked at Disney). Who wants to sit at the pool all day in Hawaii anyway? Lounge chairs are not hard to come by, they're very comfortable for an afternoon nap. 4. Restaurants were great at the hotel, yes a little pricey (not obnoxious) but excuse me, you're in Hawaii, we expected this. Don't hesitate to walk down the beach sidewalk and check out all the other hotel restaurants. We ate at the Marriott Beach Club "Longboards" place twice and Disney once. 5. Careful when going to Azul. The food menu prices aren't bad, but a GLASS of wine starts at about $25 (ask for Stuart, he's a welcome breath of humor in an otherwise stuffy environment and called me, "The Lady" multiple times making me feel more important than I actually am!) 6. I expected the Disney resport next door to be painted in neon colors, with strobe lights, and obnoxious children's music to be blasting through speakers at all times. NOT AT ALL. The resort actually blends in with the island better than the JW and is super calm. You can't even tell what's going on inside unless you actually are inside. Don't let other reviewers scare you. We went in for lunch on our last day, and as two 20-somethings, we couldn't believe the fun going on around us! Mickey and Goofy were dancing in the water with kids while parents frantically snapped pictures. Kids were screaming going down the bajillion water slides they have and the food was actually decently priced and really good! We vow to take our own future children here someday instead of Disney World! Once we walked out, we couldn't hear a thing from the outside. Everyone needs to ease up on Disney :) 7. Warning to anyone staying on the other side of the hotel that does not face Disney. We had the most AMAZING view from the 16th floor and kept our balcony open to hear the waves crashing every night. However, there were wedding receptions happening almost every night that played music loud enough for us to sing along with the lyrics and have our own dance party in the room. We didn't complain because the view was too amazing. Besides, what will they do? Ask the reception to stop? Music was done by 10:00ish each night so it didn't bother us. If you're someone who would get annoyed by this though, stay on the Disney side of the hotel. 8. Do the Paradise Cove luau. We've done one in Maui a couple of years ago and it was on the smaller side. This was about 900 people and yet, very intimate. There are many opportunities to talk with people seated around you and the food was good! There are lots of things to do ahead of time, so be sure and get there early. PLUS, as soon as you arrive someone writes your name down at a table to reserve your table spot. You go and play games and are assured your seats are saved. So worth it! (P.S. Although the cheapest package has you sitting on the sides of the stage, we had an excellent view of everything. Don't let them get you to pay the extra $30 a person for nothing!) 9. Check out the taco restaurant across the street from the JW. It's only about a 5 minute walk. It's near an ABC store too! I thought it would be a junky fast food joint and it was a cool, sit down relaxed atmosphere with reasonably priced mexican food. We ate outside and it was a nice change of pace! 10. Ko Olina offered a nice "resort" feeling. We were back and forth about staying at the JW or at the Marriott downtown in Waikiki. Turns out we made a GREAT choice with Ko Olina. We ventured to Waikiki once and it was pretty sketchy. There were homeless people all up and down the beach and on the sidewalks. Not the tropical Hawaiian vacation we had imagined. We left within a half hour and sighed with relief about our choice to stay in Ko Olina. If you're into big city atmospheres, Waikiki would be the place for you! We had the most wonderful trip to Oahu and had high standards following a Maui trip two years ago. Marriott doesn't disappoint and really treated us well (and they should considering how many nights my husband has stayed with them.) I would highly suggest this hotel to anyone staying on the island. Thanks Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Ihilani”
Reviews.Author: travelmystique
Reviews.Content: We went back here because we liked the room and all the staff were friendly. The only thing we don't approve of is the daily charge of $35 to park in the parking lot. And there were no other parking place. We tried all the restaurants in the resort and the food is very good. We feel it is even better than the food at the next door resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice secluded getaway”
Reviews.Author: Jimbokli
Reviews.Content: If you are tired of fighting the crowds in Waikiki then head toward the other side of the island and stay here. The hotel is four star and it has everything you need to have a relaxing stay laying around the beach or pool. The rooms are nice and spacious and are nicely upgraded. If you have a garden view it is still great and costs a little less than an ocean view which, in my opinion, is overrated and not worth the additional bucks - but to each their own. If you want to go to Waikiki just realize that traffic is a major drag during the commute hours and plan accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Staycation Experience!”
Reviews.Author: dg808
Reviews.Content: The Ihilani is my absolute favorite resort! The moment I arrived on the property, I was greeted with aloha and such welcome, I felt like I was a VIP. The doorman/valet/bellman were so very helpful and jumped to serve immediately. Eventually, I didn’t even have to tell them my name or room number to pick up my car, they knew exactly what kind of car I drove and my room number. I loved the fact that the doorman (each one of them on duty) really took an interest in making it personal…they engaged you in great conversation! Our room was clean and it was nice that our room was on the opposite side of the pool, so it was less noisy. Instead we heard the soothing water breaking on the beach. The view of the ocean, Waianae mountains and sunsets were spectacular! Our dining experience at the Naupaka Terrace and Ushio Tei was outstanding. Because of our busy schedule during the day, we ended up having late dinners and arrived at the restaurants right when they were closing. Despite our late arrival, both of these restaurants served us with excellence and we didn’t feel rushed at all. Each night the food was amazing! I am a vegan and the Naupaka Terrance created/modified entrees for my special dietary needs. The poolside wait staff was great, as was the food. Although I only had time for a pedicure at the spa, I felt like I was pampered and treated like a queen during my spa experience. I hope to experience some other spa treatments in the future. As a resident of Hawaii, one tends to get caught up in the routine and take for granted where we live. Who needs to travel to an exotic location, when paradise is right here in our own backyard! Mahalo JW Marriott Ihilani for reminding me of just how beautiful our aina is and how special the people of Hawaii are! You made our staycation experience the best ever!!

Reviews.Title: “Great 10 year anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: Marc R
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic! Absolutely every aspect felt good. Staff was incredibly nice and helpful. Grounds were beautiful, food was great. If I had one negative, and this is minor, it would be having to wait a couple of times for them to get our car from valet. The room was very good and had a great view of the ocean. We did have to pay extra for a mini fridge, but it was worth it and saved us money in the end because we got a lot of our drinks and snacks from the local grocery store.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Escape with my Sweetheart”
Reviews.Author: rjmkrieger
Reviews.Content: This was a gorgeous hotel and amazing beach/cove setting! The staff and hotel were first class and we loved being away from the crazy Waikiki city. The hotel is right next to the new DIsney property which actually adds to the atmosphere and if you have kids, take them there as it is pretty incredible and there is so much more for them to do and enjoy with more pools and activities. The JW's hotel grounds are amazing and the rooms are very nice and are going to be renovated in September so it will be even nicer. The pool is nice but there is only one pool and it is not large, however the frozen grapes are a great touch. The beach area is amazing to do paddle boarding, snokeling, or just have fun in the ocean water and relax in the sun and Hawaiian breeze. We had a room with a balcony on the 7th floor whcih was high enough to see over the palm trees and watch inclredible sunsets from our balcony, quite romantic. Floors lower than the 7th might not get such a great view. At night, we left the balcony door open and enjoyed the sound of the ocean waves and breeze drift us into peaceful sleep. We had lunch at the pool bar and dinner at the Italian restaurant which were very good and reasonable! Our first night, we even ordered room service as we drank our wine and had them bring up a pizza which put a smile on both our faces. I would recommend stopping at Costco on the way to the hotel (not far away) and pick up some things you can keep in the small fridge. The hotel boutique even had some great dresses for my sweetheart at a nice price along with alot of other items which was a great convenience. The only negative was when we needed to get bottles of water late one night and the store was closed so we had to go the bar and it was $7 or $8 a bottle. Bring your own or get it from the store before it closes. I would highly recommend and look forward to going back again, loved it, loved it, loved it. PS Within walking distance to the Paradise Cove Luau, fun to do and show was good and could watch the sunset. Food just okay! PSS The ice machine was just around the corner but the staff did offer to get it for us.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined by Disney!”
Reviews.Author: Lymebdr
Reviews.Content: This was my favorite hotel in the world - wonderful location, peaceful, quiet beach on a wonderful lagoon! You could stroll for a mile or more in peace and tranquility around the lagoons to the harbor. Then, Disney came in a build a HUGE UGLY RESORT right next door! Now you listen (you can't help it) to the Disney Big Screen practically on the beach, all evening!! And fight the double, triple, and quad strollers on the beach path! Well, the hotel is still lovely, the rooms are wonderful, - (food is expensive!), (parking is outrageous!) - but if the Disney Resort next door doesn't bother you, than this is the place for you!! For me - never again!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: lakewlady
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. The lobby has no doors, just flowing white sheer drapes, blowing in the breezes. Up to our room which was huge. Sitting room, bedroom, balcony and a bathroom larger than most hotel rooms. Luxuriously decorated all the way. Service was impeccable. When we searched for an ice machine, we were told no machines, too noisy. They brought us an ice bucket every night at 6 for cocktails. When we would return from breakfast, the beds would be made and the towels changed. When we returned in the late afternoon, we would rest before going out at night. When we returned later at night, again the beds were made. The spa was heaven...Pricey, but do it for yourself, you'll never forget it.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: smile35913
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Oahu. The grounds are absolutely beautiful. We were able to get an oceanview room for just $25.00 a night extra.The room was clean and spacious.It includes a mini fridge,coffee pot withcream,not packets.a safe.ice bucket with wine opener.and a blow dryer. I suggest stopping off at a grocery store prior to your arrival. As a guest you will receive snorkeling gear for an hour each day for free.The Disney resort is right next door and everyone shares the same lagoon.however just to the right of the hotel are two secluded beaches that are natural preservationist.second one ihas great snorkeling and a great oppurtunity to see turtles. This was one of our best vacations.The people were friendly and gave us great sight seeing ideas. Oh .if you have a GPS device bring it.. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleNanc
Reviews.Content: We had a ocean view room which was HUGE! Glad we declined the offer to upgrade to a jr. Suite. Lanai was spacious with a soda and table and chairs. Service at the pool was first class. Food prices were reasonable. An easy getaway

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Drue462
Reviews.Content: Our accommodations were beautiful. Our room was spotless and had a nice little patio. It was perfect for two people and seemed very private for such a large hotel. The beach was man-made but nice. We met several nice couples vacationing as well. We were able to rent paddle boards right at the hotel, which was so much fun. This is very far away from many of the tourist attractions aside from the Polynesian Cultural Center!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but disappointing. Not good for small children”
Reviews.Author: gary r
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the Marriott on vacation with our 2 year old and another baby on the way. The hotel room itself was very nice although other parts of the hotel seem a little tired (eg the pool and elevators). However, there were some big concerns: 1. Upon check in our name was mispelled in the system which created a lot of anxiety when we were told that our reservation didn't show up. Then there was only a minimal apology once it was found. We did not feel welcomed, especially compared to the Westin Moana Surfrider we stayed in the previous night. 2. The biggest concern was the balcony area of our room. Only the top left part of the balcony looked out at all, while a roof completely blocked the majority of our view (442). Because the roof came down to the edge of our balcony, newspapers that blew off the balconies above collected at the base of ours. Finally, and I realize this may be unavoidable, everyday we found a large dead cockroach in front of the sliding door (I kicked them to the side and have pictures). Since our 2 year old sleeps early we had hoped to spend time on the balcony after she went down. However, there was no light and the view made me feel trapped. I don't expect a glorious ocean view if I am not paying for it but a mountain or garden view should look at a mountain or garden, never a roof. 3. Also, with a two year old we had to spend time in the room every afternoon for her nap. Everyday there was construction noise outside that made it hard to sleep. I think it was from the parking lot. Most rooms in the hotel opened to an inside hall but ours was a long walk from the elevators and opened to the outside, making it much noisier than other rooms. 4. Finally, the pool was not at all useful for a family with a toddler. There were no shallow parts and no kids pool which made it unusable for us. I guess I should have looked into this in advance but, after staying at the Westin Ocean Villas in Kauai twice, I expected more out of a Hawaiian resort. All in all, I was disappointed. I would definitely not recommend the hotel for families with small children. I thought the beach would be good since it was protected from waves but by the afternoon the water would get visibly dirty, presumably from all the people in the water. I run the public relations group for a major auto manufacturer and I have a lot of experience with hotels at all price levels including ultra-luxury, while this is a nice hotel it is not good enough for the pricepoint and I think we had the absolute worse room in the building.

Reviews.Title: “My birthday spot growing up”
Reviews.Author: questnmark
Reviews.Content: I have to give this place 5 stars because it says "your overall rating of this PROPERTY". I have never stayed at Ihilani but the property is beautiful. The resort is located about 30 min. from downtown and I love Ko'olina. Each year I would fly back to O'ahu with my family for the summer and for my birthday my family plus all my aunties, uncles and cousins that are all on O'ahu would host an all day birthday picnic for me on the 1st lagoon. There are several lagoons here and I remember clear as day when all that was there was just the Ihilani. Now they have the disney resort and some other resorts popping up. Damn why do they have to build on all of the hidden spots? I love this place to death. I still go here everytime I go back to O'ahu even though it's exposed but it's still a gem. Tourists are chill here, the locals are chill and it's a true tropical island paradise. I hope if you go...take some time for yourself and just walk the lagoons and enjoy the area and then after go for a swim. You'll feel like you discovered a part of Gilligans Island.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: james s
Reviews.Content: Unforgettable stay in Ko Olino. This was our first time to Hawaii and we were very impressed with the JW. They were awesome, food was great, and the scenery was priceless. We originally decided to go to Waikiki beach the second half of our honeymoon. Once we were there we realized it was a mistake. If you are looking for city life, then Waikiki is the place to be. At Ko Olnoe we had an incredible ocean view, which makes up most of our pictures. The room itself is unbelievable, with every amenity you could imagine. I really have no complaints about the stay. They greeted us with champagne and the perfect room. The gym was very nice and not overcrowded. Staff was very friendly and the concierge was very informative. Please stay here if you have a chance. It will be well worth your stay. My newlywed wife can't stop talking about the view and room. Thanks JW Ko Olino Can't wait to come back

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property, luxury rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jott42107
Reviews.Content: We were "upgraded" to a spa deluxe room. It turned out to be the handicapped accessible room, which meant that the shower was small because it had a fold up seat inside of it. Otherwise, it meant that the room was very large and spacious. The bed and pillows were super comfortable. The best part of the room was the private roman bath hot tub that was in our patio! The shrubbery provided privacy without looking obtrusive. The room service for breakfast was outstanding - both the friendly service and taste of the food. You'd spend almost as much at the restaurant, so splurge and get the room service. Ko'Olina seems worlds away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. So, unless you have a car, there isn't much around for entertainment. Expect to do lots of relaxing or enjoy walking the lagoons on the property.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View, but what's with the pigeon poop all over the lanai!”
Reviews.Author: pinkietoes
Reviews.Content: The view was breath taking, but my new husband I couldn't enjoy it because the furniture on the lanai was covered in pigeon poop. I called housekeeping right away. I asked them to clean it up and change the cushions. Someone did come within 10 minutes but did a lousy job and only covered everything with towels, (when you pay over $800 buck a night) you think the place would offer clean furniture to their guests. Anyhow after three calls to housekeeping we finally got new cushions. We honestly, enjoyed the rest of our stay. The food was good, servers where nice and it was a beautiful relaxing honeymoon and we got to see a sea turtle.

Reviews.Title: “Remodeled guest rooms are fresh and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Judy3720
Reviews.Content: We were given a complimentary upgrade to an ocean view room. The rooms have been clearly remodeled and are fresh and extremely comfortable. Our lanai was a little dirty so we called down and within 15 minutes someone was cleaning the bird droppings. No less than 15 minutes later we got a call to ask if the lanai was cleaned to our satisfaction. We requested foam pillows and they were in our room in 10 minutes. Service and accommodations at this hotel have greatly improved. Special shout ouot to Naupaka's hostess Sherrie and her supervisor, Sarina who went out of their way to send a fruit and cookie amentity while we were staying at the Marriott Ko Olina timeshare. I hurt my ankle and was unable to go to dinner that evening. Sherrie and Sarina were gracious and sent us a personalized note wishing us a happy anniversary. Going forward our first choice here in Ko Olina will be the JW Marriottt...timeshares might be okay to try...but the service orientation no where comparies to the service at a full service Marriott. Thank you for the terrific stay!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: jts813
Reviews.Content: This place was absolutely gorgeous. We had an ocean view room that could not be beat. The rooms are spacious and balcony is fantastic. The lobby and surround areas are beautiful. They have a gigantic outdoor pond with sting rays and small sharks. Amazing. Overall deserving of its 5 star status. Obviously you're going to be spending a lot of money to be staying here. Costs is the only reason I didn't give it a 5 rating. Small things make a difference. For instance there was no free water bottles in the room. Obviously you can get that on your own at the ABC store, but dang for the amount you pay those small things can make a world of difference. Definitely a great place for a romantic get away.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great - but offset byservice and quality of the buffet breakfast”
Reviews.Author: takeahike66
Reviews.Content: The room I received was spacious and well decorated, It was a Deluxe Ocean view room, with two lanai with view in two directions. The room was decorated with their new design, with mood lighting, exceptional modern furniture and a very large desk that wrap around one corner of the room. Hotel staff was quick to provide service and in general very helpful. The outside landscape was neatly done, with various pools of sharks and stingrays. All the good things were offset by the high parking rate and poor service and quality of the food at the Naupuka Terrace resturant. The beach you see next to the hotel is pretty well maintained, just look too artificial. Too really see fish if you want to snorkel, you have to go out farther to the rock barrier which is pretty deep and a good distance to swim. The clarity of the water for snorkeling is not that great. For a place that is isolated from other areas and attractions, with the public transportation or shuttle service to any major attactions, it would appear that the rate for parking would be more reasonable. This may be the same rate as the hotels in downtown Honolulu, but there you don't have to have a car. Also for a high end hotel, the service and quality of the food at the buffet at the Naupako Terrace hotel is horrible. For $26 a person, the food selection and quality was just OK, nothing outstanding, Service was way below avg for the price. I tried to find coffee for at least 5 minutes after selecting my breakfast item, before I was finally told that the waiter would bring the coffee. I was sitting on the outside terrace that overlooks the shark pool. It was a good 10 minutes before a waiter showed up to ask if I wanted any coffee. When I wanted to pay my bill and leave, all the hostess, waiters, cooks, etc had all disappeared for at least 5 minutes. It was just strange not to see any hotel staff in the restaurant. Finally all of them starting walking out of the back and back into the restaurant. It was like all of them were taking a break at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Katie M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and thoroughly enjoyed it! The hotel was beautiful inside and had sting ray and shark pool. The room was spacious with lovely views from the balcony. The lagoon beach was picturesque with white sand and turqoise water. There is a chapel near so we saw couples on their wedding day. There is free wifi in the lobby, can pay to have it in room. Near the hotel are otherhotel resorts and coupke restaurants and shops and top golfcourse. We felt very safe walking round at night, loved the li'auat pleasure cove.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaii's paradise”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl N
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a beautiful hotel. We stayed here for 5 days in May 2012. The hotel was beautiful, the beach was very nice, the hotel staff were always pleasant! We had a wonderful time! The cove on the beach was very nice for snorkling and swimming!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms and beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: Lifejeep
Reviews.Content: Room was very spacious. Balcony large with beautiful view. Reserved mountain view but was upgraded to ocean view at no extra charge. Loved having the separate shower and tub. A fresh fruit platter was delivered to us complimentary due to us being long term guests. Housekeeping worked with our schedules which were complicated since we have small children. No complaints. Will recommend to family/friends most definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely in most respects”
Reviews.Author: tropicaltraveler429
Reviews.Content: My partner and I are repeat visitors to all of the Neighbor Islands, but had never been to O'ahu. To try to get some of the Neighbor Island peace and relaxation, we decided to split our time between Waikiki (Moana Surfrider) and the JW Marriott on the west side of O'ahu...and we were glad we did! The grounds were lovely, much like the hotels we love on the Neighbor Islands...fragrant and filled with koi ponds (the baby hammerhead sharks and rays were especially amazing). Our room was fantastic--overlooking the pool and lagoon, with a fantastic sunset view. It was HUGE (i was skateboarding around with room!) with a supremely comfortable bed, amazing marble bathroom, and a fantastic balcony complete with cozy couch! The breakfast buffet was GREAT, the poolside bar featured friendly staff and good drinks. Okay; now for the reason I didn't give this resort five stars: Firstly, the fish (lunch/dinner) was frankly--awful. When I go to the islands I pretty much live on seafood for lunch and dinner, particularly ahi poke. The first time I got a "fresh fish sandwich" (mahi mahi perhaps?) which was quite badly fragrant, if you know what I mean, but at least edible. But the second day, the ahi poke was gamey, smelly, and the color of a bruise, instead of the rich red color I am used to. I didn't want to be a jerk and send back my food, but nor was I pleased. The next is the Disney resort next to the JW Marriott. I know, I know...not the fault of the JW Marriott, but perhaps they could do something about the loudness of the Disney ceremonies at night, the screaming children from the Disney resort invading the peace of the Marriott's pool, and the rudeness of the Disney employees asking every second where you are staying when you are swimming at the lagoon that the JW Marriott supposedly SHARES. My partner and I are eclectic-looking individuals and we got sneered at constantly by Disney families, who prompted the Disney employees to inquire as to our room number at the Marriott (What happened to privacy?! The JW Marriott isn't even their "jurisdiction"!) when they weren't satisfied with our merely stating that we were staying there. To avoid fuss, we complied...but again, we weren't happy. In conclusion, except for the (served) fish, the JW Marriott is a lovely resort and a great place to stay if you are looking for a Neighbor Island experience while on O'ahu. I would definitely come back to the JW Marriott the next time we go to O'ahu, but if you, like us, are more "artistic" types, I would ask the staff in advance what to say if you are "treated" to a "security interrogation" by the Mickey Mouse Club!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous setting, inviting water”
Reviews.Author: Susan M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the Ihilani this past March, and we enjoyed the place immensely. The hotel overlooks a gorgeous beach and a serene, inviting blue-water lagoon that is shared with the Disney resort next door so there are lots of families with young children around. The hotel is a 45-minute drive from Waikiki but just a 15-minute drive from the Pearl Harbor Memorial and Visitor Center. We spent two half days at the center, which gave us the time and concentration we needed to go through the entire exhibit. There are four restaurants located at the hotel. We ate at all of them, and they were all wonderful, but expensive. To find less expensive food, you'd need to get in your car and drive 15-30 minutes. The breakfast buffet at the hotel restaurant is not to be missed, especially if you love fresh, tropical fruit. I showed up at the hotel with an injured shoulder, so I splurged on a massage from Ruby. She gave me a fantastic massage and set me back on the road to repair. The spa is housed in the presidential suite---worth going up there for the view alone!---while the spa facility is under reconstruction. The Ihilani is a good choice if you are looking for a quieter alternative to the madness of Waikiki.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
Reviews.Title: “Very nice property at excellent beach”
Reviews.Author: Sean B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in February for 5 nights. We booked an ocean room King but they gave us a room with 2 queen beds. They realized their mistake, but there were no King ocean views available. We were changed to a King Mountain view overlooking the Disney Hotel. The room was very nice, with plenty of room. The bed was quite comfortable and the bathroom is spacious and clean. At night, we could hear cheering from the Disney Hotel, but by the time we wanted to sleep it was quiet again. The Disney patrons share the same lagoon and beach as well, but still it was not overcrowded. I was surprised. It appears that most decided to stay on the grounds rather than go to the beach. The pool is beautiful but the water is so cold that only a few kids braved the water to swim in it. It can be difficult to get a poolside chair in the afternoon. The restaurants are pricey but the food was very good. We liked the Mexican restaurant just one block away, easy walking distance and much much less expensive. Overall a very nice Hotel, clean, and in a beautiful part of the island. I would happily stay there again, but would spend the extra money for an ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: 4BZFamily
Reviews.Content: The view from our ocean view room was majestic. The sights and sounds provide for pure relaxation. This is the perfect resort for those who are looking to get away from the city scene of Waikiki Beach. We enjoyed private room service breakfasts on our balcony and quiet sunsets in the evening. This is a great place for those who want to get away from it all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: michiganman03
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon and we are so glad that we did. We are a couple of 20-somethings that love to relax but love adventure as well. It was away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki but still located in a place where we could reach everywhere on the island. Some of our best days were when we drove around the island and just stopped at different locations to explore. The place you decide to sleep is a very small part of your experience in Hawaii. Okay, back to the resort... when we arrived at the hotel, we received a complimentary bottle of champagne (which we thoroughly enjoyed). That is an important fact because we love champagne. Rooms - We had reserved a mountain view room for 5 nights but when we arrived at the hotel we decided to upgrade to an ocean view for $250.00 ($50.00/night). It was WELL worth it. Every night we tried to watch the sunset on our impressive Lanai. Our entire west-facing wall was glass sliding doors and the rooms were well furnished. My wife liked the large bathroom with large mirrors. We had a 42-inch tv in our room as well as digital remote control to control the lights/tv/etc. These were all nice touches.
