We are loyal Marriott customers and have stayed at several of their hotels. Marriott hotels can sometimes have major faults and shortcomings, but this hotel seemed to be well managed and the rooms were very comfortable. Restaurants - We LOVED the buffet at the restaurant. It was about $25.00 a person but it was well worth it. We tried something new everyday and it was never busy or crowded. When we decided to eat at the buffet, we always left full and satisfied. We also ate dinner at their main restaurant as well and were always satisfied with the food/drink. One time at dinner, I even accidentally dropped a knife on a shark. The shark didn't seem to mind as it just swam away. I apologize for the inconvenience. Grounds - People, it is Hawaii, you should really spend your time discovering the Island. If you decide to stay on the resort for a day you won't be disappointed. We spent one day laying by the pool and one day by the cove. Both days were a great experience. The servers were attentive and available when needed (which was often). We went snorkeling and saw some pretty cool stuff in the cove, I would recommend trying that out if it's still free. The pool is a little small but I was more concerned with getting tan and getting drinks than I was swimming. Overall - My wife and I enjoyed our stay at the JW Marriott in Oahu. We liked that it was away from the busy parts of Honolulu. We spent a day in Waikiki and loved it, but liked the more relaxed atmosphere of Ko' Olina. The cove was a little busy at times but to be honest we were on our Honeymoon and were more obsessed with each other than we were the resort. Seriously, we were in Hawaii, we weren't going to complain. It is a little pricey, but I feel that it is worth it considering the relaxing atmosphere and the impressive grounds. My advice (and seriously, it isn't worth much) is to give it a shot. Especially if you are planning on staying here a couple nights and staying on the North Shore or in Waikiki a couple nights. My wife (it feels so cool to call her that!) and I had a great time and we are planning our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Still great!”
Reviews.Author: keneka
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott Ihilani has been a spot for us to stay for several years now when in the islands...business and/or with family in Kailua. Truth be known we would stay at our Koolina time share just down the beach but when that is not available we always stay at the Ihilani. By the numbers: 1. The property. Still immaculate. Still attended to with perfection. Great location and no signs either positive or negative from the Disney Aulani next door. Who can tell tho what will happen when Disney gets up to speed. The previously quiet lagoon fronting the Ihilani is seeing more action these days. Our impression is that access to the Disney property is controlled (to guest only?) so we were not able to explore. 2. The staff. What can I say...it's a Marriott and the staff standards where ever you go world wide are top-notch. Nothing negative can be said. But we are not needy visitors. 3. Restaurants. The Naupaka dining area is always good to us. This visit was no exception. The Hokule'a bar was ok but the mixologist might have done a bit better on my retro favorite Old Fashioned. We did not get to the Azul this time as we have every trip in the past whether we stay at Koolina, or Ihilani. Azul is always outstanding. Go visit. Enjoy.....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort A+++++++”
Reviews.Author: AquaV
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel and resort. We absolutely loved it and can't wait to return. The rooms were gorgeous and spacious...all new. The only thing that was "off" were the showers...the tile in the shower needed to be re-done and so did the bottom of the bath tub. This was odd because everything else in the room was gorgeous and brand new. There are hammerhead sharks in outdoor aquatic pools around the resort. My kids loved this! The coffee bar, bar and restaurants were all outstanding. We experienced fantastic service from everyone we came into contact with at this resort. We enjoyed renting the cabanas out at the cove. The man-made cove was awesome for our kids. They could play in the water without getting knocked over by waves. And the offered water toys for rent. The pool is nice, but small. But with the cove, it was just fine. Eat at the hotel. Don't get tempted and eat next door at the new Disney hotel, the food was horrible there! We couldn't believe how bad it was. The food at the JW was awesome!!! Can't wait to go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Kt S
Reviews.Content: It is a beautiful resort with gorgeous views. Great service and restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Property, Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: GoGoGidgetinMD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous and the surrounding property has so much to offer! We enjoyed the walking trail each morning because we just couldn't resist! The staff is so accomodating and welcoming! The pool is a bit smaller than I expected, but then again we spent most of time lounging on a beach chair in the sand! I was a bit disappointed to learn the spa was undergoing renovation due to an "emergency", but was very, very pleased with the massage I received in their temporary space! I am completely Marriott loyal and have stayed in many of their properties, but I can honestly say I will be headed back to Oahu just to stay at the Ihilani! Thank you everyone for making the trip so very special for us!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation of a life time”
Reviews.Author: NinaK104
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is located 38 min from Waikiki the property a gated community. The pool is small in comparison to other hotels in Waikiki but a pleasure to swim in, the staff is extremely friendly within a day they greeted you by name. The room (600ft) and bathroom are very large . the balcony was so big that it contained a lounging couch, 2 wood Adirondack chairs and round table. The food was average except for Saturday night Seafood Dinner – The food was fabulous King Crab Legs, Oysters, Clams, Shrimp, and much more and a Chocolate Fondue with all kinds of fruit, cake etc – A GREAT BUFFET well worth the money. The only problem that arose was the new hotel just next door – A Disney Hotel. The food was terrible at there restaurants, the noise at night was too loud but by 9:00pm the noise stops and you can once again heard the ocean currents. During the day relax on the beach, play golf or go to the Spa (which has a lap pool), Their is no place to park on the street, valet parking or park yourself too expensive $35 a day. Also do not eat at the small shopping center across the street. The Mexican restaurant was the worst I ever eat in.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: prts78
Reviews.Content: We started vacation in Waikiki and stayed in Ko Olina for the second week of vacation. What a big difference! We enjoyed both places a lot but our room at Ihilani was soooo nice we were happy we decided to try it. Very peacfull location, very clean, not crowded. Wondeful lagoons! We had seen turtles early morning visiting our lagoon. :) Restaurants are expensive but good. ABC Store is across the street offering hot meals. Bathroom was nice and clean. Housekeeping very good. The only negative was that the beds were not comfortable. Any other Marriott palce we stayed at always had comfortable beds and this was our first dissapointing experience. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would come back and recommend to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “5 star Resort in Hawaii - Love the lagoons!”
Reviews.Author: Doug S
Reviews.Content: Romantic and family oriented at the same time. Great location out of the main beach area. Clean, fun and an excellent spa right on the complex. We loved staying at Ihilani. For the tourist places you will need a car but you get to see the entire island. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious guest rooms but we missed having a natural beach with waves!”
Reviews.Author: Pria01
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely resort and I was impressed by the luxurious and spacious guest room and bathroom! We had booked an ocean view room but only had partial viewed of the ocean and mountains on the other side. We asked for an upgrade when we checked in but were told that none was available for our specific room type, 2 double beds and not facing Disney property. Overall the resort is beautiful with the saltwater lagoons adding a nice touch and the restaurant staff and bellman was very helpful with directions and restaurant suggestions. Restaurants in the hotel were expensive but we expected that so we decided to just do breakfast and lunch in the resort and visited nice restaurants outside the resort for dinner. 2 places I will recommend( and I will write reviews later) is Roy's Ko Olina which is at the Ko Olina beach club and there is a hotel shuttle that wil take you there. Also visit the Hula Grill at the Outrigger at the beach in Waikiki for dinner. Back to this resort review, the only negative is that there is no natural beach with waves that you can access. My son loves the ocean and it's waves and even though the lagoon was right outside the resort and great for kids, there are no waves like a real ocean and we missed that. The pool was good not great, we have been to other Marriott sorts which have bigger pools with waterfalls and slides but this one was just a basic round pool so I was disappointed with the pool area. The Ko Olina area is definitely more private than the crowded Waikiki area so if you are looking for a peaceful,relaxing vacation in Oahu then Ko Olina is a great choice. we did drive to the North Shore and that felt like the real Hawaii with the natural beaches and big waves and we stopped ate some local fruit stands and bough fresh cut up fruit and had fresh cooked shrimp from Fumi's shrimp truck which was awesome. Thanks to Sean from Marriott Vacation Club for telling us to do the North Shore drive and he was kind enough to tell us which beaches to stop at, which shrimp truck to eat from and the local fruit stands etc. Overall our trip to Jw Marriott Ko Olina was wonderful but please consider the lack of a natural beach if that is your priority.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort but needs some TLC”
Reviews.Author: FoodiesAnonymous
Reviews.Content: Went here last week to surprise our friend who was celebrating his 50th birthday- that said, we would have been happy anywhere, so that rather colors my review. Nice location away from Waikiki, but now rather crowded into a lagoon with a massive Disney complex. I'm not complaining but I'm sure it was much nicer B.D. (Before Disney) Our room must have been recently redecorated as it was very spacious and pleasantly appointed, more like a condo than a normal hotel room. Only issue was that our balcony was a pigeon haven and they were constantly perched on the railing and making a mess of things. One thing I was very impressed with was the service at this hotel. About 2 weeks- 10 days out I began to receive personalised emails offering various services, from restsurant menus and booking dinner reservations to having .things stocked in your room on arrival (Coke, wine/champagne, tonic) for reasonable charges. We checked in quickly, the agent at the front desk was pleasant and accommodating and helped us to surprise our friend with our arrival for which we were very thankful. So many customer service people are blasé and indifferent- this was a treat. Our stay was pleasant enough although we found the common areas a tad tired and uninteresting, not as luxe as they could have been for the star level of the property (and the price point). We ate at the Japanese restaurant one night and it was excellent. Otherwise we found the restaurants rather overpriced. Luckily there is a small market 2 blocks from the hotel and we got breakfast items there for our last two mornings. All in all, we had a fine time, although as I mentioned before, we would have been happy anywhere due to the nature of our stay. Kudos to the front line hotel employees though!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: Stephen88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during spring break. It was a lovely setting and pretty convenienly located. If you stay here, get an ocean view room not a lagoon view. I heard another visitor complain about noise on the lagoon side as it is located right next door to the Aulani, Disney Resort. Our room was recently updated. Very nice and has a small fridge Complaint would be lack of reliable wifi. Come on, can't be that hard as most low budget places provide it free. We visited the east side of the island. Lanikai is gorgeous! Hanauma Bay is great for snorkeling but get there early. Pearl Harbor a must but also get there early. Waikiki is not a beach for swimming or much else other than laying out. I would skip staying there and just visit for the day. Stay in Ko Olina.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet,comfortable, clean and private beach: wish I was still there”
Reviews.Author: kathyph
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to this property and this part of the island. The room on the 11th floor was spacious with a beautiful view of the natural lagoon and tide pools. There are very friendly birds though so ask housekeeping to give your lanai a thorough cleaning! Marriott needs to clean/ change the carpet though. The pool area is very nice and the lagoon with the beach is prefect. We were traveling with a ten year old and meeting up with a 7 year old and 5 year old. They were able to snorkel, swim, play with the paddle boards and floats and build in the sand all day while we lounged on the cabanas. The coffee shop is a definite miss. Take the splurge and order coffee in room. The service was just delightful. Skip lunch ( unless you ave the cabana package that includes a $75 food credit) and pick up from the ABC store across the street. Our stay included breakfast which was a great deal as each buffet is $26. The breakfast was great with a wide selection. I am always annoyed when the omelet station attendant puts out dollars in order to show you to leave a tip. I think ths is tacky and uncalled for. Marriott just pay your people better! I will say only the male chefs did this not the female ones. We also attended the Saturday night Seafood Buffet. It is very nice and offers some nice seafood dishes. I have allergies and the chef took care of me and was very attentive. Front desk and support staff are very friendly and helpful. There are fun activities going on each day for free and for a fee. Make sure you visit the tide pools and the other lagoons. Also don't miss the shaved ice at The Aulani. Though they have a wierd schedule of when it is opened.

Reviews.Title: “Xmas stay at the Ihilani”
Reviews.Author: Mckiwis
Reviews.Content: This is our fave hotel in Oahu whenever we visit Hawaii, as it has amazing views and great rooms. Our stay over the Christmas was mostly ok, but a lot worse than any other time of the year, for the following reasons: 1. Our booked room was not ready when we walked up to it, it had no power supplied to it and was under construction (last thing you want after checking in quite late at night). 2.The staff are so busy with the guests (it gets crowded over xmas) you get sub-standard service - house keeping missed cleaning our room and wouldn't make it up despite numerous times of us calling front desk and house keeping , finally after getting fed up we walked down to the front desk personally and asked that our room is made up at 11.30PM!! And the house keeping manager looked less than delighted to oblige like she was doing us a favour. 2(b)While out trying to hire out snorkel gear to go snorkeling in the lagoon we waited about 15 minutes by the cabana where there are usually staff who can serve you there and there was absolutely no one in attendance. The young men who were on duty were too busy trying to hook up with girls at the lagoon , and there was about 5 of us waiting patiently until we got annoyed and went to ask the pool attendant to get someone to the snorkel gear cabana. And finally that happened. 3.The showers in the rooms we stayed (stayed in two diff rooms as we visited twice in Dec) in were absolutely filthy with black mould. So sad for deluxe ocean view rooms that have been recently renovated and made beautiful. The fridge in our room was dirty as well from previous guests spilling something inside of it. 4.We could not use the Jacuzzi by the pool as kids kept on diving into it and throwing their swimming gear in. There was no one in attendance not even their parents to tell them to go play in the pool as this is an adult area really. Made is incredibly unpleasant to be in the Jacuzzi and have a peaceful pinacolada , so we up and went. Poor poor poor service. What a shame, as the staff there are usually so good and everything is so perfect. We have visited this hotel multiple times in the past , but this time was the most disappointing of them all.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: Natalie B
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times for business and pleasure. It's a beautiful property with great beaches and lovely grounds, and it's nice that it's away from all the madness of Waikiki but close enough in that you can easily go for dinner or the afternoon. The rooms are lovely and spacious, and it's very relaxing for vacation yet efficient for work.

Reviews.Title: “Great Change of Pace”
Reviews.Author: kharada46
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott Ihilani Resort & Spa is located in the Ko'olina Resort on the Leeward (West) side of the island of Oahu near the "Second City" of Kapolei. Ko'olina is a nice change of pace from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, offering beautiful (but man made) beaches that are much less crowded and less crowds overall than Waikiki. However, there is NO shopping near by and very limited dining options within the resort. A short 10 minute drive to Kapolei opens up your options, but if shopping is important, this isn't the place for you. Ihilani itself is an excellent luxury resort, with great service and very nice rooms. When my fiancee and I arrived, we headed directly to the front desk, where we were greeted by a very friendly staff. Despite being a few hours early, we were notified that our room was already ready for us, so we headed up to our Deluxe Ocean View room on the 16th floor of the main tower. The rooms here are MASSIVE by Hawaii standards. All standard size rooms at the Ihilani are 387 sq. ft. Our room had a great king bed with a backlit headboard, a LCD HDTV, a large work desk with great work chair, a small table in front of the bed with two comfy chairs, tons of closet space, central A/C, and a ceiling fan. The bathroom in our room was a massive marble bathroom with his & her's vanity, glassed in shower stall, massive deep soaking tub, and a separate toilet. The entry foyer to the room had a small safe, coffee maker, and refrigerator. Our room was spotless, well maintained, and had a great update recently with a great blue and white motif with dark woods, marble, and granite. We only stayed one night this time, so we couldn't experience everything the resort has to offer, but we did order a "milk & cookies turndown service." This was probably the one thing that disappointed me, as the hot cocoa (we subbed that for the milk) and cookies were great, but the room didn't receive an actual turndown. The room service we ordered for breakfast the following morning, however, exceeded expectations. Our room service attendant was very friendly and cheerful and delivered our breakfast to us on time on a cart that doubled as a good size table with white linens. So what did we order? Our breakfast was comprised of a cheese, mushroom, and spinach omelet (for me) with breakfast potatoes, toast, butter, and jams; a crab eggs benedict for the fiancee with breakfast potatoes; and guava juice for the both of us. Both dishes were great, though the potatoes and omelet could have used a touch of salt. While we enjoyed room service for breakfast during our stay, we did enjoy Ihilani's Italian fine dining restaurant, Azul, the night before. How was the restaurant? That's for another review! Besides Azul, Ihilani does also have poolside dining, a Japanese restaurant, a buffet restaurant, and a small coffee bar in the lobby. Other dining options include a Roy's restaurant down the street, a modern Japanese restaurant called YuZu that will open in summer 2012 across the street, the Paradise Cove Luau, a taco shop across the street, and ice cream shop across the street, a local food place across the street, and all of the restaurants at Aulani, a Disney Resort & Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: buddha0404
Reviews.Content: Marriott lists this location as a Category 6 on 7 point scale with 7 being the highest. Don't be fooled like we were. Best Western's treat there guests better. First, it is $35 a day to part here even if you are a guest. Second, the front desk isn't marked as such, it is small and we waited in line for 15 minutes for the two people in front of us to get what they needed. They staff is slow and unwilling or unable to handle even the simplest of tasks. Third, they messed up our reservation. Our room (a delxue oceanview) was not ready. I had written confirmation of our rollaway bed request for our son which they say didn't exist and even though we booked a room rate with their total escape package they tried to deny us that. We had to call or stop by the front desk 7 times on the first day. Fourth, this hotel is old and looks and smells like it. The room was nice and and had a nice view but the lobby furniture has been here since the 70s. The carpets and chairs are worn out and nasty. When we finally got to our room, the tv didn't work. This all put a major damper on our first day. The staff is not interested in helping the guests in anyway, so don't look to them for help. If you want to have fun in Hawaii avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Spa weekend ruined by non-advertised Spa Closure”
Reviews.Author: twitterpait
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were staying in Waikiki for a week - prior to travel, we decided to add on a weekend stay at Ko-Olina, thinking we would have a spa weekend. We had extensively researched spas in Oahu and I had even visited the area last December - we were very excited about staying there and having a spa weekend at their beautiful facility. Unpleasant surprise upon checkin when the front desk advised that the spa was closed for renovations. There was a temporary setup in the Penthouse suite, but it was barely adequate for minimal services (massages) and there were no amenities. We had corresponded several times with the spa and no mention was ever made of the closure, nor was it disclosed on the hotel's website. I had used Marriott points plus $150/night to upgrade to a deluxe ocean front room (which was lovely by the way) - add to this the $36/night parking, $15/day internet and ridiculous prices at restaurants and pool bars - my lovely "just about free" spa weekend was almost completely ruined. I will say the room was beyond beautiful and it was so relaxing to sit on deck and watch the ocean - very private. The grounds and walks were beautiful too. But the food/drinks - blech, and too expensive. Pool also pretty small - multiple pools at the neighboring resorts (including Marriott's own beach club) looked much more inviting. Also you can tell that the lagoon area nearest this property will soon be a nightmare when the Disney resort opens fully - too many kids for my adult taste. Although the only hot tub had specific signage forbidding children under 10 to use it, the hottub was treated like a kiddie pool - MANY toddlers with floating toys in there every day. We finally had the pool attendant kick out the toddlers one afternoon and we suffered the wrath of parents' dirty looks the remainder of the day. (Why would parents even think it was safe to let a 18-month old use a hottub??) Italian restaurant on site had snooty wait staff, ridiculous prices and mediocre food. If I ever go back, I'll stay elsewhere but try to go to the spa after it's remodeled!

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: msstenny
Reviews.Content: We found the ihilani very relaxing. We had a great view from the 16th floor of the beach. Disappointed because the spa was closed for remodeling. Food/drink expenses were what you'd expect from a resort, but plenty of places nearby that are cheaper. Did think that Marriott was cheap in the room coffee service-single servings and paper cups. Also the room fridge doesn't keep things cold constantly, so we couldn't safely leave food items in it.

Reviews.Title: “Awful - not worth the time, the money or disappointment From the JW brand”
Reviews.Author: JDcomments
Reviews.Content: The brand is really compromised by the poor quality of this particular resort, the staff and the overall experience. It needs to be closed for a major six month overhaul. I guess I expect more from the JW brand - but this isn't it ... The dining facilities are run down, tired, dirty and just not well kept. The rooms are run down, old and frankly had quite a bit of mold in showers, and corners of rooms... The pool was silly, and again run down. The staff does not seem to be interested in the guest - really indifferent to my feedback... They are more intertested in their commute, and their personal schedules... Really hard to get attention. I was disappointed in the upkeep, the lack of investment and the silly prices for such a poor quality experience. The spa may have been nice 20 years ago, I felt bad for the people trying to clean the stained, decaying facilities I have been to many nicer supposed ."low end" suites and residences (by Marriott), they are much nicer! This doesn't deserve to be called a JW.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, but...”
Reviews.Author: GoPackers12
Reviews.Content: I can't say much more than many others have said about this resort. It's a beautiful resort in a quiet, out of the way location. The pool is very cold and too small, almost an afterthought. Beach activities are minimal and pricey as well. The only food we ordered at the resort was at the pool bar, and was very good, if a bit pricey. The restaurants at the resort had very high prices, and we didn't bother to try them. You can get food about two miles away in Kapolei. We typically visited other places and got food there. Though it's not part of the resort, I must say, we were very disappointed in the Hawaiian BBQ quick service restaurant across the street, which has low prices, and food quality to match. The cove was nice for swimming, but a bit cloudy for snorkeling. The next cove to the south was much better, with fewer people, clearer water, and I saw two turtles. Go in the morning. My only real complaints are a bit of an ant infestation when we didn't secure our food as well as we should have, and the pillowtop bed was a little soft for my taste. There is a refrigerator in the room, but no microwave, which would be a good amenity. The staff is extremely friendly, helpful, and prompt. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Best Area in Oahu, Worthy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MTRose
Reviews.Content: While not 5-star quality, we totally enjoyed our stay here and would stay here again. We stayed 7 nights. The extra $25/night for an ocean view room was TOTALLY worth it - we spent every evening on our big balcony watching the gorgeous sunsets. Room is huge (bigger than most studio and 1 bdrm condos), quiet, nicely decorated. They kindly let us check in at 10:30am. There was some construction going on at the Spa and wedding parties made some noise on weekends, but overall (considering this Oahu) it was still very pleasant and relaxing. We really enjoyed the walk along the coves. Lovely landscape, clean. They are starting to get more restaurants nearby too. The hotel restaurants are fine, albiet a bit pricey (everything is pricey here). The room rate started off very reasonable, but once you add on internet ($12.95/day), room upgrade and parking ($36/day) it's expensive. We drove all over the island, and we liked Ko Olina area best...no regrets staying here. Shopping & Costco close by, USS AZ only 40 minutes away. Our room was on the west side of the hotel, which is the quieter side, if I was on the other side I might not have liked it as much. Pool is small....we waited there 20 minutes one day for a beer we ordered that never came (so we left). Beach is better anyway. We tried both the Japanese restaurant and the Terrace restaurant, both were fine but nothing special. All in all it was a very relaxing break and we had awesome weather. :)

Reviews.Title: “Serene and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: coast2city
Reviews.Content: We've been going to Ihilani for the last 13 years and love everything about it. Tucked away on the west side of Oahu in a quiet, peaceful resort surrounded by lagoons, this hotel is as good as it gets for the price you pay. The beach (lagoon) is never crowded and you don't have the hustle and bustle of Waikiki or Honolulu. The rooms are spacious, with a beautiful decor. The modern touches(remote control to control just about everything in the room) are also great. Service has always been top-notch. We had some concerns about traveling with a child with food allergies and the head chef met us when we arrived and reviewed the menus from all of their restaurants. He even met us down by the breakfast buffet to go over the offerings. He helped make reservations and personally made sure that the chefs at the restaurants were aware of our situation. What service! Concierge is very helpful locating great places to eat nearby as well as activities. (Although we feel much like a local since we've been there so many times) Tennis club is awesome for anyone who enjoys playing. They offer free clinics throughout the week. Their pros are friendly, professional, and excellent. The views from the courts are incredible too. The pool is on the small side and does not have the fun features other hotels have. However, the lagoon is just a few steps away and the pool deck is not swarming with hundreds of people. I can definitely relax and chill. We have not been there since Disney property opened. We will have to see how much effect that has on Ihilani.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Josh C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ihilani as part of a wedding party. The facilities, hotel and restaurants were good though the food was overpriced. This should be expected though. We stayed in a remodeled ocean view room which was amazing! This is a great place to stay if you want to get out of the crowds of Waikiki. You'll need a car so plan ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with 1 Exception”
Reviews.Author: henri mitchell
Reviews.Content: Nice property although a little small. Nice rooms, great bathroom, great service. Not a lot of beach to walk on. We had a lovely stay until the weekend. On Saturday all of these kids showed up with friends. They did not seem to be guests. There did not seem to be parents controlling the kids. It was very unenjoyable both days. Loud, rowdy kids at the pool is not what I expect at this hotel. When I complained i was told that they run specials on the weekend for the locals. They allow them use of the pool before and after check-in. If they even were guests, it seemed they had invited their friends as well. By Monday all was quiet and the pool was very enjoyable. i would not stay at this hotel again if my stay included a weekend. For the second half of our trip we stayed out the Outrigger Reef for significantly less. The pool was very nice. You had to give your room number to get towels and I saw security pass through once or twice. Even though there were plenty of kids, they all had adult supervision and everyone seemed to be having a good time. if you want to relax by the pool save yourself some money and stay at the Outrigger Reef.

Reviews.Title: “Sunny, Lovely resort”
Reviews.Author: PucksterColorado
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights here. The resort is on the west (sunny) side of the island and is quite lovely. We got a deluxe ocean view room and it was one of the best hotel rooms we've ever had--roomy, a great porch with comfy couch and two chairs and a table, incredible view, great bathroom with two sinks. We ate at every restaurant and found them delicious, especially Azul. The cove and walkway south are pretty. We chose this Marriott because we didn't want more time in a plane but wanted away from Waikiki after a 5-day conference there. For this, it was a perfect choice. Easy access to the rest of the island. Disney is next door--as in sharing the same half of the little cove, right next door--and they happen to be a touch of a noisy neighbor... lots of families, shows at night with music and lights. But everyone there is quiet after 8:30 so it's not a big deal. I can't say this is all my heart's desire when it comes to exclusive resorts, but it's very nice, refined and quite calming. Great people at the bars, and as said before, great food. We got a really good rate through AAA, so I consider it a good choice given everything we looked for on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Substandard service spoiled an otherwise nice stay”
Reviews.Author: TexasGma
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a beautiful location, rooms are pleasantly decorated. Onsite restaurants have good menu selection, dining room service was prompt. Front desk was simply unresponsive to many requests and housekeeping was erratic at best. Inoperable coffee pot had to be replaced first night. we had to make multiple requests to get the minimum number of towels. Housekeeping failed to service our room on two of the six nights stay. There was no hotel guide or any information regarding hotel restaurants and services avaible. First call to the front desk resulted only in a poor photocopy of the room service menu, with handwritten corrections. I tried again to explain I wanted information about the hotel, not simply room service, but received the same photocopy. I asked at the front desk, and was told it was being upgraded but he would find something for me. Another photocopy was brought to my room. On the third day I stopped by the front desk and strongly suggested hat I was tired of wandering the hotel to discover what restaurants and menus were on site and what other services were available. A leatherbound three ring binder was left in the room, but many sections were empty. The service was simply not what I expect from JW Marriott hotels of this class.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Renovation”
Reviews.Author: Peahead59
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an outstanding location and has recently gone through room renovations that move it into that first class property category. We had stayed there in years past but were always dissapointed in the rooms (even our upgraded rooms with private lanai and spa were depressing). However, all that has changed. Upon this visit I was very surprised to see the changes and updates to the rooms. They were beautiful. Decorated in beige and royal blues. I can now highly reccommend this property. It is right next door to the new Disney Resort and visitors can stroll over there as well and enjoy some of the Disney restaurants such as AMA- AMA for a change of pace. But during the day enjoy the JW's incedible pool, great food and service (with fewer screaming kids).

Reviews.Title: “The ingredients are here...”
Reviews.Author: TomCat5913
Reviews.Content: The ingredients are here for a very relaxing, restorative vacation. The location is well away from the buzz of Waikiki Beach, yet not isolated without the conveniences of an array of nearby places to visit. Treat yourself to a deluxe ocean view room and you will not be disappointed. During our stay, we never once heard noise from neighboring guests. There are a handful of good choices on site from the pool bar to the Naupaka Terrace for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Azul has nice outdoor patio dining and a tranquil setting to enjoy very well prepared dishes. If you seek a wide variety of culinary choices, during an extended stay, you may decide to venture off the resort. We enjoyed Roy's down the road at the Golf Course. Very good choice for local seafood dishes. The atmosphere of the resort was very relaxing, the staff were all wll trained and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “paradise”
Reviews.Author: MotherfromNY
Reviews.Content: With the exception of paying over $30.00 per night for parking - this hotel is perfect. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is located next to Disney's Aulani and my 10 year old daughter said she would rather stay at JW than at Aulani (they share the same lagoon). My husband said this was better than ATLANTIS in the Bahamas.

Reviews.Title: “We liked the JW. Not great for kids.”
Reviews.Author: missphilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW February of 2012.  This was our first trip to Oahu, and second to Hawaii. We traveled to Maui 10 years ago.  I was nervous that I wouldn't like Oahu, since people seem to encourage visiting the other islands over Oahu, but we were very pleasantly surprised with the beauty of Oahu. The JW is about 45 minutes from Honululu. The traffic on Oahu is TERRIBLE. Without traffic, it is easily a  20 minute drive from the airport.  We toured Waikiki and Honululu and you all can keep that city, thankyouverymuch. If I wanted to see a big city I wouldn't travel all the way to Hawaii to visit one. Anyway, Ko Olina is a very nice little 'neighborhood' . There are some residences, a golf course, a luau, a strip mall and three hotels on the complex which is gated off. We saw all three hotels and still decided that the JW was exactly where we belonged. There were three main disadvantages to the JW, compared to the other two hotels, and I'll get to those. But the one main advantage, which beat out the others for me, was the location of our room.  I cannot express this point enough, but if you stay here,  PAY EXTRA FOR THE DELUXE OCEANVIEW ROOM!   The JW has rooms that are the closest to the actual ocean. The Disney property as well as the other Marriott property are set pretty far back from the ocean. If I wasn't so lazy, I'd post a video of the sound of the ocean crashing onto the rocks outside our room. Beautiful. And if it became too loud, you could easily close the balcony doors, and you had complete silence. There were enormous screen doors, so you really enjoy the fresh air.  Our room was on the 12th floor. The sunsets from our balcony were not to be believed!  And the second highlight is that the balcony is very large!!! The other two hotel balconies were small in comparison. The rooms were very nice and comfortable. We were upset that they didn't offer cribs for babies, but 'pack and plays'. This probably is not the best resort for kids, but we were there for a conference so we had no choice.  Other than that, the hotel is just nice. Nothing spectacular. It's starting to show its age. The pool is AWFUL. It's a circle that looks ridiculously small for the size of the hotel. But in February, we weren't swimming all that much. It was extremely breezy, with the high temperature being upper 70's to low 80's our entire week.  The weather was absolutely beautiful for everything else, but not so much for swimming.  Unfortunately, since it was a little chilly, and the pool was not heated, the few kids that were at the property all sat in the hot tub, which was only supposed to be for people over the age of 10. And the hot tub wasn't even hot.  The beaches at all three hotels are exactly the same. The sand is very course, but clean and the water was nice.  The other two areas that the other hotels in Ko Olina  may have over the JW is that they are time share facilities so they are larger with kitchens, dining rooms, washers and dryers.  The pool areas at the other two resorts were far superior to the pool at the JW. Especially for kids. The pool at the JW was so bad, that if I were a kid at this hotel and actually saw the pool areas at the other two resorts, I'd bawl like a baby.  Fortunately for us, my Aunt was staying at the other Marriott property at the same time, and were able to use the pool for the day as her guests. FOR THE DAY is the operative word here. The Marriott and the Disney resorts are EXTREMELY STRICT with their pool areas.  At the Marriott, there were people wearing all sorts of wristbands. We wore red, for being a guest, the timeshare owners wore yellow, and if you were able to ride the waterslide you had to wear another bracelet to show you could swim. My sons had to take a swim test to be able to use the waterslide. Also, there is security EVERYWHERE on the Marriott property. So don't think you'll be able to pool hop.  It was low season there, and I can't imagine how packed the Marriott pool would be if it was at full occupancy. We also toured the Disney property and took the vacation club time share lecture.  This allowed us to see the entire property. It was OK. The rooms were nice, the balconies were small, the pool area was fantastic  (waterslide , lazy river) but the restaurant options on the property were very very very expensive, and limited, and when the third building opens, I have no idea where they are going to put everyone. The grounds of the Disney resort were very nice. I loved the pool area and the little cave where you could view the pretty fish. You can actually snorkel in that little pool (for an extra cost, of course).  Both the Marriott and the Disney resorts seemed vast and large. I don't know how to put it other than saying that they weren't very 'warm' or 'welcoming'.  They were filming the Kelly Ripa show while we were there. There were a lot of people around for that. The JW has three restaurants on site. We only ate at the casual restaurant for dinner once, when they offered a valentines day buffet. The other nights we ate near the excursions we took or the strip mall, which was within walking distance from the JW.  We also ate at Roy's on the golf course which was wonderful but fully  booked.  It seemed everyone wanted to eat there. if you want to eat there during your stay, make reservations early.  There is a shuttle that stops at all three resorts, and at some points during the day, stops at the golf course and the Paradise Cove luau. We visited Pearl Harbor, Hanauma bay for snorkeling  (skip that. Although its a pretty location, it was crowded and the water was very murky. The best snorkeling we've ever done was in Cozumel, and this did not compare. That clarity of the water in Cozumel was much better. ) We also rented a car and drove all over the island. We drove to the Dole pineapple factory, the north shore (you MUST see those waves! ) and even tried the flea market at the aloha stadium. (great place for souvenirs!) All in all, we really enjoyed Oahu and the JW.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - would go back in an instant”
Reviews.Author: Bec48603
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Ihilani Resort for our 25th anniversary. The hotel and grounds are so beautiful. The staff is friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. We even had one of the valets come over to us when he saw us sitting looking at a map and give us advise on our trip. I have read reviews from people who were at the hotel the same week that we were who referred to staff not being helpful or knowledgable. The only thing I can think is that these guests may have been some of the ones that we observed during our stay who seemed to have a entitlement attitude. Hawaii is a friendly and relaxed place to stay. If you barge in there with a hostile attitude... well... The beach and pool chairs never seemed over crowded. We were never bothered by noise from the Disney resort. The view from our room was breath taking. We had done our planning for things we wanted to see and the recommendation to have a car by other reviewers was well worth the investment. We enjoyed the freedom to get out and drive around the island to various attractions throughout the week. We also had plenty of things to walk to and explore in the area, so if you didn't want to go outside the immediate vicinity, you could get anything you wanted or needed without a car.

Reviews.Title: “Will probably stay elsewhere next time . . .”
Reviews.Author: ERDoc1025
Reviews.Content: Went there b/c it was the host hotel for a medical conference. On the plus side the view from my room was magnificent, the room terrific & the bed very comfortable - and that's from someone who has a Sleep Number bed w a Tempurpedic topper. Staff were all friendly and helpful. Additionally the facilities for the conference were quite good. On the minus side ... Pool was small & cold, hot tub really wasn't Beach was nice but snorkeling in the lagoon was below average. Of course that's not the hotel's fault - they have no control over which creatures choose to inhabit their lagoon. It just is what it is. The restaurants were average - not great but not awful either. My biggest fault with this hotel is that it is so geographically isolated & yet they do nothing to address that. I "assumed" (& once again proved assuming is never a good thing to do) there would be transportation to the hotel from HNL. Nope. I also figured surely they would have some sort of shuttle into Downtown Honolulu a few times a day. Nope. Plus they want $35/day to park a car making a rental car even more costly. It's a shame because the transportation issue really is the dealbreaker. The other stuff was pretty minor and had shuttles to other areas been available I'd return to this hotel. As it is, if I return to the conference next year I will stay at Hickham, the Navy Lodge or the Hale Koa & rent a car with the difference in cost of the room. Which I'd really rather not do - I would vastly prefer to stay at the host hotel. But not enough to be trapped on premises when the lectures let out & I can't justify staying there and renting a vehicle when the cost of staying elsewhere is so much less.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, cold pool - brr”
Reviews.Author: travelbug2004
Reviews.Content: We loved our room in this hotel - very spacious and clean, lots of storage, with a great view. We even turned around the mini couches at the end of each of the double beds to make small kids beds (we have a 4 and 5 year old) which worked wonderfully as the mini couches had an L-shaped armrest. Interestingly, when we initially tried to book a room in this hotel, my husband was not permitted to book a room because he said there would be 4 in the room and they said they only allowed 3 - how crazy is that, they literally said they could not reserve a room for us if we stated there was going to be 4 in the room. After he calmed down and since he was planning on attending and had already paid for a conference at the hotel, he called the conference coordinator who also thought that was unusual so he booked the room for us himself. They almost lost a customer and of course, we had no issues checking in with the 4 of us. The general layout of the hotel was pleasing with koi fish at the entrance and hammerhead sharks near a restaurant (small ones). The pool however was cold and hardly used. The staff around the pool were very friendly and they even had kids pool toys, such as noodles and pails, in a storage bin next to the towel stand although it was not marked as such. I just happened to see others take things from this bin and asked if it was for general use and it was. During our stay, we walked down to the Marriott beach club and saw that they had more unique pools and "heated" ones and for this reason alone, I would recommend staying at the marriott beach club if you have a choice - the facilities are much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience & Customer Service!!”
Reviews.Author: OakleafFarm
Reviews.Content: My husband spoke at a conference held at the hotel. Arrived the day before, and greeted with friendly service. Upon check in, we were informed that a king sized bed. Due the inconvenience, we were given a double queen and a partial view of the ocean for compensation. What a view!!! We normally prefer staying at B&Bs (quieter), however, the hotel experience has been amazing for us. Although we were next to the Disney resort, it was quiet around the hotel. In fact, we had great cocktails there - listening to live, classic Hawaiian music. We ate at the restaurant for breakfast and lunch. Breakfast selection was great!! Service was a little slow since there was only one waitress to 8 tables. But the ambience and friendly service (Sean was very friendly) was enough to make one patient. Lunch was good too. Just don't order the salad with seafood - I think the greens were from the buffet -not fresh. The location is perfect for cario- ran around the lagoons, and it would be the perfect place for swimming and learning to Stand Up Paddle. Snorkeling gear were available for guests - heard there were turtles and fish in the lagoon. Lots of positive ratings! The only negative: paying extra $$ for internet. I was very impressed with the overall service, cleanliness, quality of room, and location. Ate at Roy's for dinner - fixe price menu-great deal! walking distance from hotel. Highly recommended!! It's far from Waikiki Beach - so it's quiet, and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Culture of "no"”
Reviews.Author: Pekoe08
Reviews.Content: I am not sure where the people who gave this hotel great reviews stayed. I would agree that the rooms are great. That is about it. The pool is tiny and freezing. The worst part was the overall experience. If you have stayed at hotels with a culture of "yes" in their service (Four Seasons, Mandarin Oriental, etc.) then this place has a culture of "no." Almost every request was met with a negative response and an excuse. It culminated with a request for a half day rate as our flight home was at night. We expected and were willing to pay for this. The front desk staff told my wife it was not possible as the hotel was full. My wife pointed out that there were rooms available to rent online via Expedia or on the hotel's own website. She was told "then go ahead and book one of those." Being caught in a lie and then responding rudely was over the top. I would never stay at this property again. I would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: 8ladybugs
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is out dated, has horrible service with staff that really don't care about your experience, has a miniature round pool, poor restaurants, no bar with evening music. It is very tired and not anywhere close to a high end Hawaiian hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Carol L
Reviews.Content: We used Marriott points to stay at this hotel and paid and extra $50 to have an ocean view room. When we checked in, the staff offered us an upgrade to a Pacific view suite. OMG! We had two complete rooms, two full bathrooms, two flat screen TV's, four phones and two lanais. It was well worth the extra $50 per night. The beach is great and has access to the other man made lagoons on that side of the island. The restaurants were all very good and various price levels. The pools near the restaurants with the hammerhead sharks, fish and rays in them were great fun to watch. Parking costs the same if you self park or valet. Room service was a bit slow but I think they were understaffed when we were there. Overall, for the price we paid it was a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location, noisy neighbor”
Reviews.Author: Ppapp
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel, in a incredible location on the leeward coast of Oahu. First of all having a car is a must, to get to this location a to get around to the "better" restaurants in ther area. Although the hotel will charge a $35 per day parking fee, oh well, what choice did I have. Anyway, the rooms are fantastic, I highly recommend a ocean view, or bay view, the sun sets are worth it! Stay away from any rooms facing the new Disney hotel next door as the noise will drive you insane. All rooms have large balconies, wonderful bathrooms and other newly renovated items. The pool is simple, but the kids seems to enjoy, beach access is equally as easy. As a early riser, I recommend the 7:30 am fish feeding at the beach, a fun free activity.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience!”
Reviews.Author: Marie-NYNY
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at the JW Marriott Ihilani -- hotel is located in a beautiful spot by the beach west of Honolulu and the airport, while it is not that close to major attractions in Honolulu, it is an easy ride to popular attractions. Hotel is well maintained and service/staff is courteous, professional and helpful. Loved my room, was comfortable, beautifully furnished and also had an outstanding ocean view, with a priceless sunset view. Had dinner at Azul, the Italian restaurant and also enjoyed the meal, though it was somewhat expensive. Would definetely return!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon stay”
Reviews.Author: Newlywedc
Reviews.Content: Hi Everyone, So I finally came around to writing the review about our Honeymoon stay at JW Ihliani. We went around Nov 2011. Me & my husband were very excited to stay at the resort, we did a lot of research before we booked and read all the reviews here on trip advisor. We stayed there for about 12 days for our honeymoon. Let me start by saying driving by the gate to enter the resort it looked fabulous. We choose to self park park to save money, made our way to the lobby, which was nicely kept. My husband went to the front desk to check us in, & found out that our room was not the one we requested. So we had to wait about 15 minutes till they got a room. Rooms: They were okay, nothing fancy, not for the price that we paid. I would say it's like any other hotel room i've been to. The view also was not what we wanted, but I was not going to let that spoil my mood after all we were on our honey moon. They gave us the room facing the garden with all the birds which were pretty loud in the morning. So I had the door shut so we didn't have to hear the noise that much. We adapted ok for the 12 days. The bathroom needed a lot of work, the shower was leaking water to the floor and we had to put towels to prevent the water from going into the rest of the bathroom. We called maintenance to fix it which they said they would when we leave the room, but it was never fixed through out our entire stay it was leaking. No bathroom robes, which i thought was odd, with a resort that big you would expect that, especially for the money being paid to stay there as a guest. The powder room, it just felt like they did not clean it at all when we leave the room. They would empty out the trash and that's it. Food: the food was extremely expensive at the resort, we had our first breakfast there and decided to go shopping a few miles down the street & brought our food back & put it in the fridge. There were a lot of families who did that & so we decided to do the same thing. Transportation: Since the resort is so far away, I would def recommend getting a car if you plan to explore Oahu like we did. We drove to Lanikai, Beach which is a must see the best beach I have ever been to in my entire life. Drive up to the North Shore if you like to see the high waves. This hotel is not for honeymooners for sure, because the Disney Resort is right next door and there are so many kids around, especially the lagoon areas which are not far away from each other. I would recommend staying somewhere else if you are looking for romance and quite time. We made the best out of it but wanted to share with you my experience with you all.

Reviews.Title: “This resort is expensive but the view from the top floor was magnificant”
Reviews.Author: havefuninthesun
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to this very nice property. My wife and I spent four great days at this resort. Our room was facing the ocean on the top floor and the views and sounds from the balcony were priceless. Lagoon snorkling was very disappointing since water was not very warm and visibility was poor. Staff at breakfast restaurant were very friendly and food from menu was pricey but good. If you want a quiet few days, this is the place with the right room location.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay! Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Holly B
Reviews.Content: We stayed as part of a large group that rented much of the hotel. This was our fifth trip with previous stays at mostly Ritz Carlton. In my opinion this hotel was way better than our experiences at Ritz. We had a deluxe ocean view on the quiet side overlooking the lagoon of stingrays. I could have sat on the veranda on the chaise lounge all day just listening to the ocean. The room was bigger than ones we had experienced on previous trips like this and had a very large bathroom as well. We loved the small touches like the great spa quality toiletries. For once we didn't have any problems so we had little interaction with the staff for the most part except the housekeeping lady who was extremely nice and friendly. I'm not sure how expensive the hotel room would have been without the group rates so I cannot speak to that but the one thing that I thought was way too expensive was the overnight parking at $40/night plus we had to pay some weird porterage fee just to be able to use the valet (there really isn't a self park option and I would think at $40 might that would include access to the valet). If you are looking for a huge grand resort this is not the place but I think thats why I like it. It always felt quiet except in the lobby at certain times. They have one main pool but access to the four lagoons that serve the other area hotels and condos. This area of the island is about 20 miles from Honolulu but in my opinion this was a huge plus! I didn't care for the bustle of Waikiki and much preferred the quiet area around Ko'polei. I was concerned that the Disney Aulani was next door but to be honest it was self contained and not garish and did not interfere with the Marriott at all. We toured the Disney property thinking we may bring the kids back one day but decided if we did that we would prefer to stay at the Marriott. From the location if you have a rental car you can drive wherever you want to visit on the Island. I recommend a trip to the North Shore and also to Kualoa Ranch. We loved the Kualoa so much we made two trips. I have not one complaint about our week long stay. Its been a long time since I have had a five star review. Thank you Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff...hotel needs some work”
Reviews.Author: Gerry H
Reviews.Content: Hotel is modern but rooms are worn out. Staff is great, rooms are large, and love the shark lagoon. Outside of hotel desperately needs a paint job. Private lot ( not the laui) next to hotel on lagoon side hosts parties on saturday nights. Very, very loud music until 10pm. Breakfast buffett was delicious and had a nice tranquil atmosphere. Parking valet or self is $35...a bit much. Marriott needs to fix the hotel sooner than latter. Seeing the new aulani does not help out.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Ihilani - Expensive but a Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Alan_Gottlieb
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel. My wife and I spent three night there after four in Waikiki at the Trump. Both the Lagoon and pool were great and the room was excellent. This an expense hotel, however, and at $380 per/night its pretty typical for a Hawaii resort.In terms of restaurants, the Japanese is superb. We had the buffet and were very happy with it. Best Sushi I ever had and plenty of excellent side dishes as well.. ran $100 for two and was a great value. We also ate one dinner at the Family restaurant and were not impressed. The menu choices were really limiting. It was ok and nothing special. One of the downsides of this hotel is a lack of resturants nearby. There is an Italian in the hotel but we did not get to try it. Even if you have a car, however, there is not much of choice nearby. We also found the drinks at the pool reasonably priced and the service good. The one irritation was a $36 per/day parking fee which you had to pay whether or not you used the valet or not. I think this outrageous when you are paying nearly $400 per-night for a room. The year before, we stayed at Turtle Bay and I only recall paying for parking if you used the valet. Overall, this was a great stay and the weather was perfect. I don't think you will find a better resort hotel. The year before, we stayed at Turtle Bay and its was nice as well but a bit different. If you really like swimming in a calm lagoon, then go to the Marriott. If you would like a more rural and closer to nature experience, try Turtle Bay. The waves there are awesome and the North Shore is fantastic. Prices are pretty similar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: mejack
Reviews.Content: The service was top notch and the resort was very quiet and very elegant without any stuffiness. We enjoyed our stay very much and would definitely come back, given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: ArtofHair T
Reviews.Content: Check was fast and friendly. I was also upgraded to an ocean front. Staff is super friendly. Ko Olina is the best area to visit on the island of Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view and a bit of difference from ordinary JW hotels”
Reviews.Author: nyay
Reviews.Content: This place was good just because it was quieter than Waikiki beach. Compared with regular JW hotels, it looked much simpler... Terrific thing was we enjoyed new year's eve fireworks there, was launched right above our eyes over the little bay, it was very exciting and magnificent. The food at the restaurant inside the hotel was outrageous due to the special event, and food was so so. Another set back was along the pool, so small numbers of beach chairs - considering the numbers of room, it was too little. I heard many people were disappointed not to be able to take chairs by the pool (some people rudely left towels and didn't show up for hours! In this hotel, they should do something for this kind of situation since they don't arrange enough chairs). Check-in wasn't prompt even though we communicated via their online service to identify the time of arrival, this system was totally useless. Even upon arrival, we were told to wait for an hour, then we showed up again after an hour, the room was still not ready... Amenity was simple so you should not expect the way other JW treated you. But again, if you solely focus on quiet, beautiful hotel to relax, I think, it's worth staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Great area!”
Reviews.Author: mrcanfield3
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Ihilani, the room was beautiful with an ocean front view, we had wonderful experiences at all the bars and restaurant. The staff was great too!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome setting, not a typical JW property”
Reviews.Author: cderner7
Reviews.Content: We opted to stay a few extra days on Oahu after a conference. We were delighted to be able to leave behind to bustle of Honolulu for this quieter setting. The lagoons were gorgeous, we had no problems with crowds or finding beach chairs or space around to pool. The hotel was very quiet and we were told it is the smallest JW hotel with around 300 rooms. We enjoyed ourselves during our time at the resort and found the resort to be pretty kid friendly with our 1 year old son. Pros: Beautiful location Great sandy beach lagoons Fish ponds with sharks and sting rays to look at Clean pool Good sized room with very modern electronic conveniences Great closet storage Large bathroom and vanity area Large balcony Literally a wall of windows looking out to oceans Cons: The building and grounds don't seem up to par compared to other JW's. Hallways stark white, shower could have been scrubbed a little cleaner, sheets were not your typical Marriott sheets (they were thin), one pool that would be crowded if busy, same food offered in a few of the restaurants (ok food), restaurants not as trendy as some other JW properties. Overall seems older and not as luxurious as I would expect for a JW property.

Reviews.Title: “I'm not a resort fan but this place won me over”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan S
Reviews.Content: I would never choose to stay in a conventional resort. I was here for an international maritime law meeting otherwise would be looking for something a lot more informal and one-of-a-kind. However, four days here were truly delightful. We were given a genuine welcome when we arrived and our room, although it was off the main atrium on the fifth floor, was astonishingly quiet - no noise from outside so it was like a spacious, luxurious cocoon. Bit of a surprise in a place like this to find no minibar, but the hotel bar itself was very friendly and I was astonished to encounter two staff members who recalled what I had ordered the night before. The pool is small and shallow but you can get a good swim in the lagoon a few yards away across the beach. Over the course of the stay, we ate, and ate well, at the poolside bar, at the Naupaka Terrace and at Ushio-Tei, the Japanese restaurant. Japanese is one of my favorite cuisines and ordering à la carte here we had a memorable meal; others reported that the buffet option was a disappointment. The welcome continued throughout our stay - reception, restaurant, bar, poolside, parking and housekeeping staff all seemed, without exception, quite genuinely and spontaneously to want us to feel welcome. As noted by others, the parking is hideously expensive. However, I stumbled across the fact that the group we were with had negotiated a concessionary self-parking rate of $15/day and, when I was checking out, heard that the group that followed us had negotiated a rate of $10, so be sure to ask about this if you think you might be eligible. We didn't explore the adjacent resorts but did dine out one night at the Roy's across the golf course - and it was very, very good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Remote Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bikinigirlhawaii
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before flying home. Beautiful hotel and room and the room service was beyond excellent! Nice pool, small and the beach has no surf. Next door to the Disney Resort, which is probably more fun with kids. Very far from Waikiki also.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Oahu”
Reviews.Author: estesk
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were wonderful. Our oceanview suite was huge. We felt safe and secure.The Sat. night buffet was soooo good!!!!! Our first time to Hawaii and it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A short week in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: BXC53
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on Marriott points,so I can't speak to the value for the normal costs, but we very much enjoyed the stay. We were on the 6Th floor with a view of the pool and lagoon beyond. The room was very good - Quiet with the lanai door closed and the A/C unit was one of the best I have encountered -effective , yet unobtrusive. This was our first stay on this side of Oahu and we liked the more relaxing atmosphere compared to Honolulu. We found the resort food choices good, but expensive as expected in a high end resort. We did have the near mandatory rental car and found many other restaurant choices a short drive away, and a couple within walking distance. The pool was nice if a bit shallow, and the hot tub had a view of the lagoon. We swam in the lagoon and enjoyed that as well. The Disney property is next door, but for us, there was no real impact noise or crowd wise. Overall it was a good stay and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but not ideal with little kids”
Reviews.Author: pedro s
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week, over Christmas, with 2 little kids, using points. The stay was great, the staff was really nice, and did everything to make our stay pleasant. We had a problem with our room that we could feel the cigarette smell from the smoke area, despite of being on the 11th floor; the staff, from the guys on the front desk to their managers, did everything they could to move us from to a different room. They even offered us a suite that costed $350 more per night. But one suggestion: if you have little kids go to a different resort - Marriot Awailea is the other hotel we stayed at on this trip, much better for kids - but from a different island - Maui. To be fair they did promote cool 1-2-hour activities for the kids everyday, from cookie decoration to ginger bread house decoration. The beach in front of the hotel is really beautiful, good for little kids, but the water was really cold, so was the water from the pool. December is really windy in Oahu, if you get cold easily choose a different month to visit this side of Oahu. We also went to Maui and there it wasn't windy. My wife is telling me to mention that we were glad we were not on the Disney resort next door, because it was really crowded. So in summary: since I stayed on points, I can't say if the value is good or not, but staying on points is worth it if you are not taking the kids, there are other resorts that have more activities and areas for the little ones. But the staff is super friendly, the beach is really nice, and the room is huge and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “short trip”
Reviews.Content: This was a very expensive resort. It took a long time to check in but everyone was pleasant. We asked for a late checkout and receive 2 hours so that was also nice. The breakfast buffet was nice but very expensive $60 a dy for 2. The gym was excellent since it was open 24/7. The pool did not have enough chairs you have to claim one at 9AM to get one. The pool was adequate and rooms were very noisy you could hear the doors slam upstiars and the kids running around above you. The view was nice. This is a family resort do NOT go here on your honeymoon it is way too crowded and overrun with kids. Go to the caribbean much nicer less pricey. There was mold in the shower and it should be attended to if you are going to call this a 5 star resort. This is not a Ritz too bad there is not one on Oahu

Reviews.Title: “This place is AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: happytravelernp
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing room with an ocean view. The room was modern, and huge. The property was lovely, the pool was great, and the beach was nice. Also near waterslides should you feel the desire (just cause you're an adult doesn't mean it won't be fun!)

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Stacy R
Reviews.Content: 3 of us split the vacation between waikiki and the JW (tried to get night life and the beach quiet). We stayed at the Marriot in Waikiki for the first half of the trip and were super impressed (you can read that review for more info), and spent the second half at the JW! AMAZING! We had an ocean view (not pool) and had no noise issues (other than the birds that were taunting us). We went in 2009, so the Disney was merely under construction and was not an issue. The room was more dated than the other Marriott we stayed in. The beds were not as comfortable, the linens were slightly older, but nothing we complained about. the bathroom was worth the whole cost! i could have moved in! If you want a great view from the paradise cove part- insist on a room above the 5th floor (although no matter what floor you can see the stingrays below, which is cool!). Oh this is a great hotel if you want to get married, see someone getting married, crash a wedding, officiate a wedding..... you get the point- we saw SEVERAL in 3 days! (all amazing!) Food- we had the breakfast buffet each morning and it was exactly the same as the Waikiki buffet. but for dinner we did the sushi place- it ok merely ok and not really worth the premium, but what was I expecting while ording sushi in Hawaii? Transportation- we had to rent a car- which was a pain but proved to be very helpful for visiting north shore, parking was quite expensive, especially since I was staying at their hotel- where did they intend us to park? the ocean?? The spa was well above our means as was renting ANY of their amenities. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel if you get a great deal or win the lottery!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff, lovely property, good food, great beach & spa.”
Reviews.Author: sunbun22
Reviews.Content: Spent 9 days here over the Christmas holiday --- very, very nice stay. Lovely, well appointed & updated rooms on the 9th floor - one had two balconies with superb views of the ocean. Great housekeeping. With very few exceptions , the staff was top notch -- room service for breakfast every day so we could enjoy the Lanais - always on time, with great presentation and a big smile. My only constant gripe was with the stone faced bartenders who always looked like they wished they were somewhere else. What was the problem there? Great spa -- my son had a massage and I had a facial. Well done, lovely facility with a professional staff. Yes, Disney is next door. No, it's not a big deal. There is plenty of beach. Yes, the pool could be larger for the size of the property -- so go to the beach. Water is cold though during the winter - even in the protected beautiful lagoons. Two problems -- NO GUEST LAUNDRY and nowhere nearby to go either. Hotel wanted to charge $8 for a pair of shorts. Uh - NO. And charging for printing your boarding pass? Really - an amazing and ridiculous fee - especially when you do it at a HAMPTON INN for free and even for award level guests. My husband was so infuriated, he refused. ABC store across street -- good food and pretty good prices on everything you need. Eating - Most of the restaurants on site were good. However, Azul REALLY dissapointed, especially for the price on Christmas day. Chuck's Steakhouse at the Marriott Beach Club -- very good + very expensive ( but, hey, you're in Hawaii), Roy's - went all the way to Honolulu and it was definitely worth the trip! Location -- 40 minutes or so outside Honolulu -- so it's quiet --- but we loved it. We just planned outings.Wonderful walking along the paved beachside pathway through Ko Olina. Amazing views.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: T K
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights between Christmas & New Year's. What a relaxing place this was! After staying in another supposedly 5 star hotel in Waikiki, this hotel was by far the best. First, our room was a nice surprise - it was much bigger than we expected, clean, modern, bathroom doesn't disappointed with 2 sinks, separate shower, separate room for toilet, and oversized soaking tub, also fantastic view of lagoon & ocean. We immediately noticed how less crowded it was when we strolled across the street to the ABC store & saw less than 5 people in our 2 block walk. The rocky beach was fun to explore & climb around on and again, usually less than 5 people in sight. Sunsets were amazing! We were glad we had a rental car while staying here as you do feel very isolated. We got there at 2 and check-in time was 3, but it was nearly 4 before they were ready for us. For the delay, they comped us 2 drinks at the poolside bar & grill, which was nice. They also granted my request - & guaranteed it - for a late check out on the day we checked in - usually you have to request that the day of check out & it's not guaranteed. We appreciated their flexibility. The food at the hotel restaurants wasn't that great & very over priced. We were disappointed with each meal & only ate there 3 times as result. You pay for convenience. Overall, we enjoyed our stay very much and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: romadaro
Reviews.Content: Just spent one night at the JW after a weeklong stay at the Ko Olina Beach Club and I thought the hotel was in great shape and we had a very pleasant stay. I walked the grounds extensively after reading a few other reviews and saw nothing in disrepair and based on our room, which was large and clean, and the common areas, this property deserves a five star rating. My wife fell in love with the dining room next to the pool and we both thought it was extremely elegant and found the food superb and the service to be top notch. Fortunately, since we are owners at Ko Olina, we were able to escape the nickel and dime charges that others mentioned, although I would have to say that I didn't find the charges to be out of line with what other hotels in the area charge. I know from experience that parking at both the Hilton Hawaiian Village and the Hyatt Regency Waikiki also run around $40 per day, in addition to internet charges of $20-$25 per day if you're not an elite member. Seriously! As far as the Alani next door is concerned, it's just not fair to compare the JW to a property that's brand spanking new and just opened it's doors a few months ago. Of course, it's going to look better. What did you expect? There are a lot more kids around the lagoon with the Alani there than there were a year ago before it opened and it's noisier than I remember, but I didn't find it to be annoying or out of control. But, given a choice, I'd choose the JW over the Alani anyday because when the noise is contained between four walls it's a lot louder than out in the open. And, being a Disney property, it's naturally going to be full of kids.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a facelift but still managed to nickel and dime you to death”
Reviews.Author: left_at_eaglecap
Reviews.Content: Daily parking... $36. Rent a paddle board for an hour...$30. Rent a mildewed cabana for 4 hours...$20. Internet for 10 minutes....$7. Need to print something?.....$1 per page. Seriously? I was surprised they didn't charge a fee for beach towels. The hotel is in need of a deep cleaning inside and out. This observation is clear by simply walking through the new Aulani Hotel right next door. I think if JW and the boys are serious about retaining market share at Lagoon 1 Ko Olina they need to clean, paint and invest a little in fresh amenities (pool lounge chairs, cabanas, beach toys) at the old, tired Ihilani. Also, do not consider Azul (Ihilani's 4-diamond dining) as worthy of your time or money. I have reviewed Azul under a separate review.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: nyyanks
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed for six nights and it will be the only property that we stay at when visiting Oahu in the future. The moment we arrived to the moment we left, everything was perfect. The room is gorgeous and the view of the ocean and lagoon are amazing. We ate multiple times at Naupaka Terrace for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Try the banana macadamia nut pancakes for breakfast. The staff could not have been more professional. Dori and Laney at the concierge desk, Ryan at the front desk, and all the guys at the door were amazing. I can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Too short a stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pleasant1
Reviews.Content: Had reserved the JW for two nights but we were moved next door to the new Disney resort due to the president's APEC visit that weekend. It really broke up our weekend as we spent the day after we arrived packing, moving, and unpacking again at a new location. This with my 78 year old mother in law. However that said the Marriott was a gorgeous property! The staff was friendly and the service was very good as well. Our room was one of the nicest we have ever stayed in - and the view was amazing.
