I would come back here anytime. Again my only complaint was being moved for one night - it would have been a lot easier on us to have just sent us to Disney for both nights.

Reviews.Title: “Peace & Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: GLee1125
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent a week here in mid-December (9-16) & prior to our trip I read about noisy kids, the Disney Hotel too loud and I was a little concerned about the beach being over-crowded or the Aulina Hotel disruptive & I need to put your mind at ease. Yes there were children laughing & playing, and yes you could hear some activities that the Disney Hotel provided, but it was very manageable, not continuous & ended at a reasonable hour. The hotel is beautiful. The beach cove there is a very calm & relaxing place. The hotel is set in Ko Olina, out of the hustle & bustle of the Waikiki traffic. It is a clean hotel (including the bathroom, always important to me) with a great staff. Always friendly - always helpful. The Valet/Bellmen were all over it! They are friendly, they always got the car for us quickly, helped with any directions, chatted until our car arrived, and then let us go. The food on property was, in our opinion, typical for any hotel which is somewhat overpriced, but convenient and good. We only ate at the Naupaka Restaurant, once for dinner & twice for breakfast. It was just fine. We also ate at the poolside, salad was very fresh. Also, there is a Mexican Restaurant across the street with very reasonable prices. The Paradise Cove Luau is within walking distance as well. We would have eaten at the nearby Roy’s, but they had an incident on property with a gas leak while we were in HI, so it closed down until further notice. We hopped in the car & went to the one in Waikiki & it was well worth the drive. On our flight home, I asked my husband if he had any complaints about our hotel experience and he had the same response I did… NONE!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service”
Reviews.Author: AmitAgg99
Reviews.Content: Excellent to Stay, Perfect for Business. It 100% worth for relaxing mind and body. They have maiintain class in Service. Ease of Booking & instant solution is the best. To Good. Appreciate. Class of Stay. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Get away from Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Richtong
Reviews.Content: Ovrr the years, Waikiki has been the goto place for resorts in Oahu. But Ko'Olina has been developing and developing and we had a chance to get out there in prep for an upcoming event. What a place! The view is just amazing and it is so uncrossed. It is on the very dry side of the island so even when Honolulu is raining it is still beautiful here. We rated a night and watched three weddings against the prettiest sunset. If you go, splurge or beg borrow and steal and get the ocean view. The side that faces due south (we were on the 14th floor) is amazing. Like flying Over the ocean. The rooms are spacious and lovely. And the lanai's are really wonderful. Get a cocktail and lounge and watch the sunset. It is so wonderful and private. The cocktails are well made and so were the appetizers. Hey this is te spot that the heads of all 21 APEC nations had their dinner so you know if must be special. The staff is really great. We worked with the Head of events. She is terrific and so was the rest of the staff from Hellman to waiters. We also tried Azul the newly revised restaurant there. They have switched from Mediterranean to Italian with an emphasis on island ingredients. The tomatoes in the caprese were delicious as was the homemade pasta. Their wine list is wonderful and they even serve Caymus by the glass. So a great place to sample excellent bottles. The new general manager also pours as nice digestif of limoncello. Wonderful. We wanted a little bit of chocolate at the end and the waiter raided the back to get us some chocolate chips. Wonderful and thoughtful. We've been all over this island and there so many great spots. But this is like a relaxing oasis and so tranquil. Can't wait to get back and watch those sunsets!

Reviews.Title: “Simply fabulous rooms. Restaurants not appealing but dining elsewhere is abundant”
Reviews.Author: londoncal
Reviews.Content: We loved our spacious room with walk-in closet, 2 sinks, tub and shower, separate water closet Housekeeping was exceptional Pool and spa facilities were skimpy I would dine elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “You Have Got To Go.”
Reviews.Author: 1stdiva
Reviews.Content: Husband and I went to Hawaii on our 30 year anniversary. This resort was by far one of the best we have ever stay with, The staff were very kind, friendly, and helpful at all times. It is definitely worth the price we paid. The resort grounds are beautiful. It was nice, clean and peaceful. We could not and did not even want to do anything else but lay around the resort everyday. We had to make are selves go out. Wow what a great 30 year celebration they made it, you have got to go.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time on our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Dukooter
Reviews.Content: First of all i was a little worried when we booked our Honeymoon here because of the new Disney Resort opening next door. I have to tell you that it actually made the experience even better. We went over and had a few drinks at their bar and even had dinner at Ama Ama (excellent and they gave us a free desert for our honeymoon). As for the Ihilani, the resort was beautiful. The people were all very freindly and we set up some really nice trips through the Expedia guide at the concierge desk. We had an ocean view room which was absolutely perfect. The view overlooking the lagoons is spectacular. The room was in great shape and housekeeping did a great job coming in and cleaning up everyday. The room was also very spacious. We called down the first night and asked for Robes and they brought us robes from the Spa. The hotel is quite a ways away from everything, but that is exaclty what we wanted. We rented a car for two days and went to see Pearl Habor, the Dole plantation, the North shore, Waimea Valley, Sunset beach, etc. We are really glad we decided to do this because the other side of the island is so much different than the southern side. You really need to see everything. The pool is just ok, the pool at the Disney resort and the Marriott vacation clubs are much nicer, but we are more beach people anyway. The restaurants were all amazing, Ushio Tei was my favorite, definitely try their Monday and Friday buffett. We had breakfast every morning at Naupuka Terrace and the food was excellent. Prices are definitely high, but you have to expect that at any resort you stay. The only complaint i have is that there was no happy hour on the resort. No big deal, we walked down to the Marriott Beach Club from 3-5 everyday and enjoyed their happy hour. I really can't say enough how much we enjoyed our trip. If it werent for the 13 hour flight to Ohio, we would go once a year.

Reviews.Title: “spoiled”
Reviews.Author: tweekLA
Reviews.Content: Looked at the web-site it shows it all by itself with a private Laggoon. Arrived and went to our room and looked out our balcony and they have built a Disney Resort right next door (and thousands of familys with kids) all sharing the same private Laggoon. very dissapointed. The resturants have very few open hours so your kind of stuck with the Buffet and needless to say it is not that great. so food is dissapointing, distance from town is dissapointing, disney land resort next door is dissapointing, not really up to JW standards as to welcoming from the employees, nothing given to you as a Gold Member. No room turn downs in the evenings, First room was terrible and then they moved us and the room was very nice. Overall dissapointed and probably would never go back would prefer to stay in town.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE, LOVE, LOVE THIS PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: USMuseFan
Reviews.Content: My husband and transferred to this hotel after we realized the condo we booked was total crap. The rooms are fantastic and the views are amazing. The restaurants have exceptional food and the pool rocks as well as the hotel activities. We enjoyed the dancers and music at the pool on a weekend night. After our first visit we came back a few years later and got married on the secluded cove just north of the hotel. This place is heaven. The only negative thing I have to say about it is the rooms have shutters for window coverings and it doesn't black out the room. I like a room very dark when I sleep so I had to use an eye cover. But all the good overshadowed this one negative.

Reviews.Title: “Family trip over Thanksgiving 2011”
Reviews.Author: schnoodlelover
Reviews.Content: Our family of four just returned from a week's stay at the Ihilani. We stayed 6 nights. Two adults, 2 teen boys ages 16 and 13. I hope this review helps you in making your travel plans! Hotel: This is a very nice hotel. It used to be a 5 star when built by the Japanese 20 years ago but when purchased by Marriott, they made it more family friendly and the rating is now 4 stars. The hotel is beautiful and only slighted dated. We had two rooms on the 14th floor with amazing views. The rooms were huge and very nice. Definitely 5 star rooms! Pros: wonderful views of the coves; great staff; great location in the Ko'Olina resort area. Restaurants are ok...we only ate our first night at the less expensive one and ate several times at the pool. The spa is very nice and very talented staff. The coves are awesome and one of the best things about staying here or anywhere in this area. The beach area is great...you can take a great walk or run along all the coves and walk to the restaurants at the other hotels (which we did several times) Cons: We play tennis so anticipated a better experience. The courts are just ok. They charge $23 /hr and provide balls that were used. Its on the rooftop of the spa (separate building) and it is very windy. We had a view of this and never saw anyone really playing so was disappointed that they even charged. The pool is way too small for this resort. And it was full of kids so really not a relaxing place to hang out in the water. The hot tub was taken over by the kids which was one of our biggest disappointments. Most people swam in the cove (which is awesome) No self serve laundry. If you have the choice, look into staying at the nearby Marriott Beach club. It has a much better pool area, better restaurant and just more things "happening" there. Disney also looked nice but probably pricier. Beware of driving to/from this area into Honolulu. The traffic is terrible especially during their rush hour (starts early). There is tons to do on Oahu. A week wasn't long enough. Here's a few things we recommend: North Shore: definitely worth visiting for the day. Great beach towns, great fruit stands and shrimp trucks. Stop at the Dole plantation on the way back. My kids loved the big maze. Skip the dole whip...way too sweet and not really that good. Pearl Harbor area: Nothing really to say except go! We recommend getting there by 9am. Do the sub tour and USS Missouri in addition to the Arizona. Waikiki: We didn't spend enough time there but had dinner at two places that were both good and fun: Duke's Canoe Club and Tiki's. East shore beaches: the drive was a nightmare and we went on a very very windy day so not really a place we would recommend. The beaches were beautiful. I guess it depends on the time of year so check the weather forecast before taking the long ride Luau: we did the Paradise Cove luau...within walking distance of the hotel. Don't waste your money! The food was not good and the luau was only ok. For us, a very wasted night. We left early. Restaurants: Highly recommend Roys and Chuck Steakhouse in the Marriott Beach Club (ate there twice). For lunch, either the ABC store or the Taco place across the street. Both good options. Drinks: everything they make is too sweet (unless you like those types of drinks). We had a hard time finding a good martini or margarita anywhere on the island. Chuck's made the best! Good luck planning and have fun and relax. Hawaii is beautiful! We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding of a Lifetime”
Reviews.Author: Guy J
Reviews.Content: Raymond, Geri, Kim, Tamara and the entire staff at the Ihilani are amazing. They put together the wedding of a lifetime for me and my new wife. Everything was perfect, from the food, to the venue, to the rooms, we couldn't have asked for anything more. I would highly recommend having your wedding or meeting at Ihilani. They go above and beyond for your group and it's hard to find that these days. PS-The snorkeling and cabanas are amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here and visit the Disney hotel next door”
Reviews.Author: Seattlebiz
Reviews.Content: I'd forgotten how nice the Ihilani was. Nice rooms, expensive parking but if your in Hawaii get used to expensive parking, great pool and lagoon beach. Paradise Cove Luau (one of the better Luaus) is walking distance just 300-400 yards away. Nice golf course across the street and quarter mile down past the new Disney hotel. Ihilani is about 20 minutes from other nice golf courses in Kapolei, Kunia (my favorite), Ewa (pronounce eh va) & Waikele (next to outlet mall) The Ko Olina golf course has a Roys restaurant there (very good). I'll review Roys next. We were thinking of taking the kids & grandkids to the Aulani (which I will also review next) but, after spending a night there, I think we'll stay at the Ihilani and walk over to take the grandkids to the Theme Character Breakfast buffet. The Ihililani rooms are..that much better and less expensive. This area is about a 30 minute drive from the airport and an hour from Waikiki. Morning rush hour traffic (7-9am) from Ihilani to downtown is terrible (add extra 45min-hour); and if you're going from downtown to Ihilani don't get stuck in opposite commute traffic between 3-6pm. H-1 is bad during rush hour. Kapolei (the 2nd City) is only 10minute drive from Ihilani and everything is there (Safeway, Target, Costco, Theatre, Restaurants/fast food, etc.). Kapolei/Ko Olina along with Waikiki are the dryer (less rain) than other areas of Ohau

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to relax, but isolated from choices”
Reviews.Author: cruzar007
Reviews.Content: The hotel property is fantastic and all of the workers were very friendly. The rooms were extremely spacious and I think every room must have had a gorgeous view. It was quiet compared to Waikiki and it is a great place if you just want to stay at a resort and are content with just a few meal choices within walking distance. The room seemed clean when we arrived but after our first night we noticed that the maid never vacuumed and rather than hanging our towels, they were stacked on the bath. The pool is definitely adult oriented and relatively small compared to other hotels/resorts. The parking costs the same whether valet or self parking and it was by far the most expensive parking during our stay in Hawaii especially when internet is an extra expense. The coves that were created by the resorts in the area were outstanding. The waves break far off the shore and by the time they hit the shore they barely have any force. The water is calm and fish can be seen without even the need for snorkels. We walked to each resort and it is quite a distance if you have small children. As for food, within walking distance you're stuck with resort food or Paradise Cove Luau which is right around the corner. The breakfast buffet was very good and all the food tasted fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location is far from most things”
Reviews.Author: frankhou77
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, I paid $200 per night . The only thing about this hotel is the location, its far away from everything. You need a rental car to stay at this location, its $20 per day (On top of the $200 I paid) for parking. Hotel offers free wi-fi in the lobby area, in room internet was very expensive so I didn't take it, dont remember what the price was.

Reviews.Title: “Great Alternative to Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Mainstream_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I had to travel to HNL on business, and for this trip my wife and 3 year old tagged along. We've stayed in Waikiki several times before, and wanted to try a different part of the island. We were extremely pleased with our experience at this JW! First of all, thru-out this property are shallow saltwater ponds, filled with everything from Starfish to Baby Hammerhead Sharks. Are you serious??? Hammerhead swimming 1 foot from me? That was memorable. Check in was instant, and the attitude of the front desk staff was very much my style. Laid back but fast, friendly but not fake. They also recognized my frequent stayer status, and upgraded us to a suite on the 16th floor. So, I am biased. This room was fantastic. 2 balconies, each with different views, both easily covered with sliding panel blinds. Immense bathroom, hot tub, and closet space. One of my favorite upgraded rooms of all time. All the hotel amenities were great. We used the pool, beach, gym - all were great. Though we ate evening meals off property, we enjoyed lunch and breakfast at the hotel. Service and food were great, and not overpriced imo. I think that we really liked the overall design of the hotel, which others may not. Its very white, clean, and open. Cool and modern vs. over-the-top tropical. We loved it, and would recommend it for anyone going to Honolulu.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to snorkel.....”
Reviews.Author: clearlakeaggiemom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Nov 2 to Nov 5th before taking the Pride of America cruise. Our main goal was to see the fish, turtles and the beautiful landscape. This location was great. We loved the hotel. Everyone was so friendly. Try to get an ocean view. We snorkeled in the 4 lagoons and found 4 and 2 to be the best. So relaxing. If we ever get back to Oahu I will be staying here again...

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhhmazing!”
Reviews.Author: fitnessfam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for part of our honeymoon, a while back before the Aulani was up and running. We have stayed at many hotels in various locations throughout Oahu. Ko Olina was by far the most romantic and relaxing one yet. Don't get me wrong, I love Waikiki and all it has to offer, but being away from all the hustle and bustle for a few days was sooo nice :-) Some of my favortie things about the Ko Olina include: beautiful bathrooms, comfortable beds, great food at the onsite restaurants (make reservations), relaxing by the pool with the bar nearby, walking the beaches, walking paths along the beaches, the chapel was really pretty from the outside, swimming was lovely. There wasnt much going on in the evening, allowing for wonderful alone romantic evening walks, swims, swinging in a hammock, and (my favorite) sleeping with the balcony doors open, listening to the waves and the room lit by moonlight. I just have great memories, and it will always be a special place for us...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, understated & elegant”
Reviews.Author: coastal6107
Reviews.Content: An all-white, understated resort with wonderful food & terrific service. The rooms were spacious enough, with a nice bathroom & balcony with bouganvilleas on the railing, along with a very comfortable bed & nice linens. Housekeeping was sometimes late in the day cleaning rooms, if that bothers some people (it didn't bother us - we were never there while cleaning was being done). We were told we had been upgraded, without asking for it, but then we were charged unexpectedly for the upgrade. This was corrected quickly & graciously. The pool is beautiful, and the pools around the hotel with fish, starfish, rays, and baby hammerheads are just delightful! Drinks are yummy. It was not too crowded in October. This was a very enjoyable romantic stay & I'd love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful venue to celebrate 30th wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: dash
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were so fortunate to select The JW Marriott Ihilani to share our 30th anniversary. From the moment we pulled up to The Hotel till the moment we "had to go"....we were greeted and treated with the utmost warmth and hospitality. The GM obviously empowers the staff to allow each situation the personal attention it requires, there is no "cookie cutter" hotel treatment here. We were so grateful to have selected this property! While the hotel itself is a bit older, the experience makes up for it. The amazing room we had was updated and fresh and clean! Huge with lots of storage. Slept like a baby each night, very comfortable. We had commanding views nightly of the most incredible sunsets! Our room was attended to twice daily with great detail. Always very clean and items replenished. Great Housekeeping! There was never an issue with waiting for elevators. The pool area is not large, but we never had an issue finding a seat! None of the "get up at dawn" to secure your spot craziness going on here! Right below the pool was a great lagoon to float, snorkel or just swim protected by rocks for a safe and peaceful experience. We had the pleasure of seeing great fish and swimming alongside sea turtles! There is an activity cart located adjacent to the hotel/lagoon area with rentals for all your beach needs. There is a great walkway that takes you from the tip of the area down to the marina, a great walk alongside all the lagoons and various other lodging choices. There are other dining choices (as previous posters have pointed out) along the way. There is a workout area located in the Spa building just outside of the front area. We enjoyed a morning workout daily, not too large well appointed with tv's on each piece of cardio equipment, a small but efficient weight area and a few tennis courts outside with beautiful views of rainbows almost daily! The Spa is wonderful. They have daily specials, so take time to look at their services. We enjoyed a couples massage and really had a relaxing experience. The amenities at The Spa are plentiful, clean and relaxing and professional. We really enjoyed the dining choices in the hotel. The breakfast buffet in the morning offered many options for indulging or healthy dining! Lots of fresh fruits and hot items, the choice is yours. If breakfast is not your thing, there is a coffee lounge in the lobby with lots of espresso choices with light choices for breakfast, especially if you are on the run, great choice. We loved the lunch by the pool, there is always a fresh fish option daily. We really looked forward to it. You could sit at tables of at the bar. The staff at the "pool bar" always was always friendly and went out of their way to make you happy. You could also lunch at naupaka terrace, this is the main restaurant which serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. They also have a large brunch on Sundays and a seafood feast on Saturday evening. We enjoyed the signature restaurant, Azul. A lovely romantic setting, great food and service. Never experienced room service, so can't comment. There is a Japanese restaurant onsite, Ushio Tei; while not a bad experience, it was our least favorite of all the other options. We tried the buffet and not sure if it was us, or just not a "good night". There is a bar located above this restaurant that we found later in our stay that offers a warm and relaxing experience where you have comfortable seating with great views and you can order food from all the restaurants for that casual but lo key experience at night. The drink menu here was very reasonable. Located at the golf course across the street is Roys, we had a terrific dinner here one night also. Reservations recommended! We enjoyed golf a few times atThe Ko Olina Golf Course, convenient and resort course oriented, not difficult, you are able to charge your round back to the JW. We ventured out of the area a few times, up north to enjoy the surfers and the drive and beauty of the region, stopped at the jamesons by the sea haleiwa on the way back for a good dinner in a casual setting. Another day we headed to the the winward coast to Koolau Golf Club for an amazing experience, the course is located on the side of a mountain in a rain forest. We had a time of it (we are golfers) and found out afterwards that this is one of the most difficult courses out there! Stopped in Honolulu for dinner on the way back, and really looked forward to spending the rest of our stay in Ko Olina! Being on the Leeward side of the Island, the weather is more arid and hence less rain so you can enjoy the activities outdoors without the rain, more often. My recommendation would be to read up on all that the resort has to offer immediatley. My mistake was finding things out too late in our stay. Sit with the concierge and get some information, they are available throughout the day. There are daily event sheets, make sure to take one each morning and read it with your delicious coffee. There are a few shopping experiences located within the property. Across the street (walking distance), there is a small mall area with a couple of dining options, didn't try. There is an ABC store as mentioned in previous posts. I can't say enough about the location. As we were not traveling with children, the services were perfect for us. I can say that if I did have young children with me, I would look at the Marriott Vacation club just a walk down the way or Aulani next door. The lifestyle in this area is peaceful and very relaxing. Again, kudoos to the staff at this wonderful resort, they make sure you are comfortable and happy, more of a boutique resort type experience, would recommend if you are in need of a relaxing vacation with all amenities available if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a gorgeous setting”
Reviews.Author: anoasis
Reviews.Content: This hotel was way beyond my expectations- not a run of the mill hotel by any means. the rooms were gorgeous with floor to ceiling glass doors leading to a far larger than average terrace with louge chair, table and chairs and of course the gorgeous views. The bathroom was fantastic- glass shower, seperate soaking tub, his and hers sinks on opposite sides of the room and the mirrors are surrounded by what looked like mother of pearl! The staff was great, especially the valets who had many helpful tips on places to eat, hike, etc. Parking is very expensive at $30/day. The beach is nice with nice lounge chairs but the ocean here, as everywhere in Hawaii, is very cold. There is a hot tub by the pool to warm up in afterwards! Very relaxing stay. The breakfast at the hotel was also crazy expensive to us ($26/each for a standard cooked buffet). but the valets were as ever great about pointing us to local favorite Koa Pancake House, after the first time we ate there every morning! All the staff were just fantastic- one night we had been hiking all day and went back to our room to watch a movie and couldn't get the DVD player to work, a staff member was there in less than 5 minutes to hook it up for us (I wish I had him for my home as well!!) Overall it is an expensive resort, especially for meals, but very worth it if you want to relax. The only other downside is that this seems like a romantic hotel but the new Disney hotel next door did interfere with some of our enjoyment as their staff seemed to be on the loudspeakers several times an hour announcing various events and the sound did carry to our balcony. I would still stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: parkerpug
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is one of the nicest hotels I've ever been to. The rooms are luxurious and huge. The his and her sinks in the bathroom were great for getting ready in the morning. The hotel is very quiet and mostly full of adults. The pool is very boring so if you have kids you'll want to stay next door at the Marriott Beach Vacation Club since it has an amazing pool with a slide. The Coves were so fun for my kids to play in. We spent half the week here and the other half at the Sheraton Waikiki. It was just perfect splitting the time between the two places because of the activities we were doing. The breakfast buffet was soo good...we were able to make our own fresh squeezed juice!! The restaurants were pricey but top notch. We walked over to Marriott Beach Club and ate at Long Boards restaurant which was very good. The govt. rate is great if you have govt. I.D.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: GSPARKMD
Reviews.Content: I would like to express my appreciation to the staff of this hotel. From the virtual concierge, desk, restaurant, pool, and house keeping staff, they were all outstanding. This property clearly has a guest friendly, and supportive culture. Even though the property is getting older, management here deserves recognition for not just maintaining the property, but more importantly for the wonderful culture they support in their staff. This is one of the most pleasant Marriott property stays I have had yet. Many of other hotels could learn from them. I am particularly enjoying thoughs of how well they will serve our country during the current APEC meeting. Warm regards to the Ko Olina JW Marriott management and staff

Reviews.Title: “Staff cares”
Reviews.Author: Travelslo
Reviews.Content: We checked in and all the staff was friendly from the first step out of the car. Then Art at the front desk and Glenn the bellman were so personable to us, letting us know about the location, hotel and that evening our dinner staff was so friendly. We were so excited to be there finally and we were inquiring about the surf; they let us know the current surf reports on the North shore side of the island. We are happy with the bedding and the auto control lighting at the nightstand built into the phone! Im a foodie and might of been very jet lagged so I gave a 4 for the food quality for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place”
Reviews.Author: love2play2
Reviews.Content: This is my little piece of man made paradise never been anywhere I liked more. Love love love

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation place”
Reviews.Author: david740
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is a wonderful place to get away and recharge ones batteries. The grounds are beautiful. The pool area is nice and child friendly, not too deep close to the edge. The lobby is spacious, with a high atrium through which bright sunlight streams. The restaurants are quite good, and one can dine on the patio and watch the hammerhead sharks and sting rays swim by casually. Rooms are large, well appointed, with large balconies. Bathrooms haveh two sinks on opposite sides of the room and a large walk in shower and jacuzzi tub. The location is wonderfully a half hour drive from the noise and crowds of Waikiki, close of enough to enjoy but far enough not to be bothered. All in all, a great place to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Ihilani: A Different Side of Oahu”
Reviews.Author: HonoluluHistorian
Reviews.Content: Recently booked the Marriott Ihilani for business and wished I could have stayed longer. Many employees I met three years ago were happily remaining on the job and had good things to say about the hotel. Ate at both the signature restaurant (Azul's) and the Japanese restaurant (Ushio-Tei) and thoroughly enjoyed them both. If my only complaint is that the pool isn't as "modern" (lacking what seems to be the requisite swinging rope bridges and water slides) as all the other great spots on Oahu, just remember that the highly-rated Halekulani in Waikiki doesn't have a fancy pool for daredevils, either. This hotel sits on a fantastic beach, and, if you are on the beach-facing side, has fantastic sunsets every night. Since the new Disney timeshare resort is located immediately adjacent to the Ihilani on the mountain side, there was a lot of early-evening multi-media amplified noise and flashing lights, that fortunately seemed to be confined to the times when you would normally be at dinner. The meeting room for my function was extremely clean, we ordered lunch for 15 people off the room service menu, and the staff made the entire process appear seamless. Our group has booked this hotel three years in a row, and we have reserved our meeting spot at the Ihilani for 2012, because we appreciate the level of service, the cleanliness, and the room rates we receive from management.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room, had a great time”
Reviews.Author: kdkjcl
Reviews.Content: Our family spent 2 nights here is an ocean view room which was fabulous. We had a view of the pool, the shark/sting ray pool and the ocean and lagoon. There was a big lanai with lounge chair and table with chairs and since we were up before the sun with the time difference, I enjoyed the sunrise drinking coffee while laying on the lounge chair. The hotel offers many activities, zumba, yoga, 1 hour free snorkeling gear, fish feeding in the lagoon. It was a great hotel, beautiful location. Even with the Disney hotel next door, the lagoon was not crowded and we were able to find beach chairs. Checkout time was noon and we had a 10pm flight so the hotel also provided a hospitality suite to shower and clean up after our final day at the beach. The cons: the Disney hotel is noisy! They have periodic shows in their pool area so you hear characters over the loudspeaker/microphone and people cheering/clapping all across the lagoon. Parking is expensive - $35 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: DavisOtter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ihilani for four nights in late September/early October to celebrate our 1st anniversary. Ko Olina is a gorgeous area, especially if you want to avoid the busy nature of Waikiki. We especially enjoyed the lagoons and the quiet at the Ihilani, but also enjoyed easy access to Pearl Harbor, Diamond Head, Waikiki, the North Shore, etc. (you just need to plan outings around the traffic, which is heavy during rush hour in/out of Honolulu). Of note is the fact that the new Disney resort, Aulani, recently opened next door, so the lagoon isn't as quiet as it once was (according to friends who have visited the Ihilani several times through the years). The hotel is not quite at the level of a St Regis or similar, but it's very nice and we would not hesitate to return. Dinners: two nights on property (Azul, Ushio-Tei), one night at Roy's (within easy walking distance), and one night next door at the Aulani's high-end restaurant, Ama Ama. All dinners were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great apart from the loud repairwork”
Reviews.Author: Dazzerdutch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4nights after spending a week in Waikiki. Excellent location quieter and more relaxing area. Resort was great apart from the loud repairwork going on each day. Told booking agent on return who said hotel should have informed them about this prior. Recommend the spa

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, service and food... but VERY EXPENSIVE!!”
Reviews.Author: KER924
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the first 4 nights of our Hawaiian honeymoon at this hotel. We had spent months planning, and basing our hotel/resort picks on reviews that we read, therefore we made sure to pay attention to things we would review about in order to help other travelers!! The property and rooms were gorgeous and clean. We arrived a half hour before check in and were told that our room would not be ready for about 40 min, so we chose to take a 5th floor ocean view, rather than wait for the room on the 10th floor. May have been worth it to wait for the 10th floor, but the ocean view room was still amazing. The room was spacious and the bathroom was gigantic with a tub and shower, 2 sinks/vanities, and a toilet with its own door. Maid service was really great and got the room done early in the day, which was nice. Since we were on our honeymoon, we asked for an upgrade when we checked in, since my husband had an elite status on his rewards and therefore should automatically qualify. The hotel offered a room with 2 double beds, rather than the king we already reserved. We turned this down, since it didn't really make sense or seem like an upgrade. The hotel did offer 10% off at the restaurants on the resort for marriott rewards members. Restaurants had great drinks and food. Azul, in particular, although expensive, was worth the money. The food was amazing as was the service! The chef came out and introduced himself to check on the guests, which was impressive. Ushio Tei, the japanese restaurant was also good, but the waitstaff was pushy about picking the buffet, which didn't have a great selection in our opinions. The Hokule'a lounge was a lot of fun. Great food and the drinks were no where near as expensive as the poolside grill. The poolside grill was a convenient option if you wanted to eat and drink while sun bathing and swimming, but the food and drinks were really over priced. The menu we had checked ahead of time on the marriott.com website was outdated and inaccurate. They had their tropical drinks listed at $8.50, which was misleading since they were actually $14!! There seemed to be a lot of charges we hadn't planned on. A big downer was the lack of free internet. They hotel charged $7 for 10 minutes of internet use in the business lounge and the daily fee for wifi was over $20. We were suspicious that the hotel had an internet jammer of some sort since even our cell phone internet connections seemed to have an interference until we were off the resort. At one point my husband got frustrated and went right next door to the Disney resort and his phone started to work. The parking fee was $35, regardless of if you used valet or self park. Other places we stayed included self park fee in the resort fee, which is something this hotel should consider. The hotel puts a hold of $150 a day on your credit card when you check in, which we didn't know until we got there. Overall was a really nice place, but we ended up spending a lot more money than expected. May want to check out the Disney hotel right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for a GREAT Time!!”
Reviews.Author: PW7382
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a well deserved vacation/business trip. This hotel made our trip very enjoyable and filled with memories! From a breakfast buffett to die for, to feeding the sharks and rays, to relaxing on the beach, to really enjoying each and every employee we came in contact with! This hotel and crew did everything possible to make our stay worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic alternative to Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: gyroninja
Reviews.Content: This resort is gorgeous. The grounds are beutiful with several different pools to choose from as well as the lagoon to swim in. the Naupaka Restaurant has fantastic service and food and a large shark pond right below its outside dining area. The room I had was also amazing, with a ocean veiw balcony about 20x8 feet, an L-shape section sofa, beutiful shower and separate tub. Even a separate closet and dressing area! It is within walking distance of the Paradise Cove Luau . I was only here on business one night, but I will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott Ihilani Resort & Spa”
Reviews.Author: Pam F
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with friendly & helpful staff. We got a really nice ocean view room w/a view of the pool. The room was a little warm in the middle of the day because of all the direct sunlight. The beds were nice & comfy & the bathroom was huge....separate shower & tub. The toilet had it's own little room & there were two basins! They have a really nice clean gym...nice treadmills & really nice amenities (ear phones to plug into the exercise equipment so you can watch TV & dry & wet towels to clean up. The hotel is within minutes of shopping & restaurants...and within about 1/2 - 3/4 hour away from Honolulu.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: eouw0o83hf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a marriage conference and were blown away. There is a stretch of beach divided up among several lagoons which is shared by a multitude of resorts - you can walk around on this path for hours, absorbing the ocean and sun. The rooms are incredible - even the mountain view rooms have a great landscape to look at! The premises are beautiful; the room was very clean and comfortable. Bathroom had a jacuzzi tub with separate shower. Overall, I highly recommend the Ihilani.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but not amazing.”
Reviews.Author: Adam M
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, comfy bed and cool control of lights and AC from the phone. Internet service was spotty at best. Breakfast was average. Great lagoon for swimming and nothing like the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. While this trip was for business, I would stay in this area again to relax - everything you need is within driving distance, but you get to avoid the huge crowds. Assuming all rates are the same, I would probably try another option since this hotel did not stand out as "must stay". PS - I visit Hawaii 2-6 times per year (personal and business) and have a good understanding of what to look for in a location and hotel on all islands.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to relax and enjoy life”
Reviews.Author: AZPILOT
Reviews.Content: We have a condo in Honolulu and tire of the Waikiki crowds. Today we went to the JW to spend the day and relax. She did the spa of course, it was awesome. Had lunch at the beachside/poolside restaurant. Killer Maui burger was 9.50. Moved to the beach, you have the choice of 4 lagoons,all within walking distance of the JW. I opted for the beach/lagoon in front of the property and greeted by an attendant that gave me beach chairs and checked back occasionally to see if I needed anything. The water was warm and calm, the beach was not crowded or bunched up. There are a couple of vendors that offer beach toys, floating family size mats and kayaks. North shore was closed to swimming due to rough water, this lagoon was perfect. After she had been spa'ed we had drinks on the patio overlooking the beach. At sunset I suggest you walk off property to the right side of the beach and experience the surf hitting the rocks as the sun sets, nothing better. The hotel was very clean, staff exceptionally friendly and helpful. Room rates were listed at $179 the day we visited. I would highly recommend a stay or at least a day away from the madness downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Experience Away from Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Steve7856
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went here for our 30th wedding anniversary, and we wanted something away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. The Ihilani, located in the Ko Olina area, fit the bill perfectly. We could drive into Honolulu in about 20 to 30 minutes, to see Waikiki, Pearl Harbor, etc. and we could also easily drive to the north part of the island. The hotel itself was great. Nice beach along the lagoon, pool area very nice too. Restaurants on the property were good but a bit pricey, although they try to make up for it with really generous portions. The staff was outstanding. Whatever we needed, we just asked!! They are right next door to the just-opened Disney Aulani hotel, but the two places are very different experiences, so I don't think they have too much to worry about. (Aulani is very nice too; we walked around it one evening.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not a 4 star resort”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaPookie
Reviews.Content: Overall the resort was nice but somewhat inconsistent. The rooms are very nicely decorated and roomy. The bed was really comfortable. Views on the non-lagoon side were beautiful for sunset. It is pricey but getting a deluxe ocean view is worth it for the view. Housekeeping staff were a bit lazy and didn't even manage to get the trash out of the room daily. The pool was certainly not what I would call worthy of a 4 star property. There is only one circular pool and it isn't in a beautiful setting like many Hawaiian hotels. It is surrounded by the hotel rooms and concrete. There are several restaurants on the property but three of them have essentially the same menu so the food choices are limited. Also the property has no outside bar for cocktails in the evening. The pool bar closes at 7:30 and the lounge has no outdoor seating! It was sorely missed on the beautiful Hawaiian nights. One thing to try is the interactive fish feeding at the hotel. For about $40, you can feed the sharks, rays and fish in the hotel lagoons. Our host, Jessica, was so nice and very informative. Feeding and touching the spotted eagle rays was a highlight of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement - not really worth the price”
Reviews.Author: jfreeman7
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this hotel! I'm generally a very forgiving/not picky traveler, and I did like some elements, but there were too many little things that bothered me, and the two nights we spent there ended up feeling stressful more often than not. We arrived at 1:00 and the room was not ready. I'd asked for early check-in, but I know it's not guaranteed. We walked around the property for an hour, and were told that they would call our cell phone when the room was ready - they even confirmed the number. After an hour with no call, we went to the desk and were told our room was ready ... no explanation as to why we didn't get a call. The interior of the room was ready (though the bathroom wasn't particularly clean, some mold in the shower and the bathtub had hairs, etc), but the lanai area was very dirty with pigeon poop. I called about this and the lady on the phone acted as if she was very upset to hear that our chair cushion was filthy, but no one ever came to change it. I called again before dinner, and when we got back after dinner someone had put a towel over the chair cushion and cleaned the porch somewhat, but in general the porch was dirty and covered with pigeons throughout the two days we were there. I'd requested a high floor but they put me on the sixth floor, which was right on the tree line. DO NOT stay on the sixth floor! That was where the pigeons seemed worst. They were constantly getting on our porch. I thought I would enjoy the coves and they were okay, but they had a more family/kid appeal than what I was hoping for, which I guess is to be expected with Disney next door now. One of the best afternoons we had was when we went to the pools at the Disney resort, but I would not pay $500/night to stay there. Some things I did like about the property: the pool is nice, drinks at the poolside bar were delicious, and if you walk to the north (past the sign that says 'now leaving resort property, enter at your own risk) there is a pretty cove with turtles and a GREAT snorkeling cove right across from the Paradise Cove luau. We had that beach to ourselves one morning and the snorkeling was very relaxing and nice, featuring a sea turtle as well. Also, we had a sunset view room and loved the view - just wish we could have enjoyed the lanai without the pigeon presence! We walked past the Disney night shows and had a laugh, very glad we weren't facing that direction, we would have definitely asked to move and that sounds like it was a pain. In general this hotel struggled with customer service. One day the maid didn't come to clean the room until 6:30pm, when we were trying to shower/relax - she apologized but it's still ridiculous for a room that costs this much. We also requested a late check out and never got a call back about whether it would be possible, so just checked out at the normal time. TIP: Avoid the 'Welcome Desk' coupons, they're just trying to sell you time shares. I would not go back here or recommend it, which is a shame, because we did have some good times here as well and the property definitely has nice features! They need to improve.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon let down”
Reviews.Author: aegly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our honeymoon at the JW Ihilani several month before our september 17th wedding. We later found out that the Disney resort was opening right next door the week we booked our trip. There was nothing we could do to change our trip and decided that we'd make the best of it and hope for the best. We booked the JW because we wanted to have a quiet getaway compared to that of a hotel in Waikiki. We checked in Sept. 19th and requested an ocean view room, we also asked that it not be facing the Disney resort...the front desk person assured us that it wasn't facing the other resort but did mentioned that it was their grand opening week and there were going to be several events including good morning america filming at 1am one morning. When we got to the room we walked out onto our balcony and had a perfect view right over Disney's resort event area where they have their luaus and receptions and had lovely background noise of them sound checking the conch for the opening ceremonies---this sound check went on for several hours in the afternoon and even if we closed the sliding door it was unbearable. We decided not to worry and went out for the day to explore some of the island....we arrived back at our hotel room at roughly 9pm that night hoping to sit out on the balcony and relax and enjoy our first night of our honeymoon. Well instead of relaxing and listening to the waves we heard Lady Gaga & the Black Eyed Peas blasting out of speakers. We couldn't sit outside and we couldn't even close the doors and have a conversation. When we called down to switch rooms we couldn't even hear the woman on the phone. My husband went down there to try and take care of it but they weren't able to switch our rooms until the following day. We paid for the upgrade to an ocean view room and didn't even get to enjoy that view. When asked if we could be refunded that money they said it wasn't possible. The music didn't stop until close to 10pm and still being on west coast time (1am) we were exhausted and upset and just went to bed and decided to try and deal with it the next day. We were able to switch to a different room the following day on the sunset side of the hotel and we didn't hear another thing from the Disney hotel. But our room wreaked of pot that smelled like it had been stored in the fridge or bar area of the room, every time we opened that door a waft of the smell came out. We didn't complain about that and just tried to enjoy the 4 days we had left. It's not often my husband and I take extravagant vacations and we aren't picky people- it takes a lot for either of us to be upset but that was not the way we imagined out honeymoon stay would be at a renowned JW Marriott hotel. We both realized that much of our complaint has to do with the resort next door and is out of their control- the hotel itself seemed to try to be accommodating when they could be but we still felt let down- especially when we were still charged for our upgrade. I can only imagine that the hotel would have been a wonderful place to stay before the ridiculous Disney compound moved in next door. If you are hoping for a romantic getaway I would recommend staying somewhere else and if you do stay at the Ihilani, make sure you are on the opposite side from the the Disney resort if you want quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: Tiflalawi-Adventures
Reviews.Content: I was in town for an event at the brand new Disney Aulani Resort which is next door to this property. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. The bathroom is huge with two sinks, a deep bathtub and a shower. The balcony is large with a chaise and a small table and chairs. There should be a light or candle outside but there is nothing. There should also be a small table next to the chaise. Otherwise the whole room experience was extremely comfortable. You can control the entire room (lights, climate, alarm) from the LCD display next to the bed. The restaurant Azul was wonderful and upscale. The chef Pierre Antonio came by and chatted with me a lot. I tried to eat at the sushi restaurant Ushio-Tei but it was closed even on a Thursday evening it was supposed to be open. I did eat at the Naupaka Terrace, which was delicious but not as intimate as Azul. One evening we walked about .5 miles southeast to the Roy's restaurant at the golf course for a wonderful meal. Nice stroll back to walk it off. There is an Island Country Market across the street from this property. You can purchase food, souvenirs, drinks, even pre-made sandwiches and made-to-order salads, and bring them back and put them into your small room refrigerator. But note, the refrigerator does not have a freezer area, so if you purchase ice cream, you will need to eat it all at once! The souvenir selection is extensive.

Reviews.Title: “surprsngly beautiful”
Reviews.Author: shadmansoor
Reviews.Content: excellent site seeing and beautiful way through all the rooms services are also handsome by all the staff, some rooms still need to be updated evryone would love a chance to be at this beautiful and heavenly built place.one handsome word for it best place for being with your lover love it and would love to be here again and again...thanks for such a beautiful place

Reviews.Title: “Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: momofsk8rs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW Marriott Ihilani Resort in August. I have waited a long time to have the opportunity to stay at this hotel. I was so surprised just how average this hotel is. The rooms need to be updated and maintained. The tiles in the bathroom were broken, the shower grout was discolored, The bed was very firm. The hotel as a whole was nice but they market as an exceptional location so I was expecting exceptional. I decided to relax and have a beverage in the lounge/bar. I sat on a very comfortable couch, a cocktail waitress walked by a few times and never asked for a drink order. I decided not to stay and left. Service at the restaurant and front desk was attentive and helpful. Overall, the stay was good but I was expecting more.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJWCheng
Reviews.Content: After YEARS of staying in Waikiki, we took a try at the Ko'Olina area because our cousins were renewing their vows. I absolutely fell in love with the Ihilani Resort! It was fabulous. The resort sits right up on the beach, which is always wonderful. And the room was spacious and beautiful. We had an oceanview room, and the view did not disappoint. Sunsets every night right from our lanai. The bed was incredibly comfortable, and the bathroom was quite nice. With a shower and a deep bathtub, 2 vanities across the room from each other. And the toilet had a separate door. The hotel itself has an infinity pool (which we didn't utilize) and these beautiful little ponds all around with stingrays and sharks. And koi fish. My 2-year-old loved it. On the beach, just steps away from the pool, in the first lagoon of Ko'Olina is where we spent almost an entire day. It was so relaxing and beautiful. The area itself is not very crowded, which is always a plus. And the property staff was incredibly pleasant and helpful. The hotel food wasn't bad either. And up the block was a little shopping center with a couple of casual / take-out restaurants and an ABC Store, so you're never without amenities. And right next door is the brand new Disney resort, the Aulani. The Ihilani is about 35-40 minutes from the airport, and probably 45-50 minutes from Waikiki. We were satisfied to stay in Ko'Olina this time around. Couldn't have asked for a more perfect vacation. I will definitely try and stay out in Ko'Olina again during my next Oahu trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: onecentp
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is a beautiful hotel located on the 'quiet' side of Oahu. No traffic, no noise, just beauty. Our room was 630 which is really the 6th floor of the entire hotel and 3rd floor of the rooms. It is just at the top of the tree line so if we had been on a lower view our view would have been limited to the pond below. It's too bad that there are so many trees blocking the views of the ocean. If you are on the other side of the building it appears you would have a view of the pool, lagoon and ocean. Ours was of the ocean, tree tops and mountains - no complaints. Rooms are very nice and clean. Bathroom is very spacious as well. The pool area is somewhat small but nice. The food at the bar at the pool is excellent, mai tai's arent bad either. We ate breakfast at the hotel every morning and it was always very good. We would recommend this hotel provided you have a room with a view !

Reviews.Title: “Great views and Great location to Relax”
Reviews.Author: DownforceFan
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the Ihilani and had a great, relaxing vacation. This is a very nice, small resort tucked away in a beautiful area with the best weather on the island. If you want to be away from the big city hustle of Waikiki and experience the beauty of Hawaii, this is a great spot to be. Rooms – We had an Ocean View which appears to be identical to a “deluxe” ocean view, except that they are on different sides of the resort. The room was very nice, consisting of a comfortable king bed with fitted sheets and a down comforter, a large L shaped desk with a large flatscreen TV on one side. There are two chairs and an ottoman at the end of the bed facing the TV. There is a bar area just inside the front door that host the coffee maker and a refrigerator that you can use to store your own items. No mini bar. The safe is in this cabinet as well. The bathroom is very spacious with marble floors and counters. There are two sinks, set across from each other. A good sized, deep tub, and a separate glass-enclosed shower. The toilet room has its own door for privacy. The balcony is spacious with a round wooden table and two chairs, plus one lounger. The views are fantastic from the Ocean view rooms. Deluxe Ocean views face West, looking over the pool and out at the ocean. Our Ocean View faced Northwest with an incredible Sunset view and a view looking over a beautiful bay just North of the hotel. Also included in our view was the parking lot of the Paradise Cove Luau, which was not a bother, everything to see was straight ahead. Spend as many nights as possible on your balcony for sunset. The internet is WiFi, available in the room with strong signal. It seems that they have repeaters in the room to guarantee good signal. There was a wired internet port in the desk but it did not work. Internet, as of this writing, costs 12.95 per day. We were on a package that made it free. And it is free to some Marriott rewards members as well. The TV had 20 or 30 usable channels and had the Lodgenet system with a good selection of recent movies available for on demand. The only negative experience we had with the room was spotty maid service. Timing constantly changed and two days we had to call for it. The hotel has a nice aesthetic. The lobby is marble and is at the bottom of an atrium that continues up to the top floor. Lots of ponds around the property with koi, stingrays, and hammerhead sharks. They have some programs where you can pet/feed the rays and also a fish feeding program on the beach every morning. The property has a nice Hawaiian flow and feel. Upkeep is not 100%, there are some cosmetic flaws around, but not enough to be a bother to all but the pickiest of folk. Our room showed no such problems, save a shower door that didn’t close quite all the way. I’ve seen many reviews here state that this property is not up to snuff with other JW Marriotts. I’ve never stayed at a JW, but they seem to imply that JW is up there with Ritz Carlton’s, Four Seasons, etc. Since the resort if ½ the price of those properties, I think it offers excellent value. But if you need that level of quality and price, consider the Disney Aulani resort that just opened next door. It is definitely at that level (more on that below). Parking - $36.95, valet or self park. Valet service is excellent, with a very friendly staff. Call first when you need the car. No one is happy with the price. It is what it is. Beach – The lagoon is a great size. It is shared by the Ihilani and the Disnehy Aulani resort. This was not an issue while we were there. The Aulani was in the middle of their soft opening, the beach was never over crowded. I wasn’t sure what to expect of the lagoon and how big it would be in person. My best answer is if that you think it is small, it will be bigger than you expect, and vice versas. It is a good size. The Ihilani only uses up one corner of the lagoon, which is more than enough. Every day there were many, many chairs available. The most crowded days were Saturday and Sunday, which were still very pleasant and spacious. You cannot serve alcohol on the beach in Hawaii, so there is no wait service on the beach proper. They have set the beach cabanas up on the grass just on the lip of the beach to skirt this problem. The cabanas are two wooden chairs with a shared, awning that you can raise and lower to your liking. They put covered cushions on them for you and give you a cooler with two bottles of water and two pieces of fruit . Cost is 20 for a half day and 35 for a full day. The water in the lagoon is great. There are no waves, and it is very pleasant to swim or lounge in. The hotel also provider snorkel gear for free for 1 hour per day. If you snorkel near the rocks you can see some fish and crabs and the like. You can also take your snorkel gear to the cove to the north for better snorkeling and a shot at turtles, etc. Food/drink service at the Cabanas was spotty. The waiter serving the Cabanas is also working part of the pool, and some were better than others at checking on the cabana customers. There is a Rec. desk near the cabanas and they will radio for a waiter for you as needed. There are a few thatched umbrellas on the beach. These were snagged quickly in the morning. Pool – The pool is quite small but was perfectly adequate for this resort. There were always plenty of chairs available, and there are a lot of umbrellas in the pool area if you want one. We were hear at the start of the low season, so perhaps it is more crowded at other times. Plenty of servers available in the pool area. The hot tub is in the main pool area also. The pool water was very warm and comfortable. The towel stand for the beach and pool is right next to the pool. Nearby Services – Ko’olina is really well located. You are secluded in a beautiful area that really shows off Hawaii. But you are close enough to everything that Oahu has to offer. The city of Kapolei is one exit away, a 5 minute drive at most. Here you’ll find a Target (with groceries) a Costco and several other stores and places to eat . Not much you won’t be able to find here. Honolulu/Waikiki are an easy 25 minute drive away in most traffic. You can hop into the city for sightseeing, shopping or dinner anytime. The drive is easy and pleasant. They do have afternoon traffic here, especially try and avoid driving to Ko’olina from Honolulu in afternoon rush hour. The North Shore is an easy, 45 minute drive away. Ko’olina – Ko’olina is really great. Just the kind of place you want to vacation. It’s a huge secluded property. It’s gated. The upkeep is very good. There are phases of private homes here, as well as 3 resorts, and one condo property. There are several restaurants on services on the property. The Islands market is on the same street as and an easy walk from the Ihilani. There are groceries and deli food and sundries and gifts here. There is also the Just Tacos restaurant here and an ice cream shop and I think I saw a Hawaiian BBQ place as well. The Disney Aulani resort is right next to the Ihilani and has several restaurants and bars. It is a very nice property and worth seeing. Further down in Ko’Olina at the golf club there is a Roy’s restaurant. Down at the opposite end from the Ihilani is the Marriott Beach Club Timeshare property. Chuck’s Steakhouse can be found there. There is a shuttle that runs around the entire Ko’Olina property all day and evening and stops most of the places. Make use of it. Of the restaurants we tried: Just Tacos is good. Mexican food and 400 tequilas. Not to be missed for Tequila lovers. Chuck’s is just okay. Roy’s is good, but not what it once was when Roy still owned it. Regarding the Beach Club Time Shares, when you check in at the Ihilani the front desk sends you over to the “Welcome” desk afterwards to get some info and some discount cards. The “Welcome” desk is the time share sales. They don’t hound you too much here, but they will try to get you to go sit through the sales pitch in exchange for swag. Also, at the Rec. Desk on the beach, the guy in the brown shirt is hawking time shares, the guys in the blue shirts are the ones who get you equipment or setup cabanas, etc. Aulani – Lots of concern on these boards about the Aulani bringing crowds and Disney mayhem to the Ihilani customer’s experience. There was zero issue of this while we were there. No crowding or noise issues. The Aulani’s beach section is next to the Ihilani’s but far enough away. Their beach was not more crowded or active than ours. A few things to know about the Aulani that we learned. This is not a Disney theme parky kind of resort. This is a very upscale resort (Ritz level, $400+ room rates) focused very strongly on a Hawaiian cultural theme. In certain parts of the hotel, they require the employees to speak Hawaiian to each other, and a heavy focus on teaching Hawaiian culture. Half of the resort is Time Share, and therefore not all sold yet. So, not sure if they are seeing full capacity yet. We understand that the hotel portion is booked for a year plus in advance. The crowds may get worse, but so far, no problem at all, and the place seems quite nice. Tips – There is a Starbucks (Drive Thru!) in Kapolei. Also one in the Target. I know this is important to some people (I’m married to one!) A little further down the road at the Waikele/Waipahu exit, there is a shopping center that has a Leonard’s Malasadas truck in the parking lot. These fresh fried doughnut ball like items are island legend and should not be missed, but eat them while they’re hot. Also at the Waikele/Waipahu exit is a large Premium Outlets Center for those who just gotta shop. When traveling into Waikiki from Ko’Olina, use the locals route to bypass some of the traffic you hit on the H1 near Waikiki. When on the H1 heading east. Look for the 92 Nimitz Hwy exit. BUT…ignore the first one…a few miles later you see a second 92 East Nimitz Hwy exit that says “Waikiki” on the sign. Take that exit, and it is a 3 lane, flowing street that eventually turns into Ala Moana Blvd. and takes you straight to the heart of Waikiki. This route will take you right past popular spots like Hilo Hatties, Restaurant Row, and the Ala Moana Shopping Center.

Reviews.Title: “Great suite at the Ko Olina”
Reviews.Author: Slowhand1527
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW Marriott Ko Olina Ihilani hotel on Oahu again and this time had a suite and it was fantastic. One room had two double beds with a nice balcony view overlooking the mountains, and the other room had a couch, dining table, and balcony overlooking the ocean. The bathroom was huge with a giant over-sized jacuzzi tub, separate shower, two vanities, and a dressing room closet. The room also had two toilets which was convenience since my entire family was along for the trip. I always look forward to visiting this hotel and the staff are top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. A little overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: NHTraveler03301
Reviews.Content: Let me start this review by saying that the JW Marriott Ihilani is a great hotel, and we'd stay there again in a heartbeat. The rooms were spacious, the food was very good, and the service was top notch. There were a few things that we noticed that could be improved, but nothing that would keep us from returning. We stayed at the Ihilani in July, 2011 for eleven nights with our two kids (ages 11 and 8). We were given the option before arriving of upgrading to the Naupaka Jr. Suite, and took them up on it. Boy were we glad we did! The room was huge, and had more than enough room for the four of us to spead out, place a rollaway in the corner, and still have more than enough room. With such a long stay, having all that room was a godsend and kept us and the kids from getting on each others nerves. If you get the room, make sure to take advantage of the mini fridge (comes empty) for water, snacks, wine, etc. that you can get from the hotel store. Even better, take a 5 min. walk to the shopping area one block away and there is one of Hawaii's famous "ABC" stores. They seem to have everything you would need for a vacation there, even down to snorkeling equipment. Everything was of good quality, and you will save a ton of money over the hotel store. Speaking of this shopping plaza, it seems that the area is about to expand. With the Disney hotel opening up this month, you can see that developers are anticipating higher foot-traffic and beginning to put in stores, ice cream shops, restaurants, etc. This is great as it increases your choices when staying at the Ihilani. Something I would be quite concerned about, however, with the addition of the Disney hotel (Aulani) would be the number of people on the property's beach. When we were there, the beach was wonderful. Nice and quiet, and just the right number of people on it. You could spread out, and not feel like anyone was on top of you. My wife and I spent a lot of time looking at the size of the Aulani and trying to picture all those families swarming the beach. Certainly adding hundreds of people to the area will change the feel of the place, and I would hesitate on going back because of it. (at least read some reviews first!) Another thing about the Ihilani. You will need a car. The hotel is secluded, which we really enjoyed. Waikiki is much too busy for us, and the Ihilani had much more of an island feel. If you intend on going anywhere else (and you should!) you will find yourself driving at least 30 min. in any direction. Make sure not to miss the West side of the island. It is simply breathtaking. Make sure to also make time for Pearl Harbor, a swim at Waimea falls and the Diamond Head hike. If you go to Diamond Head, make sure you are in fairly good shape and bring water. An older woman needed to be airlifted off it when we were at the top. Now for a few of the negatives. The hotel has a strict towel policy. If you don't have your towel back by the end of the day (about 8pm) your room would be charged. (I think $15 per towel if I remember correctly!) For a higher-class hotel, we found this to be particularly low-rent. It would be nice if the hotel had beach towels available in the rooms so that if you left for the day, you wouldn't have to rush back to save the $60! Also, for a hotel that is in my opinion just a notch below it's sister Ritz properties and charges similarly, the hotel should set a higher standard for it's rooms. The room was a bit of a mishmash of furniture and electronics. For example, the room had two big screen TV's. Great right? Well not when they are only about 7ft apart and facing the exact same way. We noticed art missing off the walls, and there were empty spots in the room with no furniture at all. Maybe the room is so big, the hotel doesn't know what to fill it with...but it does look a bit awkward. Oh, and the parking fees: for a hotel where you almost HAVE to have a car, charging a nightly rate of $35 is outrageous. Make sure you factor this in when looking at the total cost of the room. An important point: Don't eat at night on your lanai. The hotel has roaches that will smell your food within seconds and come scurring around. We figured this out very quickly. No food, no roaches within sight. Before we figured this out we had killed four or five big ones. Don't worry, we never saw any in the room even though we had food all over the place! As for food at the hotel, the breakfast at the Naupaka Terrace was incredible. I particularly enjoyed the Filipino Omelet. Yum! We never needed to order the buffet. Ordering a' la carte was more than enough food for us, delicious, and much less expensive. We tried Azul, which was wonderful, and their Japanese restaurant which was OK. The pool-side fare was cheap and ill-prepared. I would stick to drinks and snacks only. One of our favorite things to do was to take a nightly stroll down the beachwalk. You can get to the other side in about 20min, and if you go at sundown, the view is spectacular. (Hint: book Chuck's Steak House at the Marriott's time-share hotel for about 8pm. The food is great, and you'll be just in time for the sunset on the walk over) Don't bother with the time-share's poolside grill (Longboards, I think) as the food there was definitely sub-par. Too bad, as the atmosphere there is incredible. One last thing. Don't miss the Luau next door, the Paradise Cove Luau. Yes, it is a bit cheesy, but the kids had a great time, and the food was pretty good too! All in all, it would be hard not to have a good time at this hotel, but definitely look into the Disney issue, as it looks like it could become a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you would expect from a JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: aug08bride
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Ihilani, we want to give this place 5 stars for the beauty of the property. The service here is just not what you expect from a JW Marriott. Being a longtime Gold Marriott member, they could careless that you have choosen to stay at this resort. We love the lagoons, the pool and the peacefulness in the morning. We also stayed in 2008 and 2010 and each time have noted service is never what you would expect for the price you are paying.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money, stay in Waikiki or North Shore instead”
Reviews.Author: ModfatherDotCom
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a letdown. Definitely the most disappointing JW I've ever seen. No, I wasn't won over by Ko Olina in general, but this hotel did not live up to the JW standard I've experienced over and over again, across the globe. Apparently, Marriott came in and purchased an existing property, to which they affixed the JW label; that's fine, if the property lived up to the brand's reputation. This one does not. From the lousy, tiny pool, to the rocky, unwalkable beachfront, you'd be better off staying in Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Instant mashed potatoes and had to move furniture in our suite to get to our bed!”
Reviews.Author: whitcanna
Reviews.Content: Here now...we have been here four times...they seem short-staffed. Requested foam pillows in reservation because of allergy...were not in room when we arrived. Requested them FOUR times and finally got them. We are in Pacific Suite...view is great. Room has much to be desired. Spent first 45 minutes in room re-arranging furniture as we had two big chairs in front of our bed with an ottoman. Shower walls in bedroom bath are dirty. Mirror in bedroom bath was dirty when we arrived. Two of our phones don't work! Some of the controls in the room don't work. When to their main restaurant for dinner last night. Fish was great but they served us instant mashed potatoes! Lastly, why doesn't the hotel have bottled water in the room...even to purchase? What a shame. This hotel has so much potential. Great location. Working in the hospitality industry myself, I am embarassed for their GM. Stayed at the Royal Hawaiian before coming here...their staff is exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic yet again”
Reviews.Author: topfuel
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 2nd visit to this fabulous hotel. What may be an issue is that Disney have built a hotel and timeshare next door. We had an ocean front room and unfortunately they have the sound stage right next to the Marriott. Which did cause some noise issues but i put that down to teething problems at Disney. But, It is the staff that make this hotel so special. Nothing was too much trouble, all the staff where so kind. The rooms have been refurbished recently and i personally don't like the way it has been done. The rooms are still very nice, luxury bathrooms, very comfy beds but, why make it look like a business hotel when clearly people come there for a holiday. For some reason they have removed the sofa's and put in what i can only describe as a work station. Big mistake Marriott!! This should not detract you from going. I cannot think of another hotel where we were made so welcome and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Make sure you add this hotel to your places to visit list. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Views”
Reviews.Author: DebFL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ihilani Resort for a few days after leaving Marriot on Waikiki. The location is a distance from everything, but well worth it. The resort is on the west side of Oahu but easy to find. The hotel is right off the main Hwy-H1 with its own exit. When you arrive the grounds are gated, like a small community. Upon entering the gates you notice the Paradise Cove luau, Ihilani, Marriot Beach Club and the new Disney resort on the beach side. Across from Ihilani are some new stores fronts with restaurants, ABC store-grocery/gift shop, and still growing. Near to that is Roy's restaurant. A shuttle from the hotel will take you to each place, very convenient. The hotel itself is beautiful. Breathtaking views of the beach and man-made lagoon. The grounds has a total of four lagoons spread out along the beach. Our room was on the tenth floor with a view of the ocean thru white sliding shutters and glass doors onto a private balcony. We enjoyed dining each morning on the balcony which has a table,chairs and a chaise lounge. The room was very clean, spacious and nicely appointed. It has a refrigerator and you can rent a microwave for $10 a day. The hotel is nice size with a few places to eat, a couple of shops-gifts/sundrys, one pool and a hot tub. The pool is round and not very large but does have nice seating some with umbrellas and a bar/restaurant. The lagoon is just steps down from the pool area and is very calm and beautiful. The entire staff of the hotel was very nice and helpful. The restaurants are pricey as well as the alcoholic beverages, but you are on vacation in paradise. I recommend eating outside of the resort for some meals, better food, better price and not far from the hotel (Assagio-italian food-excellent). While at the Ihilani we went snorkeling with Wild SIde Specialty tours and swam with wild dolphins, sea turtles and fish. Amazing, I highly recommend this tour! We also visited the Paradise Cove Luau, walking distance from hotel, and was disappointed. I indulged in the spa at the hotel and was extremely happy with my massage. The spa is beautiful, very relaxing and well worth it. The spa area also has a gym and lap pool which is included in your stay. We also did some exploring around the island and found it to be rather easy to navigate and not as far as we thought. Beautiful beaches on north and east coasts as well. The only negative I can express is the new Disney resort, which was preparing to open while we were there. DIsney built the hotel right next to the Ihilani. The lagoon which is not large will now be shared by both. The hotel is typical Disney style, huge and obnoxious. Being from Orlando, I can do without the mouse. I feel this area must have been so beautiful and quiet prior to this. I am so glad we were there before the Disney doors open. It truly is a shame.
