This may not be an issue for people, especially for families with children. For a romantic place I am not so sure now.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Christy S
Reviews.Content: The rooms were luxurious with a beautiful ocean view. It was close enough to Honolulu to enjoy but far enough away to be relaxing. The staff was very helpful about questions we had about local amenities. The pool was a little disappointing and somewhat crowded but the lagoon helped to make up for this. The other part of our party had a private lanai with jacuzzi which was very nice except we had to clean out the jacuzzi of debris before we could use it. Otherwise their beach front suite was also very nice. We would definitely stay here again although I wonder how crowded the lagoon will be once the Disney Resort next door is finished. I also recommend checking out the local market at Aloha Stadium as opposed to going all the way to the market in Waikiki. There was a huge selection with very good prices and all by locals. I believe it is only open Sundays, Thursdays and another day which I can not remember.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for uninvited guests”
Reviews.Author: geokdk
Reviews.Content: Check for bed bugs. Service and staff attitude was definitely disappointing compared to good experiences at other JW Marriott hotels. Service in the lounge was on the verge of downright rude. The two other restaurants were good - the service was good, the food was good, couldn't really ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Rooms”
Reviews.Author: stomachdoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. This resort is in the KoOlina planned community and is situated along one of 4 manmade lagoons that are fed off of the ocean. The Ko Olina area is about 30 minutes from the airport and is far away from the frenetic pace of Honolulu. These lagoons are ringed by beautiful sandy beaches and essentially are large salt water pools; there are no waves to speak of. You can rent Kayaks, StandUpPaddleboards, water hammocks, snorkels, etc. The JW shares its lagoon with Disney's new (and HUGE) Aulani resort which is opening on 8/29. The Disney resort dwarfs the JW in size (but not height) and I think will result in the lagoon being much more crowded once the Disney resort opens. The JW is pretty limited as far as pools go; there is just one main pool which is pretty small and is not really a feature pool; there is a small pool at the Spa if you are there for treatments. We visited the Marriott KoOlina Beach Club (a Marriott Timeshare Property) at one of the neighboring lagoons; the pools there are much larger and more interesting. The rooms at the JW were gorgeous; we had two rooms which were adjoining. Everything is controlled by a video touch-screen terminal by your bed (climate, lighting, phone, etc). The mattresses were very comfortable, the bathrooms were enormous and very nicely equipped. The rooms had large ocean-view lanais. Customer service was excellent; the breakfast buffet was top-notch as well. We had dinner in the Sushi restaurant which was also very good. Overall, the quality of the rooms was the star here, the property itself was not up to the standards of some of the other JWs we've stayed at (the JW Marriott in Cancun, for instance, blows this properly away).

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, but housekeeping could be better”
Reviews.Author: chocoholic78
Reviews.Content: The location and beach amenities are the best thing about this resort. Very reasonable rentals of snorkel equipment, kayaks and water hammocks for use in the lagoon makes it perfect for kids. Friendly beach and pool staff. Did not eat at the hotel, but went to Mexican restaurant across the street, and stocked up on snacks at ABC across the street to keep in the room fridge. Room size is deceptive; they say it is 655 sf, but half of that space is wasted on a huge foyer and enormous bathroom. One room for 2 adults and 2 kids was no bigger than any other hotel room in terms of sleeping space. Housekeeping was not good. Our room was not cleaned at all one day, and only minimally the next, and fingerprints and smudges on windows and elevators were unusual for a hotel of this caliber. We were lucky enough to go before the huge Disney hotel next door opens in late August...that will change the peacefulness of the lagoon!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Resort, we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: dloessberg
Reviews.Content: The room, hotel staff and service was first class! They really made our whole trip enjoyable and we are forever greatful for the way they made us feel on our trip. They started our wedding/honeymoon of right and really spoiled us from the spa service to the front desk reception Raquel. There is nothing like watching the sunset from your balcony to waking up to the peaceful ocean and local birds in the morning at the Ihilani. THANK YOU Ihilani staff for everything and we will be back! Book this hotel with confidence, you get what you pay for and it was worth every penny and then some!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, beautiful rooms, but expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: pkmiles
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night as a couple for a romantic special occasion. The resort is beautiful and the rooms are nice. They were also kind enough to gift us a bottle of champagne but we don't drink. Also, we thought it really strange that there was absolutely no bottled water in the room, either complimentary or for purchase. One of their restaurants was closed on the one we went to was out of a lot of the items on the menu. The food was not up to par with the rest of the resort. We ordered room service for breakfast the night before and they called twice to confirm it which was bothersome. Nice people though.

Reviews.Title: “One of Oahu's BEST”
Reviews.Author: esslm
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times. Our last stay was for our anniversary. When we got in check in was quick and the staff from the entry of the property was nothing but warm and welcoming. The rooms were very very clean which is a must for us along with the grounds surrounding. I enjoyed the pool as well. I will definitely be staying here again. The sunset and the view is just divine. And we both slept like babies in those cloud like beds. Reminds me that I live in paradise. Definitely suggest this to anyone who can afford it! It was worth every penny and it does cost a pretty penny! Our room was huge and truly had a tropical romantic ambience. LOVE!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ashley7Boston
Reviews.Content: We have visited Hawaii many times, but this was our first time at this hotel. The location is wonderful - far away from the crowds of Honolulu. Rooms were lovely and service - when small issues arose - was the definition of the Aloha spirit (friendly, accommodating, prompt, respectful). We weren't sure how we would feel with only a lagoon as our on-property beach, but it turned out to be great and no one (including picky teens) minded at all. Plus there are wonderful surf beaches nearby. After just one visit, I already bemoan the upcoming presence of the Disney property as it will surely change the laid-back, away-from-it-all atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Hawaiian Getaway”
Reviews.Author: MeanderingCows
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ihilani for 4 days/3 nights. The room we got was an Ocean View corner unit facing west and gave us a spectacular view of the ocean and the Waianae mountains. We thought that this was a great room location as opposed to one facing the pool since it was quieter and gave us more privacy. The room itself was well-appointed with lots of storage and a comfortable bed. The bathroom included 2 vanities, a shower stall, soaking tub and a separate toilet area. The staff was very hospitable - they were great! For a deluxe hotel, the only thing we thought was peculiar were the absence of bathrobes and no complimentary internet access. Free internet access is available at the cafe downstairs. As for other hotel amenities, the fitness center is very clean and well-equipped for a hotel gym. If you would like a lounge chair by the pool, you will need to reserve early. The lagoons were wonderful and we were lucky enough to see a sea turtle while snorkeling. Valet parking is $35 a day for hotel guests - there is no way around this if you bring a vehicle. The valet service was very convenient and the attendants were courteous. It would help to call-in at least 5 to 10 minutes before you head out of your room to have your car brought up to the porte cochere. Depending on the time, there could be a considerable wait if you do not call ahead. We dined at the Japanese restaurant, Ushio-Tei, and had their dinner buffet. The quality of the food and service was excellent. We had the miso butterfish which just melted in our mouths and the sashimi entree which, although seemingly a small serving, made up for it in taste - it was completely satisfying. The entrees we ordered complemented the other buffet items. Also, we had the Sunday Champagne Brunch at the Naupaka Terrace. The service was excellent but the quality of the food seems to have gone down compared to previous visits. Overall, we felt very pampered at the Ihilani and would definitely consider going back for future visits to Hawaii. It is a great place to getaway and it is not as congested as Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay. Will Disney Add/Subtract From The Area?”
Reviews.Author: Townie33
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ko Olina from 7/20 - 7/27. We couldn't have enjoyed it more. For starters we had an "oceanview" room. We looked out over the lagoon and the ocean. If you go and get the oceanview asked to be up a little higher, the view is excellent. You will have a "lanai" (balcony) which is fantastic for just hanging out in the morning/evening when it is a bit cooler. Plus (for us) we had a great view of the sunset. Our room was beautiful. I was told many of the rooms had been renovated. Ours was extremely comfortable. But honestly, we didn't spend that much time in the room. But when we did it was very comfortable and nicely furnished. The people here were simply TOP NOTCH! They more than go out of their way to make you comfortable. We greatly appreciated so many of the wonderful people at this resort and the way we were treated. Warm smiles and excellent service. As mentioned in the title, Disney is opening in late August. I can only image the area being engulfed by families with young children. As it was it was really fairly quiet the week we were there. It was not crowded in the least. Getting a spot a the pool was never an issue. Nor was it an issue at the beach at the lagoon (which is very nice). We ate on and off the property. Eating on the property is pricey. There is no two ways about it. When we ate on property the food was very, very good. If you have read any of the other reviews you probably will read the same. We walked over to JUST TACOS for some very good Mexican fare the day we arrived. It is maybe 5 minutes away. There is also an ABC Store with fresh deli sandwiches available. There are pretty good as well. We had a rent-a-car so we ventured out most days. If you do venture out, and feel the need to check out the North Shore, be ware of the traffic. I wasn't quite prepared for the Hawaiian traffic jam. But as the beach goers go to and from their cars across the highway to and from the beach, they really slow up the traffic on the road. Just a "heads up." Speaking of rentals. Parking your car on property is, in my opinion, a bit of a rip off. They charge $35/day (plus tax). The cost is the same whether you valet or not. So do the math. Nearly $40/day times 7 days just to park my car! While we are speaking of "extras." Wireless internet is extra UNLESS you are Platinum Member. I can't recall the cost, but it is somewhere between $12-$15 per day. Again, I found this to be a bit extreme. You could circumvent the cost by using your computer in the lobby for free. Many, of course, did. If you like to snorkel we hit it about every day. The water in the lagoons is very, very calm which makes it very easy to navigate. In the lagoon in front of the facility you can see some fish if you snorkel near the rocks. If you to the next cove up it's pretty much the same, but supposedly have a better chance of seeing turtles. We actually saw a seal in our cove late one afternoon. If you want a guarantee of seeing turtles go out of the facility and go to the right. Walk until the sidewalk ends and keep going a bit further and there will be a very small cove. Go past this cove to the next cove. It takes a little effort to get to (kind of a tough walk, but not far at all). It is relatively shallow. First time when went it there were FIVE turtles just hanging out. It was pretty cool. If you want to go on a snorkeling excursion I/we highly recommend HAWAIIAN NAUTICAL. The people on the boat are awesome. They do a great job making sure you have a great time. JW Marriott was great. I would go back. But I would check the reviews to see what type of impact Disney has had on the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay @ JW”
Reviews.Author: Lisa K
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at The J.W. Marriott. The guestrooms(and Lanais) are large with plenty of space to spread out. Big closet with drawers and storage space. Over-sized bathrooms feature twin sinks with separate tub, shower and lots of drawers. The beds were really comfortable. Staff is super friendly and ready to assist guests. The valet and doormen provide a warm welcome and are a great source of information. Free WiFi in the lobby. Both food & service at Japanese restaurant on property-UshioTei was outstanding (fresh sushi!) and reasonably priced. The hotel was sold out during part of our stay, but never seemed crowded-always plenty of lounges by pool/beach and the pool area food service was always timely. The beach is huge, and there is decent snorkeling just outside the lagoon. The resort is central to all parts of island-kayaking on east side (40min), Waikiki (30 min), Pearl Harbor (20 min). We drove to the North Shore one evening for dinner and the drive was a quick 35-40 minutes. There are several other good dining options within the resort-Roy's, Chuck's Steakhouse and Longboard's. Kapolei is a 10 minute drive with lots of restaurants-Chilis, Outback and several local (plate lunch) places as well. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “If you have kids this is the place to come in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: Tessa2
Reviews.Content: My family has traveled to this resort for the past decade. When we first came my kids were 5 and now they are 15! The best thing about this hotel is the man made lagoons which front the resort. My kids learned to love the ocean, in safety, here. The lagoons actually open to the ocean so sea life can enter freely but bigger nasties can't get in. I'll always remember the first time I held one of my daughters out in the water, when she was five, out in the deeper water. She put her face in the water w/her googles and saw MAGIC! She looked up at me with gigantic eyes and then plop her face went back in the water and that is basically how we spent the rest of the trip w/me holding her in the water. The resort itself is lovely with huge rooms, even huger bathrooms, and large balconies- many with fantastic views. My family likes the rooms overlooking the pool and than out to the ocean, but the rooms that overlook the garden/shark/fish pools have nice views as well. If you want more seclusion they have a building that has lovely sunset views, where they appear to put the couples/honeymooners. The bathrooms in this resort have two sinks and a shower which is separate from the large bath. Very nice for a family. The bathtubs are big enough for 2 or three kids- mine used to play in the bath w/their toys when they were little. The rooms are tastefully decorated and newly renovated. If you can afford a suite, it's worth it. The staff is very friendly, the morning breakfast buffet a must. When we first came, the one thing that was lacking was ability to get to restaurants outside the hotel, without a drive. A couple of years ago a shopping area opened right across the street from the resort, an easy walk away. Now there is an excellent Mexican restaurant, a high end shopping mart, that sells ready made food, and a wonderful ice cream/deli type restaurant and more too come. A Disney resort is opening next door as well, so families at this resort will have access to the neat Disney restaurants, without having to stay in the smaller and less upscale Disney rooms. We don't golf, but apparently the golf course is excellent for the golfers in your family. It's very easy from this resort to get to the North Shore and into Honolulu as well. There is a shark pool and a sting ray pool and your kids can feed the sharks and swim with the sting rays! The restaurants at this resort are fine to excellent. The pool is pretty and the food served poolside is kid friendly, but with plenty for the adults as well. Azul, the fanciest restaurant at the resort, is unbelievable. There is a Sushi place and the main restaurant. as well, which serves a pretty varied menu. The restaurant at the golf course, Roys, is very upscale, with wonderful service and a great wine list. There are two Luaus- one next door at Paradise Cove- which lots of people come in from Honolulu to see, or a smaller one which was being held a couple of lagoons down at the other Marriott property when we were there. I'd recommend the smaller one- much more enjoyable and less cookie cutter. All in all this resort is the best place to bring a family in all of Hawaii in my opinion. We've been to all the main islands now and stayed at other upscale resorts, but this is resort is our favorite and for families can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: u2rodeogirl
Reviews.Content: We didn't want to stay in the busy areas of Honolulu/Waikiki, so we picked Ko Olina and the JW Marriott and just LOVED it! Not a far drive from everything you want to see in Oahu, but secluded enough to relax. The staff was really friendly, the pool - although small - was really relaxing, and the cove was nice and calm. We are glad that we arrived after construction and before opening of the new Disney resort, which is right next door, as the cove will become much more crowded once it opens. Our room was fabulous, on the 12th floor facing away from the Disney resort and overlooking another natural cove and small grove of trees - we were serenaded by birds at sunset and sunrise - could hear the ocean at night - just glorious! The room was big, with a long hallway, 2 mini-fridges, plenty of closet space and a nice, huge bathroom. Perfect for our family of 4! Room service was available until about 11pm, too, which was great! We at at Azul on the property, which was pricey but very good - Stewart, our waiter, was fantastic. The poolside restaurant/bar was also great, and Nick was a great help! Breakfast was great, too, and the kids got to watch them feed the hammerhead sharks, as their "lagoon" is right below the outdoor eating area. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely return! We were there 3 days, then a week in Maui, but were really let down by our accommodations in Maui, compared to the JW Marriott! Parking is very expensive, though - $36/day. Did not really have a chance to take advantage of the kids' activities or the spa, which is why I gave them a "not sure," but it was a great property for kids - the pool wasn't too deep and the manmade cove was great for beginner snorkeling. Great snorkeling off the natural cove, as well. My husband and son saw a bunch of turtles! Overall, we felt pampered and relaxed here and can't wait to return - would have liked more time at this hotel, and will make sure we do next time!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at this hotel and would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: 2011Cindy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 days at this resort at the end of July. The room was beautiful and the bed was very comfortable. The man made lagoon allowed us the opportunity to lounge in the calm waters and soak up some sun. The property is a little bit of a drive to Waikiki Beach or Honolulu and the rush hour traffic is pretty bad. But if you are looking for a great place to kick back, relax and enjoy the ocean and the beautiful views, this is your place. Everything was first rate at this hotel....we would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Property”
Reviews.Author: sfafafrf
Reviews.Content: We stayed July 2011 and had an awesome experience. The staff was very helpful and courteous. The rooms were very spacious and comfortable, even for a family of four. The view from the Balcony was fantastic throughout the day. My family enjoyed the pool, hot tub and lagoon. The morning fish feeding was a lot of fun for the kids. They also really liked watching the sting rays, hammer head sharks and tropical fish. We ate some breakfasts and dinners at the hotel and were very happy with all the restaurants. The breakfast buffet was a good value for the kids. We did the Pearl Harbor / City tour, which picked up at the hotel. This was a good day. Also the PCC tour was a lot of fun for the adults and kids. Shayna with the concierge service was a great help in setting up our itinerary. The whole family loved this hotel and experience, and continue to talk about the hotel 2 weeks since the trip. We look forward to going back to this property in the future.

Reviews.Title: “They changed my mind”
Reviews.Author: sfuji1
Reviews.Content: After submitting an earlier request for a king room on a higher floor, we arrived having to wait for two hours in the lobby for a double bedded room. To make up for the inconvenience, they upgraded us to an ocean deluxe suite. I told the guy, that since we have a place on the beach already, (it was rented out) we didn't really care about the view. At the end of the second hour, I took out the Ipad and was ready to throw in the towel, dispute my charge later, and move on. Unfortunately, I could not access the internet and our room was ready. Upon entering the room, I have to say I was very surprised at the size and the incredible view. It was very clean as I checked the top of the lamp shade and the slats in the shutters. The shower had a tiny bit of mildew, but nothing to scream about. Also, the closet had tons of storage and extra drawers. If you have a mountain/city view room, I would definitely pay to upgrade. Normally, I don't believe in paying extra, but in this case you will get your money's worth. The bags took longer than expected so we had to call a second time. Parking is not 35.00. It's 36.48 including tax, which is outrageous, and you don't have another option. You have to valet it, so add on another fee for the tips. You could self park (same price), but it's down the hill and behind the hotel. Now for the noise. Construction at the Aulani begins promptly at 7:00am and you could somewhat hear it on the ocean side but it then again, below you is the pool with kids screaming and can hear the airplanes and waves. Simple solution is to close the sliding glass doors and you have silence. There are rooms directly facing the Aulani at the back of the hotel, and some on the other side, so these must be the rooms that everyone was complaining about. Beds were very comfortable and I preferred it over the Westin Heavenly Bed. Did not eat at any of the restaurants as there are so many great places to eat in Hawaii. Had a great meal at the Kapolei Club House (Golf course) which is open to anyone. Staff tried to be as accommodating as they could, but there obviously is a shortage of personnel. Having stayed at almost all the hotels in Waikiki, I have to say this place has a great location. The other hotels (ie Trump) have good rooms but the location is not on the beach, or the hotels are on the beach (ie Sheratons) but the rooms are awful. Also, keep in mind that traffic to and from this hotel is horrible. We had to allow an hour or more to commute almost anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Resort”
Reviews.Author: SCHargis
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott Ihilani Resort is a great hotel if you want to be away from the hustle and bustle. The location is nice as there is only a couple of other hotels situated in the Ko Olina area which is great if you are looking for a relaxing get away. The facility is beautiful and the ocean front rooms provide a fantastic view of the sunsets. Our balcony was extremely large and well accomodated. The open air lobby is breathtaking and overlooks a pond with sting rays and hammer head sharks. The hotel lagoon is private and enclosed but you have to get out early to claim a chair. Just to the right of the resort (when facing the ocean) is a small reef that has fantastic snorkeling. Food is pricy in the hotel but there are a couple of options including a Japanese Steakhouse. Most restaurants not associated with the property are about a 10 minute drive away but there are lots of options.There is a small shopping area just across from the resort but has limited options.

Reviews.Title: “A DUMP and a RIP OFF!”
Reviews.Author: topresorts
Reviews.Content: Wow! I am not sure where I can begin as there were so many things wrong with this dump. I will start with the first thing one encounters which is parking. This is highway robbery as they charge $36 a day. The hotel will give you a line that this is common and many hotels for example in New York, Chicago, Boston, etc. will charge for parking. This is a terrible argument. First of all, there is no shortage of space at the hotel. Parking is a revenue stream and no doubt a huge part of their profitability. More importantly, if you go to a hotel in a city on the mainland that charges for parking, it is usually significantly cheaper to self park. In addition, you have a choice. For example, in New York or anywhere else, if you do not want to pay the hotel parking, you can park in a lot on the street for less than half. At this hotel, you cannot and there is zero choice. They have heard this before but do not care because you have no choice and this is no doubt their biggest earner. I had arranged for an upgraded junior suite (which by the way is not even a suite, just a slightly larger room) connecting to a two bedded room for my kids. Well, it turns out that the room was supposed to be “adjacent” (translation not connecting). It was never specifically pointed out to me that the rooms did not connect. OK, I will concede that maybe I should have paid more attention to their lingo and this was my fault. I asked for truly connecting rooms and was told I would need to wait until the next day. I wait a long time for the manager who does not seem to care and just goes to the back and disappears. OK, I deal with it. Prior to leaving the next morning, I stopped by the front desk and asked them to move our luggage (which was packed and ready to go) to the new rooms, empty the fridge and put the contents in the fridge of the new room, provide a new rollaway bed and have it made up, provide extra sheets, bathroom amenities and finally, to call me when the room was ready and this was done. I was told “No problem sir. It will be done between 2 and 3 and we will call you as soon as it is complete.” Well, I got no phone call whatsoever. We returned at 6 PM and did get two connecting rooms. However, no luggage was transferred and none of the other requests were fulfilled. Of course, no one from the front desk staff let alone a manager bothered to call to see if the new rooms were ok. Also regarding the rooms, was the cleanliness. It was very poor in particular the bathrooms. As an example please see the uploaded photo of the mildew in the shower. The hotel said they would clean it but it never got removed. It was definitely mildew not an imperfection in the tile because it was on the grout as well and one when touched it, you could feel the texture on the towel. It needed to be cleaned with heavy duty special mildew cleaner and was not. Also the shower door did not properly close but this was fixed. The broader question is why is the housekeeping staff so bad that these issues are not reported and dealt with before the guest has to complain. In addition, the exterior was very grimy and gross. It is desperately in need of a power wash and re-painting. Lastly, my Marriott profile clearly indicated that I should get the Wall Street Journal but the only thing supplied was the local paper, obviously to save money. I did not bother complaining because I was able to read the WSJ electronically. The hotel had virtually no activities for children or adults. Note the uploaded image (this is not copyrighted) of the August 1, 2011 activity schedule. As it may be hard to read, I will mention ALL of the daily activities listed. They consisted of yoga (for a fee), personal fitness training (for a fee), use of a basketball and court (free), zumba (free), a tennis clinic (free, but probably geared towards making you spend money on the courts or something else), Reef and Ray Adventure (for a fee) and Keiki Marine Life Program (for a fee). Contrast this with kids and adult activities at many other JWs such as water slides, water aerobics, bounce house, tie dye t shirts, face painting, hair braiding, s’mores, science experiments, camp fires, sing alongs, ice cream making, etc. etc. The pool is very lame and is just a round circle. There are no children’s water activities such as a water slide or lazy river. It was impossible to get to use the fitness equipment as the fitness center is way too small for the size of the hotel. The concierge is the most outrageous aspect of all about this hotel. In my opinion, a concierge should be a hotel employee whose job it is to help guests with directions, site seeing, restaurant recommendations, etc. Of course, they may from time to time earn a small commission but their main job should be to help the guests. Here the concierge is not even a hotel employee but an outsourced company called Expedia Local. All they care about is booking tours for you so they and the hotel can get their kickbacks. In fact the concierge herself is compensated based on the value of what she sells and only gets her commission if she hits a certain daily threshold. The incentive system that this creates is that the concierge has no interest in helping you at all. The funny thing is that they take the money and then pay the suppliers (probably taking 20-40% for themselves and keeping the money as long as possible before paying). Just understand this twisted incentive system before you book anything. The very few positives I can say are as follows: *F&B was excellent and priced fairly. The Azul restaurant was especially good. *Valet parking staff was friendly, always had towels ready and very helpful with directions. *The room view is beautiful if you have an oceanfront. If my feedback has one thing in common is that the ownership of this hotel does not care about offering great service at a fair price. What they care about is investing as little as possible and fleecing their clients for as much as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with private cove”
Reviews.Author: Allie B
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the JW. The hotel is on the west side of the island, only about 15min from the airport. It has its own private cove and beach, which is beautiful. Restaurants are OK. Make sure to rent a car because it's at least 30 to 45min to attractions such as Diamondhead, Waikiki, North Shore etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Wonderful Spa”
Reviews.Author: MrsCombs
Reviews.Content: This weekend was my birthday and my DH surprised me with a night at Ko Olina with a few special extras. We arrived at about 6:30 p.m. and went straight to the desk to check in. There was one person up there already and one of the other employees called us up promptly. Check in was smooth and courteous. They knew we were there for my birthday and didn’t offer any sort of upgrade which was a little disappointing but hey, that’s ok. We ended up in room 620 with a West facing beach view. You could see the parking lot but it wasn’t annoying, I just made sure to shoot up and keep it out of my images. Room was nice. Smaller than we expected. Bathroom was a nice size with a private water closet, glassed in shower, his and hers vanities and a large separate tub. Tub is only big enough for one person. Shower had good pressure and plenty of hot water. The bed was comfortable but the bottom sheet was not fitted and as soon as you laid down it was fully untucked and it gathered around you throughout the night. I detest hotels that do this. Either invest in sheets that fit the bed or find a way to tuck it so it stays TUCKED! There is nothing worse than having your linens twist up and roll up around you so you are touching the mattress when you sleep. In the morning as I was straightening out the linens, I also noticed that there were 3-4 small but noticeable holes in the bottom sheet. This is something housekeeping should have noticed when making it up and replaced it. One thing I also noticed was that there was a mattress cover on the bed and when you turned in the bed the sound of that cover moving around against the mattress was very loud. I think another reviewer said something about “sleeping on a plastic bed cover” and that is about what it sounds like, but it’s not plastic. Not sure what the solution there is unless they add a pad between the cover and the mattress. The ac (which is controlled with your bedside control system) never really seemed to cool the room fully. We had it down to 68 degrees and it was more like 75 in there. Having a feather comforter with that made it a bit warm especially for DH who is a large man and gets hot easily. We tried turning on the ceiling fan but it sounded like it was going to fall off the ceiling so that was a no go. Couldn’t open the door to add a little fresh air while you slept because that shut off the AC system. The bedside control unit allows you to turn lights off and on from your bed, set the “Do not Disturb” light, and again, the AC temp. Nice touch to give the room a more techy feel. Internet access. Free wifi if you want to hang out in the lobby. In the room you pay. No thanks. As much as you pay for a room, you shouldn’t have to pay for something that any joe off the street can get by sitting in your lobby and having a cup of coffee ☹. Other than that the room was clean but it did show some signs of wear. It’s an older hotel so that’s going to happen. It really didn’t detract from our enjoyment. The grounds are beautiful and worth walking around. There is a nice pathway that leads to the beach to the right of the hotel with the hotel behind you. The ponds with the fish and other assorted sea life was nice. I did see where other viewers mentioned about it looking a bit murky but I did not notice any bad odors. Everything in the tank seemed lively. The design of the hotel is just lovely and you could tell that it was once a very grand property. It reminded me of some of the places in Barbados. The pool and lagoon were very lovely. It never seemed crowded at all. DH arranged a special dinner for me in our room. Our server was very prompt and delivered the food right at 7pm. We were able to enjoy a nice meal while watching the sunset. We had personalized menu cards and mine said happy birthday with my name and the date. The food was beautifully presented but since it was all brought and set out at once you either had to eat fast or be prepared to eat a cold dinner. You can pay to have a private server but that costs extra, just like the candle they add to your table, etc. When he told me he had to pay for the candle I was a bit surprised. That should come with the romantic dinner. Only other negative review I can give is that the two cocktails that he ordered (Amaretto Sours) were in small tumblers and the glass was only half full. It certainly left you wanting more. I got up in the am and wasn’t sleepy so I grabbed my camera and went for a walk around the grounds and down to the beach. The beach is just lovely. I wish I had brought my suit. There are plenty of chairs or “Cabanas” that you can rent and the water looked really inviting. On the way back up to the room I stopped at the coffee shop and got two muffins, a large mocha with an extra shot of espresso and a bottle of OJ for DH. That set me back $19.40! OUCH. Room service for breakfast was prompt and our server was very sweet and personable. She pushed the cart to the Lanai and set everything up. DH had the Steak and eggs and I had the Banana Mac Nut pancakes. Three pancakes…too much. He also ordered a side of breakfast potatoes that were a bit over cooked (not burnt but just hard). It was nice just to sit on our lanai and enjoy our meal so no complaints there. Had to fight the birds off a couple times after we were done because they REALLY liked the pancakes. Time to check out. That went smooth. There were a couple people in front of us but it only took a second to get up to the counter to check out. I let them know about the fan so hopefully they will deal with it like they promised so the next visitor won’t have that problem. I probably should have mentioned the AC but I forgot. Well, the day wasn’t over. He got the spa package room so even though our massage wasn’t until 12:00 we dropped our bags with the bellman to be secured and walked across the street to the spa. We were promptly and pleasantly greeted (complete with Happy Birthday) and escorted to our respective locker rooms. Once I was changed I was given a tour of the facility and set off to enjoy some of the amenities while I waited. There is a hot tub and a cold plunge pool right next to it, a steam room, sauna and “needle” shower that is essentially a shower booth that has shower jets that hit you from all angles around it. Very nice. I used it all while I waited for our couples massage. The room for our massage was a long narrow room and our tables were head to head. The massage was about an hour and mine was perfect. She listened to my requests and perfectly executed them. DH seemed to enjoy his but at one point he had to ask her to lighten a bit. Not sure why massage therapists like to push the muscle into the bone but sometimes that HURTS. When our massage was over we were guided back to our lockers and told that we could stay and enjoy until 7pm or come back if we wanted to. As nice as that would have been we had a wedding to attend so off we went. Had a shower and got ready. Few things I noticed. No razors or sanitary items which I’ve seen in every other spa I’ve been to. There are two hair dryers so if there are more than two ladies drying hair, you will have to wait. They provide shampoo, conditioner and shower gel. I wish I had brought my stuff because my hair is color treated and it didn’t like their products. They also had some mousse, hair spray, spray deodorant and lotion. Oh and lots of towels and iced towels that were very nice when you were in the steam and hot tub. So this concludes my trip report. Over all it was a nice weekend. I loved the spa, and have to say I liked it much better than Turtle Bay’s spa. More amenities to enjoy, but same wonderful service. I probably wouldn’t stay there again, just because of the bed and the AC issue. My own bed and AC are much better and not that far from there. It was nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu and it really felt like a tropical paradise. On a noise note: Construction a the new Disney property was still going on but we really didn’t notice anything until we were leaving and could hear the “beep beep beep” people complained about but it really wasn’t that bad. If you want peace, quiet (aside from the soon to be over construction) this is a great place for you. I'm a bit nervous what the new hotel opening will do to the relative peace of the lagoon but I guess that's all part of progress.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay. Beautiful and quiet”
Reviews.Author: tbs58
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for our 30th anniversary. The resort, although full (according to the receptionist) was quiet. The views were beautiful. The room was awesome with a luxurious bathroom and breathtaking views of the ocean with a beautiful lanai. I would give it four stars except that the concierge was often difficult to reach by phone and the hotel restaurants had weird closing days. We did rent a car and had no trouble getting around Oahu. We'd love to go back for our 40th.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view.”
Reviews.Author: Jlo536
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW in May for 3 nights. The hotel and surrounding area are beautiful. We had an ocean view room with a balcony that was just breathtaking. The room was very spacious and much bigger then the room we just left at the Moana Surfrider. The bathroom was huge and had a separate shower & tub and 2 sinks on opposite sides of the bathroom so we both had tons of room to spread out. The pool is beautiful and the menu at the pool bar was pretty good, I had the cobb salad twice there and it was very fresh and hit the spot. We also rented the loungers out by the beach for a half day and they were very cozy and had bar service there as well. This hotel is not somewhere you want to be if you’re looking for nightlife, there is a small bar that’s open later at night but that’s pretty much it. I did order the cheese platter at the bar one night to take to the room and it was very good. I loved sitting on the balcony in the morning with my coffee and taking in the view of the pool and lagoon, it was so relaxing. After coming from the Moana, the few little things that lacked at the JW were, the in room coffee wasn’t that great, no robes or slippers, the water pressure wasn’t very good at all which was a disappointment since you have this big beautiful bathroom and no water pressure so the showers weren’t that pleasant. Although there were a few minor things that could have been better, the balcony and view made up for all of those. We had a lovely time at the JW and would return.

Reviews.Title: “NICE BUT OUT OF THE WAY”
Reviews.Author: 2010travelsalot
Reviews.Content: The room was bigger than expected and the ocean view was gorgeous. For a spa, was disappointed there were no bathrobes or slippers in the room and also no turn down service. Far away from the action so it is a must to rent a car. If you want to get away and relax, this is the place. Disney's Aulani resort is right next door, sharing the beach, and will open the end of August, so I doubt it will be quiet for long though.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great beach, long ride to anything”
Reviews.Author: fdevita
Reviews.Content: Title sums it up. We were upgraded to a larger suite which was huge. Appointments were wonderful, beaches are protected lagoons, but there is nothing on this lower southwest corner of the island. The staff will warn you against going north on the west side of Oahu and the drive to Honolulu takes twice as long as you expect except late at night. All the great restaurants and shops etc are close to Honolulu and the ride back to the Ihilani late at night got tiresome after a few days. We switched to the Waikiki Marriott for the rest of our trip and enjoyed the best of both worlds. Very nice hotel if you are looking to get away from it all - and stay far away from it all.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach, Noisy Setting, Ok Service”
Reviews.Author: Shamzes
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that the beach is absolutely gorgeous. A man made lagoon, clear blue calm water great for swimming and floating. The hotel is about 25-45 minutes from Honolulu (depending on traffic) and is located in a beautiful golf resort village. The problem with this hotel, at least for now is the noisy construction taking place at the Disney resort next door. My wife and I only stayed here on the tail end of our trip in Hawaii, but i would be VERY disappointed if this was our main destination due to the hammering and beeping (tractors backing up). No matter how beautiful the beach is, if you come for some peace and relaxation, please look elsewhere. I noticed that the Disney resort plans to open this fall, this will create an extremely busy beach, probably a great place for families with kids, but not really for couples. I would argue that given the construction, the value for the price is not really there. The only other thing I would mention is that the concierge is not great here. I had asked to get help with restaurant options. Concierge was on break, then never called back. Not a deal breaker, but just another reason to maybe look elsewhere. If you are using points, worth staying for free/discounted price, but if you are paying retail you might be disappointed. I will end the post on a positive note. As we were leaving to tour the island and check out the north shore, the valet gave some great tips on local spots to visit, where to park, where to eat, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Lagoons”
Reviews.Author: Krissykoala
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the JW Marriott Ihilani for Valentine's Day in 2010. The balcony we had was huge and was worth paying for the ocean view. There was not much to do in the area and the pool was too small, but it really was a gorgeous place to stay. We have also stayed at Turtle Bay on the North Shore, and we prefer these resorts to the craziness of Waikiki. Very enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Hated to leave”
Reviews.Author: J_A_Mc98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW for 10 days before moving from Hawaii. We booked a standard mountain view room and was upgraded on arrival to a partial ocean view. Usually partial ocean means you have to lean over the rail to see a sliver of water, not this one! The lanai was huge and faced north up the shore line. So we had a good view of the mountains as well as the ocean. The staff was excellent, my son got sick in the middle of the night early on and someone was promptly up to help us clean up. Then we ordered room service the next morning for him to try and eat. When the lady who brought the food found out he wasn't feeling well she, of her own accord, came back with crackers and ginger ale for him at no charge. We ran into her a few days later and she inquired as to how everyone was feeling. The spa was excellent and offered Kamaina rates as well. We hated leaving after our stay.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely lovely”
Reviews.Author: Halleran4
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying in this hotel, it was the first time we took the family to Hawaii. It's worlds away from the busy Waikiki. There is a water park nearby, and up the coast the lovely Makaha beach. The hotel has it's own lagoons and snorkeling, but if you want waves you will need to go north to Makaha or to the North Coast. The rooms are luxurious and roomier than most. In addition, most have ocean views. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing place to relax and enjoy the beauty and sunny weather of Oahu.”
Reviews.Author: travelandsoul
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two days and a night with a few of my girlfriends just to relax and get away. We had a great time- the room was spacious (huge bathroom and nice balcony overlooking the ocean and hotel ponds), clean, and the amenities were awesome. The staff was helpful and friendly, the pool was so nice with the beach right next to it, and there are shops and restaurants right in the area. I'd definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Travellers041
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is an absolutely beautiful hotel! The lobby is gorgeous, the rooms are very nice - and clean, the view is amazing, the lagoon is unbeatable, the staff are kind and helpful ....the only negative, the prices are inappropriate for the amount spent to stay at this hotel in the first place. Just a couple of things to remember when staying at the JW Marriott: - Internet is NOT included in the price of your room. It costs an additional $14.00 USD per day. - Expect to pay $35.00 USD per day for parking (you are able to either valet your car - don't forget to tip - or simply drive your car to the parking garage - which is about 20 steps from the entrance of the hotel.) - If you misplace a towel (or the individuals working at the towel station forget to mark it off on your sheet as returned) the hotel automatically adds a charge of $20.00 per towel to your bill (so make sure to check your bill prior to checking out) - Expect to pay higher prices for meals at the hotel restaurants. Just to get a slight feel for it - the breakfast buffet is approx. $24.00 per person whereas the brunch buffet is approx. $47.00 per person (which includes a 'complimentary' glass of champagne) - however they are served at the same time (so make sure to read the signs and take the food from the appropriate buffet tables) - The food at the hotel restaurants is delicious though - and the staff is wonderful! - Unfortunately we didn't find this out until two days before we left, but there is a store in the brand new plaza directly across the road from the hotel called ABC - and it is amazing!!!! It has extremely fair prices, great fresh food (including made-to-order salads, amazing sandwiches, hot food etc etc etc), souvenirs, sunscreen, snorkeling equipment, alcohol .... I could go on and on - Within that new plaza there are also 2 restaurants. We ate at the Mexican restaurant (I believe it was called "Just Taco's") and the food was great, however our waiter was terrible! By far the worst service I think we have ever received at a restaurant. We figured that perhaps we was simply having a bad night. :) - Otherwise, within that plaza there is also an ice cream shop - which we heard was amazing, however we never actually made it in there. There are several empty shops just waiting to be filled with new stores and restaurants - and I would guess that once the Disney Hotel is up and running (which is directly across from the JW Marriott), they should be occupied with more fun things for you to enjoy! All-in-all it was a very lovely stay and we would def go back and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and lovely”
Reviews.Author: Travelot80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ihilani Resort for our 10th anniversary and it was a perfect location. Our room was huge, well appointed and had a gigantic lanai overlooking the ocean! The hotel sits on one of four man-made lagoons and provides plenty of lounge chairs right on the beach which we took advantage of everyday. Walk through the resort past the other hotels and enjoy all the lagoons. We ate dinner at one of the restaurants and it was a great deal, they offer a nightly drink special and the food was really good. The grounds and facilities are lovely. While there is construction nearby, it doesn't take away from the experience. Before you book, be sure to join the Marriott Rewards club, we received a 10% off card good at restaurants throughout the resort, including the hotel's restaurant's and cafe. Across the way from the hotel is a mexican restaurant that's delicious and in town in Kapolei is the Hapa Grill, family-owned and serving delicious local style food. The Ihilani resort was relaxing, staff was extremely friendly and helpful and we'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, relaxing place, and great service!”
Reviews.Author: chynadragon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the weekend we got married, and they were very hospitable. We were able to negotiate a block of rooms for our guests, and, while it wasn't cheap, it was a reasonable discount. It was relaxing to stay at a place away from the hubbub of Waikiki, and the 3 lagoons they had on the property were really nice and scenic. All of our guests enjoyed their stay there. We also appreciated the shuttle that they provide to and from downtown Waikiki for the guests who didn't really need to (or want to) rent cars.

Reviews.Title: “Special property and we will return!”
Reviews.Author: pastagirl11
Reviews.Content: Roomy and comfortable rooms with mini-frig. Can't beat it! So much nicer than our three days in Waikiki. It is so relaxing here and everyone is very friendly. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is NOT up to JW Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: beachorbust87
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned for months to go to this hotel for 7 nights to celebrate my 40th birthday. Our only goal was to rest, relax, and unwind as this was the first time in a long time we would be on our own, without kids. We have stayed at many JW Marriotts and this one does not meet expectations. In addition, there is MAJOR construction still going on next door AND at the lagoon/pool area, with noisy jackhammering and tractors beeping and bellowing as they endlessly go back and forth doing who knows what. We are FURIOUS that there was not a mention about the construction and noise on the website or from the concierge during our many months of planning this trip and corresponding with the hotel. Had we at least known there would be all this noise and disarray, we could have made other plans or at least prepared ourselves for it not being peaceful. As far as the hotel itself - It is small, with dusty plastic plants decorating the hotel floors, an extremely dirty overhead concrete entry way COVERED in bird poop, scuffed walls, and a strange outdated glass floral arrangement in the entry revolving door. There is also barely anywhere to sit in the lobby. NOT luxury AT ALL. We have found most JW's to at least give somewhat of a similar experience to a Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons, as its brand promises, but this hotel was more like a high end Hampton Inn. If you haven't stayed in true luxury hotels, you might find this hotel to be acceptable, but if you've experienced a well maintained luxury hotel, you WILL be disappointed. The only positive about our 1 night stay (we aborted the whole trip and flew to Maui the next day and stayed at the Grand Wailea) was that our ocean view room had a nice view. Other than that, the room was small, barren, had an 80s cathode ray tube TV (aka, not flat screen) and was MISSING FURNITURE. It took 3 tries in talking to the front desk to CONVINCE them that our room was missing the seating area furniture (2 chairs, table, ottoman). We ended up having to find a Google image online of what an ocean view room looked like at this hotel and took it to the front desk to PROVE that the room was missing seating. Yes, we raised all of these issues to the hotel's GM and while we did get a call back from him some many hours into the second day, he just didn't really care a whole lot about our problems with the noise, not being told beforehand about the noise, and the missing furniture. However, we were treated nicely by the pool towel attendant and we received some complimentary fruit, but this just wasn't going to cut it from what we expected of a JW Marriott. So, as we sat at the lagoon on the second day, trying to convince ourselves it would be ok, watching the tractors go back and forth and listening to the jackhammering and the neverending BEEPING of construction vehicles backing up, we packed up, cancelled the rest of our stay, and flew to Maui for the rest of the week. What a HUGE inconvenience AND disappointment. Thankfully, it turned out great at the Grand Wailea. The sad part is that we might have been able to salvage something of the JW visit, had the staff or at LEAST the GM cared a lick about our experience. How about comping the first night or free breakfast during the stay or an upgrade to a room with FURNITURE?!?! This is a classic example of how a bad situation could have at least been slightly mitigated by the attention of staff and management. So, from the deteriorated facilities, to the construction noise we weren't told about, to the apathetic attitude of the GM, this hotel is just not up to JW Marriott standards and we highly recommend you don't visit there, ESPECIALLY with Disney central going in next door. It's only going to get worse.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but a Disney Resort is coming next store!”
Reviews.Author: CRDSC
Reviews.Content: This a great hotel but a massive Disney Vacation Club Resort is opening in October and will share the same man made beach with the JW Marriott. The man made beach is small even for the JW Marriott. I cannot imagine being there once the Disney Resort Opens. We stayed here only for one night after a week in Maui at the Ritz Carlton. We came back to Honolulu to make the trip open easier. We did not use the beach or the pool. If I had come here to use the beach I would have been extremely disappointed. This hotel was perfect for what we used it for but not perfect for a full vacation. We stayed in a Ihilani Suite with a connecting room. It was a huge suite and looked to have been recently renovated. The suite has a full ocean view and and massive balcony. The master bedroom in the suite had it's own private balcony and provided good privacy but did not have a lock on the door. The master bath was also huge with a full walkin shower and huge soaking tub. The room was full of all the latest technology. Overall, you could not ask for a nicer suite. We ate room service for a late night snack and the breakfast buffet. All the food was outstanding. Service was prompt on both meals. You typically cannot go wrong with the food at any JW Marriott. The hotel is in great condition and the hassle factor is minimal. Elevators are right next to the front desk which is a also just steps from the front drive of the hotel. Overall, a great place to spend the night and eat in a pretty good location and beautiful setting. Things will change dramatically when Disney arrives. The crowds Disney brings is something I always try and stay as far away from as I can.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Suite”
Reviews.Author: Marcus808
Reviews.Content: Celebrated my birthday this weekend at JW Marriott Ihilani Resort and Spa. We got a suite, and it was so nice and big. Wow, what a spectacular ocean view over the pool. The patio was huge and we got to eat room service breakfast there. The room had a king bed and two huge LCD televisions. Never had the chance to watch TV, as we explored the "secret beach" for sunset. We then had drinks and dinner. The next morning we took a walk on the perfect cove outside the hotel. It had a huge bathroom and 3 closets. The bathroom included 2 sinks and separate shower and tub. Rooms have been renovated recently and they are fabulous. This is definitely a beautiful upscale hotel, with lots of amenities for almost everyone. This is a great hotel to come and relax especially when celebrating something special. Thanks Ihilani!! Aloha!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel! Wow! Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: MGFANS
Reviews.Content: An absolutely gorgeous hotel inside and out. Great food, great service, fabulous room. We were there for a conference but since family came along we did family stuff also. Valet parking same price as self park and both a bit pricey. Beach was great and pool was great. Our only problem with this hotel was that it was a distance away from the sightseeing stuff like Pearl Harbor etc. so if you want to do more than lounge at your hotel , a car is mandatory. Also if you want to eat anywhere other than hotel, car is mandatory. Taxis are very pricey to and from this hotel. One woman told us that the cost to take transportation back to the airport was going to be $90 and she wasn't going by limo! Traffic was terrible if you were trying to get to the hotel at the wrong time. The recommended snorkelling group would not come out to the hotel to pick us up due to distance so we spent a lot of money on parking garage that day and other days. There were no laundry facilites either. Again there was a laundromat in a neighboring town so again with the car. This is the hotel that the Pro football players and famiilies stay at for the Pro Bowl.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice for Us”
Reviews.Author: granted7
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at the JW Marriott. We are world travelers but this was our first trip to Hawaii. After reading many reviews from many hotels on Ohau, we agonized over selecting a hotel that would suit our travel needs. From the moment we arrived at the JW, we knew we had made the right choice. A spacious, tastefully appointed, impeccably clean suite, with a 14th floor heavenly ocean view awaited us. Within 5 minutes we were indulging in the land of relaxation. The entire staff of this hotel runs on one motto. "The guest comes first". We have stayed at many hotels worlwide, many of them luxury hotels. We have never found such a courteous and accomodating staff as we did at the JW. We are a couple in our 50's with grown children. Some folks have commented that they found the children in the hotel a bit noisy. We did hear kids, but it was the most pleasant sound of little gleeful screams of kids splashing about with their siblings and parents detached from their televisions and I-pods. A refreshing sound and sight to see families connected like this. We rented a car and did a few excursions to see the rest of the Island. The valet team were the best! We even drove up to the Turtle Bay resort on the north shore to do a tour and compare with the JW. So glad we chose the JW at Ko Olina. We have nothing negative to say. We will go back and we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good by JW standards but will be insane once Disney Aulani opens”
Reviews.Author: ladodgerone
Reviews.Content: Resort was fine; spa is good but the pool is on the small side; the tower of hotel rooms is a bit dated; the hotel bar is a tourists' nightmare, and the pool is on the small side. That said, you get access to a nice private cove as well as a JW resort (accessible by shuttle) that has incredible pools and good beach restaurants. The downside is, once Disney Aulani opens up, the secluded cove is going to be lost. But this resort is pretty nice all in all. I'd recommend walking up the beach (right of the hotel, away from Aulani) to find a private more secluded cove that has sea turtles swimming in it and is mind-blowing. (it's a local hangout.) Parking is a ripoff. Don't bring your own car.

Reviews.Title: “Calm Paradise”
Reviews.Author: kfreude
Reviews.Content: Nothing negative to say about the experience. I wish we had more than a weekend to stay at this gorgeous resort. Not a whole lot of beach walking available but we made do. My favorite memory is from an early morning, like 4:30am, when I woke up to hearing what sounded like millions of birds outside our lanai. There are lots of trees nearby, apparently filled with birds. It was the most soothing sound to wake up to. We had a corner room on a high floor and felt very secluded. LOVED IT! The resort is a ways from the major hopping area of Waikiki, so access to many places is a bit limited. You will need a car if you want to leave the resort on your own. We walked to Roy's, a favorite restaurant, and drove elsewhere. The pool is fantastic, beach is calm, grounds are beautiful. We walked to the Paradise Cove Luau and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves there. We hope to return to the JW again!!

Reviews.Title: “I could live there!”
Reviews.Author: SLTXTraveler
Reviews.Content: The views are amazing. It is nice and quiet. The rooms are large and clean. I was sad when I had to pack up and leave.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property, a bit far from other activities”
Reviews.Author: sorenkkg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ihilani resort b/c my company sent us on a reward trip-- there were a hundred or so of us, some with partners and/or children. Pros: The hotel is gorgeous! It was recently renovated, and the lobby, the rooms--everything is really lovely. It's got a nice pool--not too big (seating can be a problem) but the perfect temperature. Note: it's a salt water pool! The beach area is gorgeous also--it seems to be a manmade lagoon, so no worries about the waves or currents. The breakfast buffet is delicious, and we ate a couple meals from the pool bar, and the sandwiches were really super! Cons: the staff friendliness is sort of hit or miss-- no one was horrible, but when I called to confirm the reservation, the phone people were a bit abrupt. When we were onsite, the pool attendant, bartenders, everyone we interacted with were super. As it typical of a hotel, the food and drink prices were pretty high. This is NOT an all inclusive (maybe they have a meal plan or something, but we weren't on it) so a frozen drink by the pool was almost $15 usd. It was a great drink, but still. Also, the beach didn't have umbrellas or those permanent shade spots. If you wanted shade, you had to bring your own (there's an ABC store across the street) or RENT a lounger. The price for parking is about $30 a day, so take that into consideration when renting a car. However, the resort is quite far from other Oahu activities (like Pearl Harbor, downtown Waikiki and Honolulu, North Shore, PCC, Pali lookout...) so having a rental car is still probably a good idea. I don't golf, but I heard the golf course (that you ARE near) is great. There's also a Disney resort (not a theme park, just a hotel) going in next door--that should be fun for a visit. Finally-- while the rooms were renovated, they put in this very elaborate control system-- I had some trouble getting the a/c to cool down enough, so I ran the ceiling fan (which was a bit squeaky). Still--it's not about hanging out in your room that much, right?

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful and relaxing oasis”
Reviews.Author: alohatripper
Reviews.Content: May 29, 2011 We live in Honolulu, but spent the night here since the setting and amenities offered are so different, even unique. Still, it is only 40 minutes away by freeway, but a world away in feeling. This property and only one other on Oahu, the Kahala Hotel and Resort, are world-class hotel properties located outside of Waikiki. Although we've visited the site before, this is the first stay. Now we wish we had stayed before. Our eighth floor, OV double was absolutely stunning with well-maintained furnishings and high-end finishes. Nothing was wanting. The presence of a expansive balcony allowed a picture postcard view of the many lagoons and the almost finished Disney Aulani Hotel Resort, which looks incredible and soon to be an asset to the underdeveloped area. Since the hotel is rather isolated, there aren't a lot dining options unless you wish to drive to a nearby town, but we were not disappointed with the many choices for a satisfactory breakfast. It's a bit pricey, but the incredible view from the terrace is included. This hotel is an excellent option if you are tired of staying in the frenetic atmosphere of Waikiki, or even the city.

Reviews.Title: “This is an awesome facility - the best I have been to yet!”
Reviews.Author: Geocaching Ace
Reviews.Content: 5/21/2011 My wife & I stayed at this resort as part of a combination cruise and stay-over in the islands to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary. The NCL ship arrived in port earlier in the day and we arrived at the hotel sometime around 10am. We initially were assigned an "accessable room = ADA= handicapped equipped" which did not sit well with me. I called the desk and was told that they would reassign me a regular room and to use that room until I received a call. That call came around 4pm and it was well worth the wait. We received an beach/ocean facing Jr. Suite on the 14th floor with a view that was amazing. The room size was HUGE! There was an entry hallway, with counters & safe/refrigerator, dressing room w/ excessive closet space, large 2 sink bathroom with shower & tub, large porch, bedroom with 2 large screen TVs, DVD players, sitting area, 2 overhead fans, bedside wireless lighting control system, etc...... the list just goes on and on! I am a Platinum Rewards member and was treated like royalty. The valet took care of the rental car and it was available whenever we wanted it. The overall facility is expansive. There is a large open air lobby, saltwater fish lagoon, almost private beach, cabanna rentals and several restaurants on the site. It is true that the hotel is located in a remote area of the island but is it is solitude you seek, this is the place for you. Disney is building a huge resort right next door and it should be open late this summer. I can only imagine the flood of small kids when the Disney resort opens. This resort is build on one of 4 private coves which protect the area from excessive wave action. Fish are plentiful and there is even a fish feeding program every morning where you can feed and identify the fish in the cove. The hotel is located in a resort area which has controlled access via a gatehouse. There is also a Paradise Cove Luau which is within walking distance from the hotel. We opted for the Paradise Cove Luau over the Cultural Center Luau as it was 1/2 the price and a whole lot more convenient. The Luau was really great and represented the history of the islands very well. Overall the resort is in an excellent location on the west side side of the island and well connected via the H1. If you have a rental car, everything is within a 45 minute drive. If you are a couple looking for a romantic escape - this is the place for you. This JW Marriott sets the standard for the chain!

Reviews.Title: “I cannot get over how wonderful this resort was!”
Reviews.Author: jetsetmd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ihilani in May 2011 for two nights and was very sad to leave! I stayed using Marriott points (I had been in Waikiki for business and wanted to get out of the chaos for a couple of days) and I am a platinum member. I tried to limit my expectations regarding a view since I was staying on points but soon after I booked I received and e-mail that they were upgrading me to an ocean view with a balcony! It was an absolutely beautiful room and the grounds were gorgeous. The hallways to the rooms were dimly lit which at first struck me as odd but as I was walking to my room I felt like I was in a spa! I couple things of note, although while some of them are cons none of these will deter me from returning to this resort: -The staff was VERY friendly. When I checked in the guy at the Valet desk (I think his name was Michael) recommended places for me to see in the North shore area and remembered me the next day! -There were alot of kids around, which I wouldn't have necessarily expected, but just be aware of that if you are not looking for that. It didn't bother me. -Ko Olina seems to be developing and while there are on-site restaurants and a few within walking distance they aren't exactly cheap (nothing is in Hawaii). In Kapolei a couple miles away there are more chains and a target. -My room had a mini fridge (that was not a mini bar!) which was fabulous. -They are doing construction on the new Disney timeshare next door. I did not find it terribly noisy or unpleasant. The buildings are constructed, it appeared to me that they were working on the pools/grounds. I could hear the noise a bit from the lagoon but barely noticed it at the pool. I believe it is set to open in Fall. -Parking is $30 a night, not cheap. -They leave you a note in the room that explains if you leave your balcony doors open without the screen closed bugs will come into your room. It is definitely true although I can say that it appeared housekeeping cleans them out every day if some small ones do get in. In summary, beautiful room, beautiful view, relaxing stay, I couldn't have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort”
Reviews.Author: findelcamino012
Reviews.Content: During our first trip to Hawaii, my wife and I stayed and the JW Marriot and Ihilani resort in Ko'Olina and all I can say was...WOW..... The resort was amazing! Everything from the large, spacious rooms, the wonderful restraunts, the beautifully landscaped grounds, and the friendly hotel staff who did everything possible to make our trip a memorable one. We will without a doubt be going back next year and the Ihilani will be our hotel of choice. D. Parker

Reviews.Title: “There is NOTHING to do here”
Reviews.Author: redsoxnation949
Reviews.Content: Very pretty setting, however, there is nothing going on here. Resort areais very small, very limited dining options, long drive to get anywhere. Beach is man made lagoons - no waves No boogey boarding, body surfting, stand up boards, etc. You can kayak from one end of the lagoon to the other in 4 minutes and they hose you for the rentals of kayaks and floats.. Pool is tiny. Do not go here with kids older than 5 - they will be bored.to tears Also - disney resort under construction next door (like 50 yrds next door) so incredibly noisy and not relaxing at all. On a positive note, My husband is Marriott Platinum and we were upgraded to a larger room, however, the room had a very limited view so we had to be moved. It took over an hour for our luggage to arrive at our room and the hotel was not busy. Rooms overpriced considering the constuction noise. Hotel is a bit dated and with disney coming in next door will need a major remodel to keep up.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: KMJA
Reviews.Content: There's not a lot to say about this wonderful hotel. Everything was just perfect! We stayed in June 2010, for one week. Ask for a room with sea/lagoon view, it's breathtaking!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Chavayea
Reviews.Content: I used Marriott points for this vacation and I could not have been happier with my overall stay. The room was gorgeous, the views were breath taking and the staff was wonderful and friendly. Yes the Disney property was under construction and maybe it was distracting for some but to be honest - I sat by the pool or on the beach and read a book and relaxed and didn't pay it any mind. I rented a car and yes $29 dollars a night is a little steep but keep in mind where you're staying. This isn't the Holiday Inn people. I didn't eat at any of the restaurants but I did go to the little bistro in the lobby every morning for a chocolate chip muffin and a strawberry smoothie. They were addictive and delicious and they wonderful lady and gentlemen behind the counter remembered me after the first day. Room service was super fast and the food was quite yummy. I tried the Hawaiin BBW place across the street and I'd stay away next time...not so great. My only small gripe (because it can't be perfect right?) was housekeeping. I left my room typically around 8:30 am every day if not earlier and twice when I returned after 3:00 pm they either were just finishing up and I had to wait for them to leave or they hadn't come yet. I leave tips for housekeeping staff so I was a little annoyed at the delayed service. But in the scheme of things it was such a minor detail and I could have called and requested housekeeping when I left for the day to avoid that issue.

Reviews.Title: “Would be good if the beach front wasn't under construction.”
Reviews.Author: OliverA3
Reviews.Content: There are jack hammers, back hoes, diesel exhaust invading the beach and pool area. And they did not have any warning or discount. No wifi in the rooms. $5 for a glass of grapefruit juice from a carton. Very helpful and friendly staff. Sushi on site is good, but they were out of 2 sakes I ordered. Great margaritas at the Hokulani bar on site. Good bacon cheeseburger and poke at the pool. Don't come here until the beach renovation is complete.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best resorts on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: Traveling4BiznFun
Reviews.Content: This is definitely the #1 resort in Kapolei, far far exceed the Marriott Beach Club in every conceivable way. We absolutely loved our room with two lanais and views of the lagoons, ocean, and mountains. The service was fantastic and the location equally great. My only word of caution is that parking is $30/night (same for self or valet), so you should just add that amount to your daily room cost. Also, the lagoon by the hotel is a great place to relax or go for a quick snorkel!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back soon!”
Reviews.Author: DoctorMVG
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the JW Marriott Ihilani. I was first here in 2008 for a couple of days after a week in Palau before flying back to LA. I had decided to stay here because I really dislike Waikiki. Way too noisy and I wanted to have quiet to relax. Wow, did they ever deliver. Rooms were fabulous and the lanai was perfect. Food was great, and service impeccable. I will be returning on June 1st this year for a week stay to celebrate the completion of my PhD and "me" time!! It's good to hear about upgrades, especially wi-fi in the rooms. Also I'm relieved to read the reviews that say the construction noise from the Disney hotel was not noticed. I was a bit concerned about that. This visit I will rent a car to explore Oahu more, in between my relaxing in a cabana on the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with THE most caring staff!”
Reviews.Author: Sunnd
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Marriot, with my new husband, for our honeymoon this April. The hotel itself is beautiful and so quiet. The grounds are gorgeous and very clean. Our room was unbelievable! The bed was amazingly comfortable and the view from our balcony was breath-taking. The staff bent over backwards to make sure we felt welcomed and relaxed. I had to get my dress steamed the night before the wedding and the manager of housekeeping came up to my room to pick up my dress and gave me the biggest hug congratulating me and wishing me luck for my upcoming wedding. The night after the wedding, we came back to our room and were surprised by a complimentary bottle of champagne! It really meant a lot. From the people at the front desk to housekeeping, the staff was genuinely kind and very helpful. Thank you JW Marriot for a very memorable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great family experience.”
Reviews.Author: michael_landa
Reviews.Content: Our family typically stays on Maui in the Wailea area but we wanted to try something, so we booked a stay at the Ihilani on a recommendation from a friend who used to live on the island. When we arrived, our room was ready and very clean. Enough room for a family of four, but the double beds made it a little tight at bed time. The bathrooms were very spacious. We also had a nice-sized lanai which was great for our early morning reading. The staff at the Ilihani were incredibly nice. The front desk, pool and restaurant staff were very attentive and always had a smile for us. The man-made beach bays were also great for our kids. Clean and calm waters were great for swimming, snorkeling and fish feeding (in the morning by the hotel staff). One note about the fish feeding is that it is done by the sales staff for the timeshares so a very light pitch is made for you to make an appointment to see the timeshare. Don't worry, it is very light and no pressure at all. The food at the restaurant was also very good. Not 5 star, but nice attention to detail and nice presentation. With respect to the pricing on the drinks, I found them to be reasonable when compared to what we pay in Maui. Don't expect too see too much around the hotel. You will definitely need a rental car if you want to see the sites. oh, and the construction next door (new Disney resort) was almost a non-issue.
