Overall, our family had an excellent vacation at the Ilihani. Overall, this was a great vacation spot for our family.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: MikecDallas
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great property. Great rooms, view, bathrooms were large. nice large balcony. Pool is pretty small for a resort but still very nice since there is a nice beach and easy access. Several great restaurants including Azul and the pool side grill. not inexpensive but great food. my only issue was at times the staff appears disconnected from their customers. rolling of the eyes when asking for change or directions, not all but some. overall, this is a place for a relaxing time on the beach or around the pool.

Reviews.Title: “A paradise removed from the beaten track of Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: raincoastgirl
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were given a complimentary upgrade to a stunning ocean view room. It was the most spacious room I've ever stayed in. It was an odd layout because there were two flat screen tv's side by side which didn't make sense since obviously one would distract the other if both were turned on. There was a wardrobe room with plenty of closest space. The bathroom had two sinks on opposide ends of the room which wasn't too efficient. The beds were comfortable except the comforters were made of a slippery silk-like fabric which kept sliding off the bed. It took a while to get used to all the gadgets that adjusted the lighting and temperature in the room. But overall, it was a lovely room. The breakfast buffet was good value for kids ($9) but a little pricey for adults at $26.00. However, the spread was delicious with a great selection of fresh fruit and hot items. There was even a Japanese breakfast section. The service was excellent. Our son because very ill so they provided us with soda and made sure he was fine. Even after we arrived home we received a call from their the Marriott offices in LA to follow up. I agree that not having wi-fi in the room is very inconvenient. Hopefully that will be available soon. The grounds were so beautiful with interesting vegetation and exotic fish in the ponds. The pool area was busy as it was Spring Break but there wasn't ever a problem getting a chair. Compared to Waikiki the beach was relatively quiet with nice waves for some bodysurfing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kiki523
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Ihilani. We spent a lot of time just walking around the beautiful grounds. Great spa and we love azul's. The hotel rooms have amazing bathrooms. One caution though, we read the reviews about the coves to the right of the hotel. We went there and saw three eels. We later told a staff member who said they call it eel bay. Becareful for eels they can cause some damage if they bite you

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Vacation Sanctuary!”
Reviews.Author: FlyGirlinBuf
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott Ihilani does not disappoint! Our family of four (children ages 8 and 12) stayed at the JW for 3 nights at the end of February but wished it would have been for more! It was the last few days of our 10 day Hawaiian vacation and what an incredible way to end our trip to paradise! From the moment you enter the Ihilani complex, you felt as you've been transplanted to your own island sanctuary. The grand lobby, scenic views and comfortable atmosphere made it a place we did not want to depart. The JW Marriott staff (from the Front Desk to Housekeeping and Bell Staff to Activities) were friendly and helpful with tips on what to see and do on the island. The 3 saltwater protected lagoons were perfect for the kids to play especially as beginner snorkelers and the pool was a nice alternative. We were even lucky to see a rare monk seal resting on the beach! The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. Naupaka restaurant was wonderful and the breakfast buffet was great value for a family with children! The JW Marriott Ihilani Resort and Spa was convenient to everything on Oahu and truly a perfect retreat which we'll visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms and location, but not as good an experience as it could be.”
Reviews.Author: wlatta
Reviews.Content: Location - Nice beaches within close walking distance, decent snorkeling in cove, very good but pricey breakfast buffet, beautiful ocean views, great exercise room/gym. Some parts of resort are just ok - outdoor manmade lagoons look better from a distance, most of the nicer restaurants are closed midweek. Small pool and jacuzzi. The new Disney resort next door is so big, construction affects the ambiance in non-ocean view rooms and at the beach. Room - generously sized, big marble bathrooms, wall of windows slide open for great sunsets and ocean breezes. On the flip side, expected more from a JW Marriot - horrible thin cardboard toilet paper, no robes in rooms, service was only adequate. Don't expect preferrential treatment as a Gold member, almost everyone else there is also using rewards. Remember - NO concierge lounge, no reimbursment for breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: My_Visit
Reviews.Content: We came to Ihilani last minute. After spending one night at Halekulani in Honolulu, we realized we needed something more relaxing and serene. Since we were coming from NYC, staying in Honolulu didn't feel as relaxing as we were looking forward to. We weren't getting the open island feeling and didn't want to wait to get to our next island. We drove to the west of Oahu the next day and checked into Marriott Ihilani. At half the cost of Halekulani, Ihilani was perfect for us. The property is beautiful. A more relaxed, less hectic hotel than Halekulani. The beach is a series of 4 lagoons (man-made). The views from the rooms are expansive and lovely. The hotel and rooms are pleasant, good quality, and well kept. The rooms and lanais are spacious. We stayed in the hotel. There's a path for walking/jogging that takes you along the different lagoons to Marriott's time share property at the other end. If you go in the other direction, behind the hotel, you find a smaller beach stretch, which is an amazing spot for sunsets and quiet picnics. The food was quite good. We ate mostly poolside or Naupaka Terrace. One evening we ate at Azul, which was amazing. Another evening we drove to Honolulu for dinner. The time share buildings also have two restaurants to choose from. The one annoyance was the massive construction project next door to the hotel. It was loud during the early part of the day so sitting on the beach was not as relaxing, not to mention is was quite an eyesore. You hear less noise if you're poolside. At that point, the beach felt quiet and low key, but with such a massive hotel going up in such a small space, it's going to get pretty crowded on the beach once it's open. Perfect for anyone who wants to stay in Oahu for a night or more before going off to other islands, have a relaxing island experience, and not get stuck in the busy city area of Honolulu. We did like Honolulu, but preferred it after a few days of relaxing quiet. So maybe next time, we'll go there for a couple of days at the end of our visit. Overall, a great part of our trip. After four nights, we went off to Maui Four Seasons in Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “That's The Night That The Lights Went Out In Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: TropicofCapricorn
Reviews.Content: Never again. Just got back from Honolulu. We stayed at the JW Kapolei for $359 per night--rip-off. The first day/night went smoothly. Then came the Friday. A powerful tropical storm swept the island. Seems there's only one electric company on the island. So what does its thug union workers do: they go out on strike and hold the public and tourists hostage. We went with either sporadic or no power for 2 days & 2 nights. That first day we were there, took a cab to near Diamond Head and cabbie soaked us 90 bucks. We were also called "Howlee" and we took it to be racial. When we took TheBus back, we encountered homeless people camped out on sidewalks; our only alternative was to walk in the street. Rude & condescending people working in restaurants and at JW are commonplace. We were suppose to stay for 10 days, cut it short for just a weekend. Suffice to say, we'll NEVER go back to Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip...and some tips.”
Reviews.Author: rudywrites
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights at the Ko Olina JW and enjoyed the resort immensely. We had an Oceanfront room and the view was spectacular particularly in late afternoon when the sun was setting. A few things to note: the pool is a bit chilly, something we weren't expecting. There were also quite a lot of families there with very young children. Although they were precious to watch, it set a different tone to the trip. We rented a car for the entire period we were there, but we wouldn't do it again because of the $30/night hotel charge for the parking. Honestly, we took two days to do trips and the rest of the time we spent close to the hotel. Traffic into and out of Honolulu is horrific--much like the juggernauts we're used to back home. We opted not to go into the "city" for dining for that reason and would have just rented from Hertz--at the hotel--for the two days we needed and taken a cab to and from the airport. Yes, cabs are pricey, but we would've still saved quite a bit not having the car at the hotel all those days we weren't using it. Restaurants were pretty good. Roy's was the best ever. Chucks Steakhouse was good too, located at the Beach Club. There's a shuttle that can take you anywhere in the resort area to dine, which makes it pretty convenient. Be prepared to drop some money on dinners--An average of $150 to $200 for drinks, apps, entrees and dessert. We also did dinner casually a few nights in the bar at the JW--they will offer you any menu from the in house restaurants to order from there. On leaving, one tip. Ask your airline what is the earliest you can check in. Some airline counters aren't open until just before flights leave so you could be stuck waiting at the counter area for quite a while at the airport (we waiting two hours). Would we go back? Most definitely to Hawaii. Next time, probably to Kauai!

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation to Hi ever..”
Reviews.Author: jfarrar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this site from 2/5/11 to /14/11, which I visited for my birthday and what a birthday i had. Quiet, nice rooms. Glad I did not stay in downtown Honolulu. The only issue we had was the prices for dinner and lunch were 2 much. We learned the hard way that eating away from the hotel saved us, money. Staying here for 10 days was still worth the cost. I would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting in Bay”
Reviews.Author: Claudia1971
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a bay so it is safe for kids because there are no waves. The resort has a pool by its beach. We were very pleased with our beautiful room and its view (ocean). Across the street, there is a general store if missing anything. We always dine out or do little groceries ( grocery store 15 min drive away) and use the in-room fridge. The grounds are in gated community so very safe. We drove to Waikiki and were glad we had picked our hotel versus the hotel in Waikiki ( too crowded and commercial). We drove to Northshore (approx 45 min drive) Sunset Beach. Well worth drive if you want to see huge waves and surfers. On the way to Northshore you will see pineapple fields.

Reviews.Title: “Dissatisfied and Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Docltc
Reviews.Content: The location of the JW is very isolated. It is about an $80 can ride to Waikiki and almost $20 to restaurants outside of the resort. During our stay the Disney hotel next door was in the process of being built. Every morning at 6:30 AM they construction noises would begin and wake us from our sleep. We requested a room change but were put on an imaginary list. We later found out from the manager that no such list exists and that the associate had made it up to placate us. The hotel service is truly some of the worst I have ever experienced. Upon arrival we were never given an explanation of the resort (ie where the gym was, how many restaurants there are etc..) Anytime we had questions we were given vague answers. The Valets even put us in a cab where we were ripped off. We will not be returning to this hotel and do not even recommend our greatest enemy to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Eh.”
Reviews.Author: KFerg
Reviews.Content: Impressive property, more commercialized area than I expected, as the Disney property and condo areas are really built up. The spa is FANTASTIC. Great massage, amazing steam room and overall a really great experience. You get what you pay for at this spa and it would be an excellent location for a girls trip. It's quite far away from everything, with the exception of and ABC market and small Mexican restaurant. Service was poor ... I benefitted from a relatively secluded room, but this resulted in room service trays that remained out of my door for 12+ hours and the need to call maid service several times during my 1 week stay to request service (at 5pm or after) when I arrived my room did not have an ironing board, iron or hair dryer ... It took 2 calls to get these items delivered as the desk kept claiming they were "in a drawer", "in the closet". They weren't. The previous roomer must have cleaned them out or trashed them??? Who knows. This was a business trip and was enjoyable, I'm not positive if I'd pay to come back on my own, but if you're looking to get away from Waikiki without taking a flight to another island it's a nice get away.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly very good.”
Reviews.Author: Swarton
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms; spacious, comfortable, and well equipped. Big balcony, large elegant bath. Large, attractive, but shallow, pool. Huge sandy lagoon offers calm waters for swimming, and stays a bit warmer than the open ocean. And there are three more lagoons just like it down a wide paved pathway. Very pleasant public areas, although perhaps not quite as over-the-top dramatic and opulent as some of the most expensive Hawaiian resorts. Several minor maintenance deficiencies (dirty windows, stained carpet, clogged storm drains). Good food. Service good in the specialty restaurants and bar, but can get slow and neglectful at times in the main dining room. Walk or take the free shuttle every half hour to a few other restaurants in the resort complex. We do wonder what it will be like when the enormous Disney complex open right next door next August.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Mike L
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this resort for a change of pace from the crowds at Waikiki beach & glad we did. The resort is beautiful & staff was very polite & professional. The rooms are huge & well appointed with double vanities, walk in shower, Jacuzzi tub & nice Lanai. The grounds & lagoon are just amazingly beautiful with great views of the ocean. The pool looked very nice, but chose to swim in the lagoon. We ate at one of the restaurants & the food was very good! Really don't have any complaints about this resort & I'm pretty picky! I would highly recommend this resort to anyone who wants to get away from the hustle & bustle of Waikiki or just to relax in Paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Update on New Rooms at JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: antepali
Reviews.Content: I just recently returned from a two week trip to the islands of Hawaii. Our first stop was at the JW Marriott Ihilani. I had read on the hotel's website that the hotel was undergoing room renovations and that they should be completed sometime in January, 2011. To my surprise, I was unable to find any pictures of the newly renovated rooms on tripadvisor. At check-in, we were given room 1017, a recently renovated room. I believe we were one of the first guests to stay in the room! It had that clean "new room" smell! Everything in the main guestroom area was replaced-- closet doors, carpeting, bedding, wall fixtures, etc. The room was also upgraded to include a bed-side control panel to control all light fixtures, room temperature, etc. (all the features on the panel were not yet working properly however). The bathrooms were given a soft renovation, with a replacement of wall paper, mirrors, new plumbing fixtures, and re-surfacing of the vanities. The hotel stay overall was very nice. The public areas do need an upgrade next as well as the pool area. They are worn and in order for the property to maintain the JW brand standards they will need to be updated as well. The only thing missing from the property would be a "centralized" lobby bar for cocktails/drinks in the evenings. A small bar is located in the building but it is very dark and dull. There is a lot of space in the central main lobby (including a makeshift coffee bar that looks very out of place). I would not be surprised if there were plans to create that area as a central lobby bar in the future. We would definitely stay again at this property as it sure beats staying in downtown Honolulu. I've attached some pictures of the renovated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: lizzysta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in July for the Oahu half of our honeymoon. A few weeks before our trip, a co-worker stayed at the JW with her husband on business. She told me it was very nice but could use some updating like paint, etc, so I went into it a tad bit worried. We thought the resort was in excellent condition and did not notice that to be an issue. We had an ocean view room overlooking the pool and lagoon. There was a table and chairs, and also a loung chair covered with a towel that was very comfortable and perfect for reading on the balcony. We always found a chair at the pool and at the beach. The lagoon is great because it's very calm and good for swimming. One of our favorite things was the breakfast buffet that was part of our package. There were a lot of options including an omelet station and the food was delicious every day. We ate at Azul for dinner one evening. The food and service were both excellent there too. Every morning after breakfast we walked around the fish ponds and the resort area. It's great because you can walk along the path to other areas of the Ko Olina resort. We loved it! There were a lot of different people staying there - couples, families with young kids and teenage kids, business travelers. I felt that it was beautiful and relaxing. My cousin had warned me not to stay on Waikiki and this was an excellent alternative. The only negative that I found was the construction noise and visuals (cranes, etc) from the Disney resort being built next door.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing stay, despite the construction”
Reviews.Author: JandMToronto
Reviews.Content: For movie buffs or surfing fans, you will recognize this hotel from the movie "Blue Crush". The main characters are cleaning staff in the movie, and you will recognize many scenes when you visit. My wife and I stayed here on a stopover on the way back to Canada, from Japan. It was a pleasant surprise to find that this is a drier side of Oahu, as the eastern side of the island was extremely windy and much colder. However the hotel is quite far from the center of Honolulu, and a rental car is a must. You will want to drive to have more choice for resaturants and do some shopping for snacks/drinks etc. There is a town a few minutes away, but somewhat tricky to get to because of road construction and some closure/detours for the exit ramps. Also there is an outlet shopping mall within 15 minutes or so if you are into that sort of thing. The downside of having the car has been mentioned in practially every other review, which is the $29 nightly charge. Very annoying added cost. This hotel is in such a remote area and the property is extensive, you'd think that parking should be free if they had outdoor parking instead of erecting an expensive multi-story parking structure. The hotel itself is nice enough, the rooms are starting to show its age. However, the overall feel is still luxurious and the bathroom was also a nice surprise with a nice tub, shower and separate sinks. The bed was very plush and linens were luxury quality. I really liked the full length wooden shutters that run the length of the glass sliding doors to the balcony. Staff were pleasant and accommodating. Pool was warm enough. We went out to eat for every meal except for a brunch, so we can't really comment on the restaurants save that one time. The beach is clean and the water is very calm because of the lagoon protection. And yes, there was construction right beside at the Disney. You sort of block out the noise and don't really notice it unless you concentrate on it. By the time nightfall comes, they are conscientious enough to stop work at a decent hour to give peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Glorious Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Marcus808
Reviews.Content: Recently celebrated my one year anniversary with my girlfriend. Hotel room renovations are beautiful. Rooms have a wonderful view of the ocean. Girlfriend loved the spacious two separate sink bathrooms with separate tub and shower also. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting an intimate getaway with ocean views. Definitely nice to get out of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing time at the JW”
Reviews.Author: mschaaxp
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW Dec 31-Jan 3. Booked an oceanfront room and was happy to be recognized as a Marriott Platinum member and upgraded to a junior suite on the sunset side. Gorgeous views of the surrounding area. Room was spacious and clean with an oversized bathroom and a great balcony. Beach area was clean and relaxing and the grounds were well kept. There was construction going on next door from the Disney property moving in but it was not a distraction. We had a very late flight and they extended our late check-out to 6PM at no additional cost. A few negatives: $29 per night for parking is excessive, considering the rural location of the hotel. The $45 Sunday Brunch Buffet had horrible food and slow service, not to mention lots of flies. Overall, we had a great relaxing experience at this hotel. I would definitely recommend a stay at this property; however, I would recommend looking for other off-site dining options.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable Marriott Experience”
Reviews.Author: lillapluttan
Reviews.Content: If you are familiar with Marriott, this is a typical Marriott property. Very reliable, somewhat bland, but overall good without any major surprises (good or bad). I traveled with husband and 22-month old twins. We stayed on Marriott points, but if I had paid myself I am not sure if this is necessarily the property I would have chosen as I don't know what rates folks paid for comparable rooms. A colleague with young kids recommended this hotel to us. Overall we had a gerat experience. The good: - Fantastic and friendly staff. But then again, everyone is friendly on Oahu. I give the staff an A+. - Check in and room available right away at 12:30 pm, no waiting around until 3 pm. - Renovated room and extremely clean. We are a messy family with the twins and our room always looked impeccable. Housekeeping did a marvelous job and came promptly when called if we opted out earlier in the day, if we weren't ready. A+. - Empty mini refrigerator in the room and small pantry like area to use. Awesome for kids. We kept milk, fruit, orange juice etc in there. And some beer for ourselves! - Lagoon beaches are great for kids and not crowded with limited access to the public. It truly felt like a private beach any time of the day. The hotel will share the lagoon with the Disney resort going up next door, so it might get crowded when the Disney guests come along in late 2011, but there are 3 other lagoons further away also available. - Good (but expensive) restaurants. Nachos at the pool side bar was nothing to write home about, but when you enjoy them together with happy kids and washed down with a beer, life still feels pretty good. - Great inexpensive Hawaiian BBQ place across the main street and a handy little convenience store. - Great fish ponds, again awesome for young kids. - Great walking paths. - The hotel had 90% occupancy when we were there over the Holidays and still felt small and uncrowded. Mixed guests, some families with young and older kids, some older couples, younger couples, friends traveling together. Very low-key, just the way I like it. - The Kapolei community a few miles up the freeway with a Target, Safeway a few restaurants (AWESOME breakfast place, KOA Pancake house. Not to be missed, even in its strip mall location). Very new and mainland like, but utilized almost daily with us since we have young kids (diapers, baby food etc). The not so good: - The Disney construction across the street. Who said it is almost complete? Wrong! Construction is going full blown with (I counted) 12 cranes, dump trucks, back hoes, bull dozers etc. The site is CLOSE, but I don't think rooms facing the pool side will hear much. We stayed on Marriott points (platinum) and expected the construction based on other reviews here, so it was not a surprise when we got a room facing it ("mountain view"). But, beggars can't be choosers and for us it was actually a great location since our kids LOVE big machines. We were up on the 9th floor and had a full view of the site. Also, we had no neighbors on one side and a neighbor with a bigger living room facing our bedroom on the other side, so our kids, who were quite noisy at times, hopefully did not bother too many other guests. If I was a honeymooner, I'd probably take issue with the room location and construction, especially since it is not mentioned on the Marriott website. - The pool. It is not heated and was actually COLD. My kids who take baby swim lesson did not enjoy it. This was a huge disappointment since we had planned to do a lot of pool time with them. If you are older, I don't think you will mind, but my little ones would not have it. - The location in Ko Olina. As others have mentioned, it IS far away from stuff (with the exception of the strip malls in Kapolei). We expected this, but Ko Olina is also pretty close to an industrial area and, if continuing north, some very sad and poor neighborhoods. We were there over New Year's and they supposedly have an awesome New Year's celebration with great fireworks. With young kids, we were in bed by 9 pm and missed the party. We were glad our room faced away from the pool where the party was going on. We were woken up at midnight by the fireworks (which we heard but could not see). The kids slept right through it. It sounded like some BIG stuff and ohhh I was itching to go down to the beach, but parenthood was calling. I am sure it was fabulous! I guess one year they even had Sheryl Crowe perform on the beach. Yes, they charge for parking, $29/day. I don't understand why this is a surprise to so many reviewers. That's what hotels do. Good thing is that you can valet parking anytime at no extra charge and that was perfect one night during a rain storm and at times when we came home with sleeping kids and just wanted to get in the door. Shout out to the valet guys. Overall we had a great experience and will go back to Hawaii and Marriott next year, except we will try a different island and hotel, just for fun.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing, uncrowded and gorgeous rooms”
Reviews.Author: suesita
Reviews.Content: We loved our vacation here. Everything and most everybody were lovely and accomadating. However, they have some problems with the front desk. We had reservations which we had reviewed many times with the staff by e-mail and phone. With these reservations in hand, I was told the day we got there that they couldn't give us the suite we were promised. The next day, a suite was provided . There was some confusion also with "The kids eat free" program but eventually everyone seemed to understand it. Other than that, we were more than pleased with our rooms, the restaurants, the views, the pool and the lagoons. We would return in a minute and hated to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: RedSoxWorldChamps
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1) Large, spacious rooms 2) Not crowded 3) Clean 4) Well manicured grounds and fish ponds 5) Nice bathrooms and toiletries Cons: 1) Noisy! Placed me in a room on the side of the building where a huge Disney resort is being built. I was able to get a different room, however I had to complain after the noise woke me up the first morning. There is a noisy luau in front of the hotel some nights. Luaus are supposed to be noisy, however it just doesn't fit with the relaxing feel the hotel is trying to promote for all of its guests. 2) Pricey + nickel and diming - $30/night for parking, self parking at that! There were also no moderately priced restaurants on the premises. Fees for recreational activities on site during the day were offputting. 3) Inconveniently remote - This hotel is too far removed from restaurants, stores, and attractions. Maybe in a few years there will be additional conveniences around to supplement daily needs. 4) Limited pool options - There is one large circular pool. It's pretty, but only about 4.5' deep at center. There is also a hot tub. 5) Excessive sales pitch for the Marriott timeshare down the street - I came to vacation, not to enter into a real estate transaction. One or two mentions of this opportunity is acceptable, however the marketing is a bit thick. 6) Furniture seemed worn and sparse - In both rooms I had , the mini fridge was on the floor with no cabinet or stand. The first room I was given had a large living room with only a couch, end table and lamp, and TV cabinet. While this was nice, the room seemed pretty empty. Also, the electronic lighting and TV control next to the bed didn't work correctly in either room I had. I also spoke with someone at the front desk prior to my arrival to request a bottle of champagne in my room when I arrived as this was my honeymoon. No champagne was there. The front desk remediated this the following day, however the moment was lost.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it, but....”
Reviews.Author: wellfreakingwell
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel for folks who want to get away from it all. When I say get away from it all, I mean it is far from hustle and bustle of Waikiki. You will notice a significant number guests who are above 60. Parking is a serious bummer....it's $30 a night whether you valet or park yourself. Makes it very difficult to want to tip. The valet is convenient, but you ought to have the option. The pool is truly designed for the non-swimmer, over 60's and little kids. It is nice, but small. As regards the "beach"....well, it is man made and well....it is okay. Let's just say, if you (like us) are used to picturesque beaches....sorry, this is not it. The rooms are nice....obviously you want the ocean view. If you can get any of the rooms that ends in 08 or 09 (like 608/609 up to 1108/1109 and above) you wll get a nice view of the pool area and the "beach"/ocean. You may have to pay more for those views unless you are a Platiinum elite/premier, then you may get upgraded.......oh, but that $30 parking!! Now....the bathrooms are fantastic....and the housekeeping does a good job of putting back together the incredible mess we generally make. Did not mind tipping here (oh but that $30 parking) The buffett was an assault on our intelligence. If the parking does not drive you crazy, the buffett will. It is in the range of $60 for adults and about $25 for kids and it was not even better than a $11 Golden Corral (for all you "All you can eat" folks out there). The Prime Rib was great, but for that amount, we expected a great selection of fishes....but....what can I say, they fell seriously short there. To the credit of the hotel, they do provide a list of local restaurants where you can go...and our recommendation is: Hapa Grill.... You can get breakfast, lunch and Dinner. There is also Juliez Restaurant which seems to be a Vietnamese/Hawain deal. For these ventures, You will need a car (rental). You could cab/shuttle it, but these jaunts could add up fast. Now, if you live in a world where finances is not an issue.....this hotel is actually ok. The food is good, you will love the convenience of the valet parking, it is quiet and the beaches are not packed with all kinds of "riff raff". The guest seemed to be mostly caucasian and asians....not much of anything else. No insinuations here...just an observation during a particular window of time. Maybe January all the others come to stay....I dunno!! The rooms (and the bathroom...wow) are nice and the Service is actually pretty good....like anything, it goes both ways, if you are good customer (and/or you tip very well), the service will be off the chart. Will I go back? Drumroll....yes, but only as a points customer because I am a Marrioter. While I have paid similar rack rate of $295 - $300 for hotels, I did not see that for this hotel. This should be a high 5 rating not a 7 rating. Anyway, bottom line, I would simply say, this is not a bad hotel....far from it, however, if you are budget concious...and have no points, I doubt you walk away saying "wow". .....ohhh, that $30 parking drives me crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but there are better on the island”
Reviews.Author: MissMack13
Reviews.Content: This hotel was decent. It was kind of fancy. The lobby is pretty. The room was very basic nothing special about it. However, the bathroom was nice and big, really liked the bathroom. They have a nice outside area to walk around and there are large pools with fish and sharks. I didn’t like the beach at all, its in a cove area the water was dirty with debris because it gets trapped in the cove area, prob the worst beach area I found on the island. The pool and hot tub were not the cleanest. It is in a good area not to far from Honolulu or other attractions on the island and easy access from the highway, though there was construction that made the initial finding of the hotel a bit confusing. For the price I paid I wouldn’t go back, I stayed at a Courtyard that was much nicer for less money in Waikiki. You will need a car at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WOW. and WOW”
Reviews.Author: e_mcglynn
Reviews.Content: Swank place that caters to your every need. No complaints. Expensive but worth the money if you can afford it!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is next door to a large construction site.”
Reviews.Author: zoso613
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located across the street from a large construction site. A Disney timeshare resort is being built and estimated completion is Fall, 2011. The beach is located near the construction site and is noisy so we couldn't really relax. The construction woke us up every morning at 7am, some mornings it was as early as 5am. The service was average. We got upgraded to a suite because we were on our honeymoon which was nice. The concierge was awful. They seemed really inexperienced and unsure of things when we asked them about Oahu attractions. The parking attendants were great. We went to them for advice on everything. Azul, the hotel restaurant was really good, but you have to make reservations. The pool was pretty crappy compared to other resorts we stayed at on our honeymoon. The whole resort area of Ko'olina is pretty cool and will probably be really nice when construction is finished (I'd give it 5 years). Overall, this would have been a decent hotel to stay at if the construction wasn't a secret and if they gave somewhat of a discount for the noise and inconvenience. We flew all the way to Hawaii from New Jersey to lay on a quiet beach on our honeymoon and couldn't get that at this hotel. The whole staff acted as if the construction didn't exist. Forgot to mention parking is $29 a day which is insane. At least compensate us for parking!

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: peiwei
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (with 2 kids 10 and 8) had so much fun stay at Ihilani hotel. Many review does not give good ratings, but we love this hotel especially our room with ocean view. The room were really big and so does the balcony. From our room 1509 we can see lagoon number 1. Kid love morning feeding ( for fish) that are in the lagoon. The hotel feels very empty to me but nice. The hotel pool was very small but pretty. We ate at the japense resturent down stair. It was ok compare to the one we had at Waikiki. Kids love the hotel and keep on telling me that they love to come back. For our family this location was better then waikiki. It is a little far away from everything but it is what we are here for. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Oahu!”
Reviews.Author: MandeMae
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled up in our rental car we were created with smiles and warm greetings. Everyone went above and beyond and genuinly cared about every guest and the experience they had while staying with them. After a trip to the North Shore we picked up a pineapple from a local vendor. Got back to our room and realised neither of us considered the fact that we didnt have a knife to cut it with! My boyfriend called down to the front desk and asked if we could borrow a knife... less than 5 minutes later a woman came up with a knife, plates and forks and even offered to show us how to cut the pineapple. AMAZING service! Gorgeous rooms, beyond pleasant staff and great food right on sight! Not a far drive from Waikiki, Pearl Harbor, the Dole Plantation or the North Shore. The JW Marriott Ihilani Resort and Spa will be seeing us again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “My husband and I stayed at the JW...”
Reviews.Author: pecantann
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the JW Marriott Oct 3-8 2010. Our overall impression is that it's a solid property that has a few flaws. Make sure you book an ocean view suite its the only way to go. Yes, the restaurants are expensive but most hotel restaurants are; there are nearby places to eat breakfast right outside of the hotel or drive into nearby Kapolei. The service was top notch from the staff and although the beach & lagoon was man made its an awesome breathtaking site. The rooms are clean and very comfortable, they may need to update some of the furnishings but by no means was it run down. The Disney resort construction is somewhat of an eye sore but like I said go oceanview and you wouldn't realize its there. I'm not a fan of Waikiki too many lines and crowds..This location hit the spot. It's simply picture perfect...

Reviews.Title: “Major Letdown”
Reviews.Author: Mystang101
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the JW, the first thing you see is the gigantic parking garage in front of the towers of the hotel. As stated in another review, the pigeon problem is major and shows in the off-color white of the hotel, and the area by what should be the amazing pond is covered in pigeon waste. While most of the pond was very nice, the part furthest from the lobby was covered in a murky film and bubbles. I'm not sure if that was a result of the JW's own renovations, and maybe they have not done much cleanup yet. I felt really bad for the fish that were in that area. Once in the room, looking outside over the deserted pool (3 people at 4pm) was disappointing. Most of what you saw was the construction of the Disney resort next door. I understand that all resorts are built at one point or another, but the lack of communication by JW was a bad move. All you heard in daylight hours was construction noise mixed with the sound of the waves, and that was also the very first thing you would hear at 7am. When I go on vacation, I expect to wake up later than I do at home, not earlier! Night time in the hot tub was probably the best part.. Oh but wait.. JW conveniently placed a bright white interrogation light on top of the hotel aiming right at the hot tub & the beach! There is NOTHING to do in the area. If there was no construction next door, and you were here to stay on property and relax, this was a good idea in the past. Here comes Disney, it won't be quiet anymore! Our trip began with 3 nights in Maui, and then off to Oahu. In the end, we were to stay at the JW for 5 nights, but we checked out after the first. When we checked out, I asked if this was common, and they said yes it was. There weren't very many people staying here to begin with, and a large portion of the JW was closed for it's own renovations. We moved to the Marriott Waikiki, and had a great time. There was nightlife, shopping, and a great beach as well. I highly recommend the Rumfire bar at the Sheraton on the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking ocean view”
Reviews.Author: pearlexi
Reviews.Content: I had a chance to stay at this hotel for my honeymoon and it was unforgettable! We booked an ocean view room and it was so breezy and we could hear the waves crashing from our hotel room. The buffet and smoothies are worth the money. Can't wait to come back one of these days.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Relaxing Paridise!”
Reviews.Author: KimfromPA
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 2nd Wedding Anniversary at Ihilani JW Marriott and loved it! We were upgraded to an Ocean View room and enjoyed our balcony overlooking the pool, lagoon, and ocean. Location: I have read reviews here stating the location is not good. I do not agree. The area is peaceful, grounds are beautiful, and views are spectacular. There are 4 lagoons- we swam in all of them but both agreed we liked the one right in front of the Ihilani the best. Crystal clear water, nice sand. We drove all over Oahu and swam at other beaches and ALWAYS liked returning back to the serenity of the JW Marriott lagoon. Waikiki beaches were dirty and ugly and full of homeless people. Ko Olina lagoons were all perfect, clean and not over-populated. There is no real nightlife, but we were there to relax. We had a rental car and took day trips to the Dole Pineapple Plantation, Northshore, Waikiki, Hanauma Bay Preserve, USS Arizona, Turtle Bay, and the Sacred Birthing Stones from Ihilani. At night, we had dinner and relaxed by pool. We are from the East Coast and there is a 6 hour time difference, so we were up early and went to bed by 10PM each evening. Activities: Pool is not huge, but was nice and had plenty of lounge chairs around it. The hotel always had fresh beach towels and ice cold water available at the towel stand. The pool bar was great (a little pricey, but it is a resort in Hawaii). I recommend trying a Mai Tai or Ihilani Dream served in a frozen pineapple. We swam every day in the pool and in the lagoon. We took a 4 hour snorkel trip from Ko Olina Marina which included a sightseeing boat ride up the coast, lunch, snorkeling, and a professional photographer on board who recording our trip on DVD ($45 for the DVD, but worth it). We also enjoyed snorkeling in the lagoon right in front of the hotel- the turtles are fun to see. We had our own snorkel gear, but you can rent gear at a stand on the beach and Ihilani guests get 1 hour of free gear per day. We also really enjoyed snorkeling in Hanauma Bay Preserve. We walked along the 3 mile paved path everyday. Watched sunsets from the rocks to the right of the hotel. One evening, we signed out Scrabble from the concierge. Food: We were very disappointed that Azul was not open the night of our anniversary. It's closed Sunday, Monday, and Tuesday due to low occupancy in the non-peak season. It looked like the perfect romantic restaurant. We ate at Roy's on the golf course instead. It was outstanding food, but not the same atmosphere Azul would have provided. We also enjoyed room service for breakfast 3 X. The staff set up the table on our balcony one morning for a tasty breakfast with wonderful view. The coffee shop in the lobby has great turkey and cheese croisants and we stopped there for a "breakfast to go" 2 mornings before heading out for an adventure. The restaurant next to the pool (forget the name) had average, all-day type of food. I enjoyed the appetizers better than the main course. We went to Kona Brewery at the bottom of the hill from Hanauma Bay Preserve and tried some Shrimp Scampi and rice from a shrimp truck in the Northshore region. Both were excellent. Room: Recieved a Platinum Rewards Member room upgrade to Ocean View room. All rooms have spacious balconies and most look to have nice views. The Mountain View rooms are probably the least desirable views. We could see the new Disney Vacation Club Hotel construction, but it didn't distract us. Our room was clean. The tub was stained just due to age, but it was clean. The carpet in our room was fine, the carpet in the hall way dated, but by no means bad. Shower stall was spacious, complimentary soap, shampoo and lotion delightful, and having 2 vanities with sinks was convenient. Parking: Yes, $30 a day is steep and I think it should be included with the cost of staying at the resort. The parking deck was very close to the hotel and it was easy to self park and walk. Luau: We went to Fia Fia held right on the lawn at the Ihilani. Lots of fun and entertainment with fabulous food. Well worth $90 a person. Hotel Staff: All were top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre on Every Level”
Reviews.Author: jlessner
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a short stay over the Labour Day weekend. Despite our mediocre stay with a few negatives, they were hardly enough to disrupt our enjoyment of Oahu. This property is simply fine, very little to complain about. That said, I think it needs to lose its ‘JW’ designation because it’s extremely misleading. There is no above-and-beyond service nor true luxury. If you’re after something ‘special’, book elsewhere. HOTEL PROS ·Large Rooms: The rooms have an entry area that opens into a very large sitting room/bedroom combo with floor to ceiling windows looking onto the huge, furnished terrace. ·Fantastic Bathrooms: Double vanities, giant spa tub, large glass shower, seperate toilet area. Exellent toiletries. ·Location: For us the location was perfect. It’s located in Ko Olina, a masterplanned gated community on the far south-west of Oahu. Far and away from the madness and tourists of Waikiki. However, it is at least a 30min drive, in good traffic, to Honolulu. NEGATIVES ·Pool: I came to Hawaii for the beaches so I didn’t understand why the pool was more crowded than the beach but regardless it was quite depressing. It’s simply an oversized circular pool with a flower painted along the bottom. Definitely not special. ·Parking: One of the largest disappointments is the $30/day charge for parking. This is simply absurd. Again, not very JW of them... ·Noise: By far the biggest downside for me was the construction right next door of the Disney resort. Obviously, the JW has no control over that but they should have a notice on their website. It was downright impossible to enjoy yourself on the beach with the noise of cranes, sirens, jackhammers and drills going all day long! ·The Beach: Although it’s great this resort is located right on the beach, this beach definitely wouldn’t win any ‘best of’ awards. The beach is entirely artifical and it shows. There are hardly any fish or marine life. It is encircled by cement/rock blocks and the water is far from clear. Not to mention the terrible quality of the free sun beds and the fact that they charge to use the shaded loungers!! ·The Staff: I cannot complain about nor compliment the hotels staff. Mostly because I barely had any exchanges with any of them. The check-in staff was friendly enough but after that we hardly spoke to anyone. Each morning we left and every evening we returned without a hello or good night or have a great day from anyone. Very disappointing! Overall, though the hotel wasn't terrible we wouldn't stay here again unless they lowered the rate to a level that reflects the quality of the hotel or they improve the property and its service to the JW standard I've become accustom to.

Reviews.Title: “Run-down, bad location, too expensive. Not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: mrrogertheshrubber
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days on business. Room had bugs in the bathroom and mold in the entryway. Room layout was nice but damn expensive. $30 a day for parking (valet or park yourself same price) is ridiculous. Breakfast buffet was good but also doesn't warrant $30 per person. Everything about this place was stupidly overpriced. Rooms are a little run-down. Room layout and features were good but disappointing condition. Cracked marble in the bathtub, super-cheap "sand-paper" toilet paper, bugs in the room, construction debris in the light fixture, and mold in the entryway. Any one of these is forgivable but not all in the same room. Nothing nearby to do or see within a 20 minute drive. Beach was great but any other beach on the island is probably the same. They pitched the timeshares pretty hard at us.

Reviews.Title: “You want paradise.... you have found it. This property is amazing.”
Reviews.Author: Austraveller2011
Reviews.Content: I am from Australia and for many months, I searched high and low for a property who could assist me with organising a marriage proposal to my long time girlfriend. From the very first phone call i made to the JW Marriott right until the last minute of my stay at this amazing property, every single staff member in this place went above and beyond to ensure that all of my expectations had been met. Not only that but it felt like they were family. The deluxe ocean view room had amazing views over the pool, the man made lagoon with the ocean as the back drop. It really just made you want to get up that little bit earlier in the morning to step out on the balcony and take in the breath taking sights. The room was very comfortable. Sleeping was great and though the rooms need a bit of a lift, in no way did we think to ourselves this room was dirty or tacky. The room was spotless, spacious and the two bath basins and mirrors come in handy. The gardens are well maintained and the entire property is clean and classy. The concierge organised a dinner next to the hammer head shark pond that is out the front of their trademark restaurant AZUL. Let me just say this, i had spent near four months organising an engagement ring, rang hotel after hotel looking for someone who would be willing to help me with this and let me tell you the moment i spoke to JW Marriott i did not need to look any further. The dinner they set up for my self and my now fiancee was nothing more than spectacular and the food was delicious. Then to top it off the level of service provided by the waiter was too good to be true. He played along with the whole proposal and went well and truly above and beyond to make the night that extra bit special. He even shouted us dessert at the end. People complain about parking prices and that the rooms are old etc, the little things such as these are well and truly made up by the greatest staff in the world. Believe me, I have travelled to asia, europe, dubai, the U.S main land, all around Australia, stayed in some of the best hotels the world has to offer and I myself have high expectations. Not only were all my expectations met, but the experience that the JW Marriott gave to myself and my fiancee was beyond our wildest dreams. We have already said we will return for our honey moon. THANK YOU FOR EVERYTHING JW MARRIOTT..... YOU GUYS ROCK!!! You want paradise..... this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK, expected more from a JW branded property”
Reviews.Author: aschremmer
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights for family reunion. Prior reviews were pretty accurate so i wasn't surprised by anything: slightly bedraggled conditions, construction next door, middle of nowhere, parking fees, absurdly expensive breakfast buffet etc. Never the less, there is just a ticky tacky vibe about the whole place that is unseemly for the usually top of class JW Marriott properties. Rooms weren't made up until late in afternoon, glasses and coffee mugs weren't replaced, minimal towels. Had to call for additional supplies every day, which were quickly brought up by very friendly staff. Lobby internet service required a different log in sheet every day. Was 'accidentally' charged for that connection and room connection, even though as a Marriott Platinum this is supposed to be a free benefit. Charges were reversed by very friendly staff. By no means awful, but certainly not great. Booked with Marriott rewards points, but between charges for roll away bed, parking, taxes and upcharge for non construction view our 'free' room cost about $ 200.00 / night, and that was before the $ 12.95 for a single cup of coffee and a bran muffin. TIP: There is a very nice ABC market across the street that has everything one would want, at just regular old Hawaiian expensive prices. Pool and beach were fine. Golf course was in nice shape, but also quite pricey. Next stop was Marriott Kauai Resort. The difference was like night and day.

Reviews.Title: “This is a 6-star hotel with flaws....”
Reviews.Author: NoDumbPeople
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1) Beautiful hotel - secluded, no noise 2) Smart people everywhere here 3) Wonderful, awe-inspiring rooms - almost suites 4) Management excellent! Cons: 1) Too much light in the morning. - something has to be done about the wooden shade doors. Way, way too much light in the morning - 6 am, bright light. Take a tip from the Soiftel Plaza - they removed all the wood doors and put the standard 2 curtains instead. I know it's a huge expense, but so many people love dark rooms in the morning. No other cons - this is a phenomenal hotel if you don't mind light coming in your room in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Fia Fia Luau was the Best!”
Reviews.Author: 808foodlover
Reviews.Content: I'm a local Kamaaina who stayed here the last week of August and wanted to tell you all first hand, that I had a great time! I had some concerns about some previous reviews but found that I had none of the previously mentioned bad experiences. I did notice the carpet on the 6th floor that was mentioned in Temple's July 19th review so out of curiosity, I asked one of the employees about it as they were passing by. They explained to me that the carpet is different in that particular area because they are testing the carpet for the hotels renovations which is scheduled to start in September/October. They also pointed out the light fixtures and room number signs are also different in that same area. I can't wait to see what the new rooms look like!

Reviews.Title: “I would never ever stay here again”
Reviews.Author: BigWash
Reviews.Content: This is my second posting! For some reason the first post was never posted. If you want to spend 29.00 to park your car and 12 dollars to use the internet. This hotel is the hotel for you! Not to mention, if you want to feel as if you are an intricate part of the Disney resort being built right next door, get one of their "mountain view" rooms. The construction noise starts are promptly every morning and it is ridiculous! The snobbish individuals at the front desk are no better. When I asked about the noise, I was basically told I got what i paid for. Then i was offered upgrades for an additional 50 -100 dollars a night. While I did finally get a nice one to help me after 7 days, the deed had been done. It was not the way I wanted to spend my last 10 days in Hawaii. They are purely about the all mighty dollar. If you are not a Marriott Rewards member, you are a second class citizen. This hotel is not for the common folk who expect value for their money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: ckdevane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriot Ihilani Resort 1 night as part of our honeymoon in Hawaii. The property was about 30-ish minutes (without traffic) from Waikiki but an easy drive on the interstate. The property is gorgeous - open air lobby, beautiful pool and beach area, walk-able to many shops and markets. Our room was very spacious (they upgraded up to an ocean view) with a private balcony that had a great view of the sunset. The bathrooms are very large too. Our only issue was the same as some of the other posts - the parking fee is very pricey, and we order 2 pina colada's at the poolside bar that came in pineapples, and our total was $26!! For 2 drinks - yikes! We walked across the street to a small taco shop for dinner to steer clear of additional heart attacks :-)

Reviews.Title: “A1 Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: autryp314
Reviews.Content: Extra over the top friendly staff. The valet, bellman, front desk, house cleaning went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. The hotel is within walking distance to Paradise Cove's Luau. My only gripe or complaint is that the price for valet parking and on-site parking is the same, $29.00 per day. Might as well valet. The valet staff ran to retrieve our car whenever needed.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best in Hawaii - atleast until they do the renovations”
Reviews.Author: NR1234
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Hawaii, this may not be the best hotel to choose right now, and here are the reasons: 1. The location: Hawaii has absolutely amazing beaches everywhere. And, there are plenty of places around them where you can find pretty much all conveniences. We found the location of this hotel to be rather inconvienient. First of all, the beach itself is manmade and that isn't really as pretty as many of the other beaches we went to. Second, there were very few restaurants around. The first night we arrived, we had to drive almost forty minutes for dinner to get some rather aweful food. I didn't help our cause, for sure, that we're vegetarians. However, we didn't have any such problems in other places we stayed at (Sheraton Maui or the hotels in Waikiki, Oahu). 2. The hotel is overdue for an upgrade. This is NOT JW / 5 star standard. The room we got was an upgaded one on a high floor and it had amazing views. It was also very roomy and airy. However, on the first glimpse, one could tell that this was a five star hotel probably in the 80s. Not now. There were signs of disrepair in the furniture and even the bathroom accessories (soaps that smelled 'soapy' in shiny golden tubes) were so 1980s. 3. And yes, like someone mentioned earlier, the 'industrial" view of the port was not exactly as breathtaking as several other sights in Hawaii. We came to this hotel after a week in Maui (Sheraton Maui) and two days in Waikiki. Sheraton Maui was a wonderful, scenic and not-too-crowded resort. Waikiki was all the crowd and noise and fun it is known to be. JW Ihiliani, unfortunately, was neither. We ended up moving to Courtyard Waikiki after one here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vacation”
Reviews.Author: mrspjr
Reviews.Content: My experienced in this hotel was the best, everything as expected, I will go back anytime, We loved the japanese retaurant, food was also perfect, and the view from our room was also fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “FIA FIA POLYNESIAN SHOW”
Reviews.Author: ciaolola
Reviews.Content: WOW! What an AWESOME FIA FIA EXPERIENCE last night! The food was the BEST EVER, the show is far by the BEST on this island! It captured the POLYNESIAN experience, they are all awesome showmen/women =) I walked out of that show with a BIG SMILE on my face, feeling like I just went to a broadway production, SERVICE WAS SUPERB and I will recommend this show all of my family and friends, as well as guests! I’m going to bring my family to see this soon!

Reviews.Title: “Quality exceeded reviews”
Reviews.Author: sctrgrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Ihilani and I honestly don't understand what some of the previous reviewers were talking about! This hotel is beautiful with very clean,comfortable rooms and attentive staff. The beach and the pool were never crowded even though the hotel was at 97% occupancy. I will say that if you are looking for nightlife, shopping and lots of dining choices this isn't the hotel for you, choose someplace in Waikiki. When I would come to Hawaii on vacation with my teenagers we would stay in Waikiki because they loved being in the heart of the action, but for this trip my husband and I wanted to relax and the Ihilani was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Ditto, I agree "this is not the quality of JW"”
Reviews.Author: temple123
Reviews.Content: I strongly agree with the July 7th review of this hotel. My wife and I stayed at this hotel at the first of June/10 for 8 nights. JW has ( or at least did) have a reputation of a quality 5 star hotel. We stayed at the JW in Cancun and that was like staying at a Presidental Palace, this hotel appears to have been (along time ago) an Embassy Hotel at one time. At least Embassy Hotels have plants hanging on the interior floors. This hotel is overall dirty and needs a new facelift. Example: I believe we stayed on the 6th floor and in that hallway there was a 5 by 20 ft patch of carpet that wasn't even close to the existing carpet. It was like "we need to repair this carpet so go down in the storage and just get any carpet to put here". If a hotel wants to paint everything white it should at least make sure it is clean, our room which overlooked the pool area, was very dirty, mold in shower also. Ceiling fan made noise so we didn't use that. Plant stand on balcony had plants that were on their last leg. The balcony overlooked the unimpressive pool which was in need of power wash. At check in we attempted to upgrade to a "quality ocean view" from "ocean view" but was informed this wasn't possible (even though not many vistors were staying there-IMO). This hotel was booked through Orbitz so perhaps that had something to do with it. We had a car rental and were forced to pay the daily $18 daily parking fee, By the way if you do stay here you do need a car, it is away from everything. Next door hotel construction (Disney) is on going, but I didn't think this is a problem, but it will when it opens. There are several Marriott time shares close by that can "share" this pool and they do. I can only stand so many "Daddy, daddy, watch me!!!" We only had one experience at the pool bar and the bartender was more interested in watching the television than waiting on their vistors. I just can't believe anyone would have a favorable opinion of this hotel and experience. I have come to the belief that the favorable reviews are from employees of the hotel (general manager to employees: "we're slow right now so go make some positive opinions about our hotel". OR that there are PR companies that post these opinions. This is the first time I have ever made a post, I felt it is a requirement to let people know about this place. Please don't stay here and don't use Orbitz. Based on how this hotel looked we only had one burger there, so I can't comment on the food. Marriott needs to replace their general manager here.

Reviews.Title: “I'm a NJ/NY person who is pretty fussy and this hotel was absolutely top-of-the-line!”
Reviews.Author: DeeGee525
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel, after reading many reviews from Trip Advisor. I took my family, my son, daughter-in-law, 2 grandchildren, one 19 and one 16...a little trepedation particularly the comments about the "noise due to construction next door". Well the exterior of that hotel is complete so there was no noise. For all of us, and we have been to quality hotels and top restaurants in NYC, this hotel, from EVERY aspect was as good as it gets. From the friendliness of the staff to the wonderful breakfasts (be sure to get breakfast included). I noticed, on other reviews, complaints about parking charges. ALL upscale hotels charge for parking (try San Francisco and check out those rates!)..I actually think that new hotel is a plus as it will offer additional restaurant choices within the area because if you stay a week, its eating either in the Ihilani or Roys (which we went to and was quite good but I didn't love the atmosphere).I would go back, as would my entire family, in a heartbeat. We also rented a car right from the Hertz desk in the hotel. We had made prior arrangements with the hotel concierge to have an SUV pick us up from Ko'Olina transportation and also took us back to airport. Worked out perfectly. Our flight was 2 hours late coming in from Newark, it was dark and we were tired but the car service was right there at baggage claim..everything worked perfectly! Kudos to this hotel..peaceful, beautiful, perfect..40 mins away from Waikiki but a different world.

Reviews.Title: “"JW" should be removed from the title, does not meet expectations of a JW Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: Les_Michelle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is older, out of date, with no special amenities! The pool is very small and boring. The hotel is at least 20 minutes from shopping and entertainment and does not provide transportation. There is a city bus but hotel did not share this info and instead suggested we pay private service $100 pp one way. Very disappointed in this hotel! Check around before you book here!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go to Hawaii to Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: fratspin
Reviews.Content: Half of my family lives in Honolulu, so I travel to Oahu and the other islands at least once, sometimes twice a year, and am very familiar with many hotels all over the islands. I have to say that this is by far my least favorite hotel in the state. I stayed here because it was the place chosen for a family reunion, so it wasn't my decision. There is absolutely nothing good about this hotel. It is not located anywhere near Waikiki or any other place you may want to visit. The beach is a man made lagoon that has nothing special about it. It is located near some docks that provide an excellent "industrial view" but don't expect anything near tropical. Furthermore, currently there is a massive construction project underway for a Disney hotel about 200 yards from the Ihilani, and once that is opened I am sure the experiece will only be that much worse. The food at the hotel was abosuletly inedible; and way over priced. I am not a cheap traveller and I generally don't complain about prices, but I have had better meals at a Denny's or a cheap Vegas buffet than what I was forced to eat every morning for a ridiculous $29. We did order room service breakfast 1 morning, which was equally as bad and somehow cost $190 for 4 people! Lunches and dinners were equally as disgusting. I think it is reasonable to expect that when you order fish at a restaurant in Hawaii that charges about $25-30 an entree that the fish would be at least fresh. However, the fish and other foods were always far from fresh, had horrible textures, and had clearly been frozen for quite sometime prior to being served. The rooms are a little worn down, and the air conditioning never seemed to really work. On several occasions I woke up in the middle of the night due to the heat and was unable to turn the AC back on, so I had to use a ceiling fan that rattled so much when on that the noise was unbearable. The pool is nothing special. It is just a big circle with a flower painted on the bottom of it. The Hot Tub is pretty basic, but one day it was unusable because the heater was broken and it was heated to about 110 degrees. Service was pretty bad, no one at the hotel has any desire to impress you or even attempt to earn a tip. Bellman and valet parkers will just sit around the main entrance rather than offer to park your car or take your bags, which is absurd. The ONLY decent thing about this hotel is the gym, tennis courts and somewhat decent basketball court. The BBall court has some sort of soft padding on it so its not entirely functionaly. I'd guess that reason why this hotel has good athletic facilities is that these are the reminance of when the NFL Pro Bowlers used to stay there. Overall, this hotel is horrible and is a terrible value. There are so many better options not just on Oahu but on all the other islands as well, so I cannot even begin to understand why someone would choose to stay at the Ihilani. (PS no WiFi here. Something I would expect from a "high-end" hotel.)

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: BruceB87
Reviews.Content: We had always traveled to Maui, but as we were planning a Thanksgiving trip, we decided to head for Ihilani on the advice of some friends. We didn't really want to do Waikiki, since we had our 6-year old daughter with us. What a wonderful hotel! We had a great view of the sunset, and it was perfectly quiet when you needed it to be (i.e., the weddings didn't bother us). Our favorite restaurant was Roy's, of course. We actually had Thanksgiving dinner at the hotel, and it was quite nice. Our daughter enjoyed the Keiki beach club for kids. Since it was out of season, it was only open two days or so, and was very uncrowded. The only complaint I would have is that the website does not include any information for children (specifically, the club). It would be helpful to have a schedule on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: the5millers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a few evenings here while on Oahu, and really enjoyed this hotel. It is isolated from the rest of the area, and it has its own beach. We originally wanted to stay on Waikiki, but our travel agent recommended this resort. We really have no complaints about this place. The staff, service, room, food, accommodations, etc... were all perfect! Every attention to detail was evident.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat guest”
Reviews.Author: Landgraf13
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Ihilani within the span of a year and I can't wait to go back. Not one bit of the hotel or the property disappointed. The food is amazing and the atmosphere is perfect. The only downfall of the hotel is also a bonus. If you're looking for something close to Waikiki this isn't for you. It's about a half ride by car but at the same time that's the great part. It keeps the place comfortably crowded and not overcrowded. The lagoons give you a great taste of the ocean without the rough surf and the big bonus there is that you can pretty much hear the ocean from any room in the hotel. We didn't sleep with the door closed a single night. The sushi restaurant is out of this world and the breakfast buffet (while a bit pricey) is worth every penny. Prices for everything seem pretty much on par with the rest of the island, however drinks are a little steep but the bartenders make sure each drink is worth it. The spa is one of the best around. I also highly recommend the stingray/shark encounter. It's an amazing experience and something not many places have. It's very informative and extremely hands on. The ambiance in every corner of the hotel is perfect for anyone looking to get away and especially for a romantic getaway. The atmosphere is rather quiet (very, very few children at the hotel - both times I've been there) which makes for a more relaxing trip. The rooms are very much well kept and very up to date. One inside tip I can give you is if you're like me and want to spend every possible minute at the beach and therefore take a red-eye back to the mainland, you still have a place to change/shower/freshen up, even after check-out. They have a few guest rooms which are set aside for that very reason. They're first-come first-served but if you ask about it the morning of your departure they'll help you schedule it. It's a regular room and just a great place to shower and get ready before you head to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the extra drive. We really enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Lumberdelt
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriot Ihilani may be an older hotel, but I didn't think it showed it's age a bit. The view from our Ocean View room was breathtaking. It overlooked the pool, private lagoon and the Pacific. They are building two other hotels next door, so it was a little noisy during the day. On the up side, the hotels aren't built yet so the Marriott still has the entire lagoon to itself. There were a lot of kids running around and the hotel was very family/kid friendly. The food can be pricey. There is a new ABC Store that is literally across the street that you can walk to in 2 minutes. I thought they had very reasonable prices on everything from souvenirs to food/liquor. Parking is $30 whether you park yourself in the garage or valet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: ATLCTC
Reviews.Content: This resort is located in the Ko'Olina resort area of southwest Oahu. It is ~ 20 miles from Honolulu/Waikiki. We enjoyed our stay at the hotel. Disney is building a large hotel on the property next to this hotel, so be aware that there can be construction noise when you are laying out at the lagoon.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your P's and Q's”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaTraveler350
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by stating that reviews done by the general public are not always going to reflect a level of accuracy for every individual who reads them. Meaning that people come from different backgrounds and what's posh and luxurious to Joe The Plumber may not be suitable for Joe Montana. It's always a matter of perspective of both the person writing the review and the person reading the review. I feel that a better way for these review sites to do a better job would be to try and match the reviewer and reader tastes in some manner but that's just my 2 cents worth. I'm neither poor nor rich, I'm probably classified middle to upper middle class more due to the fact that my wife and I have no kids and can afford to do things like take nice vacations, drive nice vehicles, and eat at nice restaurants. So we do both have to work hard for a living and I do make a point of watching where my dollars are spent, but by no means would I be considered a penny pincher. Unfortunately for JW Marriott Ihilani the bar had been raised considerably since we had stayed 5 nights on Maui at the Four Seasons prior to our stay at Ihilani. With that experience fresh in our minds, it was hard for Marriott to compare. Let me explain each of my ratings. The room was very clean and the maids kept it clean while remaining unobtrusive. I had no issue with the cleanliness. The location of the resort has it's benefits and it's drawbacks. The benefit is that you are away from Waikiki and Honolulu and all of that traffic and noise. The downside is that it's a long drive to Waikiki and Honolulu restaurants, night life and shopping. If your idea of vacation includes lots of Mai Tai's at lots of different bars, then you may want to consider Waikiki. The restaurants at the resort are ok. There is Naupaka Terrace which is where the daily breakfast buffet is usually served and they have informal lunch and dinner as well. We only ate the daily breakfast buffet there and the food was good, the omelets and waffles exceptionally so...thank you Byron and Ray! We had eaten at Azul, the upscale restaurant at the resort, and Ushio Tei, the Japanese restaurant at the resort on previous trips and left both restaurants unimpressed so we had no intentions of eating at either of them on this trip. There is Roy's restaurant nearby at the golf course which we had dined at previously and had great meals so we had dinner there 2 of the 4 nights we were at the hotel and were not disappointed. The rooms are large and spacious, ours was an ocean view room at the end of the hotel on the 11th floor. We had a beautiful unobstructed view of the ocean out our sliding glass door. I had requested a room away from the pool since I didn't want to hear a lot of pool noise. However what I did have was a lot of noise from next door at Paradise Cove and their Luau and some wedding reception parties. That all ended early enough so as not to affect our ability to sleep. The rooms still have the older tube type tv's, no flat panels here and a limited number of channels. In room movies start at $12.99. The bed was very comfortable. This leaves Value and Service. I booked an Aloha Promotional Package code PRO on the Marriott website. This package included an ocean view room, breakfast for 2 daily, free internet daily, and 4th night free (website says 4th night will be credited at checkout) at a rate of $299 per night. So basically my 4 nights was going to cost me $897 plus tax and parking fees etc. Of course I was surprised when I had the express checkout slip under the door to see that I was being charged for all 4 nights. Well I wasn't really surprised, I was half expecting it because the very same thing happened to me before at this property 3 years ago. It almost seems as if they want you to get all caught up in the enjoyment of your vacation and then hectic morning of getting packed and to the airport that they hope you miss their "mistake." So IF you get a package deal, the value CAN be good. But IF you pay rack rates, you're would NOT be getting a good value in my estimation. Thus "Watch your P's & Q's. Keep an eye on what you're being charged here and make sure that you're getting everything you are supposed to get. And THAT kind of puts on one the defensive while on vacation and doesn't make it easy for you to relax if you're constantly having to worry about how you may be being taken advantage of. So while they fixed the billing problem when I brought it to their attention... that doesn't negate the fact that I had a $299 billing problem and had to bring it to their attention to begin with. It makes me wonder if they were truly sorry or just sorry they got caught with their hand in my wallet. I can't say that I'd recommend it to a friend because I don't know that I'd recommend it to myself to return. With Disney scheduled to open in the near future I can envision the lagoons filled with squealing kids. IF quiet and away from Waikiki is what I want next time I may give Turtle Bay or Kahala a try. If I'm willing to brave Waikiki maybe the Halekulani. After my stay I recieved an email request from Marriott that I fill out a survey form....I will now include a copy of my written survey response to Marriott............................... I booked a 4th night free package inclusive of breakfast, high speed internet, and a commemorative coin. Because of the many package options available to be booked via the website it can become very time consuming to determine which particular package provides the best value for possible travel dates. The morning of my checkout an express checkout slip had been placed under my door and did not reflect the 4th night free as being credited to the account. The website said the 4th night free would be adjusted at checkout. So this meant that I had to go to the front desk and request the adjustment be made which was an inconvenience. It would seem to me that the Marriott billing system would recognize what promotional packages people have booked and adjust the billings automatically. I guess it's too bad I don't live in a perfect world. I figured that while I was already at the front desk wasting my time, I would go ahead and ask for my "commemorative coin" since I did not receive it at check-in and was surprised to receive a "Hawaii state quarter." Better than a sharp stick in the eye I suppose. As I mentioned previously the package included breakfast daily for 2. When I checked in I was given a card upon which is said that we would receive "American" breakfast buffet for two daily and that it was valued at $40 and included an 18% gratuity. Well this left me to question what exactly this was to pay for. The buffet prices are two tiered at this resort.
