First there is the "cold" breakfast items only which has a price of something like $16 per person and then there is the "hot" full breakfast buffet priced at $25 per person. There was no "american" buffet or breakfast or anything listed on the menu. Simple math tells me that 2 x $25 is $50 per person which is $10 more than what my voucher was supposedly good for. So when I first went to the buffet I told my server that we were on the breakfast package, showed him the voucher that said the value was up to $40 and pointed out that the hot buffet price was $50 and asked him what I was entitled to. He said that he understood my confusion but all he knew was that everyone on the breakfast plan got the full hot buffet at the $25 value, which was fine with me. So after the first breakfast we had I got the receipt and it was billed to my room for $53 or so. The second day I got the receipt and it was a $0 balance and I filled out my room information and signed it. The third day it was the $53 or so again. (Now I'm confused if the breakfast is supposed to be charged to the room then deleted at checkout or not charged at all in the first place) This all just illustrates that nobody seems to know what's what as far as your packages are concerned. It almost seems that it's Marriott's goal to create this air of confusion on purpose. Maybe the front desk clerk was wrong in writing the $40 value amount in? The promotional code on the website simply says free breakfast daily, it doesn't specify a dollar amount or what exactly that breakfast entails...i.e. hot, cold, or a croissant and glass of juice. I'm not complaining because I was underfed or don't feel that I got what I paid for....I'm complaining because of all of the confusion. Why put the paying customer in a position where they have to ask for clarification only to show that your staff at the hotel and/or restaurant is just as unsure as the customer? Simplify things, nobody wants to be left to wonder about the details. Having stayed at this property before, I knew of the breakfast buffet because I've had packages that have included it. It didn't occur to me that there were different levels of buffets, and our last day, Sunday it got even more confusing with items on the buffet labeled as "brunch." My final bill did reflect all of the charges from the restaurant had been removed so I'm not complaining about that. This was my third stay at this property and a few things that shows a decline in service and amenities caught my attention. Previously the coffee lounge/pastry bar downstairs provided free Illy coffee. I think that was due to the fact that there were no coffee makers in the rooms at that time. Now there are coffee makers in the room, but really, nobody wants in the room coffee because water from the tap just doesn't taste right and the coffee is weak for the amount in the packets etc. Anyway I went down the first morning to get coffee from the pastry bar area only to find that the coffee was no longer free and was going to cost me over $8 for 2 large coffees....double what Starbucks charges. You have always charged for parking but I think $29 per night is quite excessive. We stayed 5 nights at the Four Seasons on Maui before coming to Ihilani and they only charged $20 per night to park. I can assure you that nothing about your property is as nice as what the Four Seasons Maui offers, not even your parking. It's almost as if you are isolated on a side of the island away from any other hotels with a captive audience and you are taking full advantage of it. Of course while the valet guy is getting my car I'm gritting my teeth because I'm already paying $29 per night and now I've got to tip this guy on top of it...the $29 per night just isn't enough is it? You would think that with all the cars parking there at $29 per night that you could afford to power wash the bird feces off of the tinted glass covering over the waiting area by valet. Or maybe clean the soot stains from the portico where the torches are. Not to mention the bird feces all over the windows by the elevators. And $13.95 per day for internet usage!?!?! I'm glad my package included free internet. Look you don't even have wireless internet in the rooms and your internet was rather slow. There used to be flowers and leis in the lobby for the women, there were none this time. The Naupaka Terrace was closed for breakfast 3 out of the 4 days we were there and the breakfast had been relocated to Azul. This venue doesn't seem to be large enough to accommodate all of the guests and it seemed that tables and chairs had been thrown in there with seats halfway sticking out into walk paths. What I didn't understand is how could Naupaka Terrace be open for dinner but not breakfast? It was just a minor inconvenience. I thought it was a nice touch to set up a timeshare stand at the steps from the pool leading down to the path the lagoons. This gave us a nice opportunity to be hassled by one of your timeshare people who wouldn't take "no" for an answer on our "restful" vacation. There seemed to be a lot fewer staff working at the hotel. The shops hours had changed and were less convenient. But you know all of these things, they were all conscious decisions on your managements part. I just didn't want you to think any of it went unnoticed. These reasons are why I feel that when I come to your property I'm being nickled and dimed at every opportunity, and I have to watch you like a hawk to ensure that I am not being taken advantage of and am getting what I paid for. I mean had I not caught the $299 error on the free night not being credited to my account on checkout would I have gotten a phone call from you expressing how sorry you were that I had overpaid? Was it an oversight on your part? I tend to doubt it because it's not the first time I've had issue with one of your packages and the price charged at checkout. Throw in some Disney and some lagoons full of screaming kids and urine and I seriously doubt I'll be back. I do want to thank you for sending me this survey in a timely manner so I could respond while these issues were still fresh in my mind. I think I'll go ahead and post a copy of this survey response on the trip advisor website as well to help others make informed decisions. Thank you for your concern.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: JimNColleyville_TX
Reviews.Content: The entire staff of this hotel deserves recognition for their outstanding service. The valet team was both friendly and knowlegeable of the area and offered many other tips about the island. All the restaurants were great and the breakfast buffet, typical Marriott is even better on Oahu. The hotel is poll just the right size and the beach area very safe and sheltered for swimmers of all ages and skills. Rooms are modern, tastefully decorated and the bathrooms are large. Perfect location to watch the sunsets, take beach or path walks to the Marriott K'Olina timeshare facility and it's only 30 minutes from Honululu airport. The free shuttle service takes you to Roy's, Chuck's Steak house and the Timeshare's beachside bar for great drinks, pupus and watching the sunset. My only criticism is the steep $29/day parking fee for both self or valet parking. Definitely recommended and will make it a must on our next trip to Oahu

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon Hotel - Pure Bliss!”
Reviews.Author: Travels57
Reviews.Content: We stayed the first 4 nights of our honeymoon at the JW Marriott and loved it! This hotel is amazing. Very pretty and the rooms & bathroom are huge and very comfortable. We stayed in a Deluxe Oceanfront room and loved it. The lanai was amazing (great size) and the sunset views were awesome. When we arrived, they had champagne and strawberries waiting in our room - very nice touch! The staff was wonderful. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Oahu - it's the best. The location is far away from the crazy crowds and traffic of Waikiki. It's nestled into it's own private part of the island it seems. There is some construction noise from the resort being built next door, but we hardly noticed it. If you plan early morning activities, the hotel's location can be hard - just plan to get up early because Oahu does has traffic in the mornings. We never had a problem - always got everywhere we needed to go in plenty of time. The poolside restaurant at the hotel is wonderful - great food and ocean views. The grounds are amazing and the multiple lagoons are so nice. It's never overcrowded with kids or families. Stay here for a relaxing time on Oahu!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, here are some facts”
Reviews.Author: Squirm
Reviews.Content: I'm just your typical person, while I'm not easily impressed, I'm not hard to impress either. There seems to be some confusion on what this hotel provides. I just spent three nights there. Overall I loved the place. You can't go wrong with the rooms, they are big and the balconies are huge and great where most of them overlook the pool/lagoon area. The hotel DOES provide a mini fridge and a coffee maker. From reading past reviews I was under the impression these were not provided. There is also valet parking, but you can self park and avoid having to pay a tip, but there is a daily parking fee of $30. Yes, the pool is small, but the lagoon is great. There is another small lagoon just north, but it rocky. The restaurants are somewhat pricey but the food and service was great. I would rate this place a 4.5 star if there was a choice. 5 star seems a bit much. I would stay here again, if I ever visit Oahu again.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful!!!”
Reviews.Author: romos23
Reviews.Content: Was hesistant after reading some reviews, BUT were very pleasantly pleased. Yes, it is on the quiet side of the island, yes, disney resort next door being built, yes paradise cove luau next door, BUT who cares. If you want a beautiful resort, with beautiful service, beautiful scenery, this is the place. Also, during the month we were there, NO rain, not even in the morning. Met people at the airport who told me it rained everyday on the islands they were on, even some on Oahua(where resort is located). Our four(short days) were filled with wonderful memories thanks to the hotel. The staff is courteous, but not intrusive, and will help with any questions you have. Hey, if a little noise next door is going to ruin your vacation, then don't stay here until the disney resort is done, BUT you hardly hear it. I think if someone wants to find a problem they will, otherwise, for some beauty and relaxation this is the place for you. Also, don't forget, if you want some action Waikiki is only 20-25 minutes away. North short drive is about 45, but with all the stops on the way it feels like 10. Make sure to hit locals like Giovanni's shrimp truck, Dole plantation, and Halewa Joe's for seafood. Definately will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place! But bring a padded wallet...”
Reviews.Author: soosyq
Reviews.Content: This place is a visual stunner. Service is outstanding and the grounds/scenery to match. These rooms have it all...marble, floor to ceiling windows, some of the best beds in the world and gorgeous furnished lanais. One gets the feeling the room charge is helping to pay for the all the marble and the beautiful KOI ponds throughout the property complete with stingrays, hammerheads and tropical fish. Lots of gorgeous art/sculptures here too! Nice pool with the lounge chairs, umbrellas etc. If you need these things be prepared to pay. Everything costs. Floating type device to use in the private lagoon (which by the way is beautiful) cost 18 dollars an hour! And of course there is the incessant obligatory tipping that comes with it...you get the picture. Right next door Disney is building a resort making this not so quiet or so private. Next to that is the Marriott resorts and timeshares. There are 4(?) lagoons and they did not seem too crowded at all. Very nice beach time! Lots of families of course. As with any hotel of this caliber, when you need to eat you have some on site options and be sure the bank account is padded. Hard to justify those prices for food thats is on some sort of bird sized portion control, but thats the way it goes. You can be trapped there with no other choices if you did not rent a vehicle. No free internet/Wi-FI. When I used the business center and some charges were incorrect, I was informed that it is not staffed on the weekends and there really wasn't anything they could do. Was a bit dissapointed with the inability to find peace or silence (however not the hotels fault)...I thought it would be quiet/resort like due to it's location away from hustle and bustle. Some things you might want to know if this is your thinking as well...There is a very popular Luau that takes place nightly a parking lot away. Attended this Luau and was fun indeed, but more like a show with Luau type food. Not too authentic and PRICEYYYYY! You could easily hear this noise resonating throughout the exterior of the hotel each and every evening. Also, hidden in the bushes in the back of the hotel right on the water is a makeshift "campground". This campground also has a stage setup of some sort where Saturday and Sunday evenings included a DJ or extremely LOUD top 40/techno/hard rock music blasting over any peaceful "ocean sounds" with many "woohoos" from the crowd. I did notice this all ended at 10pm however so there must be some rule there. As my room faced this campground I was able to witness the campers climb through the bushes to enter the hotel and use the bathrooms and such as well. From our lanai you heard tropical birds sing and our room had a breathtaking view of the ocean and grounds to the left. To the right, a massive parking lot stretching over to the Paradise Cove Luau where many buses deliver people during the evening. Too bad this is the location. Once at the resort without a car, be forewarned about transportation here...Taxis charge 70 - 80 dollars one way not including tip to airport. Our ride was 15 minutes for about 13 miles. Car service from hotel could offer the ride for 96 dollars. Hertz is the only onsite car rental option and charges 37 a day if you can return to car to the exact hotel location. When I inquired about drop off at the airport the price became a " off site drop off" price of 116 dollars. Overall - a beautiful hotel but there are better options with better amenities.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING - Service, Amenities, Facilities - all PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: MzAPortland
Reviews.Content: There just aren't enough good adjectives out there to describe this hotel. The ONLY 'negative' is the traffic you may encounter getting there. But trust me - being at this beautiful resort, on the quiet side of the island, away from the craziness of Waikiki? Totally worth every second spent on the H-1. I'd like to single out a staff person or 2 - but I can't. They were simply all wonderfull. From check-in, to housekeeping (thanks for all the extra coffees & towels!!), to maintenance, to valet, to poolside & restaraunts, to the spa, to the concierge - - everyone we encountered was friendly, helpful, informative, and most of all, effiecient. Our ocean view room was huge, comfy, and best of all, really DID have a full ocean view! We were offered an upgrade to a Jr Suite at check-in and they allowed us to view both rooms before making a decision. Turns out, for us, there was no need. The Jr Suite we looked at was directly over the pool....great for some folks, but we were happier with our original reservation. The standard rooms are HUGE already, and our originally booked room was directly above the fish/ray ponds and waterfalls looking at nothing but trees and ocean from the balcony. So relaxing to start the day with a cup of coffee and that view. Room service was FAST, yummy, and average pricing (we all know you pay more for room service, right?).... had both breakfasts and a dinner - all perfect. The Sunset Grill was wonderful for dinner although not as impressive for lunch. The Poolside Bar & Grill however was the best of the bunch. Some wait time for service, so be patient - but the menu for lunch was a bit better than the Sunset Grill and you get the benefit of being at the beautiful pool with view of the private lagoon. Oh, their 'tropical' cocktails come in a frozen pineapple. A pretty gimick - but be warned, they start leaking when they thaw and get very sticky. We learned after the first drink to ask for ours in a regular glass. Drink prices are a bit on the high side - but again, as with room service, its a poolside bar on Oahu....... you're going to pay the premium. Housekeeping had some issues restocking washcloths and towels, but one quick call and 'POOF' extras were delivered almost before you could hang up the phone. The spa is beautiful, and pricey (of course). Massages were great after the long travel day getting to the islands. Note that for this location you will absolutely NEED a car for your trip - most attraction shuttles do not come out to Ko Olina and there are stores and restaurants just one exit up the highway where you can eat cheaper or stock up on room munchies and beverages to save some $$ too. Or, if you didn't pack enough clothes or swimsuits there's a Ross and a Target where you can fix that right up! All in all, we just returned home last night and I'm already trying to figure out when we can go back! Thanks all at the JW Marriott @ Ko Olina - you made our Hawaiian vacation everything it should be!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: erik35ftl
Reviews.Content: What can I say??The JW Marriott Ihilani Resort and Spa is beautiful The rooms are ***** Stupendous!!!!!!! ocean and cove views from our 2 floor to ceiling glassed in lanais! Gorgeous Marble bathroom with soaking tub and seperate shower. Staff was amazing!! property is a self contained piece of paradise!! I can't wait to go back. My mother had a massage in the spa Tennis courts with mountain and ocean views Stingrays and hammerhead sharks in pools It just goes on Simply said breath taking

Reviews.Title: “Would I stay again? You bet!!!”
Reviews.Author: dastagg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the second time. Once in 2005 and again in 2010 for an anniversary vacation. The resort was great. The beaches on the lagoon are great for swimming, even kids as it is protected from the open ocean. The rooms are very large and bathrooms are super sized. Has large bathtub and a separate shower with double sinks. No kitchen or microwave as I'm sure they want you to eat at their facilities which are quite expensive. We ate just down the road at many different resteraunts which are much better priced, just have to drive a few miles. The balcony was nice sized with a table and two chairs which is nice to sit and watch the ocean. We had a ocean front view which means you are at one of the sides that partially face the ocean and if you want a full ocean view, you need a delux ocean front room but we were more than satisfied with our regular ocean front views. The waitress at the bar and grill by the pool is super nice and remembered us from a prior trip 5 years earlier. Super lady. Since this hotel is way on the west end of Oahu, it is very secluded from the traffic or hustle and bustle of Honolulu, which is what makes this a great place to stay. After just driving around Honolulu, I am so happy we stayed away from the area and stayed at the Ihilani Resort on the West End of the island as it is not too far a drive from the rest of the things to do. The parking is rediculously priced at $29 per day and is self parking or by valet. No free internet in the rooms either. For the prices paid to stay at thsi hotel, both above should be included but overall, I will be back the next time I go to Hawaii. Bed was super comfortable and super clean. My wife dropped something that went under the bed and found a folded card stating "thanks for looking under the bed and noticing how clean it was under the bed". It was clean. Most beautiful sunsets are available at this hotel since it is on the West side that can be seen anywhere. No distant mountains or land to interfere with the super sunset views. Absolutely beautiful. Area seems to be building up however with more Marriott resorts which are already in place, but Disney is building a couple of resorts next door which I hope doesn't interfere or overpopulate the resorts lagoons which this lagoon will be used with the Disney resorts and are not crowded now, but not sure after these new resorts are finished.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience but worth noting both positives and negatives”
Reviews.Author: galaxyplumber
Reviews.Content: Positives: Location was fabulous; great food all around; pool and lagoon were very nice; proximity to beach/lagoon was just down the steps from the pool; room was spacious and clean with beautiful linens; beautiful lanai/balcony overlooking the pool and lagoon; landscaping is well maintained; one of the best sunsets from the beach on Oahu. The staff handled the tsunami crisis in an excellent manner. Negatives: Parking onsite was $39 a day.. No coffee maker in room and was told that there were limited coffee makers available; one was delivered to our room eventually; as a Platimum Elite member with 1.1 million Marriott points, they would not waive the pricey daily internet fee of $13.95. Although the website warned of renovations of a nearby property, construction next door was extremely close and noisy with cranes and trucks beeping and grinding from 7;30-4;30pm mon-fri, it was really bad for any morning sleepers. If you have an early AM flight, leave very early as the traffic on the H-1 is horrible and may take up to 2 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back soon!”
Reviews.Author: windfair
Reviews.Content: We recently spent several weeks in Hawaii on different islands and this hotel was one of our absolute favorites! The service was exceptional. Our room was spotless and overlooked the ocean. We frequently left the doors to the lanai open to listen to the surf and watch the sunset. Our maid came in several times a day to freshen up the huge bathroom, provide additional towels, etc. Everyone at the front desk was also helpful and friendly. The room was extremely spacious and included a foyer, a sitting area, in addition to a desk. There was a safe and refrigerator in the room also. Food was expensive on the resort, but we did eat at the nearby Kolohe's Beach Bar & Grill at Ko'Olina Beach Club. There was free entertainment and if you arrived before sunset it would be an excellent place to watch the sun go down. The food was good and the prices reasonable considering the location. There is construction going on next door, but not on weekends or holidays. On the days we were there while they were working, we closed the lanai doors and it was like nothing was going on outside. I used the lap pool and hot tub several times. The pool was not crowded and always clean. Towels were provided and the people who worked at the spa and fitness center were also very friendly and helpful. It was very pleasant to walk around the lagoons in the early morning and evenings. A great place to go if you enjoy peace and quiet! I liked it better than the hustle and bustle of the more popular Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Another great vacation”
Reviews.Author: champ27
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days at the JW Marriott Feb 12-22 and had a fantastic time. This was our second vacation at the same hotel (last visit was July 2008). This time we travelled with another family with young children, and we all enjoyed our stay. Location is beautiful - runs along the paths beside the lagoons were a treat. We used our car every day - Target & Costco are closeby and convenient for water, snacks, and even cereal/milk if you want to have breakfast in the room. Free coffee in the lobby is excellent. Premium Outlets are within 15 minutes. We are not sure how the massive Disney hotel next door will impact the gorgeous beaches in the future. For now, this is a beautiful, quiet location - great for families.

Reviews.Title: “Flies, dirty, horrible food, and bad staffing - SKIP THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: BriefBoy
Reviews.Content: Located at least 20 minutes from HNL this hotel is the pits.. 7 miles to closest food / shopping. Rooms and common areas are filthy, staff doesn't care when you express concerns, rooms was filthy upon check in, carpets soiled and tub stained. Water is so "hard" it makes your skin itch and and showers look awful. They constantly trying to sell you a time share at this place

Reviews.Title: “great beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: Dorothy w
Reviews.Content: The management and staff went out of their way to make our stay memorable. There were a few problems with respect to our suite but management responded immediately and fixed some of our concerns. The views from our room were spectacular and we enjoyed the close proximity to the ocean. Apparently the hotel will undergo a major room renovation project during 2010. This is needed. Once done this hotel will deserve a 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil Paradise”
Reviews.Author: kristy123
Reviews.Content: Really is a bit pricey but if you have the extra dough it's worth it. Stayed for 7 nights. Had a great ocean view room on the 11th floor. We did not eat at the hotel. Would recommend driving your rental car (you do need a car because it's about 20 min drive from airport) back towards the airport to the first exit, Kapolei, and hitting the Target for liquor and snacks. Aloha Salads in the same shopping center is a great place for salads, the Costco across the street has amazing ahi-poke (seriously), get there before noon and head for the back by the prepared food. Outback Steakhouse is across the street as well as a Starbucks & a movie theatre. Back to the hotel......seems to be a lot of older folks there. The lagoons are the best! Great place to relax or walk along the rocks and check out the tropical fish. The surrounding neighborhood is beautiful. Disney hotel is being built across the street so a bit of construction noise. Overall, love our stay. Staff is very friendly. P.S. the business center is expensive. I think we paid $15 to use the computer to print our boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a peaceful tropical paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Leemay46
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ihilani for our 30th anniversary in April 2008. I have to say it was the BEST vacation we have ever had. From the super friendly staff, to the wonderful food and the beautiful surroundings, it was just perfect. I would recommend this hotel to everyone who wishes to visit Hawaii and explore the island of Oahu. It was the perfect location (just about 20-25 min. from Honolulu). We could quickly get to the North Shore (which we did 3 times) or to Honolulu for shopping and dining. The grounds are gorgeous, with 4 man-made lagoons along the shoreline. We walked the beautiful path along the lagoons every morning and at sunset we made our way back to the small beach just off the property to get that perfect sunset photo. I cannot say enough about the friendly and helpful staff. I actually commented to my husband that everyone who worked there always had a smile on their face. When we arrived, we were given a choice of rooms and the receptionist encouraged us to visit the 2 rooms and decide which one we wanted! Our view was unbelieveable, overlooking the pool, first lagoon, and ocean beyond. It was heaven on earth. I will not hesitate to stay here again, in fact, I wish we could make it a yearly visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay but he parking fees and condo sales push were too much”
Reviews.Author: packedandready2go
Reviews.Content: First let me explain the reason why I gave the Ihilani only one star. I believe it deserves three stars but I have automatically dropped two stars from the rating because of their obnoxious $29/night parking fee. There was construction on the adjacent property.On the plus side the room was spacious and well laid out. The staff was friendly as well. The man made lagoons -the coral reef was dynamited to construct them - are good for swimming. The beach was lacking adequate shaded areas. I have been told that the massive adjacent construction project is going to be a Disneyland hotel. As this will front the same medium sized beach as the Ihilani caveat emptor if making reservations for the future.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: StephanieQuarles
Reviews.Content: AWESOME! Staff was very helpful and the hotel was amazing! The only thing I didnt like was that they charge for internet use :/ Other than that the food and stay was great!

Reviews.Title: “Good Resort - But Nothing Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: toga1k
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for 3 nights as I came here to attend a conference. As a resort there is nothing wrong with this place. The service was prompt with friendly staff. The first room we got was on the 19th floor in the main building but had quite a number of bugs flying around due to previous guests or the cleaning staff not closing the screen door. So the front desk gave us another room which is in the annex (the 3 floor structure closer to the ocean). The room looked kind of old. To be more specific it seemed like they did put in some new furnishings but the overall room ambiance just felt rather 80'sh. Well I guess the whole building structure was designed during that time period so can't really expect more on that point. The bathroom was very large though, with dual sinks which we like very much. There are quite a few man-made lagoons nearby which you can swim in. There are walking/jogging trails as well that take you to the marina. There is Paradise Cove Luau about 15 min. walking distance away which you can go to for that "Hawaiian" experience. We did, and actually it was not bad as we took quite a bit of nice photos there. Well, just do not expect decent food there. One gripe at the resort is I wish someone would police the lounge chair squatters around the pool. At 8am these squatters came out to "possess" the chairs all day. Incredible! Overall the atmosphere in and around this resort is quite relaxing which is what one would expect in a resort, right?

Reviews.Title: “Vacation Excellence”
Reviews.Author: francrob
Reviews.Content: This resort even though far away from most attractions on Oahu was very pleasurable! The views from our room were totally fantastic! The room itself was to die for as well as the service! I couldn't have asked for a better vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Nice upscale JW Marriott with good staff out of the way location”
Reviews.Author: gooddeal333
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Thanksgiving and were given an upgrade as soon as we arrived. We got a suite with a private jacuzzi. I was a little owrried about noise but the rrom was great with a HUGH bathroom and the room once the door to the patio was closed noise was no longer an issue. What a great romantic stay! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BradyM4
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love the hotel! Can't wait to go back! It is paradise there, and much more private than downtown Waikiki

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hotel and the isolated beach is excellent.”
Reviews.Author: quasar4
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Ihilani and I would recommend staying here, if only for a few days, to escape busy Waikiki. The room I got was spacious, but I absolutely loved the bathroom. I'm a big bathroom person and the bathroom is absolutely huge! There is a stand-in glass shower plus a tub to soak in after a day in the sun. My only complaints about the room are that the TV was not a flat-screen (LCD) and the small fridge did not keep cold. For a hotel of this caliber, I would expect a small investment in a modern television set would be in order. The beach is great!! It is well groomed and clean. The hotel provides you with beach chairs and towels. The water is calm and there are no rocks or other debris on the sea floor. Swimming is great and I got to see fish underwater as well, which caught me by surprise. Try the Hawaiian pizza! The pineapple is just too good. There is one annoyance that I did not appreciate, although I was aware of it from another review on the site: they really want you to attend their information session about timeshares or condos at the Ihilani. When you first arrive there, the frontdesk tries to get you to attend by offering you discounts to there restaurants. When you get into you room, there is a card on your bed AND your night table offering more of the same. In the evening, someone calls you to remind you about their session. It was annoying. I think they even tried to call me the next day, but I did not even bother to answer the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel for Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: nikkilaura2003
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights for the second half of our honeymoon. We chose this resort for relaxation after 5 nights in Waikiki. It was beautiful, spacious, and quiet. The Naupaka Terrace restaurant is great for breakfast, we chose to eat outside near the shark pond. We had lunch a couple times at the pool bar, and they have delicious frozen drinks that come in a frozen pineapple there. We loved lounging at the pool, it was never too crowded. The lagoon was beautiful and warm with soft sand, great for swimming and relaxing. The resort has a free shuttle to a couple places in Ko Olina, including the neighboring Marriott vacation club. We took the shuttle there one night for dinner, and walked around the resort. Our room was beautiful and spacious, the bathroom was huge and I loved having 2 sinks, and the toilet had its own little room. We had a refrigerator which was nice also. There is a beach behind the resort that is kind of hidden, take a walk around the backside of the resort towards the water, it is gorgeous. Would definitely stay here again, it was a nice, relaxing way to end our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “All time favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jassini
Reviews.Content: The room at the Ihilani was the most beautiful hotel room I have ever seen. The grounds were like walking through heaven and the Spa was to die for. Had a wonderful time at the Ihilani.

Reviews.Title: “FUN!”
Reviews.Author: LebanonLittle
Reviews.Content: the hotel is really nice and cozy the only issue is its far from central city and downtown

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mizzou420
Reviews.Content: hey yall, if you take a trip to hawaii make sure you stay at the jw. its a bit out of the way but well worth it. the entire staff are friendly and courteous. they have a golf course across the street, a louau on property with real firedancers ! even a boat harbor that has fishing charters. henry the parking valete got me upgraded to room 420 he was awesome! the pool is over looking the beach very tropical. also 3 beachs to choose from all within walking distance. overall a great hotel with lots of perks

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, def one of the best on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyPirate
Reviews.Content: If you're set on staying on Oahu, but want the relaxing atmosphere of the other islands, I'd recommend this place. Neither the pool nor the beach was ever crowded. There were a few more kids running around than I expected, but that didn't take away from it. Staff and service were excellent. They were out of king beds so upgraded us to a ocean view suite at no charge. Yes, the parking charge is little crazy and you can get away without a car if you are the type of person to do more laying on the beach than touring the island. The marina is within walking distance and has a small convenience store. Also, a 5 min drive down the road are a whole bunch of restaurants, shops, and a good grocery store. So, I wouldn't say the place is in the middle of no where exactly. Oh ya, the parking deck is 20 feet from the hotel, no need to use valet if you want to save a few bucks on that. The food was decent. The Saturday night seafood buffet for $45 was reasonable. We had lunch and even dinner a few times at the pool bar/restaurant. It's pretty good for a salad or cheeseburger. One of the best surprises that a beer was only $5. :-) One finale note. The construction is right next door and a little behind the hotel, but it is right there. For a construction site, it's not that noisy, but you will hear it if you are outside. It's not awful and considering the discount on the rooms, I'd still say it is worth the stay! It's a solid 4 to 4.5 star place.

Reviews.Title: “needs some upgrades”
Reviews.Author: mancow13
Reviews.Content: nice and quiet place to be, but charge for parking is way to high for (29.00+ tax per day) pool jacuzzi needs repair and upgrade, not a cheap hotel. but it's worth it. rooms are nice and clean, needs new furniture, (chairs, and loveseat out of date) and not comfortable. beautiful sunsets. few steps for a snorkeling experience. I will go back sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Relaxing, Great Service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SJK2005
Reviews.Content: Not much to complain about here... Beautiful Location... Lovely Hotel & rooms... Amazing Lagoon... Fantastic Staff.... This was our first stay at this hotel after a visit to the lagoon at Ko Olina last year. The room over looked the pool & the lagoon. We were originally booked into a ocean sunset room but we really wanted a pool lagoon view. The WONDERFUL staff were MORE than happy to change us to a room we preferred at NO TROUBLE OR COST! It was such a lovely experience! Our room was modern, VERY spacious, HUGE double bathroom, two vanities, huge bath that our two yr old LOVED & a large shower & separate toilet which my husband LOVED! Our room wasn't ready as our flight was a 6am arrival. But we were offered a hospitality suite to relax & freshen up. The valet guys were SO nice! Very accommodating & friendly! The girls serving us at the pool were WONDERFUL especially Danielle who was at our beck & call basically. We barely noticed she was there but we were NEVER without a drink or food. She was SO friendly & super nice to us! It was what you would expect from a 5 star relaxing holiday. The pool attendants wouldn't just give you a towel they would also take it to your chairs & set the towels up for you! The cocktails were SO GOOD!!! The pool & lagoon are amazing. So spacious & relaxing. Not hectic & cramped like waikiki hotels. We travel to Hawaii EVERY year & this hotel is one of the best we have stayed at (spacious like Maui Resorts)! But beware, it is VERY QUITE & RELAXING here! There are NO SHOPS within walking distance. Just a small sundry/lobby shop with milk, water, beers, magazines etc... If you don't have a car you will use room service & the hotel restaurants. We have a needy two yr old & we were fine with the facilities available. If you have a NEED for shopping you can catch a taxi to the Waikele Outlets for $25. The outlets are a MUST SEE. VERY CHEAP!!!!! There is NO night life here either... Trust me you won;t need night life... It's SUPER relaxing!!!! There is construction next door, the Disney Hotel is being built. But we did NOT notice it at all. Only heard some beeping & saw some some cranes when we were on the beach. It is NOT a problem!!! The restaurants in the hotel open on alternate nights... so if you have a favorite it won;t be open two nights in a row. But it's not a problem. All of them are lovely. We loved the Japanese buffet. And Roys at the Golf Club is YUMMMY!!! People that complain about hotel restaurant prices are CRAZY!!! Its OBVIOUSLY a resort so you must expect resort prices!!! BUt the food is beautiful!!! We spent our first week here & our second week at the Moana Surfrider in Waikiki. WE LOVE waikiki for the shops & the night life... But LOVED our relaxing week in Ko Olina. It was a REAL RESORT EXPERIENCE! SO RELAXING!!!! If your looking for excitement, shopping & night life look else where,,, If your looking for crowds head down to the 3rd lagoon to the Marriott vacation club. It looked SO BUSY... Not our style. Great if you have teens, they can use the pools & slides etc. But a bit hectic & busy for us... But if your looking for FANTASTIC service, location, facilities, cockatils & relaxation COME HERE! The JW Marriott is Wonderful!!!! We stayed at the Westin Moana Surfrider in Waikiki the week after here & the JW MArriott put them to shame! The Moana's service was disgusting compared to here..... The Golf course is gorgeous... pricey to play but worth it! I would stay here again to relax & enjoy the service! A TRUE RESORT!!!!! Thank you to ALL the staff.... They were ALL amazing!!! Stay you won't be disappointed...!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely HORRIBLE Experience...Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Guarino14
Reviews.Content: Would never stay here again. I wrote an e-mail to the GM and to Marriott Customer Care. Outdated room...terrible experience. Valet Employees were unprofessional and rude. From the second we pulled up, they did not come over to our car to open the door. They waited for us to exit the car and instead of welcoming us in a professional manor, they said “Whats up Man? Are you checking in?” They then proceeded to rush us out of the car because they have “a lot of cars coming through here now.” I dismissed this as possibly just a busy night but things didn’t improve. I went out later that night to get some sodas to drink and a snack because the resort shop closes at 8PM which is ridiculous considering supposedly lesser hotels, Courtyards and Residence Inns have 24 hour service. When I returned and pulled back up to the resort, different Valet Employee but same bad service. Being woken up twice in the middle of the night by resort guests At approximately 2AM, my wife and I were woken up by a drunk resort guest trying to enter our room. She was inserting her card into the lock and pushing the door multiple times. Not a pleasant way to spend the night. At approximately 6AM, we were once again woken up by someone actually opening to door and only the latch kept the door closed. My wife who was livid at this point and went down to the front desk to complain about the night that we had. The front desk said that they would have security come inspect the lock to see what happened. A couple of hours later we received a call from security to inform us that they did not have a record of an “entry” at 2AM but they did have a record of an “entry” at 6 AM. To make matters worse, security concluded that the 6AM entry was from the Housekeeping Supervisor who incorrectly read their paperwork and was trying to inspect the room. Now mistakes do happen, but being a JW Marriott employee, don’t you think that the employee should have apologized for making the mistake instead of having to us having to yell from bed that not to open the door. Needless to say we had a terrible night sleep and could not go back to bed. Room Dirty When we initially entered the room, my wife used the bathroom to find ants on the floor. I had to go into the bathroom stall to kill the ants so she could use the bathroom. After not being able to sleep because of being woken up at 6AM, we decided to possibly enjoy the morning on the balcony. To our displeasure, we found bird dropping on the chair cushions and bird droppings all over the floor on the balcony There is an incredible amount of dust on the baseboards. My wife has an extremely bad case of asthma and she made the comment in the morning that she needed to take a second allergy pill because he breathing was acting up. After I inspected to room to the possible causes, I noticed all of the dust on the baseboards I

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: gagagaga1
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to Hawaii many times, but this was our first stay at the J.W. Marriott Ihilani. We spent the first 5 days of our trip in Waikiki and chose to relax & enjoy the last six days of our vacation at this beautiful resort. We found the hotel staff to be friendly, prompt, accommodating, and helpful in every way. The bell staff, valets, restaurant personnel, room attendants, concierge staff, pool & beach attendants, etc. were all outstanding. Having never been to the Ihilani before we were not sure what to expect. Traveling with family we found our rooms to exceed our expectations. They were fabulous. We had reserved ocean view rooms and discovered that our rooms were not in the main tower, but directly across the shark & sting ray ponds. There was never any noise from elevators or other hotel patrons. It was awesome, relaxing, & the beautiful sunsets from our balcony were stunning. We enjoyed roaming the beautiful grounds both day & night. Dining was limited, but what we expected from a resort. The Pool Grill was a great option as we spent many hours at the pool and nearby lagoon. We often frequented the Terrace Restaurant with only one small complaint - $25 for a very ordinary breakfast buffet. Not worth the money. The parking fee came as no surprise as other hotels also charge parking or (as the Turtle Bay Resort) an added resort fee. Only two minor complaints: 1.) They do not have full size cribs for small children. This made sleeping difficult for a 1 year old grandson. A resort that carries the J.W. Marriott name should have full size cribs. 2.) I was kicked out of the fitness center because I didn't have on tennis shoes. I was not using any of the machines - only hand weights. I didn't, and don't plan on, bringing tennis shoes on a trip to Hawaii!! The girl was quite rude. I was still able to get in my daily exercise on the walking trail by the lagoons though. Incredibly beautiful resort and location. We will stay at the J.W. Marriott Hotel during future, frequent trips to Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Kara20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott, KoOlina for six nights. Great location, great rooms, very spacious with good views. We had a suite which was beautiful. The food at all restaurants was outstanding and all the help was great. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it, but did not LOVE it”
Reviews.Author: 1diamondgirl
Reviews.Content: Well, after looking at many on-line reviews we decided to book at the Ihilani. The pictures look fantastic. The lobby is very nice and the concierge and Expedia local expert all were helpful. ROOMS: The registration girl did a good job and was very friendly. However, I was not impressed with my "ocean front" room as it looked out towards the Paradise Cove Luau (you can't actually see the luau, but you do see the parking lot for the luau!). The view did have some ocean view which is beautiful, but it also had the view of the parking lot! Not to my liking at all after paying a premium! Since it was late and we had reservations to go out that evening we took it up the next morning. The same girl was working at the registration and she had me look at a room to see if I liked it better. After going to the room, there was an air conditioning fix-it man in the room trying to fix the air conditioning (not a good sign!) and I kid you not, the room was actually only up one room (but on a different floor) from the room we had - so naturally, it also looked out on the same parking lot! I went back down to registration and said that room was unacceptable also and I wanted what I'd paid for - an ocean front/view room - upon which we were sent to look at the 3rd room and it did have a LOVELY view but also came with two double beds and not the KING we had requested. We did stay in that room, but needless to say, it was not as "romantic" as we would have liked it!!!! But the view was lovely and we made do with the bed situation. The bathroom was huge in the room, but did NOT have a whirlpool tub and just wasn't as luxurious as we have had in other resorts. Make sure you do not book on the side closest to the renovations being done at an adjacent property - I understand from the bell staff that Disney is building a hotel adjacent to the JW Marriot. The bathrooms could have been much more lux. The balconies were very nice but not overboard lux amenities. The bedding and mattresses were above average and were comfortable (yes, EACH of the beds!) LAGOON/SNORKELING: It was beautiful and nice beach. Had some okay/moderate snorkeling - nothing to rave about, as has been noted. The kayaking is a joke - we thought we could go out as we do in Cancun or Riviera Maya but it is just in the small lagoon! So we weren't interested in doing that little kid type kayaking! Would be fine for little kids I suppose. POOL: Nice, kept up well, sparkling clean. Nice, comfortable bar area and good food pool side - not too overpriced and fairly good. The Ceasar Salad had chunks of chicken and was huge - about $14 which was a bargain by this resorts prices! RESTAURANTS: Over priced buffet. I am not kidding - $25 breakfast buffet that is just a moderate buffet - nothing remarkable whatsoever. You can have the $17 fruit/cold only option but really just everything in the terrace restaurant is soooo overpriced. Breakfast would be about $45 each morning! The waitresses and hostesses were very nice. Efficient and quick service. Omelets were very good - but standard faire. All just the regular stuff and nothing really 5 star quality, in my opinion. SHOPPING ON SITE: Not much to choose from. The couple of shops I saw were Adequate, but pricey. Forgetaboutit! Not much fun shopping here! YOGA: Everyday was a different time! Didn't know what time it would be until that day's agenda came out (unless you stayed up late to pick it up from the front desk!). One day it was at 7:30 am, the next 5 pm, and then 9. Very confusing! Also, it was not free - cost about $12 each day! PARKING: $29 resort fee for parking a car on site, but highly recommend having your own car as you are out away from everything. Some might not want to get away fromt he resort, but I did not find it had enough activities or amenities to keep me staying there - so we were glad to have a car. The valets were wonderful, speedy and helpful. OVERALL: Just not that impressed that it was a 5 star resort. It was nice but just not the place that I had been looking forward to. I did not find it had the activities for a couple. I did see they had a wonderful kid's program each day so if you had children it might be a good place for you to stay. It did not have a "sexy" vibe at all! It did have a nice view from our 3rd room - and it was peaceful. The restaurants did not beckon! The activities did not beckon! I'd give it a solid 4 or 4.5 rating and probably would not stay here again. The spa was also very over priced but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, this is the life I want every day”
Reviews.Author: TexanXXL
Reviews.Content: The experience was great. I am sure by reading others comments that the most common comment is about everything being full price. I agree but this is a resort on Oahu, so this is not the place to come on a budget. However if you want the experience of a life time and great service, food, a room to go down in the record books then this is it. Most all rooms have a private balcony whcih we used to eat our breakfast on every morning. We would order room service and the lady would set it up every day and treat us like we were King and Queen for the day. The room was large with a super large bathroom. open large bath with a shower that was glassed in. There are fish ponds on the property that have sharks, rays and coy in them. The lswiming agoon is awesome. My wife didn't want to swim but sun bathed and read her novel the whole time which made her happy that there was towel service and assistance if needed. Several full service resturants are on property. It has full services to include a sundry store, jewlery store, and a great clothing shop where my wife bought necklaces as presents for everyone at home. It is about 30 minutes from Wikiki so you will need a rental car but for our second stay in HI we would prefer this then the hustle and bustle of the strip. I was extremly pleased with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “How to have an amazing honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: FallHoneymooners2009
Reviews.Content: We had the best time of our lives and the hotel made that happen. The best service I ever had, amazing view from our spacious room. Concierge did a great job planning our entire honeymoon. It was like they read our minds sometimes and knew exactly where we wanted to go and what type of service we required. Always polite set in a quiet relaxing atmosphere! I wouldn't go back to Oahu and stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Still Great”
Reviews.Author: cruzerd
Reviews.Content: I don't know what I can say that the other positive reviews have not already said. Check In was easy, and actually let me look at 2 rooms because I didn't think I like the first room we were assigned. The front desk staff was very friendly. We had a sunset view room, we could hear the waves and it felt a little more private. I did notice the furniture was looking a little more worn than it had on previous stays and the rooms could use some updating but the bed was comfortable and the bathroom very large. The construction next door was not an issue for us, the only time/place you can really see it is when you are on at the elevators. Yes, you can see the cranes from the lagoon but it was not at all intrusive. We usually got coffee in the morning from the lobby cafe and also the portions in Naupaka are large enought to share if you don't want a huge breakfast. We always go to Roys for dinner a couple of times while we are here, I was not real impressed with Azul in the past. The lobby bar has a good late night happy hour. The parking is overly expensive, we actually chose not to valet most of the time because the parking garage was not crowded and then we did not have to tip or wait for our car.. The location for me is a big plus, the lagoons are great for snorkeling, #2 usually has turtles. The N Shore is less than an hour away and you don't have to deal with the Waikiki crowds. I hope that the Disney resort will be pretty self contained with pools, etc so the folks staying there will not all end up at the lagoon. We will continue to return to the Ihilani as long as it continues to have the same relaxing vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Secluded location”
Reviews.Author: ycjc
Reviews.Content: Located on the west coast of Oahu. The Ihilani is a great destination with beach coves that allow you to enter the smooth waters. The best part of the hotel is the beautiful beach.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Spot for Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: QueenBinLA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 9 days in September. Found this to be a very relaxing place. Liked the fact that it wasn't "Waikiki crazy." The pool was small for a resort but the proximity of the hotel to the lagoon more than made up for that. Loved the open restaurant for breakfast. Didn't like the $30. a day parking fee for our rental car but you need a car at this hotel. Would definitely recommend Roy's at the Golf course and Chuck's Steak House at the Ko Olina Beach Club nearby. We had an oceanview room and loved it. The room was wonderfully decorated and we especially appreciated the large, attractive bath.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bry09
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was amazing. The furniture in the living room could have been better, but it was fitting for the space and the island. The balcony is huge with plenty of room to order room service and have them set you up dinner out there (which they will). The entire side of the wall that connects to the balcony has white wooden doors that have wooden built-in blinds that you can open and close. The doors slide open and there are screen doors which open and then there are glass doors which open. You can have none, some, or all them opened or closed, and they all lock. It is nice to have the screen doors so you can close them and no creatures can get in, but still enjoy the outdoors- especially at night. We slept with the screen doors closed so we could hear the ocean and the ceiling fan on. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was very spacious and clean with a nice walk-in shower, large bathtub, 2 sinks, and a seperate space with a door for the toilet. When you come in the room, there is a nice cabinet with a minifridge and drawers with a nice countertop and mirrors. The fan, lights, and a/c are all controlled on a touch screen phone by the bed as well as buttons that you may need to call anyone at the resort you may need to call. The service was great and they greeted you by your name when they answered. When you arrive, you will find a card in your room telling you they have a free gift for you from the vacation club. Go receive your free gift from the side desk and they will ask if you would like to go see their time-share property directly next door. If you go listen to the presentation that lasts 90 minutes you will get to attend the luau at the property next door for free or a dolphin cruise, snorkeling, or other activities. We did the free luau, Fia Fia, which was a $75 value a piece. It was amazing!! We enjoyed every second of it! There are NO strings attached; you have to listen to the presentation and thats it- no purchase, commitment, or anything necessary (I was very skeptical). The shuttle can take you there for the presentation and luau and bring you back which is great. There are several restaurants at the resort, at the gold club, and at the vacation club. The shuttle runs about every 30 minutes and will take you to any one of those. The lagoons are beautiful! There are 4 of them, so you can find one to enjoy. If you go toward the right side of the lagoon where the wedding place is set-up, just beyond the bushes you can exit the property onto land with rocks on the ocean. It is a quiet, beautiful place to watch the sunset with an amazing view of the mountains and the ocean with nothing in front of you. At the front desk, they keep a print out for you with all of the activities for that day and the next day. You do get 1 free hour of snorkeling and feed the fish is every morning. They have tiki umbrellas on the beach for you. You can rent a cabana they have set up for $20 that comes with cushions, a cooler, fruit, water, and a flag to raise for service including food/ drink service. The shops there and food is pricey. We didn't eat at the resort much because there are so many other great places to eat on the island. The parking is $30/ day which was pricey. They have valet parking also, so we never parked our car. The price is the same if you park or valet. Valet is easier because if you go to park, they have about 3 levels reserved for the valets. It is a good distance from honolulu (about 45 mins) so you need a car if you plan on going over there. The internet is $12/ 24 hours. Make sure you check your bill when you are going to check out and they didn't put any accidental charges on. When you arrive, they will ask for a debit/credit card to put a $200 hold on. Parking will come out of that each day. If you charge things to your room, it will also come out of that at the end of your stay. I would not recommend you give them a debit card- give them a credit card in case there is a mistake with charging on you bill and they add another hold. There is some construction going on next door, but it never bothered us. I loved being able to drive down to the busy side of the island, but also go back to the resort and be secluded and quiet. North Shore isn't too far from here either. We enjoyed our stay, and would love to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort A++”
Reviews.Author: StrykersMommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week the middle of May. We had great weather the entire time. We had an ocean view room and it was definitely worth the money. The food was really good but quite pricey, we found ourselves eating at the nearby town alot. The beach was very nice, the golf course was beautiful, and the spa was top notch. It wasn't a bad drive from the airport either. I would definitely recommend renting a car because the resort if somewhat secluded, the parking fee at the resort was a little unnecessary but it was nice to have the valet at all times. We will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “The setting was spectacular”
Reviews.Author: ginaoneill
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very large with great views from the lanai. The staff was very attentive. We used the beach cabana most days and the beach staff were great. We would go back to this hotel in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Way better than Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: 6continents_counting
Reviews.Content: No doubt this is a luxury resort. To give you an idea how good this place is, we got married in our room. We did that for two reasons: first, the background from a balcony made for great photos and the father of the bride couldn't walk long distances. Besides "technically" speaking, if you get married on the grounds of the resort (other than your room) you have to pay a $500 fee. Now the room. Great, especially the enormous bathroom (which made getting ready for a wedding great). Great balcony. Our room was on the end which on the positve side allowed for a little more breeze. On the down side and this was the biggest complaint was that there is construction next door. However, it never woke me up and I'm a light sleeper. It will be a least a year or two before that construction is done but don't let that alone detract from your decision on this place. Regarding the resort, let me give you the good and bad. First, the bad. It's expensive. Meals were expensive, but good. Parking of $29/day is outrageous and due its location there is no choice but to have a car. If anything turns me off about this place it is that fee. Further, they charge for everything such as internet, local phones, cabanas. Location was good and bad. Since I'm talking about the bad, to put it simply, unless it's the beach, you must drive to do or get anything. Now, the good about this place. Tops on the list is the location (but see above). It is NOT Honolulu. Our parents stayed there so we went there often to see how they were doing. They liked being able to walk to restaurants, but there was a lot of hustle and bustle. Traffic is a nightmare. If you are looking for a quiet romantic place that you imagine to Hawaii to be then the JW Marriott far outweighs everything else. Green grass and palm trees, waterfalls (albeit in man made fountains), sandy beaches, and beautiful sunsets. The service here was top notch. The pool was nice also. Spa service was nice to have if it's what you;re looking for. Also, gym and tennis courts. Bottom line, come here if you want to get it away from it all, go to Honolulu if you want action.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It”
Reviews.Author: BFCNewJersey
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is exceptionally overrated, over-hyped, and they nickel and dime you for everything. Calling this a five-star resort/hotel (or seven stars in the Marriott rankings), is an insult to two star hotels. The much touted lagoon beach is badly designed. so that there is a huge dead-spot in the water right in front of the hotel, where all of the flotsam and gunk collects in smelly murky green water. The hotel is not near anything, and is at least 30 minutes to anything else. So as a result you are at their mercy for drinks and food. A simple gin and tonic set me back $10. The same kitchen feeds the "high class" restaurant and the informal restaurant, but the food is 25% more in the "high class" end, and the informal is hardly a bargain either. Lastly, Disney is building a hotel right next door, and the noise is horrendous. It appears construction will continue for the next 6-9 months. If your idea of a vacation is staying outside in Times Square, you'll feel right at home. The staff is courteous, but they have been programed to turn everything into a revenue raising event. When you arrive, you can count on being given the shabbiest room at the lowest level possible consistent with your reservation. Then they will graciously offer to upgade you from the room with the view of the airconditioning compressor to a more spacious room with a better view, but only if you agree to a 20-50% increase in the room rate - even though the hotel is probably only 50% occupied. If you want to see anything on the island while you are there, you will have to drive at least 30 minutes - probably longer depending on what you want to see. And since the only way to get there is by car, count on $30+/day for parking. And don't even think of bagging the car, since there isn't that much to do on site even if you are willing to venture into the smelly green water at the beach. All in all, if I had it to do over again I'd stay at the Kahala Resort or if you're set on Marriott then the one in Waikiki. The Ihilani offers absolutely nothing that you cannot get elsewhere for much less, or much better accommodations for the same price such as the Kahala, or any of the major hotels in Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Great Waikiki alternative”
Reviews.Author: jkchen1
Reviews.Content: Great resort to just relax without having to go to another island. Disney is building a resort right next door so be prepared for a little noise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: titiger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the second time. The rooms are excellent; large, comfy, spectacular bathroom with garden tub, separate shower, dual vanities. Free coffee in the morning was a plus in the lobby. Nice breeze through the open air lobby, birds chirping, waterfalls, comfy seats to enjoy your first cup of coffee in the morning. Excellent lagoon for swimming with the kids in the ocean. It's a nice and quiet location, away from the traffic and noise of Honolulu (about 18 miles west of the airport). Great golf course with shuttle transport around the complex.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation of my life...”
Reviews.Author: chicagocubsfan_9
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Ihilani Resort, and I can honestly say it was the best vacation of my life! I have stayed at many 4 and 5 star resorts, but have never been treated so wondefully as at Ihilani. From the moment our car pulled up, we were greeted with tropical drinks, leis, and hotel staff assuring us that if we need anything, they were at our service. When you walk into the lobby, it is like an oasis from stress, and you automatically feel as though you are on vacation! There are so many wonderful things I can say about this resort, but I will cover the most important. It is an extremely child friendly place, but it is also very romantic, and relaxing. The restaurants are fabulous (my personal favorite being, Ushio Tei). The pool is surprisingly private, and not over-crowded. The lagoons are breathtaking, and almost look like something taken out of a painting. The rooms are by far the best hotel rooms I have expereinced. They are huge, clean, and luxurious, whether you are staying in the regular rooms or the presidential suite, you will not be disappointed! I would recommed this hotel to anyone looking for a true vacation. This will be the place where I will choose to go for many vacations to come.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a quiet, relaxing lagoon”
Reviews.Author: dcg86
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and grounds, wonderful service. We stayed in a suite with a large balcony with a view. Having come here from a busy week on Kanaapali Beach, this was just the opposite but what we needed - quiet and relaxing! We took long walks every day around the 4 lagoons, sat by the pool with comfortable chairs and service. You can rent fun floating toys in the lagoon as well as sit on the beach in the chairs provided. The lagoon is great for small kids because there are NO waves. We ate only in the hotel restaurants, all of which were delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place for a getaway”
Reviews.Author: Jim H
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to a Deluxe Ocean View room on 11th floor. Room was perfect, no issues with cleanliness as some reviewers mentioned. Location is beautiful, but far from Waikiki. Service was top-notch as usual from Marriott. Special requests were quickly filled. Took advantage of onsite Golf and Spa services, both were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “BEST YOU CAN GET ON OAHU.....”
Reviews.Author: luvhawaii4ever
Reviews.Content: My husband travels alot and there really are no five star hotels on oahu this is it. We got an exceptional deal through costco so it was only 199. a night ocean view deluxe room so for me this was well worth it. The staff was great, everything I asked for they got me. The pool side service was also great. The pool is quiet and simple and I could keep a close eye on the kids easily. They have free cold icy lemon water at the pool as well which I loved. The view from the rooms and the bed was comfortable. The bathrooms were beautiful and there was even a refrigerator in the room. The hotel lobby is incredible. The kids loved the sharks and sting rays! There is FREE coffee in the am, which is not offered at most other hotels on the island. We got food from the coffee shop in the lobby for breakfast, muffins and stuff. Bought cereal and milk for the kids at the local store one exit ahead of the hotel and used refrigerator in room. Asked for bowls and spoons from room service and they sent it up, free! We ate lunch at the pool side grill, great for the kids. Dinner once at the azul not worth the money at all. After that we went to chilis which is only one exit up from the hotel off the highway. Do not go the other direction on the highway towards the mountains, I did and it got dangerous fast, bad area. It is very time consuming to travel to most tourist areas from this hotel, but if you are looking for a quiet family oriented vacation where you dont have to lift a finger this is it. Also this is the nicest hotel on the island, there are a couple at Waikiki but they are noisy and not family oriented. We also stayed a few days at the Marriott in Waikiki which was nice, but noisy and the ocean is dangerous for the kids to swim in and crowded. This area was nice if you like to shop, I preferred the quiet simple beach at the JW myself. CONS…. TV is a joke, hotel restaurant overpriced for the food, Noisy in early evening- paradise cove right next door until 900, Nothing to do close to hotel. By the way parking is charged at all hotels in oahu, however if you call and ask them for a deal they may let the parking charge go. (they did for a friend of ours, we didn’t know to ask til too late) PROS….LOVED the rooms, pool, service, views, and beach, and lobby. Also walked up to the other hotels that the Marriott has and swam in the pools there , one has a slide and water falls. Another has live music with drinks. ASK for 10% off card at the beach side activity hut . You get the discount at the restaurants including pool side, room service, ect. BUY wine at a store and bring it to room, they have openers and its cheaper and romantic on the lanai.

Reviews.Title: “You must have a rental car to enjoy staying at this resort!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BeautyOnTheBeach
Reviews.Content: JW Marriott properties generally have a reputation for presenting a classy upscale standard of lodging. While the landscaping and the outside scenary along with the lobby were beautiful, the rooms and amenities were not (5) start quality!!! There were no actual amenities included on the resort other than a free cup of coffee each morning. You will not receive a free continental breakfast as courtesy of the hotel. Also, several travel agents do not provide transportation to THIS resort anymore, nor does the hotel shuttle provide free service to and from the Honululu Airport. The cost of transportation to this resort from the Honululu Airport is about $70.00 one way. Please confirm with your agent that transportation to Ko Olina will be provided!!!! Internet availability is advertised but does cost $12.95 every 24 hours down to the minute in both the lobby and the rooms!!!! Although Hertz is located on the property and the vehicles are stored there at the resort, parking fees are assessed and do remain at $30.00 daily. As previously stated, after reviewing the resort restaurants and menus, the necessity for a rental car became an absolute must. Do not touch tne Menu and Select buttons consecutively on the remote, this is the PPV television ordering system and the cost is $14.95 per movie, so please use caution when watching television as well! Unless you are within business class, have a corporate discount, or meals are not at your expense, we strongly recommend that you set up an advance rental reservation for the convenience of being able to enjoy both meals and activities on the Hawaiian economy. Food prices were unusual whereas, the cost of cereal w/ fruit $10 per serving, a glass of juice $6.00, a serving of hot wings ran about $24.00 in the hotel. Therefore, the cost of car rental, PRICELESS....... One experience that no one should miss is the Paradise Cove Luau, fortunately, it is within walking distance of this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Classy but flawed”
Reviews.Author: karenk540
Reviews.Content: First the good parts. The beach / beaches are outstanding, great for swimming, snorkelling (sea turtles visit regularly at high tide / early morning before the kids are out), the grounds are lovely, shark pond is a great feature, pool is nice, food is good, service is excellent. It is one of the nicest places on Oahu for sure - but then Oahu is kind of crowded and doesn't have many real luxury resorts. It doesn't stack up to those on the Big Island's Kohala coast, for example. Bad part is that it is a long way from anywhere and so you are a bit stuck with their restaurants etc, and it has plenty of space - so why is parking $30 a night? And it's the same cost whether you valet or not. Everything is extra - no leis, no robe in the room, no in-room coffee, breakfast is $$$ - so when you add this to the high room prices it rankles a bit. For such a high-end place, the cleanliness wasn't amazing - our room had dust, ants and some mildew in the shower. And then there's the construction of the Disney resort RIGHT next door. This is really ramping up now and your beach experience will be flawed by beep beep honk bang bang clank noises all day, although it does seem to be 8-5 Mon-Fri. In summary you could pick worse places on Oahu if money has no meaning for you, and if you can get a good deal on the room when the construction is over we recommend it. But don't expect to be pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Netedge
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for 4 nights and I actually tried to get my wife to check out early and move to Turtle Bay on the north end. Parking is $30 a night. The restaurants are outrageously $$$$. You quickly realize that using valet every time to get your car is very expensive. The TV was old (not even a plasma or LCD). There is no good coffee on the property. And I had to catch them double charging us for a concierge activity that was several hundred dollars. They also wanted big bucks daily just to use wireless anywhere in the hotel for the internet - I haven't paid for wireless in a room for at least 3 years and I travel frequently. I suggest you find something more reasonable. The one upside is the oceanfront room had a beautiful view. Meanwhile more on the room.The pillows were foam like you'd get in Motel 6 - not even down pillows. This is not what I would call luxury in any way. The jacuzzi was not warm and my daughter called it "scummy". The jauzzi at the spa is Ok and recommended if you want one. The pool was small. There was friendly help at the pool bar. You have to know there are better options in Hawaii than this!! My wife wouldn't switch to Turtle Bay even though I and my kids preferred it and it was much more reasonable. She didn't feel it was the high rise kind of feel she likes. That's about the sum of it all. We'll look elsewhere in the future. This felt like a convention hotel like you would get in Orlando or Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4 star Resort as advertised!”
Reviews.Author: MammaG75
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week of rest and relaxation in my favorite place in the world...the Hawiian islands. Ok the JW, for a 4 star resort the first thing that struck me upon arriving was the stained carpets in the hallways. Also our room smelled very musty and the furniture looked pretty worn. Being Hawaii and a JW you can imagine prices were high but this thing really amazed me. They DOUBLE charge for internet!! So daily if you get on your laptop in the lobby wireless, 12.95, plus tax, then go to your room same day and plug in, 12.95 again!! We complained loudly and they did reduce it to just one charge per day. Should be free. But worse than that the food was just awful. The only good meal we had was at Roy's at the Golf Club house. Ok now the good stuff. The Spa is wonderful and reasonable. They run a daily special. The location 20 min out of Honolulu we loved. Much quieter slower paced. And the swimming lagoons and beaches were the best I have ever been to. We will stay somewhere else when we go back. But really loved the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice upscale Marriott, protected swimming areas”
Reviews.Author: DocRB
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, well run, with typical Marriott "can do" policy. It used to be even better before Marriott took over, perhaps some of that former Japanese-Hawaiian hospitality lingers. Regardless, it's still great. Restaurant prices are high and there is no nearby alternative since it's about 30 minutes from the airport, opposite direction from Honolulu. Nice coves to swim, would be great for children. If you want a splurge, get a deluxe room in the 3 floor building near the beach. Take-out sushi and fine wine on the balcony at sunset is a memorable experience. The mountain view room are just that. Go for ocean view, it's worth it. Nice treat is dinner in the Azul restaurant, their high end option. You may sit outside.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: sacrich95
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid-May and just loved it. It was a beautiful hotel with many great amenities you would expect to have at a place of this caliber. At check-in, we were able to upgrade to a suite on the 11th floor which was spacious and had a great view. We loved the lagoons and went to the fish feeding in the mornings. We like the prix-fix menu's at the hotel restaurant. The chocolate chip macadamia nut cookies at the little store on the pool level are to die for. Made fresh daily. I could not walk by without buying two or three a day. Everyone at the hotel was extremely helpful and friendly. It will be interesting to see if the serene location is affected by the Disney vacation club that is going in next door.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Ocean Views”
Reviews.Author: piliSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 3rd wedding anniversary. We paid to upgrade to an partial ocean view and the Marriott upgraded us further to a spectacular full ocean view on the top floor (most likely because my husband is a Platinum member). The rooms were on the small side, but the view made it all worth it, which was the full length of the room. The bed was super comfortable and the bathroom huge; the patio was large with nice furniture. One night there were fireworks at eye level which were amazing.
