We don't normally play tennis, but the rooftop courts have an ocean view so we played one afternoon and had a really great time. The tennis/spa staff was nice and the workout room well-equipped. Valets were also extremely helpful. Restaurant options on this side of the island were limited, but Roy's, which is always exceptional, is right across the street at the Ko' Olina golf course. The hotel bar has a romantic ambiance and friendly bartenders. The grounds are beautiful and the lagoon a nice addition. Great walking path along all three lagoons that ends at the Marriott Beach Club, which is fun to check out. A few things to ensure your stay is great - there is construction for a Disney hotel on the east side of the building, so make sure you stay on the ocean side or it can get loud. Also, make sure you don't plan your trip when box jellyfish are out or you won't be able to enjoy the water. You must get a rental car if you stay here to enjoy the rest of the island - its about 30 min. from Honolulu. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: Annika50
Reviews.Content: My family and I (two adults and two kids aged 5 and 4) spent five wonderful nights here in June. We stayed in an ocean room with magnificent views over the pool and ocean (well worth the extra money) and had plenty of space or the whole family - the bathrooms in particular were enormous. The kids loved it and so did I! It was very relaxing & indulgent. There is a shark and stingray pool & tropical fish in the lagoon that the kids can feed. Fish feeding is free and available every morning at 7am. The shark and stingray feeding is at an extra cost and only 2 or 3 times. It was well worth it and was one of the highlights of the trip. The lagoon is warm and very calm - perfect for toddlers. There is also a luau every evening at Paradise Cove next door, but we ended up going to a very good Fia Fia at the Ko Olina Marriott (free in exchange to listening to a timeshare presentation). The food in the restaurants were a bit pricey but no more than Waikiki. We made a short trip out to a nearby Safeway to stock up on drinks/fruit etc. If you are not driving it's a short taxi ride and Safeways will call you a taxi at their end. We also ate at Naupaka and the Poolside Grill and thought both were very good with big American sized servings. We found that ordering two meals was enough for the 4 of us. Naupaka also had a really good 3-course early bird special for dinner. The Expresso Cafe also had inexpensive light breakfasts such as bagels and pastries. Coffee is free for hotel guests at the cafe until 11am. There were kids menu's at all the restaurants and under 4 eat free with the breakfast buffet. There is no kids pool but my two were very happy with the lagoon and hanging around the edges of the adult pool, while we watched from lounge chairs, drinking cocktails and reading books - bliss! Spent the day at the Marriott Beach Club 2 lagoons down that is more family friendly but liked the Ihilani more...a bit more classy and less crowded. The pool at the Ihilani also had more shaded areas so the kids didn't get sunburnt. On Saturday afternoon there was Hawaiian music and hula show by the pool and activities on most days such as lei making and yoga. Staff were very friendly and helpful, with lots of Aloha. We stayed at another hotel in Waikiki for a further 9 nights and used it as a base to explore Oahu but we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Ihilani and wished we didn't have to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Lagoons were GREAT for the kids, Hotel AVG and Staff Great, except for The HORROR DORY@ front desk!”
Reviews.Author: briancowan
Reviews.Content: I didn't want to write thi review until I settled back into My routine at home...4 Adults and My 2 kids, 7 and 10, flew on Hawaiin Airline direct to HNL from PHX. 6 1/2 hr. flight. Getting there was bad, returning was a dream...Anyways, Suffice it to say the highlights of the trip were the lagoons and the Japanes Restaurant in the Hotel. When going to the restaurant, make reservations for the 6 person room...changes the entire evening...shoes off, sitting on the floor, rice paper sliding doors...really authentic-style...great food and service. The Rooms and ENTIRE HOTEL NEED UPDATING. Had a major problem with the front desk...DORY, at the front desk, said I was lying about the check-in and rates...complained to the General Manager...still cost me...I AM 47, DO WELL AND NEEDN'T lie about $100. I have been a Marriott Rewards fmember for 9 years. Listen, don't waste your money at this hotel. We stayed 6 nights, paid for 5, and it STILL cost 2 adults and 2 kids over $6k for an OKAY tixme. FYI-I just stayed at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge, in Phoenix, for the 4th of July Weekend. It was AMAZING! The Staff, Lazy River, Pools and STAFF were to DIE for...10 times better than the JW Marriot Ihilani. Sorry, guy, Just stating the facts.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Every”
Reviews.Author: ilalio
Reviews.Content: The service was wonderful, our room was over looking the pool, bar area, the location was just great i like everything about it. (Jan 6, 2009-Jan 13, 2009)

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Hawaii Experience”
Reviews.Author: ASoCalGal
Reviews.Content: We visited Oahu for a week's vacation and stayed at the JW Marriott at the Ko Olina resort area. This was the perfect location for "getting away" while being within driving distance of all the sites on this beautiful island. I have visited the islands over 20 times and really enjoyed staying for the first time at this hotel. We are from Southern California and spend lots of time at the beach, so we are accustomed to both freeway traffic, the hustle and bustle of tourist cities like Honolulu and beach towns like the ones on all of the islands. We were able to enjoy all areas of the island during the day, and the amenities of the hotel in the late afternoon. We did not eat at the hotel as we were out and about every day. You can get coffee/pastries in the lobby cafe or full on breakfast in the restaurant. We ate most of our dinners in Waikiki at ocean front restaurants, and did not mind the 30 minute drive back to the hotel. Believe me, Honolulu/Waikiki traffic is nothing compared to LA - and the speed limit is 55, not 80+. Don't let the drive deter you from booking your stay here. Also, Chuck's Steakhouse at the nearby Marriott Beach Resort (timeshares) was fantastic, with a great location overlooking the lagoons and lawns, and was probably the best deal we had on dinners as the meals were not a la carte. It was great to come back to the hotel at the end of the day, in the beautiful resort area of Ko Olina, and enjoy the peaceful setting on the water. Our room was very large, clean and had a terrific ocean view. The bathroom was huge compared to most hotels we've stayed in (including resorts) and was convenient to have a separate shower, tub, toilet room and two dressing vanities on opposite sides of the room. We were front and center above the pool, but found it quiet during the morning and in the evening. Our housekeeping staff was fantastic and was quite attentive. The valet staff was superb and was well worth the price - for heaven's sake - you're on vacation - valet your car!! The valet price is comparable to hotels we frequent in the Palm Springs/Indian Wells resort area in Southern California, so again, no surprises here. The pool was just fine, as we were there every afternoon and also at the lagoon which is just steps away. Both were great and the pool bar/restaurant had somewhat pricey food/drinks, but again, we were on vacation and I enjoyed the splurge of a Mai Tai served in a frozen pineapple shell! There are plenty of lounge chairs facing the pool and towards the ocean. There's also lounge chairs on the beach at the lagoon, as well as a full beach activity center. We used the business center for reserving Germaine's Luau (next exit down the highway) online and for checking in for our return flight, and did not get sucked into using a computer in our room while on vacation. (We also saved about $20 pp on the luau by doing this with Hawaiidiscount.com.) Also, the tv was just fine - just used it for viewing dvd movies we brought with us at night . Yes, Disney is full speed ahead with construction of their resort adjacent to the hotel. There is a very large construction site obscured by tidy green fences. The construction DID NOT start early in the morning (like most construction does), but started later and ended around 5-ish. Yes, there are cranes viewable above the fences. Not a big deal and really, not so bad. There is also construction across the street from the hotel, a new restaurant and possibly shops. This area will soon be much like Kaanapali on Maui so you won't have to drive far to eat, shop, etc. Overall, we were VERY PLEASED with the hotel and can't wait to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “need better house keeping”
Reviews.Author: OahuKamaaina
Reviews.Content: i am a local resident of oahu & have attended my niece's wedding in august. i thought this would be a nice place for me & my 2 kids to take a mini vacation in september without the hassle of leaving the island. we'd stayed for 3 nights. we had a spacious ocean view room. our stay was mostly enjoyable. we loved the easy access to the pool & the beach right below. the only thing that bothered me so much was the ants in our room. they were crawling on the bathroom floor, the foyer & the lanai doors. some crawled onto our beds & i found dead ants lying all over the inside of the refrigerator! room service accommodated by sending someone up to spray the room & wiping down the frig. although the spraying seemed to have helped, we were left with the room smelling like insect spray for the day. the rest of the stay was nice only till our final morning i was greeted with 3 chubby roaches crawling quickly out & back underneath the refrigerator! I felt sick to my stomach. I wrote up a complaint letter & was ready to turn it in when we checked out, but decided not to, because we were greated by our very courteous cleaning lady in the hallway as we were leaving. Not wanting to get her in trouble I'd decided to trash the letter. all in all, the hotel stay was nice & the staff was too. if only the ants & roaches weren't sharing my room, this would have been an awsome stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden hideaway in Oahu”
Reviews.Author: vjsinghisking
Reviews.Content: When it comes to visiting Hawaii, I prefer Maui. So when my girlfriend asked if I wanted to accompany her to Honolulu for a meeting, I was somewhat reticent to joining given I had no desire to contend with tourists in Waikiki. I had stayed at the JW Ko'olina when it first opened, so I suggested that we try it for the 4 nights. The JW is approximately 25-30 minutes from HNL, and given the development, traffic on the H1 can get congested during rush hour or weekend evenings. The property has aged somewhat from when I first frequented, but it remains a welcome oasis from Waikiki. The rooms are tasteful and while not Four Seasons' caliber, they are certainly better then rooms at a Marriott, Hyatt, or Hilton. As an elite member, we had an ocean front room with unobstructed views. Naturally, we left the doors open at night to listen to the waves crashing. The staff is quite attentive throughout the resort especially at the spa. We had massages which, while pricey, were quite refreshing. The signature restaurant onsite is not very good, and I would recommend dining at Roy's at the golf course or heading downtown. The other restaurants serve delectable food. The resort features a beach alcove which is quite nice as you effectively have the beach to yourself. The pool is refreshing although there is only 1 pool at the resort. The golf course is well kept and manned by friendly staff. It's fairly open and not overly challenging, but its worth a round. If i am 'forced' to return to HNL, I will gladly reserve a room at the JW.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: queenladyk
Reviews.Content: OK. There are a couple things you need to know before staying here. One - this is NOT a five star hotel (although everyone of our local friends told us that this was the best hotel on the island - which would then lead me to go to another island but we were going to Oahu for a wedding) I would say a 3.5 to a 4 star. Like other reviews have said there is an issue with the cleanliness of the rooms. The bathrooms, carpet, couch (which was severely stained) and TV have seen better days. I don't remember the last time I stayed at a hotel without a flat screen (which I thought was a requirement of a 5 star). Also, the hallways were filthy - needed some vacuuming ASAP! BUT the best was the lanai (we had a view of the ocean not facing the beach lagoon but the stingray lagoon - this is the way to go as it is MUCH quieter from the pool activities but you get to see the most AMAZING sunsets every night from your lanai) was very nice. Also, no wireless only a plug in for $12.95/night. A bit outdated. Two - there is a new Disney hotel being built right next door and right on the lagoon so this is bound to get crowded and busy once construction is finished but it was getting noisier by the day on the beach with the construction. During our visit they just had finished putting up the HUGE cranes. So beware of a room facing that way. We didn't hear any noise from the construction in our room but it was loud when we were on the beach. We had a oceanview room ($299/night with $100/night resort credit) which was a good deal. Look on mariott.com. However, the resort credit is not valid on the room rate plus taxes but the good news is the place is kinda isolated - as the other reviews have said - so you find yourself eating a lot of meals here. We ate the breakfast buffet everyday - loved the juicer - had room service the chicken fingers were good - we really enjoyed the food here despite the price but we needed to use our resort credit so it worked out. They do nickle and dime you and the price of the valet is the same as self park - so valet. The good news is you can call and tell them that you are leaving in 15min or so and they will pull your car around so you don't have to wait when you get down there. Also, due to the isolation you do have to do A LOT of driving if you are going into Waikiki (30 min) or to the north shore (45min). So rent a car - they have a lot of specials so you can get a good deal! Overall, this hotel was above average - I wouldn't go back unless I had to go back to Oahu. I would go to the other "real" five star resorts on the other islands.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place! Would recommend it anyone!”
Reviews.Author: Clairie143
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from the JW Marriott Ihilani Resort and we had a fabulous time. We got upgrade to a deluxe ocean view room because we are platinum members as well as on our honeymoon. The food got a little old after a few days of eating at the same restaurants. There isn't a lot of places to eat around the area except Roy's which is great as well as other restaurants like 10 minutes away. The pool was great as well as the service around the pool. The Ihilani Ice Tea is amazing and my husband and I must of drank like 15 while we were there. Yummo! :) The resort is beautiful and easy to get around. I'm very happy that we choose this restaurant for the beginning of our honeymoon because its a great hotel to relax and just chill! The ocean was beautiful and the water was so perfect without a whole lot of waves! Make sure you visit the spa and bring your bathing suit because the spa area is beautiful so take advantage of the steam room and the pools :)

Reviews.Title: “awesome facilities for the price”
Reviews.Author: bruneko
Reviews.Content: we really enjoyed this resort. though it is a nickel & dime you sort of place, i.e. you have to pay separately for internet, a cabana, they price you out of the their buffets, parking is extra, etc., it was still a great place to stay all in. their rooms are extremely spacious, and we had a beautiful ocean view. their beach/cove areas are private, shared with a resort community that made for great runs/walks. scuba gear and kayak rentals are free til 3:30pm. this place was about 45 mins outside of honolulu, which was nice to get out of the busy area. service was very friendly. i would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Resort”
Reviews.Author: phoenixwtc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights at this resort (6/4 - 6/8) and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We have been married for over 30 years and this trip was a sort of 30 years get away for us. The room we had was on an upper floor looking out over the ocean. The room was very comfortable. The balcony was very spacious and private. We had read about the construction next door for the new Disney resort but we weren't bothered a bit by the construction. We would highly recommend this resort to anyone looking for a a nice resort out of the noise and hustle of the city, though getting to the city was quick and easy when we wanted to enjoy those sights.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Quiet Resort”
Reviews.Author: Love2traveltacoma
Reviews.Content: The Ko Olina Marriott is about 20 minutes away from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu. If you're looking for a quiet and peaceful place this is it. We had a ocean front room and it was beautiful. My only complaint would be the sheets were very noisy, everytime I turned over I woke up. Our room was close to the luau that is held next door but the music stops fairly early each evening and it really didn't bother us at all. The pool is small but we never swam in it since the man made lagoon is right outside the hotel. Even though the lagoon is public there were very few people other than hotel guests. If you enjoy snorkeling you can snorkel right in the lagoon. There are 4 lagoons but they aren't close together. If you go to Lagoon #2 early in the morning you can see sea turtles. They are building a Disney Resort next door but we never really heard much construction noise. Once it is built I'm sure it won't be nearly as peaceful as it is right now. Apparently the resort is suppose to be huge!! Other than Roy's there really isn't any other restaurants close by other than the ones at the hotel. We found the food at the hotel very good. If you want an AWESOME waiter ask for Scott at Naupaka's.

Reviews.Title: “Where a local goes to relax in luxury!”
Reviews.Author: OahuJ
Reviews.Content: This is simply a stellar hotel - it's where this local goes to enjoy all of the amenities and beach access that tourists take for granted and locals can't afford! Having stayed here for for the last 4 years, it has only improved now that the huge convention crowds are staying away. The rooms are spacious and clean, the pool offers gorgeous beachfront views and the whole place is almost too much like a living postcard, complete with swaying palm trees. Kids love the shark and ray pools and the grounds are beautifully manicured without having that Disneyland feel (like the Hilton Waikoloa). The restaurant, Naupaka, is good, although the $15-$25 per person per meal prices can add up quickly. The breakfast buffet is fantastic, with make-your-own-juices, seafood omelettes and almost everything you could want. However, to save money during breakfast and lunch we drove into Kapolei most days and for the same amount of money at dinner we ate at Roy's which was fantastic. The only real downside to this luxury hotel is that you get nickel-and-dimed from the $30 parking to the $13 internet to the $5 water bottles, to the $25 breakfast buffet. How is it that at Courtyard Inns, all of that is free and the room rate is under $100 - here it's $350 a night! Also, some of the inclusive amenities aren't advertised, like the free use of beach toys and the exercise classes. Finally, I don't recommend the childrens' program because they spend all day in a dreary daycare-like room doing "craft" projects they could do at any daycare. I thought they would be doing awesome kid-stuff around the hotel's grounds. Wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Every Expection! Thank You Marriott for Making My Birthday Trip Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: momcat1959
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed at the JW from 16-22 May. This trip to Hawaii was a celebration for my 50th Birthday. The J.W. exceeded our every expectation. It is an exceptional hotel in a gorgeous setting. Prior to our departure I read many reviews on Trip advisor. I became apprehensive because the hotel was recently receiving some not so great reviews and I really wanted this trip to be spectacular. I almost changed hotels but I’m so glad I took the reviews with a “grain of salt” and stayed at the J.W. We are Marriott Vacation Club owners and buying a Marriott timeshare was one of the best vacation decisions we have ever had. Marriott is a first class operation and has not disappointed us to date. I will break this review into sections for ease of reference. Staff and Service Top notch all the way. Prior to our arrival I received a message from the virtual concierge. Since it was birthday trip I had a number of requests. I was using points for this trip and had paid $100 for ocean view upgrade. I decided to upgrade further to a Napauka Junior Suite. Although they originally informed me it would be another $100 upon arrival I was charged nothing extra beyond the original $100. So, we had a massive 1000 square foot room for $100 per night. More on the room later. When we arrived the room they gave us was near the ball room so it was noisy. I called the desk and they immediately offered me another room overlooking the pool and lagoon, gorgeous. So, if you don’t like your room or location just ask to switch, if they are not full they are more than willing to accommodate. Also prior to arrival I requested champagne, cheese and cookies upon arrival. They sent a beautiful tray up about ½ hour after we arrived and the champagne was complimentary. For my birthday dinner at Azul, they greeted me with a happy birthday and went out of their way to make the evening special. Our room was made up in a timely manner every day and kept tidy. Every one of the staff we encountered was friendly and helpful. Public Areas Spectacular is all a can say. The grounds are meticulously maintained and absolutely beautiful. The lobby is very impressive with its massive atrium and expansive marble floors. Some have complained there are no longer flowers on the center table. It did not bother me. I think the art display is lovely and the lobby is very grand. There is a sitting area and coffee shop in the rear. Don’t miss the free very delicious coffee in the morning. The sitting area opens to the fish ponds below. The pool is not big. I found the all the hotels we visited in Honolulu did not have big pools either (Halekulani and Outrigger). The huge water park type pools don’t seem to be the thing here. The pool setting is lovely and the size was fine for us. It was not crowded. The lagoons are fabulous. There are beach toys for rent and also covered double lounge chairs that come with water and snacks for $20. We rented one and it was very nice. The lagoon is calm and great for swimming. It lovely to walk along the lagoons in the morning and evening. There is construction going on next door but there is a barrier. It is a bit unsightly if viewing from above but it did not seem noisy to us. We heard very little. We were out a lot during the week days we were there so it may be a bit worse. I’m very sorry that this area is going to congested by Disney theme park type hotels. It’s a shame, but that’s progress. Location This hotel is on the leeward side so the weather is wonderful. Very predictably sunny and dry. Even when it was a bit cloudy in Honolulu it was clear in KoOlina. It is about 20 min from the airport, 35 min from Pearl Harbor and 45 min from Honolulu. Traffic was a little heavy at times but not unbearable. We are very glad we stayed here. It was peaceful and a nice escape from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. We went to Honolulu often for dinner and did not have any issues with the commute. Room The rooms are very large at this hotel. Our suite was massive. It had a long marble entrance with a dry bar that contained a mini fridge. There was a massive dressing room with huge closets and a scale (nice for weighing luggage). The only thing is the closets were big but lacked enough hangers, so actually not as useful as they could be. Marriott should provide more hangers in these huge closets. Bathroom was also extremely large. Marble with two sinks a soaking tub, separate large shower with ledge seat and a separate area for toilet. Then there is the bedroom and sitting area which is also huge. We had 2 double beds, desk, couch, 2 dressers, long table and another table and table by the beds. There were two TVs. Yes, as some have complained they are not flat panel and a little older, but fine. Who would want to watch TV here anyway? They there is balcony. This was the best part. It is very large and the louvered doors open completely to the fabulous view. There is a lounge chair and full table and chair. No, the hotel is not new, but the room was still kept very well. I read some complaints about worn bath fixtures. Ours were not new, but certainly very acceptable. Our room was also very clean. One slightly annoying feature was that the clock in this suite was across the room and could not been seen at night. Also, having the light control on the nightstand had advantages and disadvantages. All in all we were very happy with the room. Restaurants Napauka is a very nice casual open air restaurant. The breakfast buffet was very nice with wonderful eggs Benedict and many options. Dinner was also very nice. Azul was wonderful. The food was excellent, the setting lovely and the staff top notch. I loved the coffee served with a tray of chocolate chips, shavings and whipped cream. What a nice ending to dinner. Price I was actually surprised that things were not as expensive as I expected. From reading I expected outrageous prices for food and services. We found the prices to be the same as any very nice resort we have stayed in. As mentioned they gave me a multi upgrade for $100. Yes, you pay for valet parking, and it is bit high, but it is expected that some things we be overpriced in resorts. Is it always justified no, but it’s the way. Something to note is they gave us a multiple upgrade for only $100. They also gave me complimentary champagne and the free coffee in the morning was a nice touch. Spa I had a facial and my husband and son had massages. My facial was very nice and the first time I was not pressured to buy products. My husband said his message was the best he has had. The prices were equivalent to other hotel spas we have gone to. Overall We loved this hotel. It exceeded our every expectation. I would not hesitate for a moment to stay here again. For activities we found the location a good base. We visited Pearl Harbor, sunned on Waikiki beach, took the Outrigger catamaran sail, hiked Diamond Head, surfed the North Shore, dined at Duke’s, snacked on Leonard’s malasadas and had an overall wonderful time. Thank you Marriott for making my birthday special Link to pictures: http://travel.webshots.com/album/572735516WmZbQs

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: desicutie515
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. My boyfriend and I did not want to leave. It was beautiful. I'm a pretty picky person when it comes to hotels but I fell in love with this one. The staff was great. The bathroom and room were spacious and clean. The hotel is located aobut twenty to thirty minutes away from waikiki. Waikiki is so busy and if you want more of a relxing getaway, you should definitely stay here. Ko olina is so relaxing. Its away from the bustle of the city. I loved the location. We rented a car so it was perfect. If you have a car and a gps, it is really easy to get around the island. We drove to different parts of the island and I have to say that ko olina was one of my favorites. The paradise cove luau is also really close to the hotel and I would definitely recommend everyone to go. It was so much fun!! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A Really nice place”
Reviews.Author: LeDash
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to Oahu a friend referred us to the area referred to Ko Olina- he loved the place so much that he nemaed his daughter after it. We explored and immediately saw why he was so taken with the resort area and had been scheeming ever since to figure out a way to stay there on a vacation. This last trip we got a taste for a couple of days when we got a nice break for a stay at the JW Marriott Ihilani Resort & Spa at Ko Olina. This resort property is very nice and not for the faint of pocket. Reality set when 4 of us sat down for 3 chesse burgers, chicken wings, 3 beers and a Maitai for $125 (tip included)- Ouch!!. Now the cheese burgers were big but I would not say they were the best I've had (Dukes?). And no, there are no other less strenuous venues in this area- although Roy's is almost in walking distance. As with most high priced hotels you pay for everything- $13/day for internet, $30/day for parking, etc etc Our room was on the 9th floor and was very nice with the latest in nice bed/linens. Our room had the "mountain" view which today is a view of the new Disney resort construction site and tennis courts. The room was a good size with a very nice large bathroom- Jacuzzi tub with a separate shower, his and hers wash bowls and a "water closet". Service was very good although the valet did manage to give our travel partners rental car to the wrong people however they made every effort to make up for it by making sure we had transportation till the unsuspecting couple returned with our car. Took my daily walk along the beach which was very nice- however I saved my sea frolicking for Poipu Beach on Kauai. Frankly, if you have the funds this is an excellent property but you really need to make sure you are comfortable with the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, would definately stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: ctw01
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, clean, very friendly staff. We stayed on the 10th floor overlooking the lagoon, pool and ocean, fantastic views! Food was fanstastic, we ate one night at Azul restaurant, highly recommended!! The lobster bisque was delicious!!

Reviews.Title: “Beauty, Beach, and Luxury”
Reviews.Author: vacationgina
Reviews.Content: This resort exceeded all of my expectations as I struggled over staying here and Turtle Bay. I never made it to Turtle Bay, but I didn't feel the need to look any further. Can't review the food, but the drinks were yummy. Water rentals were pretty fun and free for guests. The pool was a bit boring due to it's circle shape, but really it was thoroughly enjoyed. The lagoons are really calm, so if you want to body surf or have any wave action you will have to head to another beach. Paradise Cove luau is walking distance, a sunset is to be seen here that you wont soon forget.. The resort is simply elegant and fascinating with its beauty, sharks and sting ray pools, and accomodations. Our room was shockingly beautiful with a view of the pool, lagoon, and the ocean. This place offers that special something that makes you feel glorious and pampered, it makes you feel as if you have truly entered paradise. It was hard to leave this place. Also like to mention that it was not crawling with people, but they would love to sell you a time share.

Reviews.Title: “Food Poisoning- My child hospitalized”
Reviews.Author: maddiegirlDallas
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I got very sick from the room service kids hot dog. My daughter had to be hospitalized. The hotel was not helpful, they immediately were more concerned with filing a “security” report then the wellbeing of my young child; who was in convulsions from dehydration. I am fighting and losing against Marriott in court for medical bills, it is difficult when Marriott is willing to spend ten times the amount of the ER bills on Attorneys fees. I have no choice to but warn other travelers’ to be careful of what you eat. If you do become ill Marriott will not advise to be tested for food poisoning, they will try to hide it. I am a road warrior and have been completely shocked by the actions of Marriott. Please do not risk the safety of your children here. I would only recommend this resort if you are looking for a quick weight loss solution, I lost seven pounds in two days….the hard way.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel away from the hustle and bustle--RENT A CAR!”
Reviews.Author: KLDESQ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott on Oahu’s western shore for a week, celebrating our son’s 10th birthday in July, 2006 . This property, taken over by Marriott in 1999 from the Nikko Hotel chain was built in 1993. I would highly recommend reserving at least an ocean view room or higher if you can swing it. We stayed there on points, but paid to upgrade to an Ihilani Suite on the 16th floor with commanding views. The hotels policy is to give a complimentary one class upgrade for Marriott Rewards Platinum Members (sorry Gold Level members—they are kinda snobby on the upgrade, but you can pay for it). It was $60 per night to go from the standard room to a deluxe ocean room (deluxe is just higher than the regular ocean) with the free Platinum upgrade. If you are Gold or lower it will set you back $90 per night. From there, the upgrades get interesting. To go to the first suite it will cost you $120 per night (rack rate for this room is $800 per night) if you are not Platinum then it is $150 (providing you are using points). To step up to the suite we had, cost $210 per night (rack rate is $1500 per night) again, non platinum members it would be $240 per night if available. The suite we had was really nice. It contained 1400 square feet and two separate and distinct balconies—one off of the master suite and the other off of the living room. If you have kids (we have two) and have the money—I’d definitely recommend it. The suite also has a separate dining area and two bathrooms. Pros: 1. Amazing rooms—with REALLY huge and awesome bathrooms. I understand that we were in their second highest category, but the concierge told me that all of their bathrooms were marble, etc. Our main bathroom had a huge walk in shower and also a huge soaker tub and separate WC. The second bathroom also was done in all marble. 2. Great views—we were on the “sunset side,” for the balcony off of our living room—the sunsets were similar to Key West, although honestly not quite as amazing. 3. Really good service. The service happens twice per day, which is really nice for (and almost necessary) for a beachfront property given the sand, etc. 4. Location: this is also a negative—see discussion below. The Ihilani is on the sunny west coast of Oahu—about a 45-minute (or so) drive from Waikiki. It is a new upscale residential area, Marriott is also building a new Ritz Carlton property on this location, they have recently finished a time share as well It is very quiet, calm and peaceful. If you want active nightlife—stay somewhere else. 5. The Marina. We went swimming with dolphins in the wild for our sons 10th birthday—how cool is that? 6. Beaches: they have three man-made lagoons, which are great. The water is very calm and very warm. There is little or no wake. The beaches are beautiful but are man made—they were trucked in. They are also groomed everyday. 7. Restaurants. There are several really good restaurants. They have a great seafood buffet every Saturday night in their open and airy restaurant, on Wednesday night’s they feature Prime Rib. There is also a Japanese restaurant and bar and a more formal dressy restaurant. Bottom line here is that the food is *very* expensive, dinners averaged $200 per for our family of four. The breakfast buffet set up back $80, you get the picture. 8. Golf Course: While it is clearly not Pinehurst #2 (my personal favorite course to play) or Pebble (my second favorite), heck or even Shadow Creek for that matter, it is a very nice and quite scenic resort course. Here too, it is expensive, around $200 per round with everything and is not in the league of the aforementioned tracks. 9. Spa. Perhaps the best for last. Don’t go to the Ihilani unless you plan on using the Spa. It was recently voted the #1 Spa in the world by Conde Naste readers—I wholeheartedly concur. Cons: 1. Expensive. Be prepared to spend a ton of money going into it—that’s what I did and we had a great time. For example, a spa treatment my wife and I get at home in North Texas was triple the cost at the Ihilani—that’s why we skipped the typical treatments and opted for things like the “stone treatment” that you can’t get anywhere else. 2. The time share sales pitch. I didn’t go to this property to be asked to: “become an owner.” It was not as bad as the Marriott Ocean Club (see my review of that horrible property), but enough said. 3. You aren’t near any type of “action.” Which was fine for us—but if you in the single crowd and want to go to bars, etc. this is NOT the property for you—go to Waikiki. 4. The entire property is heavily geared to tipping. While I don’t mind tipping this place is insane. Literally everyone seemingly has their hand out all day, I guess this dovetails into the clientele, I’d guess the average household income of those privileged enough to spend time here is 250K+, but I didn’t like being expected to hand out money all day, every day. 5. NO HIGH SPEED INTERNET access in the rooms. There is a business center in the basement that has four stations—but it costs $.15/minute for the privilege of checking email. To me, if they charge you nearly 2K per night (between all the sundry taxes, etc.) they should “throw in” internet access in each room. Summary: The JW Marriott Ihilani at Ko Olina is a top-notch beach resort. They have one of the best spas on the planet. The views are amazing, the beaches are wonderful, the water is warm, etc. The only item that I would ask you to consider is that be prepared to totally “relax.” I mean that in a good way, as a week was a bit too long for me. I am an attorney with a very busy practice. After a couple of days of sitting on the beach (and swimming with the dolphins) I was ready to go and do “something,” We explored literally all of Oahu but if we go back to the Ihilani again (and I certainly would) It would be for three to four days—other than that it is a winner!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Beach”
Reviews.Author: bacamper
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW Marriott for 7 nights while on vacation with the entire family. Had a mountain view room. The room was nice, his and her sinks in the bathroom and a mini fridge in the entry way. Biggest complaint by me and others in our group was the sheets. They were the cheapest, scratchiest, loudest sheets ever. Worse then a motel6. Not what I expect from a JW. The hotel never seemed crowded. The pool is very small as is the deck around it. The highlight of this resort is the lagoon. It was very beautiful, not crowded. Great for the kids and adults to swim in. Can snorkle in there also. They have a fish feeding daily at 7:30am by the lagoons edge. The morning buffet is terrible. I have no issue with the price, actually expected it to cost more then the $24 that it was. But my party was skipped over while waiting for a table. We came across countless dirty plates and glasses as did the people at a neighboring table. There was nothing special or particularly good about the food. I recommend just grabbing something from the pastry shop in the morning or going to the nearby town of Kapolei where there are tons of places to eat any meal. The hotel charges $29 per day whether you self park or valet, so you might as well valet. But if you do self-park it is very close by and easy to get in and out of. The valets were always very nice and very fast. The fitness center is very nice and opens early. Also there is a paved path along the lagoons that is great for jogging. They had some live music by the pool on only 2 of the 7 nights we were there. And that ended at 7pm. The pool bar closes around that time also. We walked down the beach to the Marriott Beach Club every night. They always had live entertainment until 9pm and their bar stays open till 9:45 . The resort is about 45 minutes from honolulu, and everything else. You’ll be doing tons of driving to do your sight seeing. My recommendation would actually be to spend maybe 2or3nights in waikiki , do your shopping and sight seeing. Then head to the JW for some peace and quiet on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: josh1231
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in late March. I was very impressed. Service: The service was top notch. Every person we dealt with was nice from the front desk, to the servers to the valet and bell staff. Everyone was very willing to help with anything you needed. Grounds: The grounds are really amazing. They have 2 separate little "ponds" (don't know what else to call them, and I'm fron Kansas and that's what we call them there :) ) one with little sharks, and one with stingrays. You could spend a lot of time just looking at those. The pool is nice, though for the number of people the hotel holds is a little small. The public hotel areas are realy nice with a lot of lush vegatation. The beach is great. They have little cove's to swim in which are protected from waves so they are very good for swimming in the ocean. Food: Probably about the only bad experience. There were maybe 10 tables full for breakfast and 15 or so empty and we had to wait for a table??? The greeters at the resturaunts seemed very innefficient and were the only staff we dealt with the entire time that I would not consider top notch. That being said our waitress was fantastic and the pancakes I had were some of the best I have ever had. Rooms: I upgraded to a junior suite for $180 a night. Not cheap, but well worth it. The bathroom was very large with a separate shower and tub. The closets were very large. The room was large as well, and very nice with a separate good sized seating area with coffee table looking out through the 2 sliding glass doors onto the patio and ocean. The patio was nice sized and comes with a full sized table. Overall: Nice place, I would highly reccomment it. I found the $250 charge for a 6pm checkout to be a tad high (though I did gladly pay it). That and the resturaunt greeters are my only negative. One thing I'm not sure of though, is I don't believe they have wireless internet. I found wired internet, but couldn't connect to a wireless spot.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Place on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: shavyj
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort with amazing, child-friendly lagoons. The food is great and the resort is so relaxing. I loved sitting by the pool watching the sharks and the sting rays, sipping drinks, eating pu-pu platters. It is an expensive resort but worth every penny. We loved it so much, we go back every year!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would not go back there.”
Reviews.Author: Polly C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel when it was run by the Japanese and it was wonderful then. It's not the same atmosphere. Construction noise from morning until evening was definitely annoying. While some of the staff was very nice, others were indifferent and, at times, rude. Food was way too expensive and the parking fees ridiculous. We felt as if we were "nickled and dimed to death"

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the area of Honolulu airport”
Reviews.Author: zugs
Reviews.Content: We overnighted here on the way back to the eastern US from a vacation in Australia. Our room was beach front and wonderful. Service could not have been better. I understand that taxi fares can be high -- we rented a car at modest cost. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Most Beautiful Resort In HNL (over Waikiki Hilton & Marriott)”
Reviews.Author: psychepooh
Reviews.Content: Through Pleasant Holidays, booked trip & stayed at Hilton Hawaiian Village first night, Waikiki Marriott (2nd & 3rd nights) & JW Marriott 4th Saturday night. Worried about previous reviews about construction, so only booked one night. But there was no construction on the weekend, so would safely book weekends only here. POSITIVES: This resort is waaay more gorgeous than the Hilton & Marriott in Waikiki!!! The most beautiful landscaping - shark & sting ray pond, palm trees, lush gardens for perfect for weddings. I wish I had booked 2 nights here! For a $40 upgrade, I got a great ocean view room that was enormous (ROOM 1021) - maybe 600-800 sq ft! Felt like an apartment almost. Foyer is prob 8X8. Monster bathroom 10x15 with two vanities, nice deep tub, shower & seperate toilet stall. Bedroom 18x20 had 2 queens with a wicker desk, wicker couch, wicker chair and remote controls for lights. Balcony is to die for - very soft & comfy wooden lounge chair with soft high quality padding with warm towel covering & two chairs & a table also. Wifi $12.95/day available outside around the pool. There is a nice lagoon for swimming with a nice sandy bottom. Very nice lounge chairs for rent $20 for 4 hours for the chairs with canopies over them. NEGATIVES: the place was cold (claimed 80* but felt like 65* and couldn't make it any warmer) and very dark for such a large room. Only had small dim lights (maybe 40W bulbs) near the beds and one on the desk. The rest of the center of the room was left quite dark. If you want to do any reading, you'd be better off reading in the foyer or bathroom for lighting. Also negative - NO WIRELESS internet in the rooms - only slow moving wired $12.95/all day (would also give you access to the wifi around the pool). 3 restaurants - only ok food - buffets were bland and lame and cost $39 - the same as fillet minon off the menu! Swimming pool is not heated but there is a sauna - but all hotel guests must share these.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HowleyB
Reviews.Content: We used Senior Rate for the final week of our annual trip to Hawaii. We stayed in Wailea, Maui for the 1st 2 weeks on Points. We had an oceanfront room since I'm a Platinum Rewards member and it was beautiful. I'll try to post Pictures later, they are on my portable computer at home. The winds were very high during the visit and the sand was blowing on the beach. The only thing lacking in KO Olina is a choice of good restaurants. There is a Roy's accross the street but I prefer a bit more options. The hotel Restauurant, Azul< was very good and there was a Japanese restaurant that was not open every night. Maybe when more hotels open in Ko Olina there will be more options. I'd definatly recommend this hotel but plan ahead to get the best rate.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: txsrc
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel largely because everything about the rooms is spacious and mostly elegant. Bathrooms and lanais are especially fantastic and all rooms we've seen have seating areas. We also like the Ko Olina area, and although we usually prefer Maui or Kauai to Oahu, this hotel makes us want to spend a few days on Oahu in addition to whatever other island we're visiting. The hotel should replace the mattresses; they are not as comfortable as in newer Marriotts. And the TVs are very outdated and parking charges too high. But despite these criticisms, we really love this place and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it- can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: WA_local
Reviews.Content: This resort is just awesome- such a beautiful location. We had a deluxe Ocean View room that was huge, with King bed, sitting area and a wonderful bathroom with marble floors, soaking tub, separate shower and dual vanities. The bed was acceptable, although not as comfortable as we were hoping. Our lanai overlooked the little lagoons with the fish and manta rays and the ocean. We loved being able to just have the screen doors and have all the fresh ocean air come into our room. We also enjoyed sitting on the lanai in the comfy patio furniture. The resort also provides you complimentary snorkeling gear for an hour/day. The man made lagoons are awesome. We spent most of our time in Lagoon #2. We also spent a lot of time lounging by the pool, enjoying food and cocktails served in hollowed out pineapples. The BEST! We had the nachos and the quesadilla, as well as many mai tais and lava flows. :) We ate at two restaurants- Chuck Steakhouse by Lagoon #3, which was so-so. The other one was the main restaurant by the pool for dinner. Service was slow and we each had a $15 bacon cheeseburger that was passable. I'd suggest hopping in your car to go to Kapolei to eat. We also ordered room service one night- the creme brulee, which was pretty good. Overall, though, Ko Olina is Hawaiian paradise. We can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful place - would gladly return”
Reviews.Author: garyr59
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 11 days at this Marriott. Because of some of the reviews, I was apprehensive about the property. However that completely changed after checking in. Check in was really easy, they had all the right information. The room was beautiful with a great ocean view. Floor to ceiling windows right across the lanai. The lanai was huge, accommodating a table with 2 chairs and two loungers, with room to spare. Every night we listened to the crash of the ocean as we went to sleep. In the morning, we awoke to birds singing. In the distance we could watch whales play. The room clean, with first class amenities. Absoultely no complaints about the room. The room attendant did an excellent job. Note: The side of the hotel we stayed on - with only ocean views, faces private property where some nights, there are parties and lauaus. They can be quite loud, starting after dusk and finishing around 10. However, only 1 event over the 11 days was really too loud. Mountain view rooms might hear the construction from the disney resort next door. Yes, the meals are expensive. That is typical with resorts. If you have a car and you really should have one for longer stays, Kapolei,10 minutes down the road has many good reasonably priced restaurants, a Costco, Zippy's, Safeway, etc. We ate once at the hotel, at the Japanese buffet. The food was good, but not enough variety to justify the cost. We wouldn't eat there again. The lagoon and beach was beautiful. Good snorkeling. The pool is a little small and crowded and the hot tub is way to small for this size hotel. some of the pool loungers are in need of repair. Anyways we preferred the beautiful beach. Yes, parking is expensive. However, many many resorts now charge a resort fee of comparable price, whether you use the resort facilities or not. Fees are a part of hotel operations now, just like baggage fees are the norm for airlines. Valet service was excellent. Ask them a question and they either have pre-printed directions or good advice. All the staff were good to deal with. I honestly cannot understand the negative reviews of this property. I am a very picky traveller and have stayed in many many places. No this is NOT a 3 star hotel. NO this is NOT a bad place to say. I say it definetely a 4.5 star hotel. If you want to stay in a beautiful hotel, in a gorgeous location, away from the madness of Waikiki, this is hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tj1966
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a weeks stay at the Ihilani Resort. My husband and I are seasoned travelers and we cannot say enough about this hotel. Before our trip we read some of the reviews on this web site and were somewhat concerned. To our delight either the hotel has gone through some upgrades or we were just not picky.........which would be the first time in my life. Our room appeared as though it had just been renovated, new carpeting, paint, bedding etc. On our way out one day we saw a door open on another room and the employee quickly asked us in he was painting between guests. The staff was outstanding, the food was good not great but certainly not bad. Food and Drinks can be expensive but you are in Hawaii so that is the norm. The location was quiet and away from the hustle and bustle but we still took advantage of tours leaving Waikiki. Disney Resorts is building next door so I am afraid this gem will no longer be hidden.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Birthday Getaway”
Reviews.Author: candycraze
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Hawaii for her 50th birhtday and booked 4 nights at the Ihilani Resort using Marriott Reward Points. I debated whether to stay at the Ihilani or the Waikiki Marriott, and I definitley made the right choice. Everything about the property exceded my expectations. The location was perfect. It was secluded, but not a far drive to Honolulu and convenient to the rest of the island. The surrounding area was beautiful and tropical. Our room had a fabulous view overlooking the pool, lagoon and the pacific ocean. The balcony was very spacious and had a table and two chairs, a lounge chiar and a beautiful flower box. The room was wonderful and very large. The staff, from the front desk to the pool and lagoon attendant, was very friendly and helpful. We had complimentary Kona coffee and bought pastries each morning for breakfast. We dined one night at the Azul restaurant and it was wonderful. We had the menu specials which were 4 course meals for $45 each. Since we used reward points the property was very reasonable, but if we had paid for it, it would have been worth the expense. My only regret was that my wife wanted to explore the island every day and we didn't spend as much time at the resort as I would have liked. But it was her birthday so she got to choose. We also spent 3 additional nights at the Aqua Coconut in Waikiki and had a very good experience. The hotel was very clean and fun and the staff was excellent. The Aqua Coconut is 3 or 4 blocks from Waikiki but was surrounded by lots of nice restaraunts and shops. We didn't care much for Waikiki so it didn't matter to us that we were not right on the beach. Plus we got our fill of beautiful beaches at the Ihilani and on the rest of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Great hidden jewel on Oahu!!”
Reviews.Author: JWTraveler2009
Reviews.Content: I went here for my wedding and had my relatives stay here. The hotel was absolutely beautiful and the staff was amazing!!! I would definitely recommend this hotel to prospective visitors! It is a little out of the way, but well worth it :)

Reviews.Title: “They Nickle And Dime You To Death!”
Reviews.Author: oscar09
Reviews.Content: The hotels location and overall experience was nice. Its a nice getaway from downtown. We paid for the best and therefore expected the best. I think the restaurants at the resort are priced completely off the wall. We paid $50 for a breakfast omlete and begliam waffle.Good food but not great. I would recommend not eatting at the resort. Another thing that was rediculous was the parking. They charge $30.00 per night for parking and the valets expect a tip in addition. They actually told my boyfriend they work strictly on tips.....come on! The carpet was very old and stained in the hallways. The room was nice and cozy but small. They are getting by with the bare essentials thats for sure! The staff are so/so. The location with the lagoons was great thats about the only thing that saves this place.However; the Disney Resort is coming in right next door so if your counting on a quiet romantic getaway count it out when thats finished. Those lagoons are going to be packed. Unless you get a deal on your hotel room its priced out of its league thats for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay....but be prepared to PAY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1969usmc1988
Reviews.Content: Ok it was my last weekend on Island before I deployed for 4 months. I decided to take wifey to a night away and the JW. WOW, we were treated marvelously. One becuase we are Marriot rewards member and two becuase we had Military and Kamaiana ID. That said, the one night stay still topped out at nealy $1500.00. Now hold on, hold on....momma and I like to run with the big dogs when we can so we did the whole deal.....dinner at Azul (amazing), room service for breakfast, snorkeling in the bay, clothes at the gift shop. etc, etc. Was it worth it? Yes....every penny....but bring PLENTY of them. THAT is the only reason this hotel doesn't get 5 stars with me. If I pay $80.00 for breakfast then it should taste like $80.00. Now don't get me wrong, it was good. Moslty, becuase of the company. LOVE YOU DARLIN!!! Semper Fi.....see you in the O flow.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and dirty”
Reviews.Author: mjwelte
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the JW for a business conference that I attended. Overall our stay was OK but no where near a 5 or even 4 star resort. We had a large room and it included a refrigerator and a separate bath. From talking with other attendees of the conference our room was bigger than most. However the room was filthy. The bathroom had hair and toilet paper on the floor. One of the drinking glasses was visibly dirty and we would set it out each day to be cleaned. It became a game as we would put food, juice, etc in the glass and each day the glass would be rinsed out with the same crud stuck on the bottom. It wasn't until we actually took the glass to housekeeping that we got a clean glass. The wicker furniture was also filthy as we found out when we laid some of clothes on it to dry out and instead covered our clothes with a gray/black grime. The prices of the restaurants, drinks, and amenities were not any where close to the quality expected. One of the dinners was at Azul and was mediocre in quality and the service was worse. The food was not that good and was extremely overpriced. Now for the positives. Our stay was made bearable by the staff working at the hotel. We had some less than stellar staff but the positives more than outweighed the low sides. The valet workers and the beach lifeguards were awesome. They were very helpful and made us feel like we were really welcome at the hotel. One of the gentlemen working at the front desk was also very good. We also liked the lagoon as it offered a place to swim and hang out for the day. It was family friendly and gave my kids a place to play and relax without any fear for their safety. We have stayed at quite a few Marriott properties with my business travels. Up until this trip we were not concerned with quality. This hotel is very expensive and I have a hard time justifying the price. If they did some work on the housekeeping and dropped the prices at least 30% it might make sense to visit here. Until they do so we will most likely stay elsewhere the next time we visit Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches and Moldy smell”
Reviews.Author: dukeklaus
Reviews.Content: We were so excited for our stay and feel that we were jipped by the JW. We had huge cockroaches in our room and one landed on our table during dinner at a restaurant on sight. Coincidence? We go to Hawaii every year and have seen them but never at this level. The ponds with fish in them were mucky looking and you feel bad for the fish. The staff seemed like they were on a burning ship. Checking with them or asking questions was like dealing with a rude ticket agent. The concierge had huge piles of documents on their desks and you felt like you were bothering them. Our room smelled like mold and when we asked to be moved the next rooms mold smell was worse. We had asked for a fridge when we booked the hotel and was told we were 3rd in line and it wasnt going to happen? We are platinum elite so we are used to being spoiled but not being treated like a lepper. Needless to say we stay with the Marriott on average 200 nights a year and cancelled all of our rooms for this year. The weather was beautiful but the pool was an ice box. Please take my advice and either go to the Big Island if you are a Marriott's Reward member or use your 400 usd and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Try the West Coast of Oahu and stay at JW Marriott Ihilani.”
Reviews.Author: MaryAlice10512
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel on West Coast of Oahu. Ko Olina resort area is gorgeous with 4 lagoons and lovely beach walk. It's peaceful and quiet and clean. (Not for people looking for night life or lots of action.) New shopping center on property to open later this year. For now it's a short drive into Kapolei for eateries, groceries and outlet shopping. Airport is approx. 30 mins. away. JW Marriott is extremely pleasing and the staff was great. After many trips to Hawaii in every sort of accomodation the JW Marriott is now our #2 favorite resort. Also recommend dinner at Chuck's Steakhouse in Marriott's timeshare property down the road. Use beach walk to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Caveat Emptor”
Reviews.Author: SFW0rldTraveler
Reviews.Content: We visited the Ihilani this past Christmas, staying 9 nights. Unfortunately, we had lousy weather, but that is not the subject of this review. Just as a heads' up to other Christmas travelers, the part of Oahu where Ihilani is situated is very windy, and all of Oahu gets rain at Christmas time. The Ihilani is quite remote - unless you want to be a captive of the resort, a car is a must. The hotel charges a very steep $30 per night to park a car, whether you valet or self-park. However, having a car saved the vacation (particularly as it was not beach weather). There are many possibilities for day trips to the North Shore, Pearl Harbor and Waikiki, etc. The hotel is looking a little worn and in need of a renovation. While our room was spacious and had a nice size balcony which was sheltered from the wind, the corridor carpets were badly stained and walls were scuffed and chipped. Our room had one technical glitch after another, and we had a parade of engineers trying to fix things. Internet is available by ethernet cable and only one computer can log on at a time. You must ask them to only charge you once per day if you wish to use two computers ($13.00/day); once you have paid, you can connect via wi-fi in the lobby. There was a hole where the refrigerator should had been. We asked for one and were put on a "wait list", with it finally arriving a day later. The refrigerator is key, as the hotel food is quite expensive, but there is a Safeway just a few miles away. The hotel restaurants were adequate, but on the holidays, imposed a steep fixed price menu ($85 for Christmas and New Years). The higher end of the restaurants on a regular night would cost a minimum $70 per person, before drinks. The night we tried it, we were surrounded by screaming, exhausted children. The lowest priced wine was $17 a glass or $65 a bottle! There is a nice spa and gym, and a lovely lap pool which was always sheltered and uncrowded. I did not play the golf course. However, they allow for 5-somes to tee off , making for a very slow round. The restaurant at the golf course has great food and the prices are reasonable. The beach is man-made, with lagoon swimming which is good for small children. Covered beach lounges are $40 per day - yet another high charge. - and ,had the weather been good, there were not nearly enough to accomodate the hotel guests. Across the street from the hotel is a huge open space, soon to be occupied by a Disney hotel. When the construction begins, the noise and dust will be monumental. After the new hotel opens, the added guests will overwhelm the small beach and golf course.. At that point ....caveat emptor!!

Reviews.Title: “the only 5-star thing about this place is the price”
Reviews.Author: HKO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week at the end of Dec 08 on our honeymoon. The resort pretends to be a 4- or 5-star resort but it is really more 3-star in quality. The only top-star feature is the price--we used points to stay here and still came away with a $2,000 bill for food. Without a car or a designated driver you are stuck eating at the resort's VERY mediocre restaurants (which would be OK but for the astronomical price they charge). We were horrified at the $300 we paid to eat at Azul for New Year's Eve--the food was sub Red Lobster quality. I know it was New Year's but still, come on--can you at least serve hot soup? There is a very good Roy's within walking distance but everything else is a 20 mile car ride. Maintenance on the resort also suffers. The staff does not tend the beach--beach chairs are scattered all over in a mess every morning, unlike other beach J.W's we've stayed at. Toilets in the restaurant were missing hardware. Stairs had no-slip treads coming half off. Not really acceptable for such a pricey stay. The rooms were very private and clean; good housekeeping. We also liked the lack of crowds and lack of touristy kitsch. But the "lagoons" felt artificial and man-made. There are no waves at all, though the beach was nicely uncrowded while we where there. The spa was also overrated and they automatically add 20% gratuity. Overall we would not go back and would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Decline”
Reviews.Author: SFtraveler21
Reviews.Content: This is a nice property, but Marriott seems to be content to ignore it. It needs refurbishing, and virtually everything in our room was broken. The hotel is also seriously understaffed. I also thought that I was nickel and dimed to death and that the restaurant prices were way too high (perhaps catering to Japanese tourists). There is a new Disney hotel about to be constructed about 50 yards away. Watch for this, because when construction begins you don't want to be anywhere near the Ihilani.

Reviews.Title: “Good but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Metsfan5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in December and I must say I don't understand many of the extremely negative reviews posted. Yes it's way too expensive (including the ridiculous $29/night parking whether you use the valet or not), but having spent 10 other days in Hawaii this trip, the whole state is much more expensive than the mainland. We had 2 rooms on the 8th floor that had gorgeous views of the ocean and were spacious. The bathrooms have two sinks, a nice touch for couples. We found the staff to be very friendly and consistently smiling. My only gripe is a personal pet peeve of having piped-in music playing at the pool. Why these resort hotels promote relaxation, only to bombard you with their loud, uninvited music is beyond me. One other note is to be aware that they're just starting construction of a Disney hotel next-door to the Marriott. For now, it's not an issue and you wouldn't notice it unless you're using the beach. However, I can envision a different story once they break ground on a large high-rise structure. Might be worth calling ahead to check teh status in the future. I would definitely recommend this place as a pleasant alternative to the noise and congestion of Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Location IS NOT everything!”
Reviews.Author: NZ_SandS
Reviews.Content: Some of you reading this are probably in doubt as to the apparent remote location of this hotel which was in fact one of our primary reasons for choosing it. The location is undeniably pure paradise. The lagoons are perfect for snorkelling and swimming - we saw a turtle on our first snorkel and colourfil fish not far off what we saw at Hanauma Bay! However, I have to echo a few comments made by previous reviewers. The staff absoloutely let this place down. They're cretainly not unfriendly or unhelpful but they're not exactly welcoming and warm. For a holiday destination like this you expect a little warmth and hospitatiliy. Resort prices for food and wine were ridiculous and be warned .... if you're going during a busy period fridges in room don't come as standard. We reqeusted one on our first day and were put on a "waiting list" although I had my doubts. The cynic in me thought it was a convenient way to limit the food and drink we kept in our room. I would strongly recommend you request one in advance of your arrival and find a convincing reason for having one if needed ;-) Rooms are spacious, views are spectacular. However, we did expect an ocean view room and actually got a partial ocean view in my opinion. If you stood to your side you'd see ocean but directly in front of you was a car park and the neighbouring Paradise Cove. Requested a move but they could not oblige due to capacity issues and offered to reduce our rate. Not ideal because it was a special holiday for us and we'd have preferred the view over the cash. Spa prices are ... in my experienced spa opinion ....exorbitant! Whilst the massage was first class and the pedicure / manicure faultless ... a little research into neighbouring spa facilities would no doubt save you a small fortune. Finally, on checking out we had quite a few "errors" on our bill. As an example, the reduced rate was only applied for one night, in resort credit offers we had on booking were not applied and there were two or three extra charges (albeit it nominal) that could not be accounted for. Worth taking five minutes to go through it. So in summary. Would highly recommend the resort for families with young kids. We've been fortunate enough to travel and see some pretty amazing places so I would not count this as a "romantic destination" but the location is halfway there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great location!”
Reviews.Author: paka808
Reviews.Content: My wife and I for the most part enjoyed our stay at this resort. The staff was friendly, our room was spacious and we also had a private balcony which was nice. The grounds of the hotel were nicely manacured and the seeing the sting rays, sharks and salt water animals in the hotels lagoons was a nice surprise. The pool was a little small but we still enjoyed swiming and eating lunch right under our umbrella pool side. We also enjoyed the walk and swiming in the protected man made bays in the area. I think there were about 4 or 5 of them along the entire resort property. The only complaint I had with our stay here was the ant infestation in our particular room. I called to have our room treated and they did come up and spray, but these ants still found a way in. I felt that this room needed to be fumigated professionally. But other than that it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - but not worthy of "JW" title”
Reviews.Author: Aspenoza
Reviews.Content: Marriott has affixed its "JW" title and given this property its highest category rating for which you would expect the best luxury, service and amenities that Marriott has to offer. I have stayed at several domestic and international Marriott resorts and while this property is nice, it is only average for a Marriott resort. If you are using points or paying a high-season rate you will likely be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place + Great Price = Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: knightmoves808
Reviews.Content: Booked reservation under special "ka'amaina" rate few days before actual check-in date. I am the Promos/Venue Manager for the Live Band that was scheduled to perform here for New Year's Eve. Things began to go wrong upon arriving an hour earlier than the 3 pm check-in time. When 3 pm came, we were forced to wait back in line only to be told our room was still not ready. Now its over 20 minutes and still nothing was heard. Finally we stand back in line and for the 3rd time we were told not ready again. This time I asked for the manager and the clerk went to get him/her. Manager never came out and the clerk instead gave us another room. Once in the room, lanai view was that of a spectacular side of the hotel's wall. Oh goody. Teach us a lesson. Went down to pool area where band was to perform 2 hours ahead of time to reserve seats closest to stage. Once arriving at performance time, seating was not as reserved so had to go back and explain our prior reservations. Finally seated properly and now we order 2 glasses of champagne. Instead we get 2 glasses of wine. Finally get the right order and about 40 minutes later we were being told to either order food or be kicked out of our seats. What?! Where did it say that? Manager by name of "Andy" arrives and belittles us in front of other guests and then boots us out. Ended up standing rest of night and at the end, bar tab was given and NO itemization or pricing. Just one big amount that we didn't realize till arriving back home. Ordered 5 drinks total and how the heck does it add up to THAT amount?? Called my credit card company and they said this place swiped the card 3 times! Only once did I ever authorize and sign for!! Bottom line, maybe we are the exception but nevertheless being that it DID happen, multiple star ratings doesn't necessarily mean the service is as up to par. Only Dean, hotel's GM and the party itself saved the experience. KnightMoves808, Inc

Reviews.Title: “Not exotic surroundings but elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: SimoneEv
Reviews.Content: As I'm looking for a new location for holiday in Hawaii I thought I should write about our September 2006 experience in this hotel. The location is very far from anything and you may think a secluded hotel will ensure a little paradise but this one doesn't. On the sides of JW Marriott there were constructions sites for two very tall buildings and the entire setting looked mass tourism. The local staff was rather dull during our 5 nights stay, I couldn't quite get it where is the Hawaii spirit they keep advertising. Liked : -the room. Very big, elegantly decorated, modern, comfortable. All housekeeping services were spotless.Big balcony-terrace facing the Ocean. (I would recommend to pay a little extra for the Ocean view, the mountain view was dry and pretty ugly) -the breakfast. Simply a perfect 5 stars hotel variety. The location of the breakfast restaurant it's splendid, next to fish pond or inside in the garden. -the view of the pool and the ocean garden illumination during the night. Spectacular. -Beds. Fantastic comfort. I guess it's a Marriott trade mark :-) Disliked: -location of the hotel. In the middle of the nowhere and once you're out on the motorway there are some nasty looking neighbourhoods around. -the beach in front of the hotel is made of ugly looking sand. Looks rather like fragmented concrete than natural sand. -no umbrellas on the beach. We had to move to the pool for shade. -there was a violent scene between a beach boy and a hotel guest. The hotel security intervened but it was a disturbing moment for all tourists. -eating in the hotel was extremelly expensive and not nicely prepared rather on the American mass-tourism fast food trend. -too close to Pearl Harbour which made for terrible noise during their daily flying routine. All in all : probably a superb stay for a congres. Dreadfull if what you're expecting it's exotic holiday in Hawaii. Now I'm looking for Maui only, Oahu it's the administrative island so no charm.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: almcall103
Reviews.Content: We took a quick trip to Hawaii for Thanksgiving with our college age kids and other family members. We have stayed in a number of very upscale hotels and we loved the understated and relaxed vibe of this place. The layout of the rooms was perfect, we have nothing bad to say. I can't understand some of the negative reviews. I think they don't get it!!

Reviews.Title: “Hated this place”
Reviews.Author: wpmSeattle
Reviews.Content: This place is really sad - Isolated with no surrounding restaurants or businesses, food at excessive prices($6.00 for a small box of raisin bran, $20.00 for the least expensive glass of wine, uninspired menu at high prices,etc), $30.00 per day to park a car, extra charges for everything(charge for helping feed the fish). They've got you trapped here. The only good things were the nice large room, a nice view of the ocean

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay...highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Hobbes13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over a long weekend and found the resort to be just beautiful and the staff extremely friendly and accommodating. Generally, I don't love O'ahu, but if that is the island you are sticking with, then you can't go wrong with this place. We had just a standard room since we were there for just the weekend. This simple room was large, clean and mostly quiet (something about the accustics of this place makes even the slightest noise below go right up the building). It featured a beautiful lanai furnished with a chaise, table and two chairs. I recommend the side overlooking the cliffy side of the ocean rather than the pool and groomed beach...I think it is a bit quieter. Yes, it's expensive, but its a resort and we just expected it. We also felt that we got our money's worth. The location is a bit isolated so it was worth it to us to dine at the hotel rather than deal with the traffic on O'ahu. The staff was also very gracious and welcoming. It made for a lovely weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: thechinesecockney
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Deluxe Ocean View Room on the 17th floor, and then moved to the 15th floor when the roof started leaking following heavy rain. The manager handled the situation extremely well, and we were offered a choice of a suite as a replacement, but opted for another ocean view room instead. Location This hotel is located on the south west coast of Oahu, about a 45 min drive from Waikiki. There is no public transport, and not easy to get to any nearby towns, restaurants etc unless you have a car, as taxis can end up becoming expensive. For the days we required a car, we hired one from the Hertz desk located at the airport, it opens up at 7am and as long as you drop the keys off with the hotel front desk prior to 11pm, you will avoid the $29 parking fee. Just pick a new car up the next day if you need another. Facilities As the resort has several large lagoons, as well as the pool, we didn't find it that busy when looking for space. There are special lounge chairs with shade available for additional charge, if you need it. The hotel provides 2 hours free rental per day of snorkel gear or kayak. The internet access is expensive, but manage to randomly find that I was able to access free wireless by the gift shop and bar entrance at the stairs. As others have pointed out, the restaurants are pretty good, but you do have limited choice (becomes more annoying the longer you stay) and can become quite expensive. You can also walk to the Ko Olina Beach Resort (15 mins) along the nice walkway, to eat at those restaurants also. They also have a larger convenience store then at the JW. One thing we found frustrating is the lack of tours/activities from the hotel, due to it's location. For example, the Pearl Harbour tour only runs once a week! They run every day from the Waikiki hotels, so be aware if you intend to use the tours. Also the spa located at the hotel was severely overpriced, costing around $200 (after you pay the tax and the 22% tip then add on top) for a 50 min massage. A round of golf also seem a bit steep. Room The room was clean and a good size. The balcony was what we liked the most, and being able to sit outside and watch the sunset. Having the sound of the ocean there is great.
