As others have stated the birds are quite noisy around sunset, but apart from that we didn't notice it, I would prefer that to the traffic, people etc that you hear from the rooms at the Waikiki hotels any day. The bathroom was probably the biggest I've seen, with two basins, bath and separate shower. There are no coffee/tea facilities which was poor, but we had refrigerators in both rooms, so not sure why the previous reviewer didn't have one. Overall, this hotel is pricey, but we felt it provided value for money. The location added to the relaxing atmosphere, the fact that you couldn't pop down to the shops or restaurants meant that we just chilled. If you want to be right in the thick of the action and tourist areas, this hotel isn't for you. The staff were excellent, and every single one was friendly and helpful. My final tip is to make sure you snorkel around the lagoons, we managed to see a sea turtle that swam around us, which was amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: millionmiletraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 2 week stay at the JW Marriott Ihilani Resort and Spa at Ko Olina. We had a deluxe ocean view room on the 15th floor. Here is a summary of our experience. Positives 1. Great location away from Waikiki, which makes for a quiet relaxing holiday. 2. Wonderful well kept hotel gardens and pathway for walking along the shore line 3. Very friendly & helpful staff that are willing to accommodate your needs 4. Large spacious rooms with great views of the ocean – it’s worth getting an ocean view room on a high floor. 5. Great beach area with fully protected lagoon for swimming, which is open to the public. Weekdays are quite, but it gets busy at the weekends, which was not a problem for us. Negatives 1. The extras really mount up. Expect to pay: - $29/ night to park a car - $12.50 for a pool side cocktail - $35/day for renting a cabana on the beach - $24/person for buffet breakfast - $100+/copuple to eat in Azul restaurant - $60+ for a bottle of wine - $12.95/day for internet access None of the above includes taxes or gratuity 2. Lack of shade on the beach. The midday sun is very hot and most people run for the limited shade. 3. Small hotel pool and surrounding area resulting in some over crowding. 4. Limited facilities in the room. No coffee maker, refrigerator, etc Marriott Rewards If you are Marriott reward member don’t expect any privileges or concessions what so ever at this hotel. I am a gold member and received zero recognition for it – not even a complimentary bottle of water at check-in. Summary If money is no object and you want a great holiday in a quiet location then I am sure you would not be disappointed if you stayed at the JW Marriott Ihilani Resort and Spa at Ko Olina. However, if you want value for money then I suggest you search around a little. From my experience there are other locations in Hawaii where you can get the same great holiday for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par with other Marriott resorts”
Reviews.Author: MachiHB
Reviews.Content: First of all - the staff is outstanding. Courteous, friendly, and professional. The problem is that the resort seems to be running on minimal budget - total lack of amenities, entertainment, so-so food, empty lobby, worn-out carpet, furniture, etc. We had a room that faced the ocean, and the sounds of the waves crashing on the rocks below was wonderful - until the birds started to flock on the trees. The noise is deafening - you cannot hear the waves. For the price one is paying, I expect to get complimentary internet, choice of USA Today and NY Times, not just the local paper, and bottled water in the room. The free coffee downstairs in the morning is very nice, tbut he prices charged for pastry is ridiculous. The best place for adults to hang out and have something nice to eat and decent drinks is the Hokelau Lounge. Unfortunately, it's only open from 6pm-12am. Final word - we did end up buying the time share. The Ko Olina Beach Club is much nicer than the Ihilani. Cannot recommend this to others. Book a room for a little more at the Ko Olina Beach Club and take the shuttle to Azul (assuming it stays open - we had a mediocre dinner) or Roy's. Enjoy a drink at the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Everything About This Resort!”
Reviews.Author: georgiagirlatheart
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the JW Marriott Ihilani Resort & Spa. The resort was everything we hoped for and more. Never have we experienced such incredible service and hospitality. We were welcomed with true Hawaiian spirit the moment we arrived. It felt like paradise and we couldn't wait to get back to the peace and tranquility of the resort after each brief sightseeing outing. We stayed on the seventh floor and had a stunning view of the ocean, lagoon and pool. The salt water pool was lovely with plenty of padded chaise lounges to relax on. The pool attendants were friendly, informative and seemed to truly enjoy interacting with the guests. We enjoyed complementary fresh pineapple served poolside each morning of our stay! The lagoon was incredibly beautiful and we spent our time snorkeling, floating and lazing around in the sun. The breakfast buffet at the Naupaka Terrace was defiantly worth the price... fresh fruit, made to order omelets (crab & shrimp please), Belgian waffles, Portuguese sausage... need I go on? We certainly enjoyed it! BUT... don't bother with the seafood buffet, it was not worth the price and left us disappointed. Do however have dinner at Roy's, five minutes down the road. The food and experience was a 10+. Be sure also to drive to the North Shore to eat at Giovanni’s shrimp truck. I know how it sounds but it is absolutely the BEST shrimp ever and a serving is very filling and reasonably priced. Visit the Arizona Memorial.... it was a powerful and introspective time. My husband served in the United States Navy and we were touched more than we can say. Overall our stay at the Ihilani was as close to paradise as we will get this side of heaven! Enjoy yourself....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lioneuge
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife went here for our honeymoon and it was magnificent! We didn't really want to be in the hustle and bustle of Waikiki since it's really crowded and noisy, so we stayed on the other side of the island. If you want peace and relaxation, this is the place to stay. They have a private lagoon, great hotel pools, and decent restaurants on-site. We actually stayed at the Marriott in Waikiki to do some shopping for two days, but aside from being walking distance to downtown Waikiki shopping area, there isn't much else that stands out about that hotel and location. The drive from the Ko Olina to downtown Wakiki doesn't take that long, so you can get all your shopping and try out the famous Waikiki beach and then head back to Ko Olina to get away from it all. We got a rental car so we could explore the island on our own and the drives to get to excursions wasn't that bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice beaches but bland hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavBach
Reviews.Content: Nice beaches but the hotel was bland and too far from island attractions

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mdrob0304
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 days in September. Great experience. Hotel is just beautiful. Staff and service was above expectations. Ocean view room was wonderful. Large balcony with great views. Grounds of hotel are what you would expect for relaxation and enjoyment. Great choice if you want quiet time. Nice walking trails around beautiful property. Pool a little small but lagoon more than makes up for this. Spend the $35 to rent beach front cabana. This was worth it. Make reservations at Roy's. The best food we had in Honolulu. Skip Chuck's Steakhouse. Too much money for the lack of quality food. Breakfast buffet was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for a wedding”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveler52
Reviews.Content: We were here for four nights in mid August. We had originally booked the room for two adults and one child, with two queen beds We went to our room and had one king bed and no where for a child to sleep. We left the room and had a delicious meal on site and had a look around the property, figuring that staff would bring a roll away in while we were out. We returned to our room to discover that our child still had no place to sleep. We went back to the desk and spoke to another person. After another trip off the property, we returned to find a very nicer than usual roll away bed in the room. It was booked as an ocean view, which is was. We were on the fifth floor, it would have been nice to have been on a higher floor for more view of the ocean. But we did get some nice sunset photos from the room. Our room overlooked the fish lagoon and gazebo. We could see the stingray swimming in the lagoon from our balcony. There were several weddings at the gazebo during our stay. The room was very large and very clean with a giant marble bathroom which had a jacuzzi tub and a large separate marble shower. The toilet was in it's own room. One complaint was that the room refrigerator was sitting in the middle of the bathroom floor and did not seem to belong there, we had to walk around it. There is a room control console near the bed that can control any light in the room, also make phone calls, with a clock and alarm too. There were even lights under the side tables of the bed which were wonderful if someone had to get up in the night. The hotel sits near a beautiful lagoon which was great for swimming and snorkeling. The hotel pool was fairly small for the number of rooms there. The only option for your vehicle onsite is the parking garage which had a $29 per night fee. There were usually three concierge in the lobby to help you plan any number of trips or tours. We had a dive trip which left right from the hotel. And there was a class for children where they were given information on the fish in the lagoon and then actually were able to wade into the lagoon and actually feed the fish and stingray by hand. A bit pricey at $30 a child who had to be accompanied by an adult at $39 if they were under 12. But we were glad to have chosen this hotel after we saw the crowds of Honolulu, but it seemed to be more for couples as a romantic getaway or for a business meeting, than for families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Relax and Forget About Exploring Oahu”
Reviews.Author: BBEXTREME
Reviews.Content: Our 7 night stay over 2008 Labor Day was excellent since we did not want to drive anywhere and just relax. This J.W. Marriott hotel is first class. Great bed, large rooms, sliding glass doors with wooden shutters which are along the length of the room to the outdoor lanai (offering a breathtaking view), excellent bathroom size with shower and tub, nice atrium in the middle with fast elevators, large hallways to the rooms, very good soundproofing, high quality design and construction, modern architecture even though the hotel is 15 year old, nice hotel layout to access pool, lobby and restaurants, and rooms have privacy from other rooms so no one can look into your room. The hotel is immaculate and kept up as much as possible. Maid service is also excellent and supplies more towels at night. The pool is not done with plaster but is all different color tiles like the pool at the Halekulani Hotel in Waikiki. It is circular and they use salt instead of chlorine. I would say the pool is extremely well taken care of and not like a typical chlorine pool. The pool water has buoyancy to it and fun to swim. It is also was not too cold but not too warn either. It was just right. They have lots of nice staff at the pool and at the beach and can give you lots of attention if you need it. All the staff was quite helpful and considerate from the lobby to the pool and the restaurants. This hotel did not seem like a typical Marriott. It was definitely much better and not so Marriott feeling. This hotel is not a Four Seasons type either. This J.W. tends to be more on the casual side and laid back which we preferred. The hotel is located on a man-made lagoon and beach. It is not on a natural beach. The natural shoreline is rocky and the surf breaks right on the rocks. Man-made lagoon is pretty large with no waves from the ocean since the reef and rocks are right at the entrance to the lagoon and block the surf from forming inside and to the lagoon beach. So it is very safe to swim, chill out and relax. The hotel is located inside the guard gated KoOlina resort which includes a golf course, 3 additional lagoons, two large towers which were the Marriott’s timeshare (Marriott Beach Club), a Condo tower, and a small golf club house that has a Roy’s restaurant. The KoOlina resort has homes along the golf course and is very upscale. It is about 20 miles from Honolulu airport and crowded Waikiki. It is a perfect get away from normal day to day living and to just relax. The location does not easily lend itself to tourist activities such as exploring the island, sightseeing, or shopping. If that is what you want, then you are better off at staying in Waikiki. The food at the restaurants was quite good. The breakfast buffet was very fresh and excellent. Food service was also very good. Dinner at the Japanese restaurant was excellent but it is closed on Tuesdays and Weds. We only ate at the hotel restaurants and one night at Roy’s. We did not have one bad meal. No complaints. The one negative was the excessive billing for parking, internet, business center, etc. They charge $12.95 per 24 hours of internet access and $29 per day for parking (there is no other parking available so you are a captive). The business center cost $.35 per page to print and $6.00 for 10 minutes of internet. Breakfast was $24 per person and dinner can run over $100 for two. Pool alcohol tropical drinks are $12. So, you need to factor that into your budget otherwise your bill at check out might surprise you. My only suggestion would be for Marriott to build the Internet and high parking fees into the room cost so you can better plan for your budget like they do on the mainland. Many folks have complained about the parking and internet since you are a captive when at the resort and we all know what happens when little of no choices are available. At the Marriott Beach Club, they have an internet kiosk where you can get 10 mins of Internet access for $1. That timeshare is within walking distance or the hotel has a free shuttle over to the timeshare Marriott. The J.W. should match what the timeshare is offering its guests. Also, many others have complained about the cost of parking. Since we didn't have a car and ate at the restaurants, I assume the Marriott GM was a happy camper. Although the J.W. suggested that guests should rent a car, the drive to Honolulu can be over an hour at certain traffic times and that is not something we wanted to experience during our vacation. Also, the freeway diamond lane requires 3 people to be in the car and these diamond lanes are closely watched by the Oahu police. Be careful. One last disappointment is the cost to get a shuttle from the airport to KoOlina. The rate is $85 one-way for two. Don’t try to prepay for a roundtrip since some of the shuttle companies are known to take advantage of tourists. I think the hotel offers a fixed price pickup and drop-off which is done by “VIP Trans”. Most shuttles have set prices for transportation from the airport into Waikiki (east) but not to KoOlina which is in the opposite direction (west) from the airport. You need to plan on this expense since the hotel does not offer courtesy shuttles outside of the KoOlina resort. All in all, we felt that our stay was very good and would recommend the resort to others.

Reviews.Title: “JW Does it Again!”
Reviews.Author: Katerina_CA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a long weekend at the JW Marriott resort in Oahu. I picked this location based on my great experience, six months earlier, at the JW property in Cancun. The Ihilani resort met and exceeded my expectations. The room was beautiful with a big balcony overlooking the ocean and a huge spotless bathroom. When i inititally checked in they put me in a building adjacent to the main hotel tower. However, these rooms are very noisy because of their proximity to the elevator which rings upon arrival and then the doors slam really loudly. The following morning i complained and was moved immediately into the main building, no excuses or questions asked. This was just one of the examples of great service at this location. Food was very good, especially the seafood buffet at the main restaurant that had an amazing selection at a very reasonable price. The breakfast buffet was also pretty good. We also tried the Japanese restaurant and liked it. They have a special early evening event when all sushi and their special cocktails are 50% off. The pool and the beach were great as well. There are plenty of beds available and we never had trouble finding a vacant spot. The lagoon is a great place to swim and is full of amazing tropical fish. The hotel rents out snorkeling equipment. Now, a couple of complaints. The hotel does not provide any coffee or tea making equipment in the room; nor do they have mini bars. This is very surprising for a property of their class. Perhaps they want people to go down and spend money at the restaurants. Another thing that was missing - bathrobes. Also very surprising. Of course these minor things did not spoil our vacation in any way. We had a great time. We would definitely come back to this place. Hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “So Sad to Leave this Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TSprinks
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Ihilani for the first part of our honeymoon. We could not have been more pleased with our experience. Every person we dealt with was super-friendly and helpful, especially the valets. The hotel grounds are beautifully done (very cool fish, ray, and shark pools) and the lagoons are perfect for swimming. The pool/hot tub area is very nice, but we didn't get to use it much. (The 10:00 pm closing time is strictly enforced, but we spent our days out and about.) The hotel lobby is open to the outside and a lovely breeze comes through. At check in (which was very pleasant), we were given a room on the 17th floor, which had an absolutely stunning ocean/sunset view. Being so far up (and away from the pool area), we got no noise from down below. The room was very comfortable with a sitting area and a "glamour" bath with separate vanities, a soaking tub, and a separate glass shower. The beds are really comfortable with lots of extra pillows. I did note that the layout of the room was a bit awkward in that you didn't have a good view of the TV from either the bed or the sitting area, but who goes to Hawaii to watch TV anyway? This was not a problem to us at all. We dined in two of the three onsite restaurants. At the Japanese one, we had the dinner buffet which included shrimp, steak, and several varieties of sushi and sashimi. The price tag is steep ($45/person) but its all you can eat, its delicious sushi, and its Hawaii so we went with it anyway. We had the breakfast buffet at the poolside Naupaka Terrace twice. This was outstanding. Again the price is high for breakfast ($25/person), but we filled up there and skipped lunch those days, so it ended up being an okay deal. They have every breakfast food you can think of and then some and its all very fresh and tasty. We weren't bothered at all by the birds. Hello, its an open air restaurant! Of course there are birds!! We had dinner there one night as well and the prices are fairly reasonable ($13 for a tasty chicken sandwich and fries.) The other restaurant, Azul, seemed to be a little more upscale and the menu sounded heavenly, but we didn't get to try it. The thing we most enjoyed about the Ihilani was its location. We wanted to see Oahu without having to deal with the hustle and bustle of Honolulu and Waikiki, so this hotel was just the ticket. Depending on traffic, it seemed to be about 30 minutes to an hour from Honolulu, but its so calm and serene we felt we were a world away. Its certainly close enough that you can drive to Honolulu for dinner if you choose, but if you want to be steps away from the nightlife, this is not the place for you. (We drove into Honolulu for a fantastic dinner at Alan Wong's....highly recommend!!) Pearl Harbor was about a 35 minute drive from the hotel early in the morning. If we had to pick one negative thing about this hotel, it would be the cost. There's a daily resort fee and internet usage is not included here. There is no self-park option, only valet, so you end up spending a lot in tips on top of everything else. The restaurants are pricey, and there aren't other options nearby (at least that we found.) But, from what we could tell, prices are fairly typical for Hawaii and we were prepared for that, so it certainly did not hamper our enjoyment of this fabulous resort. We definitely want to come back to Oahu and stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Odiesback
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Hawaii after a week at the JW Ihilani. We had a wonderful time. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was clean and everything was in working order. We went with our two year old daughter and this was a perfect choice for small kids. Her first time in the water was great. Very relaxing. Every time we venture out to Honolulu it was a nightmare. Too crowed, intersections have no street name signs. Glad we did not stay in Waikiki. The Paradise Cove Luau is just next door. Very convenient. The only downer: The restaurants are extremely overpriced for the quality of the food they offer. Not worth it. Another thing: the rails on the hallways are too low in my opinion. I had vertigo every time I went out for the elevator. All in all, I would strongly recommend this resort if you want peace in Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “ahhhh relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Star2515
Reviews.Content: After 3 days at the Outrigger, the JW was a relaxing change. Not that we didn't like the Outrigger, but when you think Hawaii this is more like it. I've read past reviews that say the JW charges for everything, however I didn't notice a difference compared to the Outrigger. if anything they were less charge happy. Water and fresh pineapple was served free at the pool and chairs on the beach were first come first serve. Rooms were clean and large with a tub and a shower. We enjoyed this hotel very much and would go back again. Our only complaint would be the time it took the valet to get our car...guess the Outrigger spoiled us there.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievablely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: sgdc
Reviews.Content: We loved the Ihilani - it's remote location offered us a perfect end to our honeymoon... away from Honolulu and Waikiki, we could enjoy the calm surf, wonderful grounds, and lull around on the hammocks with the ocean breeze serenading us. The staff was exceptional and very helpful, they upgraded us to this wonderful suite with a balcony that overlooked the grounds, and the ocean , where we enjoyed a sunset room service dinner one of our nights. While remote, it took us very little time to get to the other parts of the island, and we enjoyed several day trips to waikiki, north shore, around the leeward side of the island, and to the various tourist destinations, just a terrific terrific stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing, quiet, but lacking a bit on the "Aloha Spirit"”
Reviews.Author: 2vacation35
Reviews.Content: My wife, and two children (6 &4) just returned from a 7 day stay at the Marriott Ihilani. While we still strongly prefer vacationing in Maui or Kauai, this property on Oahu was just what we were looking for in terms of beauty, relaxation, diverse activities, and amenities. The hotel is in a secluded area on the west side of the island, 25 minutes from the airport and 35 minutes to Waikiki. The property is settled on 4 beautiful coves that provide calm beaches, good snorkeling, and several family friendly options for water activities (free to guests). The pool is nice and shallow throughout - good for floating and kids. The rooms were quite large and the views of the ocean, coves, mountains, sunset, and stars was fantastic. Our first room had a very loud A/C unit (hotel was completely remodeled) and was infested with tiny ants. We complained to the hotel staff several times. After 3 nights of "fixing" the situation, my wife and children were covered in nasty ant bites. Finally, the hotel manager moved our room to a jr. suite. No problems in this room, and it was very large (approx. 1,000 sq feet). In terms of food at the hotel, the breakfast buffet was excellent but pricey ($28 for adults) with lots of choices. More local food would have been interesting. Azul, the most formal restaurant at the hotel, was fantastic in terms of food, atmosphere (great sunset), and service. This was my favorite meal of the trip, slightly ahead of Alan Wong's! My wife would disagree. The sushi restaurant was disappointing and only open a few nights. The bar was nice, but had a very limited food menu and only had entertainment (great local band!) on Friday and Saturday nights. Roy's fish restaurant was a few blocks away, and it was very good and had much different selections than the Roy's in the states. The hotel had excellent fitness programs that were free of charge. We did yoga and stretching on the beach, aqua jogged in the cove, and morning fitness walks. The instructors were very friendly and the class sizes were very small. My wife had a massage at the spa, which she enjoyed. There is a huge fitness center attached to the hotel, but we did not use it, as we wanted to be outside. The hotel has several very large pools for fish that are beautiful and kept the kids entertained for hours. One pool contained hammer head sharks and a reef tip shark. Another contained rays that ranged from small to enormous. The other contained tropical fish. For $30 each, my children were able to feed all of the fish, including the sharks. This was a highlight for the kids, as the instructor was very knowledgeable and the fish were hungry. The only reason that I did not rate it as "Excellent" was that the service from the hotel staff was only fair. It seemed that few people wanted to go the extra mile when we asked for help or information. It was surprising, as I expected to get much more of the "Aloha" spirit that they always sell. Much of the staff seemed bothered by having to assist. I should note that the pool, beach, and fitness was excellent. Last comments: We loved the "Ko-Olina Cat" sunset sail cruise. The boat, staff, and entire experience was perfect! 40 dolphins were swimming right off the tip of the boat. They offer a snorkeling event as well, and people were raving about it. Wish we had done that! We did a swim with the dolphins snorkeling event with a different company that was OK. Boat was power only/no sail, too crowded and obnoxious tourists (grabbing the sea turtles and kicking in the water which frightened the dolphins away) The Dole Plantation is a very over-rated tourist trap. Wish we had skipped that!! The Luau at the beach next to the JW Marriott was just OK. The kids liked it, but it was too commercial for adults. Not sure if there is a better option.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: TorontoDragon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ihilani for a week this July. The rooms are spacious, the views are gorgeous and the atmosphere of the actual Ihilani is wonderful. A few complaints though - firstly there is no refrigerator in the rooms. We were travelling with a 6 month old baby and this was very difficult. When we asked for one, we were put on a waiting list for nearly 2 days. When I got very upset and told them I had a baby in the room, one magically appeared within 10 mins. The pool area is also phenomenal - lots of sun chairs and great sized pool. Bar and wait staff were all very rude though ... it justtook away from the trip. you expect aloha when in Hawaii. I will say that the Valet guys were exceptional - they made up for the rest of the staff. Finally you have to pay extra for everything. The rooms are not cheap to start with - you still have to pay for internet ($12/day), use of beach chairs ($35/day) (we tried to use our own sun shade with the baby and were abused by the security guards), and high parking tariffs ($29/day) (this place is not even in Waikiki so there is plenty of room for parking). We loved being away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki and the resort was stunning - I just would have loved to have better service. Would I go back? - probably.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PAW1208
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this "resort" for our honeymoon based on our past (very positive) experiences with JW resorts. Unfortunately, this resort was a huge disappointment--not even close to the quality of accommodations and service that is typically associated with JW Resorts. We booked an ocean view room, and were not given one (yet were charged for it). We were refused when we asked to see a manager, and spent an hour arguing with the front desk before getting into the room we were paying for. The lights in the room weren't working, so we spent the first night of our honeymoon with multiple maintenance personnel coming in and out to "fix" the lights (which they were unable to completely fix). We also had red fire ants in our room--we both were bitten on several occasions, even after they told us they had sprayed twice and taken care of the problem. The service was awful, the staff rude. The "premier" restaurant was horribly overpriced, with poor food (overcooked shrimp and vegetables, other items cold by the time they were served) and a pitiful wine list (only 4 reds to choose from). We also rented a car from the Hertz counter in the lobby, and when we showed up to pick-up our car, the car was there, but they couldn't "give" it to us. So, again, we spent an hour just to get a car for the day. We were scheduled to stay at this resort for 9 nights, however, after such an awful experience, we checked out early and moved to the W in Waikiki. For the quality of service and the accommodations, we didn not believe this hotel to be worth the price tag. The quality of the service was lower than what we have recieved at standard full-service Marriott hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ihilani”
Reviews.Author: df12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott Ihilani Resort to spend some family time together before a week of soccer games. From the moment the valet opened our car doors we felt the spirit of "Aloha". We checked in expecting to get one of the regular rooms, but instead the front desk clerk upgraded us to one of the suites with a wraparound lanai. What a delightful surprise! We soon met our housekeeper and she asked if we had any special requests. We asked for an endless supply of towels (since we take lots of them after each outing) and a cooler full of ice. She took care of us daily without fail. The activities staff were very helpful in telling us where to snorkel (other than the lagoons) and giving us complimentary use of the kayaks. The lagoons are a great place to learn to snorkel and a safe place for the little ones to swim. We especially love them because they are not crowded like in Waikiki. We will be back to Ko Olina because it is perfect at the moment. We are dreading the day when Disney and the other resorts are built nearby bringing the crowds with them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: TizzieBelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first part of our honeymoon. Be prepared for an expensive stay!! It did not matter though as you get what you pay for. We had booked an ocean front room but they upgraded us to a ocean front junior suite which was massive. It was great to have so much space and we had two massive wardrobes and two sinks, double shower and a huge bath tub. The breakfast was excellent and there is so much choice - it is all very pricey but where else can you go when everything is driving distance away? Staff are friendly and the hotel is immaculately clean. We had dinner here three times. We felt that Azul was overpriced and was not worth paying the money for. Their other restaurant which was the one used for breakfast was far far better. The quality of food surpassed that of Azul. The fish dishes were better and the staff seemed friendlier. It is best to visit that restaurant a bit later if you want to avoid the rush. We had amazing steaks in their "not so posh" restaurant and everything was fresh and served quickly. It is worth staying here rather than some of the more touristy areas. We visited Waikiki and stayed for about an hour - alll I can say is yuck. It is full of people (loud drunk people) you can't walk on the beach as there are too many people and it is just so crowded. stay at the Ihilani, it is expensive but I am so glad that we stayed away from grotty Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway on West Oahu!”
Reviews.Author: hoohiki
Reviews.Content: My idea of a perfect getaway is first and foremost staying at a hotel or resort where relaxation is the rule. I found this idyllic spot - the Ihilani Resort. It was away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki and downtown Honolulu. It is located on the west side of Oahu, 20 minutes away from Honolulu airport and 45 minutes away from the world famous surfing locale, Banzai Pipeline. The resort grounds has 4 different swimming lagoon areas, a hammerhead shark and sting ray pool, beach just outside the hotel doors, and a beautiful golf course. The tide pools filled with sea creatures are on private property adjacent to the hotel, but many guests have no problem exploring the area. In fact, a kids camp, which is basically a babysitting service, take kids to the tidepools to learn about the fish and other sea critters found on the reef and tidepools. Kayaks, snorkeling gear, and surfboards can be rented on the beachshore. The beach itself is not overly crowded as you would find in Waikiki. The lagoon is perfect for early morning swims and safe for children because the outside breakers prevent the strong currents from coming in. The swimming pool at the hotel is on the smaller side compared to some of the pools at other resorts on the outer islands, but it's very clean and doesn't seem crowded. Very nice! There are 3 options for the rooms - Garden view, Ocean view, Ocean front. We stayed at an Ocean view roon and it was breathtaking. From our balcomny, we had a great view of the beach, tidepools, the garden with the sharks and sting rays, and the Waianae mountain range. We had 2 double beds, a sitting area, a bathroon with a large tub and a shower, and his and hers sinks. The only problem we had was with a loose shower knob that at times did not allow us to have hot water. Also, I wish a small refrigerator was included in the room. (We needed to fill up our ice bucket with ice quite often for our baby's milk.) The room was clean without the smell of smoke, and that's throughout the hotel. The staff, housekeeping, concierge, bell service, dining room hosts and servers were very friendly and helpful. The parking was horrendous, charging us $29.00 per night. The overall ambience despite the hotel being 90% occupied at the time we stayed in the peak of summer, was a relaxing, care-free, no-worries feeling. We weren't rushed, no lines to fight through, and we faced no traffic when driving to the Northshore, the countryside of Oahu. Now that's a perfect getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible vacation at the JW Marriott Ihilani”
Reviews.Author: ErinPhoenix_AZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 6 night stay at the Ihilani. We had an incredible time! I am surprised to read a few reviews stating that the staff was not friendly. We had an absolutely excellent experience with every staff member there - from the valet attendants, front desk staff, to servers at the restaurants. We were so happy with the servers at the Pool Grill, we left a fat tip on our last day. Everyone was super helpful! I am on a medication that needs to be refrigerated, so they put a mini-fridge in our room and on our last day, they kept my medication in their personal fridge behind the front desk - very accomodating! In my thinking, if you treat the staff with respect, they will return the favor. My husband is a 'Gold' status with Marriott, so we have stayed at plenty of Marriott's and this one was just as nice as any other. We had an ocean view room on the 10th floor with amazing views of the lagoon/pool area. The bed was perfect, just like the other Marriott's we have stayed at. This one might not be as fancy as some of the other JW's, but you're in Hawaii! This is the place to relax and just chill. Some ideas for where to eat if you want to get out of the Ko Olina area - I would definitely recommend getting a car to get out and explore the island - it is beautiful. We ate at the hotel only one night. You have got to try Alan Wong's in Honolulu - our best meal of the trip. It is written up as one of Oahu's best restaurants, and with good reason. Also, up in Haleiwa on the North Shore, Haleiwa Joe's is really good for fresh fish and prime rib. Thanks to the bartenders at Ihilani for telling us about that place! Things to do - I highly recommend the Wild Side Specialty Tours in Waianae for snorkeling with wild spinner dolphins - an incredible experience. A marine biologist leads the trip, and they limit the amount of people to 15, so you are always guaranteed a small group. Also, definitely go on a drive to the North Shore - it is beautiful and fun to check out all the surfing beaches (even though they are super calm in the summer). The town of Haleiwa is great - cute, laid back, and fun little shops. We stood in line forever at Matsumoto's for the shave ice - but you've got to -it is awesome! We also did kayaking in Kailua - on the Windward side of the island. Very neat - could see sea turtles right underneath you while skimming across the water. This was my 4th trip to Hawaii and definitely my favorite. I had stayed on Waikiki Beach years ago and this was SO much better. We barely went down there - too many people and way too touristy. We have nothing but positive things to say about the Marriott. It is on the expensive side, but I would think most people realize that if they know anything about Marriott, specifically the JW's. It's a vacation, isn't that when you are supposed to splurge a little??? My last recommendation - get out and explore! The Marriott is wonderful, but the island itself is fantastic - beautiful countryside, hiking spots, etc. There is so much more to Oahu than Waikiki Beach, and that is just another reason why staying at the JW Marriott is a perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: deborahj62
Reviews.Content: I received an offer in the mail from Marriott to visit Ko Olina Beach Club resort, the adjoining property to this hotel. It was for a very good rate - better than I could've gotten commonly - and included a rental car. They didn't care if I brought my friend instead of my husband. This was a "girls' retreat" so they placed us in the hotel instead of the resort property, in a very nice, large room with 2 beds. The cost of the entire 5-night package equaled about what the cost of 2 nights of the Ihilani room cost would've been. The whole property was lovely and there was absolutely no sales pressure. We don't golf, but the golf course looked high-quality, and we enjoyed the ambiance of Roy's overlooking the green. We used the spa while we were there and really enjoyed it as well. The swimming pool in both the hotel and the spa's lap pool are saltwater, which was a nice change from chlorinated pools. All staff we interacted with were very attentive and not just superficially so. They did not discriminate against "special offer" guests versus regular guests like some places. In fact the conceirge went "above and beyond" because I'd shipped some snorkel gear ahead of time that never arrived till after we'd already left, and she arranged for it to be returned to my home. It is a bit off the beaten path, but we had a great time, and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: stear003
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week for our honeymoon. We stayed on the 7th floor and had a corner, ocean-front room overlooking the lagoon (see photo for view). We could lay in bed and see the ocean...perfect! Every night we slept with the doors open and listened to the waves. The room was very large and perfect size for a week's stay. Bed was comfy and the bathroom was huge! Nicely kept up. (see photos) We are both in our mid-twenties but never felt out of place. We were treated with respect and everyone was very friendly and eager to answer any questions. We rented a car and got out just about every day to go on day trips. The hotel was great with giving us directions when needed. We explored the other lagoons and chilled out by the pool whenever we came back from a day out. The lagoons were a bit cloudy but nice and calm for relaxing. The pool was never too crowded and we always got a lounge chair. Grounds were well maintained. We ate at the hotel a few times: first night there we ordered room service and they set it up very nicely on our lanai with candles, etc. There was a delay in getting someone to come back to get the table, etc. but nothing to get worked up about! We also ate in the Naupaka Terrace for lunch and dinner. As a side note: they have the same items on the menu as the poolside grill but the poolside grill was $3-4 more per entree! The Terrace is overlooking the pool and outdoor/open air so go figure. The drinks were outrageously priced ($12.50/ cocktail) so we only splurged a few times. We ate at Roy's one night and that was the best meal we had on our whole trip! (we ate at Alan Wong's our last night...so there was comparison) Overall, I would recommend this hotel...just be prepared to spend your money! It was exactly what I dreamed of for a perfect honeymoon. Very relaxed and romantic. Definitely rent a car and explore the island. It is breathtaking!!

Reviews.Title: “So beautiful, but felt slightly out of place”
Reviews.Author: Tal100
Reviews.Content: We chose the Ihilani because we wanted a place near civilization, but not smack in the middle of the chaos and noise of Waikiki. We like to go to Hawaii to relax, so the beach scene? Not our thing. We chose the Ihilani over the Kahala because it had better rooms for the price, though I think we may try the Kahala next time. First off, the room was absolutely divine. Perhaps just a smidge on the small side for the price, but otherwise--in perfect condition, well-maintained, tastefully decorated, etc. We were fortunate to get a deluxe room on the 17th (highest) floor, with an absolutely gorgeous view of the lagoon. We didn't have sunrise or sunset views, which was a pity, but it was lovely anyway. It was also lovely to close just the screen door every night and have the sound of the waves sing us to sleep. It was also nice to have padded furniture, including a lounge chair, on our lanai. We ate most of our meals at the Naupaka Terrace, their cafe. Although cafe is really a misnomer for it, as this was some of the best food I've ever had. I mean EVER. Even some of the fanciest tablecloth restaurants around couldn't rival them for sheer food quality. I was seriously impressed. I'm not a food snob (one of our meals that week came from Burger King and another from Denny's, so there) but I do know when someone knows what they're doing with the basics. And that chef KNEW. Wow. We didn't ever get to Azul, their higher-end place, but I suspect we may have had to have been carted out of there on stretchers if we did, after going catatonic from food heaven. Also very cool is their little man-made lagoon (one of four at the Ko Olina resort.) It's perfectly designed so there are next to no waves, and only a few small sea critters floating around. Some folks even had their toddlers there, showing them the cute little blue crabs that live on the rocks near the breakwater. Now, for the downsides (and there are some, sadly.) First of all, the location is definitely a little odd. The resort is on the dry, desert-like leeward side of the island, which means it's a chunk of artificially created oasis in the middle of scrub. It's also just down the beach from a major chemical processing plant and port. Kind of cool if you like watching frieghters being guided in by tugboats, but kind of ugly if you'd rather not see chemical mixing tanks on your otherwise-beautiful horizon. Also, the resort--primarily centered around the Ko Olina golf course, along with the Ihilani and the Marriott timeshare just down the road--does tend to cater to a certain kind of...hmm... upscale, conservative sort of crowd. The hubster and I are financially comfortable, but we're also somewhat on the crunchy liberal and low-BS side too, and at times, I kind of felt a bit out of place in my Target shoes among the Chanel bags and designer polo shirts. We aren't trashy slobs or anything, just perhaps a little less gated-community sorts than most of those frequenting the place. We would never, for instance, have behaved like the entitled wench who berated (loudly) the restaurant's host for not seating her whiny brood with a water view. (Clearly, they were the only customers that mattered in the place!) I suppose the best way to explain this issue is to point out that the hotel has a small network of ponds/lagoons on property, with a collection of fish and a few small sharks and stingrays. Not necessarily unusual for resorts like this, but in this one, it really looked like the poor creatures just weren't at all happy in their artificial environment. The stingrays, for instance, had had their barbs amputated, and one of them looked like the stump was infected and irritated. Poor guy. Overall, it seemed like they weren't being taken care of in an animal conservation sort of sense, they were just there in a Let's Dominate Wildlife! sort of way. A small issue, to be sure, given the overall quality of the place, but it did kind of gnaw at the back of my mind. If one can overlook these sorts of issues (and I mostly could) it's a terrific place. Great customer service, great rooms and a great location if you're not into the nutty city life thing. Do definitely rent a car, though, because you'll probably want to go into Kapolei if you want to grab snacks or do other sorts of shopping or off-property meals. Also, one last note: I highly recommend doing the wildlife-watching boat tours offered by Wildside Eco-Adventures, which is just down the road about 20 minutes or so from the resort. What an absolute blast, and the staff were so respectful of the animals. It was the highlight of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, but nice lagoon”
Reviews.Author: kingsandi
Reviews.Content: In June 2008, I stayed with my family for a week. This was my second go around at Ko Olina. The first time was at the Marriott’s Ko Olina Beach Club. I don’t want to bore you with details of my travel experience, but I have elite status with all major hotel chains. I travel a great deal, and I’m only writing this review, because if I was going to bring my family to the Ihilani, I would want to know these details. I wouldn’t be so critical of a hotel in general, except this one advertises itself as a high-end resort/hotel. First the positive: JW Marriott is on a great location. It has fantastic semi-private lagoons. In general, it’s a modern hotel with good common areas including a nice pool. (Nothing fancy but the pool is clean and does the job) It has nice fish ponds and a separate pond for sting rays and sharks. It also has good restaurants. Rooms were above-average sized and well appointed (bit out-dated) with all the basic necessities of a 4 star hotel. (If you think this is a 5-star, you’re out of your mind) Fitness center missed a couple of specialized equipment, but had everything I needed. It has a separate lap pool for the swimmers. I own timeshare with Marriott and typically stay at the hotel portion between 40-60 nights per year. I have trouble believing a Marriott category 7 hotel can be operated in this fashion. Room: As soon as I entered the room, it hit me: A strange and unforgettable odor. It’s a cross between fresh paint and cat urine, more the latter. We aired the room overnight to no avail. They granted us a room change, but the new room had the same problem albeit to a lesser extent. I later discovered it was in the air conditioning. Both rooms were extremely dirty. Dirt/dust everywhere, hairs (not ours) on the bathroom floors and entrance, and food particles in plain sight. Both rooms were the same. Some areas of the rooms look like they haven’t been clean in years. Bugs!!! I stayed a week in Kauai before coming here, but didn’t have any insect problems while staying at an outdoor resort. JW is an enclosed hotel, and we were on a high floor. We had silverfish, mosquitos, gnats of varing size and flies. The problem got so bad, I went to the local Wal-Mart for an insect candle. Our fourth night, we discovered a huge trail of sugar ants from the balcony to the opposite end of the room. We found ants in the bedding and other furniture. When ants are found on the 14th floor, you have to suspect the problem is not localized. Parking: They charged me $30.37 per night. I know what you’re thinking...you could always do without a car or not stay there. True...However, when I made my reservation, my confirmation email showed a parking fee of $19/night. In a matter of two months, they raised $10. Second, this hotel is in a rather remote location, you really can’t do without a car when you’re with your family. Since they’re the only game in town, you have to pay the extortion. I’ll gladly pay a parking fee which is a result of supply and demand. This is something very different. JW has a relatively large parking structure with lots of empty slots. For the money, stay at the Marriott’s Ko Olina Beach Club. One last thing, my gold status didn’t mean anything at this hotel. I couldn’t even get a late checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but they nickle and dime you on EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: BlueMan1077
Reviews.Content: Pros – Beautiful rooms, wonderful view from our floor (11). Service for everything was great, except that everything came with a price and a tip. The shark, fish and ray pool was nice and they even had an interactive session for $30. Beach access was great to the private calm lagoon. Plenty of chairs and was never very busy. Cabana rentals were available for $35/day, but we just opted for an umbrella and chairs. The restaurants served great food, but the prices were a bit high. The prime rib was AMAZING!! Room service was VERY fast, but again kind of pricey. Complimentary snorkel/fin, kayak and hammock boat rental for 1 hour a day was nice. Cons - Everything costs extra. You'd think for spending over $500/night you'd get to park your car or access the internet for free. Parking is $30/day for both self parking and valet. Internet is an additional $13/day. $100/day extra for an ocean view room. Tips are somewhat expected for everything. We took advantage of the complimentary hammock boat rental and when I signed the form for the rental the staff made sure they pointed out the “gratuity” line on the form for their help in renting the equipment. Noise from the pool late at night might be a bit much for some, but eliminating it was as simple as closing your sliding doors. The spa is very expensive and didn’t seem worth it. Tennis is available, but again for another price. The pool is small, but I don’t think anyone booked the hotel for the pool. The bar at the pool is a nice touch, but drinks are SOOO expensive. An 8 oz pina colada (or any of their other mixed drinks) is $12.50, plus once again the bar/wait staff expects to be tipped. Overall – I don’t think we’d stay here again, despite the good service and good food. The price, tip expectations and nickle and diming that takes place was way too much for us.

Reviews.Title: “Lost it's luster”
Reviews.Author: regularguy2007
Reviews.Content: I'll get to the point. It was my honeymoon. I called several months in advance to find out if they could guarantee me a deluxe ocean view room overlooking the pool. I wanted that view because I've stayed at the Ihilani twice before, and found out that rooms that face north west get exposed to a spot next to the hotel that often has parties during the day and sometimes late at night, playing loud music. I called the hotel directly and they said they could guarantee the deluxe ocean view I wanted if made in advance. So when I had my dates ready I called reservations and specifically told them the view I wanted. I told them it was my honeymoon and that I knew that there was loud music on the north west side of the hotel. They said they could do it and got even more specific by asking what floor I wanted. I told them the 7th would be fine. I called the hotel directly again about a week later to verify the reservation (though in fairness I don't recall if I again mentioned the specific view I wanted). This was done 3-4 months in advance of my trip. For $417 a night I wanted the same spectacular view I had had in the past. I could step onto the balcony and see the 4 lagoons south of the hotel, and the room was private. Nobody could see into my room from another balcony so I could lay on the bed in my underwear with the windows open getting that awesome ocean breeze. When I got to my room, and realized it was not overlooking the pool, but instead faced north west, I called the front desk. They told me there were no deluxe ocean view rooms available overlooking the pool with a king bed....only twin beds. Plus, when I told them about my reservation they said there was nothing in the notes of my reservation indicating the view I wanted. So then I called the same number that was on the email from my reservation, and had them look up my reservation. They said there was no mention of my request overlooking pool, and then said that if I had requested the reservation specialist to 'put my request in the notes' then they would have. I said how am I supposed to know that I have to specifically tell them to put my request in the notes. The woman just said that some reservation specialists will just do it on their own, but some won't unless you ask them to. LAME!!! So for two nights I heard drumming and singing, one until 10pm. And during the day their was a party. Plus the guy next door came out on his balcony and turned around and looked right into our room where my wife and I were laying. The food at the hotel was excellent. The room was very nice except for the location. The phone system didn't work correctly, so even after I retrieved a phone message, it kept blinking that I had a message. I called the front desk twice and they deleted the message, but it kept blinking so I just left it. The mini fridge was empty and barely cool which made me feel like they were trying to do things on the cheap. The other times I stayed there, it was stocked with drinks and candy bars, etc. The pool was great. The staff well trained and friendly, especially the concierges. bottom line: when I go to paradise and pay $417 + 30 (room tax) + 20 (G.E. tax) + 19 (parking tax) = $486 a day, I expect more. I'll try another place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, lovely retreat”
Reviews.Author: SheaG
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for two nights at the lovely Ihilani resort. It was a nice surprise! This is a solid four-star property in a truly great, quiet location. Good-size rooms, spectacular bathrooms, nice views, and decent service. The lagoons are great for kids and adults. Some complain about the remote location of this hotel, but for me, that is the charm. This is not a typical Oahu hotel. There are lots of things to keep you occoupied, but they are of the more solitary variety. Walking/jogging paths, secluded beaches, nice golf course. I imagine that during holidays and/or the high season there are lots of screaming kids. But during mid-week, low-season, it was heaven. The breakfast buffet was included with our ocena view room rate, and it was very good with lots of variety. We ate at Azul, the on-site Italian place, one night, and Roy's just across the street the other night. Both were very good. The pool is a low point. Small, with loud music playing around the bar/pool area. But with the beach and lagoon areas, who wants to be by the pool anyway? We definitely plan to return and take the kids. This is a really good place for a break from Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View.. but lacking in service”
Reviews.Author: kcly
Reviews.Content: You might want to think twice about making the 50 minute drive away from town for the mediocre service levels at this resort. At the start of our stay the agent who checked us in was very cold and never looked up once during the minute check in process- nor did he review any of the details of our room. I found it a little strange that I had to ask the pertinent questions about our room. He didn't even ask for the other person's name that was staying with me. Goes to show how much they value the hotel's integrity when it comes to security of the property? I also while having lunch near the pool it was hard to enjoy my salad while having to smell spoiled juice and swat fruit flies that were coming from the bar. To cut down our wait time for our valet parked car we called ahead to ask if it would be brought out-only to be told by the clerk to just come down and wait. While we waited over five minutes for our car. While we waited we could over hear the clerks gossiping and chewing on gum. There were no other cars or guests waiting for their cars so I can't imagine why a 4 star hotel wouldn't offer a more efficient valet service. We've stayed at the Kahala were the car is always waiting for us upon request and the valet and their clerks makes conversation with us instead of their co-workers. The best part of our stay was watching the fish feeding from our balcony. At least their is some culture that is trying to be integrated into the resort. Overall a property as secluded as this one needs to "step it up" a few knotches to expect people to leave the comforts of Kahala for a property that will give you below average service.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: gorams
Reviews.Content: Just beautiful. Beach is very calm. No waves for boogie boarding - this was something I wish I would have known ahead of time because my teenager likes to boogie board - however, I loved the calm waters. The beach offers rentals of chairs and water toys. Good snorkeling right there in the cove. Largest balcony of any hotel I have stayed at. I am a travel agent and have been sent to several hotels all over the world and this by far is the largest "standard" room and balcony. Very spacious and the views are spectacular. Prices for meals are very high. Take the 10 minute drive into town and there are several restaraunts that offer good value. We were able to walk to the Paradise Cove Luau. Enjoyed the show.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisInSC
Reviews.Content: This property is all-around excellent. Immaculately clean, I don't think I saw a spec of dust ANYWHERE at any time. Perfect sunset view, very quiet and relaxing. Personnel: Front Desk -- Friendly, efficient. What you expect at a 5-star resort Chambermaid -- Supernice. My wife and I knew her by name within 3 days. Always offering to go get things etc. Valet -- Excellent. Jeep always brought around in 2 minutes or less. Spent time talking with us, giving us suggestions and directions. Concierge -- Can't be topped. My wife, being the impulsive one, went down one afternoon to get help with setting up a 'romantic surprise' for me when we got back from dinner. Un-flipping-believable what the concierge put together in 3 hours. Waitstaff/Bartenders -- Friendly, efficient. What you expect at a 5-star resort Facilities -- Room -- perfect. quiet, private, great view and affordable (in Oahu terms) Lobby/Common areas -- elegant, tasteful, spotless. A bit dull and lacking in character though. This is my biggest complaint, so you can see that this stay went well. Pool -- Again, spotless. Well designed so that you felt connected to the rest of the resort, but not 'in the middle' of it. Beach -- Great lagoons, a lot of beach-per-person. This definitely IS NOT Waikiki. GREAT snorkeling. I saw more marine life here than I did SCUBA diving. Food/Dining -- Sushi bar is great. My wife and I don't eat shellfish, so we talked with the waitress (Hi Belinda!) and the chef for a while and they custom made a huge platter of sushi for us. Also took some notes and did some custom things on the Friday night buffet just for us. Breakfast buffet was great. ALOT to choose from. Ate there 4 times and never had the same thing twice There were a couple of other places there, can't remember them off the top of my head. But everything was excellent. Spa was the best we've been to at any price. NOTE: This is on the west side of the island in 'Ko Olina'. It's away from Honolulu/Waikiki. If you want to be in the middle of the nightlife, this isn't for you. This is quiet, relaxing, and pampering. Great for single couples, retirees, honeymooners and the like. Kids are certainly welcome, but they'll get bored and fidgety quickly. Also note that Disney is planning on putting up a bunch of resorts in this area. If you want the tranquility, go in the next couple of years.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful but long way from the action”
Reviews.Author: aussieNewYork
Reviews.Content: We arrived and hired a car as a hertz gold member, perhaps the worst car rental facility i have used. Arrived at 4 pm and traffic to hotel was like peak hour in ny. We arrived at hotel in 45 minutes and it is a beautiful spot. Clean and peaceful. Gorgeous views and had one of the biggest rooms in my life on deluxe room. pool is small but ok, beach is nice. We went to pearl harbour, i thought it would be easier than from downtown. No sir, massive traffic at 6.15 am and tough time finding pearl harbour, but just misread instructions. Golf course looked nice but not sure who is attracted to this place. We stayed one night on way from the big island and other family stayed one more night and got a taxi to airport on sat morning and still cost $95. Nice place and great views, had fun lake with baby sharks and huge stingray swimming around but not sure why i would stay here a week.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: AEKBS
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Great restaurants, friendly service, nice atmosphere, clean rooms, nice views, great bathrooms, fantastic spa! The hotel is quite a distance from Waikiki, so if you're hoping to hit the beaches of Waikiki and do other Oahu-tourist activities, this isn't the hotel for you. This is more of a destination hotel, and it's not really close to anything, but that's exactly what we wanted, so it was perfect for us. The spa was truly excellent, and I plan on returning just for the spa! There are many activities scheduled for kids, so this resort is a good option for families traveling with small children. The beach is lovely and not crowded. The room was very quiet--we did not hear any outside noise. Our room had a lovely view from its spacious lanai. The bathroom was spacious, well-lit, and comfortable, with a deep bathtub just begging for a bubble bath! Bathrobes are provided in the room, if you need them. The only downside to the hotel is that the pool does not provide sunblock, as many other higher-end resorts do. If you forgot to bring your own sunblock, it's quite a walk to the one shop that sells it. So remember to bring your own sunblock to the pool!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT~! would definitely go back again. nice location”
Reviews.Author: skiColorado_92
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week's stay in April at the JW. This was one of the best vacations we have ever had. Perfect location, but close enough to Honolulu if you want to see WWII attractions and dining. The four lagoons and one small cove are all within 1.5 mile walking distance. All are clean, the grounds very well kept. GREAT snorkeling. We mainly snorkeled in lagoons one and two (which are the closest to the hotel).. .saw great fish, and sea turtles ... very close~! the hotel's staff were all great~! we never encountered a problem with the service. all staff were very helpful and VERY nice. the hotel is clean, spaceous. we loved our partial ocean view room with balcony. The beds are super (we are picky about bed quality.. nothing makes a vacation turn out poorly than if you have a bad bed to sleep in or a bad sunburn~!) the pool is small, but since that wasn't something we were "into" it did not matter to us. we were all about going down and staying on the beach all day. anyway, we would definitely go back to this hotel. And I am very picky with where we stay at in terms of quality, cleanliness, and service. This hotel was GREAT~! loved it. wish we could go back every year. tip~! GET THE breakfast buffet INCLUDED in your package. we did and we very happy we did that... it is a GREAT buffet.. huge , lots of choices.. the items do NOT change at all from day to day but b/c it is so big , if you are staying there a week it will not matter. The price is $28 per person. so ya, get it included in your package if at all possible~! it is well worth it. my husband and I ate the buffet mid morning, then only needed one more meal the rest of the day. do rent a car if possible, esp if you want to go see the rest of the island. which we highly recommend doing the war memorials and driving up to the NORTH SHORE and the eastern and southern part of the island. on the other hand, if you just want to go someplace, stay there and not move around. I would do that at this hotel too. I recommend this for couples and families both. This time of year was perfect to go~! not crowded at all.. and the weather warm and water perfect. We did a snorkeling / dolphin / whale watching boat trip one of the days out of the Ko Olina boat dock area which is just down the road from the hotel. you can book the package at the hotel and get free shuttle to and from the boat dock. The package I thought was expensive. we ended up paying about $255 for two people for a 4 hour cruise. in my opinion the place they took us to for snorkeling was just ok... I had better snorkeling in the lagoons free right outside the hotel~! but it was worth it to see that part of the island from the water, ride the boat and we did see many dolphins at play PLUS a mama and baby whale~!~! that was super , was they surfaced quiet close to the boat. very thrilling. If you want night life, crowds, and tourists.. stay in Honolulu.. if you want more secluded, quiet and restful, I say this hotel is the best~! you can still go to Honolulu if you want for dining, etc. it's just a 20 minute drive away.. but it's away enough so that you feel away and not packed in with hundreds of other tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel In a Remote Location - Get a Car”
Reviews.Author: SouthMiami
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and beach area. This hotel is totally out of the way, so if you are looking for action the cheese e tourist seen, stay in the Waikiki Beach. If you are looking for rest and relaxation, this is it. Staff was nice and the rooms are excellent. Room service is excellent. The hotel's main restaurant, Azul, serves okay food at expected prices. I was not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise perfected”
Reviews.Author: GiGiLafoo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to the Ko Olina JW Marriott and loved every luxurious and relaxing second there. From the moment of our arrival the staff was extremely warm and quick to accomodate. The lagoons are incredible, my daughter and I could not get enough of swimming in a protected tropical sea. The rooms were lovely, comfortable and well cleaned. My husband loved the golf course at Ko Olina. The food ranged from standard fare to fine dining and was really not priced as high as I had thought. We never had anything other than very friendly and prompt service. Even when it was cloudy and/or rainy we enjoyed having a drink under cover while listening to tranquil music or watching a variety of marine life around the resort. The path connecting the resort to the chapel, vacation club and marina made for a safe and lovely stroll. We didn't miss the crowds and congestion of Honolulu at all. In fact, while driving anywhere near that area I was happy to get clear of it to again enjoy the lush beauty of the rest of the island that is still unspoiled. It certainly seemed a family friendly resort to me. No one minded the happy laughter and play of the well-behaved children I saw there. The only problem we encountered was with a dolphin adventure excursion out of the nearby marina that had nothing to do with the resort.. The crew was unprofessional and inexperienced, dropping passengers in the open ocean and then dropping anchor 100 yards away in a position that had the passengers struggling to swim back to the boat against the ocean current rather than dropping anchor on the low side of the current to allow the passengers to drift and swim back to the boat with the current. The inexperienced "first mate" stumbled around on deck and even shoved my young daughter from the boat into the ocean very near a reef and the boat's metal ladder and motor/propellers. We saw much better vessels and crew nearby for a better and safer dolpin adventure. One last bonus of a fantastic ocean and lagoon view at this JW Marriott..... we often saw pods of wild dolphins cavorting in the ocean from our lanai.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ziggydssp
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the JW Marriott was just wonderful. The hotel grounds, common areas, and the rooms are very nice. It's a very relaxing atmosphere. I loved the open air feeling of most of the lobby areas. The breezes blowing through were just delightful. We had an ocean front room on the 9th floor. I can't say enough about how pleased we were with the room. There was plenty of space to sprawl out and make this our home for five nights. The view from the room was spectacular. I have attached a few photos from the room. The pool setting was lovely with plenty of lounge chairs and umbrellas. I thought the food and the drinks at the pool very reasonably priced and tasty. Food prices at the other restaurants are on the pricy side. If you are trying to save money and don't want to spend money on food at this resort, I would not stay here. One of the true benefits of staying at the hotel is the resort atmosphere, where you just unpack relax and take advantage of all the conveniences and pampering the hotel has to offer. It would be a pain to leave all the comforts of this hotel to go and find something to eat each day. The hotel is convenient to the beaches on the North Shore, about 30 minute drive. I loved the North Shore and all the beautiful colors of the water and the big waves and surfers. The hotel is not convenient to Waikiki Beach. It's about an hour drive with moderate traffic. It would be worth making a day trip in to Waikiki Beach but if you need or want to go there more than once, I would not recommend this hotel. Again, it's truly a resort to get away from the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel on a (too) isolated part of the island”
Reviews.Author: Mgbeaty
Reviews.Content: The resort was excellent and the beach was just as good. If you don't plan on leaving the resort, I strongly recommend this hotel. It is a great place to relax in luxury. The restaurants and the spa were also both excellent, although overpriced. Just like other reviews have said, however, it is a long way from Honolulu. This was originally a strong attraction for us, but we didn't realize that we would have to travel just to find a good off site meal. Having a rental car is a must. We upgraded to an ocean view and I recommend everyone else do the same. We have a terrific view of the pool and the ocean that took our breath away. Our only criticism was that they "nickel and dime" you for everything. For example, we had to pay $20/day to self-park and internet access was $13/day in the common areas.

Reviews.Title: “No Aloha Spirit”
Reviews.Author: quallkoski
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a very disappointing stay at the JW. We travel to the Islands twice a year and this was our first stay ever at the JW. The resort is beautiful, beach great, nice location ....BUT the staff was terrible. Absolutely the worst service ever. The pool bar was especially awful -no smiles, it was if they were doing you a favor to bring you an $8 cocktail and even less patience with my kids twhen they wanted snow cones - it felt like we were inconveniencing the employees at every turn. The restaurant - coffee shop - was very unaccomodating - we had ten people for dinner and they wouldn't pull tables together for our party we had to sit at (3) tables side by side and the restaurant was empty. We then moved to Waikiki for the remaining of our stay and were treated with warm Aloha Spirit from local restaurants to the Sheraton......We won't be back.....to JW!!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, but too far from the city”
Reviews.Author: Curdie
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort if you want to stay in the hotel, go swimming, and lie in the sun. If you want to get out and go into Honolulu though, it is a bit too far away. The hotel itself is quite nice, very clean and white, with a big pool and a big, wide beach with protected swimming area. The hotel is much nicer than a traditional Marriott (think business trips) but not as swank as some of the more glorious resorts on the other islands. The rooms are large and luxurious; we had a deluxe ocean-view corner room on a higher floor that had views of the ocean from both sides, and we could sit in our room and watch the sun set, perfectly framed in our window. I would not recommend eating at the hotel, as the food was ho-hum and overpriced. The problem is, there is nothing else to eat anywhere close to the hotel. It is a 1/2 hour drive to Honolulu, where all the good restaurants are (and they are REALLY good), and there is often traffic on the highway. And if you're staying on Oahu, you want to go into Honolulu, as it's the main attraction. I would recommend staying at a hotel closer to Honolulu so you can eat and sightsee, and go to a resort on another island to relax and unwind for the rest of your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Ihilani - perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: pemex
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in March. Earlier in the week - a few days at Moana Surf-rider in Waikiki and also a few nights at Keiki Bungalows on the Oahu North Shore. The Ihilani is a great hotel. We were upgraded to beach front 4th story room - great lanai with great view of sunsets. After a week tour of Oahu - this was our place to wind down and relax. The lagoon is great for swimming - and my wife and I swam in the morning and evening. Restaurants at this hotel enjoy really good food - and great service. We had lunch three days at the pool bar, the seafood buffet (e.g. really excellent - and I *hate* buffet's) at Naupaka and one cozy dinner at Ushio-Tei. Here - spider roll was "just OK" (e.g I prefer the tempura crab legs) but other sushi and rolls were excellent. Service across the board was excellent. One night - we walked to nearby Roy's for dinner - was excellent - of course too. We went sailing on the Ko Olina Kat at next door marina. Highly recommend the sunset cruise. Great crew. Nice fuzzy whales. (OK not so fuzzy - but fun to see.) Great guests. The two free cocktails on the sunset cruise put all into a good mood. One morning we drove up the coast past the campers/squatters (interesting) to Ka'ena Point. Here - you will find very rugged coast line, nesting albatross - so highly recommended if you want to take a stroll along the rugged, remote black lava coast. Would go back in an instant. Some photos attached.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort stay on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: Shoe1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Ihilani. When we arrived, we were advised that our room (mountainview) had been upgraded to an ocean-view ground level with private garden with jacuzzi. A wonderful addition to the aready stand-out rooms. The staff (valet, housekeeping, front desk) were all excellent. The only hotel restaurant we ate at, Naupaka, had good food but was understaffed. To make up for this, they did throw in free desserts. If you have car, try Assiaggo in Kapolei where they serve excellent Italian at very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful propery”
Reviews.Author: KMme
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from our 10-day vacation in Oahu, Maui, and Kauai. It was our first trip to Hawaii for myself, husband, and 2 kids, ages 5 and 7. We stayed at the JW Marriott for 2 nights during the first leg of our tour. The hotel is definitely away from the hustle and bustle and is in a residential area. I’ve read pros and cons about this, but my advice would be not to book the hotel if you want to be near Waikiki. It is a nice hotel to get away from it all. The pool was a bit small and just one depth. This was nice for the kids, but a little ho-hum for the adults. The beach area was beautiful and the lagoon was really nice. Great for both kids and adults. There is snorkeling there, but you have to swim out a bit and there is no lifeguard there. I was a little weary about swimming out to where the lagoon met the ocean, as it was late in the day and I was by myself with no life vest, so I only stayed in the immediate lagoon area for a little bit and saw a couple fish, nothing exciting. My husband stayed out a little while longer than I but did not see anything different. The room was fantastic. Plenty of room to spread out and beautifully decorated. Service was top-notch. The only complaint I have was that since the hotel was geared more for adults (i.e., the spa and golf course), we got a bit of a look (or sneer) from some of the guests when our kids were in the pool. The kids were splashing a bit (each other, not other guests) and were a little loud (as kids in pools are, not screaming). All in all, they were being kids in a pool on vacation, but as they were the only kids around, we seemed to get “the look” from other guests. I would return here, but not with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for my honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: pbutala
Reviews.Content: In the interest of full disclosure, let me first say that I used my Marriott points for this stay. We had spent about 1 1/2 weeks in Hawaii, namely doing the NL Pride of Aloha cruise through the various islands (horrible cruise by the way...but, for a different review). The one week wasn't too much of a honeymoon---we were up early in the morning, trying to make the best of seeing what we can while the ship was docked, and combined with having a lousy cruise experience.
