One thing we wanted to do though was spend a few days at the end of the cruise relaxing in Oahu. After one week of hectic touring, we wanted some solitude and relaxation. And JW delivered! The rooms were spectacularly clean; service was impeccable; beach was gorgeous; and the lagoons were amazing (we actually spotted more fish there then paying for a snorkeling trip elsewhere). The restaurant was quite reasonable as well, especially considering you're in a top end hotel. My only advice would be to rent a car, since getting to Ko'olina isn't very easy or cheap. One taxis are about $60, and you're a bit away from Honolulu.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: TR-Den
Reviews.Content: Pros: Both the pool and near by lagoons offer your pick of fresh or salt water Nice sized rooms with awesome ocean views Pool staff attentive and polite Beautiful grounds Excellent Spa Excellent Golf Stingray Lagoon in the middle of the hotel Hokule’a Bar has great food and awesome views Perfect Hawaii sunsets Lot’s of sunshine Prompt Valet Complexly safe and secluded grounds Cons: Remote location with few dining options outside the property Not much to do on this side of the island Rooms are slightly dated Can’t Speak To: For the most part, we ate off site, so I can’t speak to the dinning other than pool side or the bar mentioned above. Views from the Mtn Side rooms

Reviews.Title: “Bring your nickels and dimes”
Reviews.Author: JenD23
Reviews.Content: Ok, let me start by saying that my husband and I stayed at this hotel as an incentive for his work, so we did not have to pay to stay at the hotel (I can’t complain about a free trip anywhere). However, I must say we still spent quite a bit staying there. It is really sad that no matter how much a hotel room costs they still have fees for just about everything inside and outside the room. My husband plays tennis, so to use the tennis courts there was a fee. I believe it was about $20 each time or $40 for a week. Even if they arrange a match with a club member, there is still a fee. There is a fee to use the lagoon equipment (i.e. kayak, etc), a fee to use the covered lounge chairs at the beach, a $12 fee per day to connect to the internet…don’t even ask how much the fee was to use the golf course…fortunately neither of us play. I almost forgot parking at $20/day (and since a car is a must have for this hotel since it is so far from everything you will generate a nice bill for this) The rooms were beautiful with a nice sized lanai. It was great having a view of the peaceful lagoon. The bathroom definitely outshined the room…double sink and vanity, separate shower and tub…very nicely done. There was an event in one of the "beach front suites" (technically not beach front, but a nice view). The room was essentially the same as the regular rooms just larger...even the bathroom was exactly the same just slightly larger. The mini bar is totally packed with very pricey drinks. I heard that there is a fee (once again) to have them unload it so that there is space to put your own things in it. Only maybe 2 or 3 smaller water bottles will fit without removing things. The lagoon is great and perfect for families with small children. People even saw turtles in the lagoon which is nice. The hotel grounds are beautiful and the food at the restaurants was very nice. The hotel is extremely far from just about everything. If you want to have peace and quiet this hotel is perfect, but if you want more nightlife be prepared to drive.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it but it's isolated right now”
Reviews.Author: Tsaki
Reviews.Content: This Marriott on the west side of Oahu. Besides the hotel, the Marrriott timeshare is a just down the road, there are some residences and golf courses and a luau operation. The timeshare is partially built and a high rise condo complex is being built in the area along with some shops and restaurants. The beach areas appear to be manmade coves that are quite nice. We tried 2 of the 3 restaurants on the JW Marriott property (I mean where else are you going to eat?). The main dining room was first class, very nice but no view. The terrace restaurant was semi-open air and we had breakfast and a late lunch there. The terrace was a bit spotty as far as service. The busman was disassembling the salad bar and was quite loud. The room was spacious, well appointed, beautiful bathroom, and lanai with a great view of the ocean and some of the coastline. It was a VERY nice room. Valet service was efficient, checkin was prompt, friendly, helpful. The fitness center was very nice with quality equipment and in clean setting. If this is your first trip to Oahu, this is probably NOT the place to stay. If you arrive late afternoon, you're in rush hour traffic going to the hotel. If you try to go to Honolulu in the morning, you'll fight Los Angeles type bumper to bumper traffic most of the way. We were attending the Dec 7 service at Naval Station Pearl Harbor taking 45 minutes from the hotel to the gates at the Naval base leaving at 5:15 am. I've attached an aerial photo I took of the JW Marriott and you can see that it's in a nice less crowded place. The second photo is of Waikiki near the Royal Hawaiian which is just a short distance from the Marriott on Waikiki. If you like the 24 action of Waikiki and all the urban annoyances it brings, the JW Marriott will bore you to death. If we come to the Dec 7th services again, we'll probably stay in Honolulu/Waikiki where the traffic would be bad when we arrive, and it can be bad late in the afternoon, but at least we'd be in town with more dining choices and still within reasonable reach of other attractions. If we're coming just to kick back, the JW Marriott will be considered or perhaps we can stay in the timeshare buildings where the variety of pools and amenities might work better for a stay of a week. This Marriott is REAlLY nice but you need to look at a map and see how it works for your plans.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 20 year Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: okufanatic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely wonderful! We chose the Ihilani because we wanted to stay using Marriott Rewards points at an awesome destination for our 20th wedding anniversary. I can not say enough great things about the Ihilani. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. The room had a beautiful ocean view. It was well appointed and spacious with a beautiful lanai. We would open the sliding doors to our lanai every night and listen to the ocean as it gently swept against the shore. The hotel is on the west coast of Oahu away from all of the crazy Honolulu traffic and congestion. It is a little piece of paradise sitting in an area with four protected lagoons that are great for snorkeling. The grounds were perfect. Our favorite thing to do was to get lava flows or mai tai's and lay in the hammock to watch the sunset in the western sky every evening. We also enjoyed the live local entertainment provided at the pool every evening. Our favorite entertainer sang love songs which only added more romance to the beautiful sunset. The food and service was great at the Napaka Grill. The Ihilani was definitely one of the greatest places anyone could choose for a romantic getaway, honeymoon, or anniversary. I can't wait to stay there again! Only draw back is the $18 dollar per day parking garage. Oh well, I guess paradise has a price.

Reviews.Title: “Basked in the service and hospitality at Ko Olina”
Reviews.Author: texanmom2008
Reviews.Content: We are still experiencing a pleasant hangover from a week long stay at the Ko Olina property of JW Mariott at Oahu, Hawaii. The property is immaculately maintained and is set in a panoramic locale offering mountain and ocean view rooms. The staff was friendly and courteous and responded to our requests in a prompt and efficient manner. The concierge were mostly locals and very knowledgable about the place. Our request for a room change was very well handled. Infact, we were offered a better room with a specatcular view. The staff made sure we got adjacent rooms with our friends so we could have "together time" even while at the hotel as well. There is a lot to explore and enjoy on the property like the sting ray pond and habitat, well manicured lawns with exotic plants and walking trails. We stayed with four kids with ages ranging 3 through10. The hotel offers a private lagoon that is a good place to spend the day with the kids. If you have adventurous young ones who MUST surf and boogieboard, you must travel to another beach away from the property. The breakfast buffet at the Naupaka Terrace was awesome with a huge variety offering the regular spread and the local flavors of Hawaii. We opted to stay here as it is secluded and is a good respite from the mainland and the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. If you are looking to savor luxury and experience island hopitality at its best, look no further than Ko Olina. The rooms are pricey but worth the moolah.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Dano77
Reviews.Content: Came here for a convention, but was very impressed. We live on the Leeward side but have never visited the hotel. I heard how pricey the rooms were, and it was well known for the NFL Pro Bowlers coming here. As other reviews suggest that this is a place for relaxing, I don't think that it is still a finished project yet, I believe they have more in mind to finish the job, I love the view in the lobby, and I love relaxing out side, and the golf is great. They have four man made coves in the area, they are all murky, maybe in the future they will resolve that, the turtles still come into the coves, but you have to get pretty close to the breakers to see much sea life. The sunsets are beautiful, the food is good and relaxing is easy here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: Acreace
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ko Olina until New Year's Day and had a great time. The room had a great view of the lagoon and ocean. We chose the resort as it was away from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu & Waikiki Beach. This place was great to detox from everyday life on the mainland. I have read people complaining about the cost of things... while I am in favor of getting a good deal, my response is to vacation somewhere else... There are plenty of more affordable options. I feel like you do get what you pay for when it comes to ammentities in Hawaii. The service was excellent, the concierges were helpful, and we were able to see some great sunsets. High points were: Azuls restuarant, The fireworks over the lagoon on New Years eve, the stingray & hammerhead ponds, and how well maintained the grounds were. Low points: Weren't allowed to check in before 3pm (even though we were told in advance that we could), we weren't able use our Marriott points due to the time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience - A Fabulous Hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lois611
Reviews.Content: This JW is truly a serious rival to many Ritz Carltons. My husband & I stayed for 7 nights January 6-12, 2008. We used our Marriott Reward points with an upgrade to an oceanview room. The hotel is situated right on the water. Our room had an true ocean view. The room was quite large (king bed, sofa and armchair, plus a desk/chair and cocktail table). There was a small, separate entryway that had a lovely chest, with mini bar, safe and storage. The bathroom was superb. Two sinks/vanities on separate walls, giving you lots of space to put toiletries. A very large tub, and a separate shower with big seat/shelf. All very new and well kept. The pool and pool area is small by most standards and was probably very crowded over the holiday season. But we visited in January so there were plenty of lounge chairs available. The beach is nice with lots of chairs. The water is in a lagoon and good for children to swim in. Everything was very well maintained. There are 3 restaurants; Azul (expensive), Asian (didn't try it), and a large all day dining one. Our first night we ate at Azul and were disappointed. Prices were very high, wine prices were ridiculous and service was terrible. We felt extremely rushed. Then we discovered the Roy's Restaurant down the block (within walking distance). Can't say enough about what great food and service !! And far less expensive. Try the fixe price menu; great value and the chocolate souffle (really a lava cake) is out of this world. We tried Azul one more time and told the waitress of our unhappy experience the first time. She slowed down the pace of the meal and we happily found a great reasonably priced red wine. We must have overlooked it the first time. The food were served in a more leisurely pace and it was all prepared very well. They comped our dessert to make up for our first experience, which was nice. There is a lovely walk along the water that features several lagoons. It is well paved and lots of water fountains and rest rooms along the way. In about 20 minutes, you can reach the Marriott Vacation Club, which is just being built. Two buildings out of 4 are up already. Very high density and family oriented. Beautiful pools but if you are looking for a relaxing time, stay at the Marriott Ihilani. We encountered a few minor problems with our room but each time they handled it quickly. There is a new electronic bedside system that controls lights, air conditioning, etc. This wasn't working properly so it was always very, very cold in our room. But we slept with doors open and listened to the waves crashing. We would love to return to Ihilani and hope that the area builds up a little more so there are more restaurants. Honolulu is about 20 miles away but during rush hours, it can take an hour to get there. So we only dined in Honolul one night at the fabulous "Michel's" It lives up to its reputation as a great restaurant and almost every table has a view.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag at the Ihilani”
Reviews.Author: j32063
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5-night stay at the Ihilani. I was bringing my parents to Hawaii for their first-ever visit, so I chose Oahu for the tourist sites and the Ihilani to get away from the crowds of Waikiki. Oahu is not my favorite island; the glitz and congestion seems so anti-Hawaii, but we managed to have a fine time anyway. Things got off to a rocky start at the hotel. We arrived a check-in time to find one room ready and the other not...not terrible, but frustrating after a 6-hour flight. It seemed to take forever for housekeeping to finish up, and we didn't get into the second room for about 2 hours. The hotel did make up for it by giving us 2 days' worth of comp breakfast buffets, which was actually quite a bit (more on food and pricing later). The rooms were large, bright and had wonderful balconies. We had corner rooms on the 10th floor with 2 balconies each, and the lanais were good for viewing whales and the nightly hula show. Considering prices for rooms in other places, it seemed fairly reasonable. What was NOT reasonable was the way the hotel socks it to you at every possible opportunity. Fees upon taxes upon surcharges...$18 per night for parking, and then a tax on top of that! They tried to charge both rooms for parking even though we only had one car! The mini bar, room service and restaurant prices were much higher than usual...$28 per person for a mediocre breakfast buffet, with no other cheaper options nearby. We ate in all 3 of the hotel's restaurants and found them to be good but not great and too expensive. Service was usually pleasant and at least competent. One rather nasty feature is the business center which charged the highest per-MINUTE rate I have ever seen to go online. 5 minutes' worth to check E-mail cost me nearly $7! The beach/lagoon is pleasant enough and especially good for families. Don't plan on doing any body surfing; they are man-made and still as bathtubs. There is pretty good snorkeling, although high surf beyond the breakwaters pushed in a lot of sand and made things rather murky. The pool area is OK, albeit a bit crowded. I suppose it was all fine, but there was something generic and uninspired about every aspect of the place. It's good for older folks and families with young children but not great for the more active or romantic. I hope not to vacation on Oahu again, but if I do I think I'll try Turtle Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: bcmom_7
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great trip in Hawaii! The first week was spent on the island of Oahu, which was nice, but didn't quite have the "tropical island" feeling that I had expected. It is definately more a city and has a touristy feel to it. Don't get me wrong, it was Hawaii, and I enjoyed it! The JW is a nice resort and a great choice if your not interested in large crowds. I would definately suggest renting a car because depending on your length of stay, there isn't a whole lot around the resort area except for relaxing or golfing. The restaurant choices at the hotel are decent. They have a beach and poolside grill, which serves ok food, at least the drinks are nice. They also have a outdoor restaurant called the Naupaka Terrace that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. The food was good, especially the spicy chicken lettuce wraps. The portions are large, so if you're looking for a light lunch, maybe sharing a plate wouldn't be too bad of an idea. The fanciest restaurant is Azul located next to Naupaka Terrace. The food is better there, but unfortunately the service was lacking the night that we went. It's not that the waitress wasn't trying, but they only had one bus person for the whole restaurant. When we finally got our food, it was good, although I have to say that some of the pairings that the chef had suggested in serving the food, like Lemoncelio with our chocolate dessert, was odd. Stay away from the organic chicken, it was really dry! They do have a sushi restaurant, but the night we wanted to go there it was closed, I will have to say that if you want good sushi, go to Nobu in Honolulu in the lobby of the Parc Hotel, it was fantastic!! We had all the suggestions that our waitress had recommended and she didn't fail us. The resort itself is nice. They have a pool, which was a little small, but ok for the kids. The beach is nice and you can reserve cabana seats for a fee (I think $40 for 2 lounges). That does include a cooler with a couple pieces of fruit and two water bottles. We enjoyed the beach more than the pool. The kids used the kayaks a couple of times. I believe that you can also get complimentary snorkel gear from concession on the beach. We were there for relaxing, so with the exception of shopping and eatting in Honolulu and visiting the Arizonia Memorial, we just lounged. They do have a great walking sidewalk that connects to other resort areas that's great for a morning jog or stroll. The room was also nice, and we were given a basket of fruit when we arrived, which was a nice touch. The rooms were kept clean and the turn down service each night kept the bathrooms arranged and supplied with towels. We stayed in the Pacific Suite with a beautiful view of the ocean and overall we were pleased. I gave the JW an above average rating, but I would say it was just slightly above average. But to be in total fairness, we stayed at the Four Seasons in Maui the next week and that's trying to compare apples with oranges...but that's another review.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about the service, but great rooms”
Reviews.Author: EugeneTokyo
Reviews.Content: My family and in-laws (8 adults and 2 kids-4yrs old and 1yr old), stayed here for 7 days from Dec 29-Jan4. First the good: -Rooms are very nice (we had an oceanview on the 10th floor). We didn't have any problems with the housekeeping. We found the service (problem with bathtub drain) fast. Telephone greetings were always professional, as they greet you by name on the phone. -Great location for people with kids and for those who want to get away from the hustle of Waikiki. We stayed at the Halekulani last year and it was very nice, but there weren't that many other kids around, mostly young couples. Also, I personally do not like the crowds in Waikiki. All of the commotion detracts from the resort-I am on a vacation atmosphere (my opinion). When you go to Waikiki, you will see what I mean. I live in Tokyo and the strip on Waikiki is more crowded. -There is a KMart about 2 miles down the road on H1 East (exit 1B). So if you travel light in order to buy things on location, it is convenient. -Beach was very nice as was the lagoon. It was not too crowded and the beach was very clean. -Food at the resort was good, but you will pay for it (it IS a resort). Now the bad: -We were planning to arrive at 7am on Dec 29th, therefore we decided to pay for a room starting on Dec 28th, so that immediately upon check in, we could shower, unpack, tend to our 4 yr old and 1 yr old baby. When we arrived we discovered that the hotel had given our room to someone else on Dec 28th, even though we had a confirmed reservation AND they knew we were going to actually check in at 7am on Dec 29th. When I asked about the reason, they said they needed to give it to somone else (they must have known that it would inconvenience us because they said they were fully booked and the people in our room were not scheduled to check out until 12 noon). I was astounded by this. They gave us a choice to wait until the afternoon for our original room or to take a similar room on the 4th floor which would be ready "in a couple of hours". It still irks me just thinking about it. We decided to wait for our original room. So there were were at 7am, just off a 12 hour flight with a 4 year old and a 1 year old, waiting in the lobby with all our luggage for 6 hours. The only thing they offered us was complimenatry coffee (which is free anyway). -I agree with some others on this board that the pool was freezing. Other guests I talked to complained of the same thing. Even on the sunny, 80 F days, the pool was pretty empty except for the kids. -The staff are professional, but only a handful really projected a warmth and sincerity. I felt that they were just tired of all the tourists. The staff at the Halekulani last year were a little better, but not by much. We also stayed in Maui 2 years ago at both the Sheraton Maui and at the Westin Maui. The Sheraton's staff had the Aloha spirit in spades. The staff there were genuinely friendly and made for a real resort atmosphere. The Westin was much like the Halekulani and this hotel...professional, but missing sincerity. I guess I would be tired too if I had to deal with tourists 365 days a year. If I hadn't stayed at the Sheraton Maui, then I wouldn't have known there is something better out there. All in all given our personal experience and familial status, I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian paradise”
Reviews.Author: eliz7811
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were given a week long stay at the resort at Ko Olina for our honeymoon. At first we were a little bit disappointed that the resort was so far out of the Honolulu/Waikiki area, but after being there for just a day, we were glad to be out of the city. The room (even though it was a non-ocean view) was fabulous and always clean. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and had excellent recommendations for us. We consulted a staff member about a hiking trail, and he suggested one that wasn't as well-known, gave us directions, and it was a fantastic hike. Take advantage of the snorkeling in the lagoons. We got to see all kinds of fish, and a few turtles. My favorite part of the entire stay was the breakfast buffet. Thankfully this came with the price of our stay, and my husband and I still reminisce about the fabulous food and the selection. According to my husband, the golf course was one of the best he's ever golfed on. I went to the spa for a manicure/pedicure, and I thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere and wished I could spend more time there! The one thing that really made us feel welcome is that we were obviously not the most well-off guests (as a teacher and grad student), but we were treated as though we were.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hawaiian Experience”
Reviews.Author: HornFan
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is designed to separate you from the average traveler, for it is an upper class hotel. As a Marriott is still feels like a business hotel, but it has many resort features to the liking. For example, it has a semi-private beach versus Waikiki Beach and a resort style pool. The pool service kept bringing us items throughout the day like ice water, juice, and iced cold towels. The food there was above average. What we liked best about this hotel was that is was not crowded and not too many kids. There is a Marriott nearby and on the same property, which is very kid friendly. Our room was designed as tropical, but the furniture was cheap looking. The room décor needs to be updated. We had a great view of the pool and ocean, and the bathroom was up to luxury standards. The cleaning service was excellent including the daily and turndown. We had an excellent stay with no problems. This is a great place to stay if you do not want to stay in Waikiki with all the tacky tourist stuff around you.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Return Stay - Management Indifferent- No Aloha Here”
Reviews.Author: PetermanCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Last year we stayed here a week and fell in love. This year we broke up and it was sad- because the Ihilani just didn't care. We will never return. The pool was freezing and empty (not heated- even the kids stayed out, now THAT is a cold pool to keep kids out). Little elegant touches are no more. Turndown service is no longer automatic-- imagine paying $500 a night and coming back to your dirty towels and unmade bed after an elegant evening out. What is management's response? One hint: we woke to the same mess. No offer to send someone up. This indifference trickles right down to the car parkers who were actually unfriendly (yes we tipped). Surly would be a better word. We returned expecting the same great experience we had a year before, but will not go back. We found a much better resort- no their rooms are not as great, but they heat their pools and greet guests with smiles and warm concern, not cool indifference. This is called aloha and they no longer have it here.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a great hotel (yeah, it's pricey, but still great)”
Reviews.Author: Steve F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ihilani for three days following a week-long NCL cruise. It was exactly what was needed; a "stay in one place" antidote to the constant movement of a cruise (which we enjoyed as well, by the way). We booked through Priceline, getting a significant discount over the rack rate...and were able to get adjoining oceanview rooms on the ninth floor. We stayed in the larger of the two; our daughters had the room next door. I can't say enough about our room. It was beyond spacious, with tiled floors, and a patio/porch that gave us incredible views. The bathroom was bigger than our cruise cabin, with a number of amenities. Robe and slippers were provided. The bed was very comfortable, and the linens were high-thread count. The hotel staff was gracious and very professional...with one exception: my wife and daughters went for a lunch at one of the restaurants and were ignored for about 15 minutes. They stopped a hotel executive who was walking by, who took care of the problem personally and immediately. Please note that the JW Marriott can be expensive. Don't expect to get by cheaply here; entrees at the restaurant can routinely run at least $25...which means dinner for four with appetizers and drinks will easily run $150 or more. (Dinner at the nearby Chili's, however, can run $80.) If you're looking to scrimp....this ain't the place. There is a grace and an isolated splendor you'll find at this hotel that flies in the face of the hubbub you'll see on Waikiki. We have traveled to a number of places, and stayed at a number of resorts. This is the first place where we have resolved to return. You will not regret a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Ko Olina!”
Reviews.Author: BRJL
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week from December 5th to 12th at the Ihilani Resort and Spa in Ko Olina for a quick winter break. The biggest plus to this resort is the fact that you are 45 minutes from Honolulu but it seems a world away because of the peace and quiet of this area. The hotel is similar in style to the Hapuna Prince on the Big Island. It's nice but could use a facelift. We had a 9th floor ocean view (room 920) on the west side of the resort. The sunsets were wonderful and the lanai was very private with comfortable loungers, a small round table and chairs. We had dinner at Azul their fine dining restaurant twice. The service was wonderful and the food was fresh and perfectly prepared. Ushio-Tei had a grand Japanese buffet with an unbelievable selection. We had the breakfast included with our room package so we visited the Naupala Terrace each morning. The staff was so kind and gracious. We could have the buffet or order anything from the menu. My husband and I visited the spa and had the Maui ginger sugar scrub and the couples Lomilomi massage. Samantha and MaryAnn were great! If you are a golfer don't miss the Ko Olina golf club. We only played the back nine but had a great time. The best part of our visit was simply lying out on the beach and swimming in the lagoon.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: goldentravelbug
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous hotel, off the beaten path. It was secluded, but with everything one might need. The lagoons (beaches) were nice and quiet and not crowded. The hotel offered amenities, like snorkeling, canoeing, kayaking, etc. The whole ambaience of the hotel was amazing. From the shark pond, the pond filled with ocean creatures, the private lagoons, the poolside and pondside restaurants to the fabulous rooms, the hotel, overall is a wonderful place to stay. We plan to take our kids back soon. The rooms are wonderfully romantic, with large bathrooms (seperate tub/shower, marble thru-out) and large balconies that overlook the ocean (you hear the waves crashing 24/7). But the resort is great for families with children also. The lagoon beaches make it a safe place for kids to play and swim - no waves, etc. The food is good, not overpriced. The room service is prompt and efficient. The lobby is beautiful and the gift shops have plenty to offer. If you want nightlife, tons of restaurants to choose from and a hoppin' beach scene, this is not the resort for you, but if you want a laid back, quiet, elegant, relaxing resort, then you've found the right hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!!”
Reviews.Author: Pointsgalore
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott in July and loved it! The hotel was very nice and away from the traffic of Waikiki. The grounds are beautiful and the beach was excellent for small kids (no waves or undertow). The pool was not as big as I would have liked but we never had a problem getting chairs. The restaurants on-site were very good. Be sure to rent a refrigerator for drinks/snacks. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A fine, remote, hotel”
Reviews.Author: dweymouth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the JW Marriott Ihilani Resort & Spa twice, for a total of four days, during a two week trip to Hawaii in October ‘07. Both accommodations were upgraded ocean view or ocean front rooms, but not suites. Perhaps because I anticipated a generic Marriott experience, the Ihilani exceeded my expectations for these stays because of the rooms, service and setting. The biggest weak points I noticed were the somewhat sterile and dated lobby/atrium and the ho-hum pool, which can’t compete at all with the surrounding gardens, beach and fish ponds. Also, the hotel charges for their Internet connection and don’t think of staying here long without a car. The rooms were large, spotless and fresh looking, with bathrooms with separate showers and Jacuzzi tubs and beds that were very comfortable. The manufactured bay makes easy swimming, even when the ocean is rough or you are with children. The three restaurants plus pool bar offer a nice range of eating choices, although nothing is cheap. There were many young and large families there when we were who must have had budgets we never did at that age. The hotel’s breakfast buffet was one of the best we have found anywhere and is a special treat if you are on a package that includes it (otherwise $27 each) in your room price. The hotel’s upscale dining room also served us the best dinner we had in our two weeks in Hawaii (including the Four Seasons Resort Lanai at Manele Bay). If you want to spend a lot of time in Honolulu or Waikiki, this hotel is too far away. But if you want a quieter and pretty setting, I’d recommend the Ihilani (if you can fit it in your budget).

Reviews.Title: “Rush hour traffic on vacation, Yeeeech!”
Reviews.Author: JP3CHICAGO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 07 for three nights. I was using Marriot points and therefore expected to get the basic room. At check in we offered to upgrade for some cash. They found an ocean view room for $50 additional per night and we accepted. The room was good. It was located in a sepreate wing from the main building and tucked behind the pool side bar. Our room was in the 23 tier and had a great view of the ocean. It took some effort to get our luggage over to this area but I found this section of the hotel to be extra private and quiet. The upkeep of the room was average. There were many signs of wear and tear as well as signifigant mold in the shower area. The property clearly suffers from delayed maintenance. I aggree with many of the other reviews. It is located a long way out of the activity zone of Waikiki beach. If you came to Hawaii expecting to just chill out at the beach it is an ok choice, but, if you seek any kind of nightlife I urge you to not book this property. We got stuck in some serious rush hour traffic coming back from Waikiki one afternoon and it felt like I was back in Chicago. This is not what I want to experience on a vacation. I personally think that the location stinks! Overall I will not complain too much since it was virtually free. My final thought is that it it not worthy of the J. W. Marriott nameplate. It feels more like a glorified Marriott Courtyard that was placed in a tropical location. Mahalo, Good travelling to you!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: kmunis
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two week island hopping trip in Hawaii for our ten year anniversary. We also stayed at the Four Seasons on both Lanai and Maui and there are reviews on those locations posted as well. My impression of the JW Marriott at Ko Olina was that it was ok, but it was also marred by two incidents which I will detail below. As a Marriott Rewards Member we had a ton of points to use so we got 5 free nights at this hotel to start our Hawaiian adventure, paying only a small fee each night to upgrade to an ocean view. We arrived late (about 10pm) to a very basic check-in (no leis or anything). We were starving so I asked where we could get something to eat. I was told the only place was the lounge and it would be closing soon as well. By the time we unloaded our luggage in our room and got to the lounge we were told we had our choice of only three things on the menu - altogether not a good first impression. The resort is about 20 minutes from the airport and about 40 minutes from Waikiki. Although its nice to be away from crowds of Waikiki, just keep in mind that if you don't want to spend most of your time on the resort you will have to drive almost a half hour or more to go anywhere. Our room was nice with a very large bathroom, making the size of the room a little on the small side. I had requested a refrigerator in the room since we were traveling with our kids and that had to be put in the bathroom, where the coffee maker was located as well. It was an odd arrangement - I know people love that wow factor of a huge bathroom, but at what cost? The ocean view was wonderful, though. Since the hotel is on a man-made lagoon the water here is very calm, perfect for small kids or people who don't like waves. The sand is somewhat rocky with bits of coral in it, probably going back to the whole man-made process and not having hundreds of years to weather and soften. There are no services at the beach unless you rent a cabana, so you need to get your own towels from the pool area to bring to the beach, try to lay claim to one of the half dozen or so permanently afixed thatch umbrellas if you want shade and then walk back up again to the pool area if you want a ice water or something to eat. For something different, take a walk along the shore away from the lagoon (to the north), there is a rocky beach that has tons of little tidal pools where you can see fish, crabs and snails. The pool is perfectly round with stairs at either end meaning most people, especially kids crowding at the edges. The pool deck seemed to be small. I know the hotel was not full while we were there, yet the pool deck always seemed crowded. Also, they were working on the grout around the pool deck everyday, so there were cones and caution tape up on one or two sections of the pool deck everyday we were there. What was nice were the fish ponds under the lobby, my kids loved trying to pick out the sharks, sting rays and starfish. We ate one night in the Japanese restaurant when they had their buffet and it was ok. The breakfast were delicious though - carmelized banana french toast - yum! Breakfast buffet was about $30, entrees about $15-$20 for breakfast and lunch, Dinner entrees about $20-$35. Tropical drinks are $8.50, pretty good for a resort on Hawaii. The hotel is also a short walk away from Roy's, which is a fabulous restaurant - I highly recommend it! Service was good, not great but not bad either. It did not seem like anyone went above and beyond, as demonstrated by the two incidents I hinted at earlier. The first were the additional guests in our room. From the moment we checked in we saw a creepy critter on our floor. I had heard stories about bugs in hotel rooms in Hawaii and this was only one so we let it go, but the next day we say another, then another. My husband complained to the front desk who said they would check into it. Never any follow up after that and we still found one the day before we left. Second, I realzed after the 25 minute flight over to Lanai after checking out that I had left my camera battery charger behind. In a panic I called the hotel to describe the item and advise exactly were it had been left They informed me the housekeeping staff was not done their rounds and when they were they would contact me. They did call back to say nothing had been found. I hung up the phone but after thinking about it I called back and ask to speak to a manager, again gaving very specific instructions as to the exact outlet it was plugged in to. I was told the room would be specifically checked and I would get a call back. By the next day I called again since I hadn't heard anything and now had to tell the tale all over again to someone new. Again the room was to be specifically checked and I was told to call back. I did and supposedly nothing was found. I was quite irritated by this since I called them within a couple of hours of leaving the room and I know that charger was right in that socket so it was clearly stolen by someone. I don't like leaving a bad review just because of a specific incident or incidents, but my overall impression of the hotel was not too great to begin with so add that other stuff on top and now I would not go back or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: nrbailey
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the beautiful Ihilani in early October and were very pleased with everything. The accommodations were excellent and the staff, while not overly interesting or gregarious, were all courteous and helpful at all times. Since our trip was during the off-season, the resort was sparsely populated and we had ample choice of seating at the pool and restaurants most of the time. The pool is small but clean and the lagoons are very beautiful. If you can, get an oceanside room - the view from our balcony was gorgeous! One thing to note, the Ihilani isn't close to anything (except the Paradise Cove Luau) - if you like to be within walking distance of lots of activities, this isn't the hotel/resort for you. I also used the salon for a mani/pedi visit and enjoyed it very much! The treatments were fantastic and my stylist was very pleasant and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular !”
Reviews.Author: patmcci
Reviews.Content: Took my daughter for her 40th birthday to see Jimmy Buffett at the Waikiki Shell and to stay at the Ihilhani. Both were spectacular. We stayed on the 17th floor in an Ihilani Suite and I wished I never had to leave. It was beautiful. I worried about the reservation because I am so fussy and particular and we only saw a floor plan on their website but no virtual tour. But my worries we unfounded. Two balconies, one on each side of the hotel. Huge entry, guest bath, living room, huge master, and huge master bath with a jazuzzi tub that could have held 6 people. Staff was friendly and couldnt be nicer. Front desk staff remembered both of our names from the first day on (and the names are not easy ones). The lagoon are lovely, however snorkeling in them is a little disappointing....not too many fish. If you need to be near Honolulu or Waikiki, it is a bit of a drive and the traffic can be awful! So be prepared. But it's so much nicer to stay out of the big city and be where it's quiet and beautiful instead. Eat at Roy's, right near the hotel.....its Killer !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on the west side”
Reviews.Author: RazorB
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel on the west side of Oahu. Easy to get to Pearl Harbor and rest of Island as well. Beautiful Lush grounds, ask for Ocean View facing Northwest and get view of Mountains as well. (See picture) Stingrays and Hammerhead sharks on display in hotel ponds. Hotel is on the ocean, near a beach with protected reef, and small pool. This is a smaller resort without all the beach activities/amenities, so better for adults, than kids. I would stay away from "Azul", their signature restaurant. Service was horrible, (food was cold when finally arrived) not sure if it was a one time thing or constant (we never went back), but there are several nice restaurants one exit away on the freeway. (Outback Steakhouse, Italian, Chinese and Japanese steakhouse) Several guests we talked to said they were eating there after we relayed our Azul experience. We started ordering Room service and eating on the balcony while watching the sunset, since service was amiss. Breakfast buffet was pretty good, but since it is all outdoor's had to share fruit with the flies. Staff at buffet's were ok, which were included with our package. Overall the room was very nice and spacious with great balcony, pool bar service very good, but the restaurant's were not up to normal standards. I would stay here again, but would skip the meals at the restaurants and either order room service on the balcony or eat at the Barber Point restaurants one exit back towards Honolulu. This was a good couples hotel since it is smaller and not much of a pool for kids (no slides, etc). There were a few kids, but they gravitated towards the beach which had plenty of room.

Reviews.Title: “Not too impressed”
Reviews.Author: Lisa F
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at hundreds of Marriott properties over the years, we have to say the 'JW' was sub par. The rooms were out dated and the views were limited. (We personally viewed 5 rooms). The swimming pool was old and had that 'sun screen' taste. The bathroom reminded us of an old 'Vegas Honeymoon' with it's gaudy decore. If, however you are traveling with a group for a wedding, then this is the place for you. The chapel on the lagoon was pumping out 3-4 weddings per day. Our hotel pool was full of people who knew one another, making it seem more like a family reunion, than a getaway from town for my husband, myself and our 10 year old son. We were bored with the lack of shops within walking distance, but did enjoy the lagoon. We do not recommend the JW Marriott. There are so many Marriotts to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely relaxing place away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: JCMass
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week here to celebrate our anniversary. We found it very calm and relaxed even though the hotel was almost completely filled, (we asked). This resort beautiful, the spacious grounds provide beautiful places to walk, and the views are spectacular. The rooms are large and very comfortable with many extra's that make it special. The breakfast buffet at the Hotel's Naupuka restaurant is excellent, it offers much variety from made-to-order omelets, Belgian waffles, and hot and cold cereals. I especially enjoyed the juicer, with a large selection of fruit and vegetables. Our server suggested a combination that included watermelon, carrots, and grapes. We also ate dinner here several times, where they serve a different type buffet each night as well as a full menu of island seafood and meats. The service here is excellent. There is music by the pool each night, and it can be heard in the open air lobby as well. There was a leis making class in the lobby on Saturday morning, I made a beautiful one that lasted four days. The sunsets each night are especially beautiful if you go to the far right of the property and follow the short path along the water to a small beach that is not part of the resort. We went and found photographers taking pictures of couples and wedding pictures each night on this beach. We took pictures ourselves. It was just beautiful don't miss it. This is the place to stay on Oahu, but we agree with other reviews they charge for things that other Marriott Hotels include in the price. It seems like everything is extra and it does make the hotel appear cheap. Most will include the buffet breakfast, or internet service, and offer free parking. Not here, parking is $18.00, internet is $12.95 and breakfast is $25.00. It can add up quickly. We are Marriott rewards members and only found out later that we did not receive any points by booking with a travel agent.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Time at J.W.”
Reviews.Author: terra36
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our one week stay at the J.W. Ihilani Resort & Spa for our honeymoon. We both had fabulous time and felt that the resort provided us with a wonderful experience. The staff was friendly and attentive, housekeeping provided impeccable cleaning services and our view from the room (partial ocean view) was gorgeous. With that said, we would like to highlight some of the memorable things we did while keeping in mind that this is a category seven Marriott hotel, (so expect to pay a pretty penny). If you have a rental car, parking is $18 per day at the resort and movies can be rented for around $13 a piece. Drinks at the Poolside Bar average at $8/ piece, while food is around $12. I felt that both food & drink was good, but nothing out of the ordinary. Things to Do: We highly recommend trying the breakfast buffet at the resort, which is served daily at the Naupaka Terrace. Cost is around $26/ person and includes a wonderful selection of food including turkish sausage, eggs benedict, bacon, pastries, fresh fruit, gouda cheese & meats, a "made to order" omelet station, and perhaps my favorite, a juice bar, where you could add different combinations of fruit to a blender to create your own personalized fruit smoothie. We splurged and got massages at the Spa, which has provided its services to celebrities like John Travolta and other NFL players. I received an aromatherapy massage ($125 + $25 gratuity tip), while my husband got a reflexology foot massage ($140 + $28 gratuity tip). If you purchase a spa package, you also receive complimentary access to its other services (needle shower, sauna etc...) for the rest of the day. Otherwise, it is a $20 fee per day for access to the spa. We felt it was well worth it, if you can afford it. Go go the Fia Fia Luau. My husband had previously attended the Paradise Cove Luau on a past trip and felt that this luau was exceptionally better. The food was delicious, our host was entertaining, and they only accepted approximately 200 people (at the most), making for a much more personalized experience. Reservations can be made with the concierge at the Marriott Beach Resort (next door). The luau is held on Tuesdays and costs $70 per person. For a romantic dinner out, try Roy's (at the Resort) or Alan Wong's (Honolulu). The average meal ranges from around $30-52. Both places had excellent food and celebrated our honeymoon by giving us free dessert, that was decorated exquisitely. Tour Pearl Harbor -- The U.S. Arizona tour is free and opens at 7:30 a.m. I would recommend getting the headset, which is $5 per person, and provides you with a narrative as you tour the site. Climb Diamond Head -- Parking is $5 for the day and the view is worth the hike. Tips: Kapolei is 10 minutes away from the resort and offers wonderful meal selections at affordable rates. My husband & I got all-you-can-eat pancakes, 1 meat, & 1 egg selection from the Hapa Grill for breakfast one morning for around $10.00 total for both of us. Other restaurants at this exit include En Fuego, Pizza Hut, McDonalds, Burger King, and Papa John's. Barber's Point is 5 minutes from the resort and will provide you with a K-Mart, where you can get cheap souvenirs, a movie theater, and an outback steakhouse.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful getaway place”
Reviews.Author: ttct007
Reviews.Content: We visited this resort in June 28th 2007 . We had a great time staying here. We had read the reviews here before we left . It was exactly what other people said about this place. Very spacious room and great guest service. The lagoon and beach are great for kids and family. Lots of activities and thing s to do that you don't have to go to downtown Waikiki areas unless you like more actions. It 's a very relaxing and quiet place with beautiful lanscapes and scenery. I 've seen people complained about the noise from construction. Actually , I hardly heard it or noticed there were noises. My kids (a toddler and a 5 yrs old ) love this place. My son who is 5 yearsold did not want to leave . The pools are great for children with sand beach and kid spa. I t's also near by Pinapple plantation , turtle beach, wailea water fall park about 30min. drive. We definitly would love to come back this place in future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tallguy39
Reviews.Content: For our honeymoon my wife and I decided to begin our stay in Hawaii at the Ilihani. We stayed for a total of 6 nights. We had an Ocean View room and the view was really nice. The lanai overlooked the pool and one of the lagoons. It was very peaceful in the mornings and we would eat our breakfast there. It was very noisy at night as there was usually music by the pool. The room doors, once shut, absolutely shut out the noise ... but it's hard to just relax on the lanai in the early evenings. For $13 / day you can have high-speed wired Internet in the room. No wireless connection worked for us (only one was available, but I believe it was secure ... so, not free). Fairly steep and no weekly option was available. We rented a car the week we were there and there's really no other way to do it. Part of the allure of the Ilihani was being in a nice, peaceful setting (ie, not Waikiki). But we still wanted to get around and go to North Shore, Diamond Head, Waikiki for a day, etc. Plus we're very much "chain restaurant" people and Kapolei is only 5-10 minutes away and has a good variety of familiar restaurants (Outback being our favorite). We also got a mini-fridge for the room and got supplies at Safeway (also in Kapolei) to have cheaper drinks and snacks. One night while we were there we decided to get some floaties and watch the sunset in the lagoon. It was a great idea until we noticed a lot of commotion over on the shore and a very large animal was in the surf. As we started swimming towards shore we saw that it was a full-grown seal that was making its way onto the beach. We decided that if the sea creatures were fleeing the water that we probably should too, so we missed the sunset. We asked the hotel official that was keeping tourists away from the seal if that was a regular occurance and he said it was the first time he had ever seen such a thing. So, rare as it may be, remember that swimming in the lagoons is the same as swimming in the ocean, and large animals CAN make it in there with you, however rare it may be. We also did the hotel's "Reef and Ray Adventure" and fed the fish, baby hammerheads, and stingrays. Feeding the fish is, well, throwing pellets at water. The lady was informative and friendly, but feeding fish is feeding fish. The hammerheads were a bit more interesting. You stand behind a small rock wall (so as not to be bitten) and throw fish chunks at them. Very similar to feeding the other fish, except these are sharks. And sharks are cool. After that we fed the stingrays. There are two adults and two babies. The babies swim right up next to you and to feed them you have to place the food on your hand, submerge your hand to the bottom of the shallow pool, and they glide over you and suck the food up. Really fun! The adult feeding is more complex to explain, but still extremely fun and you're right there in the water with them. No real barrier, and they swim right up to you. I highly suggest doing this activity if you're an animal lover, as it is a very unique experience. We got some massages at the spa. The spa is VERY nice and has all sorts of stuff that was available for free aside from the massage ... jacuzzi, sauna, 360 degree shower, a cold water dunk tank right next to the spa (I thought that was a kid thing??) etc etc. The massage itself wasn't anything spectacular, but then again I'm not really a massage person. We were suckered into the timeshare presentation the first day we got there. I understand why they do it, but it's a bit disappointing to be spending so much at a resort and having the employees there give you a sales pitch for things like that. Overall, it was a very relaxing way to begin our honeymoon. Oahu is a fun island, with tons of stuff to do (especially if you have a car). There's a lot outside of Waikiki that others may miss.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Family”
Reviews.Author: NRS6
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here. Kids loved the lagoon and pool. They made many friends and staff was very nice. If you want to do a lot of day trips for tourist spots, this is not the place for you. We left the property only for a trip to North Beach and a Ko Olina Catamaran morning trip. I had called the property directly for reservations and I was given a great room with 2 lanai's overlooking both ocean and mountains. The kids ate free at the Naupaka Terrace. Azul is very good.There is a restaurant just outside and few restaurants just a couple of exits away. The only trick was getting back on the highway. They all cost around the same.North Beach is just 20 minutes away and worth a trip, with Dole plantation on the way. If you want to enjoy the beach and pool and hang out, this is the perfect place. If you want to tour the island, and looking for night life, you are better off elsewhere. The lagoon rents water hammocks, kayaks, peddle boats etc. Come early enough you have plenty of spots with shade and you can drag the beach chairs. In season pool is full of kids and families have a good time. There is a pool on the upper floor of the Spa for adults only, where my wife went every morning. The pools are only 3 to 4 feet deep and there is no lifeguard. Spa facility is great and you can use the facilty for a basic fee (free with a treatment). The Hanuama bay snorkeling is supposed to be good but has limited parking and after early arrivals fill the spots, they close it. So we went snorkeling on the catamaran trip, which is average. Marriott has time share buildings and each has its own man made lagoons (4 of them), all next to each other. You can walk to these. All in all I would highly recommend this place to families .

Reviews.Title: “Best choice hotel for Oahu!”
Reviews.Author: amycb4
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay away from the chain of hotels in Waikiki for our vacation. We wanted a nice, relaxing, quiet resort and that's exactly what the JW Marriott fulfilled. The restaurants are unbelievable. At Azul, we had the best service I have ever had in my life! The Japanese buffet kept us eating until we were delirious all night. The 4 lagoons were more than enough for snorkeling and relaxing. They even had kayaks and paddle boats to rent. One night we went out to Waikiki, it was disgusting. We couldn't have been more please we chose the JW Marriott. Needless to say, we never left the resort for the rest of the trip. It was heaven! Be prepared to tip though, there is a lot of services and they are not necessarily complementary.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RCRGator
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is extremely convenient if nothing else. The rooms (we had an upgraded room) were fairly standard, Marriott-quality rooms. We had a nice view of Diamond Head and the beach. The location is the nicest part of the hotel though- directly across the street from the beach and within walking distance to a ton of restaurants. There was an AVP (Volley Ball) tournament held across the street when we stayed there and all the players stayed at the Marriott. That was convenient and fun entertainment. Lapping Diamond Head made a beautiful and reasonably difficult running path. Back to the rooms, they were nice. I utilized the business center a lot and they were very accomodating. It did take forever to get elevators to the room but that was not too big of a deal. Overall, a very enjoyable experience but probably more because of the location than the actual property itself.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ocean Front Location on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: margod
Reviews.Content: Amazing Ocean Front Location, Amazing Hotel, Amazing Service. The BEST for Romatic Get Away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Just4law
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on the recommendation of others from June 20-25. My husband and 19 month old son were also on the trip. When we first arrived, we were about an hour early for the 3 pm check-in, so we had to wait around until they called us when our room was ready. This took about half an hour, so not too bad. When we got to our room, it was on the 4th floor (which is really the first floor above the lobby) and it was pretty much the last room on that side of the hotel. Not only that, but we had a lovely view of a roof/wall from our patio. Needless to say, we asked for a change of room right away. After a few phonecalls and threatening to go to another hotel, we were moved to an acceptable room on the 10th floor. The hotel itself is quite nice, but I wouldn't say extremely luxurious. It's very clean, nice bathrooms, common areas and lobby. We had a package which included breakfast and I have to say that was really good. There are many choices in the buffet and I would recommend getting a breakfast package if you can. The pool was a little small, although we never really spent time there, as there is a private lagoon right behind the hotel. This lagoon was very beautiful, no waves, and great for small children. Most of our time was spent there. The hotel is located about 20-30 minutes from Waikiki, so if you want to be in the middle of the action, you shouldn't stay here. But we were ok with being further out, as it is more quiet and secluded. But the dining options in the area are limited. There are basically all the fast food places and a couple of more decent restaurants, but that's about it. You will have to drive to get anywhere exciting, so getting a car is highly recommended. As we were with an energetic toddler, we didn't do much sightseeing, so I can't really comment on that. There are some shopping centers on the island, including the Ala Moana center which is the nicest, but again this is closer to Waikiki. Overall, I would say the hotel is quite nice, very clean, the staff was just ok, and the lagoon is gorgeous. But it is out of the way, and there is not much to do around there, so be aware of that when booking. For a nice quiet place, this is good, although it is not exactly cheap. I would recommend this hotel to others who would like a getaway in Oahu away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: pazzaidea
Reviews.Content: Absolutely magnificent! You won't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: 4RealBeach
Reviews.Content: I frequently travel both for work and pleasure and this resort is one of the nicest places I've had the pleasure of staying. Yes, I've stayed in nicer (and larger) rooms, have eaten at better restaurants, have stayed places with larger/nicer pool areas, and have had more intimate ocean-side lodging... but the combination at this resort was top-notch. We were here for a part of our honeymoon in early July (also San Francisco and then after we went to Kauai). We were taken care of from the moment we walked in. If you are looking for a night-live, I'd look elsewhere, but the place was quite relaxing and although it seemed that there were many kids around, it was never apparent. We took a trip to the North Shore and into Honolulu/Waikiki and I am very thankful I chose to stay here. Yes, parking does cost $18, but if you were trying to save money, you probably shouldn't come to Hawaii. I'd recommend this property to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Get-Away”
Reviews.Author: tcro1234
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from Oahu and stayed at the JW for a few days. We had an upper floor north facing room which we truly enjoyed. The view is great and the sun set right into the water with a great view from our lanai. The staff was friendly and the vibe was very relaxed. This place IS a bit isolated, so if you want action and/or nightlife, this is not the place for you (OR be prepared to drive 30-45 minutes to get to Waikiki, etc). By 10pm the place is a ghost town. This resort is GREAT for families and children (which wasn't our focus since we don't have kids, but it should be pointed out!). The snorkeling is far from great around the lagoons, but if you just want to put some fins on and swim around for fun, its fine. I'm sure some guests miss out on this part so I am adding another note: If you walk out towards the ocean on the right of the lagoon (facing the water), make a hard right and walk north along the path. There is a sign that says 'you are leaving the resort grounds' (or something similar), and keep going down onto the beach. There is a nature (not man made) lagoon here with a little beach. It feels much more wild and natural than the resort lagoons! If you explore the lava rocks right on the water, don't be surprised to see 3 or 4, or even more, sea turtles hanging out in the shallow ends of the water. It was such a pleasant discovery and it was GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but over priced”
Reviews.Author: hikezion
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, however, I found it to be no better than a Marriott Courtyard. I stayed here to be close to family, my parents were put up by my sister who was staying down a couple of lagoons at Marriott Vacation Club which I though had much nicer rooms and pool area. Everything here was 25 to 50 percent more expensive then the Marriott next door. The breakfast buffet while good, reminded me again of my days spents at Courtyard's on business trips and it cost much more. Watch out for the mini-bar, typical over priced items but the snacks all had expired dates on the package-a few by almost a year. The staff were exceptional and always were helpful, housekeeping was again typical of any Marriott. Yes this hotel is in a very pretty setting but rent a car because it is not close to anything. I would stay there again after I recover from spending 3 grand for a 7 nights. Next visit to hawii will be to another island.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel ruined by terrible service”
Reviews.Author: VATraveler79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon, and could not have been more disappointed with the service we received. We know Hawaii is a destination for lots of honeymooners and we did not go in expecting special service or a room upgrade. BUT, since the hotel contacted us a few days before our stay and asked us to complete a questionnaire including a question about whether it was a special occasion, we assumed there would be some congratulatory note or mention when we arrived. INSTEAD we were greeted with an offer to UPGRADE for a hefty price, not once but TWICE. AND the wrong type of room -- based on our repeatedly confirmed requests -- TWICE. It wasn't until we asked to speak to a manager that there was (miraculously) a room available that met all of our confirmed requests. This is a beautiful hotel. Our room, once we finally got to it, was lovely and the beach off the lagoon is SO nice. But a good hotel experience has as much to do with the service received as it does with the building and grounds. I have never felt so nickel and dimed as I did at this hotel. The hotel definitely used its remote surroundings to squeeze every penny out of us -- ridiculous given the prices charged for the rooms. When we returned from our honeymoon I noticed an unauthorized charge on my credit card from the hotel for over $150. When I called the hotel, I was informed this was for mini bar charges (we never opened the mini bar). I understand a hotel running a few dollars worth of charges from the mini bar without first contacting a customer -- but $150 must have been the WHOLE mini bar. I think a call was warranted in this case BEFORE the charge rather than requiring the customer to review her credit card statement and then dispute such a large charge. I would recommend this hotel if you're looking for a nice place to stay outside Honolulu, but only if you don't mind a constant effort to squeeze money out of you. If we return to Oahu, we'll be staying at the Halekulani next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect with small kids”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler71
Reviews.Content: We have several small children, and the Ihilani was perfect! We like calm beaches, and the lagoon was the best for them to play while we relaxed. We like nice suites that are cheaper than two adjoining rooms, and the Ko Olina room was perfect- it had a king and a sitting area in one room, a luxurious bathroom, and a second bedroom with two twins. The food was more than adequate. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, quiet luxury stay away from the city”
Reviews.Author: nomorereviews
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ihilani the first week in June with our twin 13 years olds, and had a marvelous time. This was our 13th trip to the islands, where we have stayed in some premier locations. This resort was just as lovely as many of the other highly rated, but at least half of the cost. The hotel is off by itself on the western shore, so if you are into nightlife, you might find it too quiet. What the hotel lacks in activity, it makes up for with the rooms and service at a relatively reasonable price. The room we were upgraded to for free was a huge two bedroom suite, with a lovely entrance hall and a very large bathroom, comparable to the Four Seasons, but even larger. There were two separate vanities, one with a stool to sit at the make-up mirror. There was a wrap around lanai, with views of the mountains and ocean. It would have been nice to have two lounge chairs instead of one so my husband and I could enjoy lounging outside at the same time. There was a teak table and two chairs as well. The housekeeper, Cynthia, kept our room well stocked and spotless. The hotel is on a calm, man -made lagoon, which was nice for the paddle rafts and water hammock my daughters and I rented, and we were not charged a fortune to use these as some other resorts do. If you like ocean waves, you will be disappointed as there aren't any for body surfing or bugie boards. There were some tiki huts on the beach to offer shade, so get to the beach early if you want to use one, and we loved relaxing on the hammock set between two palm trees. The infinity pool was not large, but was never crowded. Great lounge chairs with padded cushions. Service was terrific with pool attendants offering cold water and shaved ice. When I put my towels in the bin, the attendant said "I'll do it, that's what I'm here for". The virgin pina coladas and lava flows from the bar were excellent and creamy, and again, not an arm and a leg like at Wailea, Maui resorts. We ate all our meals at the Naupaka Terrace, which had great quality, lovely presentation, and good service at a reasonable price for a resort of this caliber. The nightly special was a good deal with a soup and salad bar, choice from three entrees and dessert for $25. I had the fresh fish each night, which was outstanding, and my dessert was one of the largest and best creme brulees topped with fresh fruit that I have ever had. The dessert alone at comparable resorts would cost up to $15. There is a nice walking path along the lagoon that passes the glassed in wedding chapel, condos under construction, and timeshare buildings. We took a 20 minute walk to the marina where snorkel trips and sunset cruises leave. On our sunset cruise we saw many spinner dolphins that entertained us. There is a general store at the Marina where there is a grill and you can get liquor, supplies, and snacks. At the Marriott time shares, there is also a general store for supplies, souvenirs, and alohawear. There are also a couple of restaurants there that were lower priced than the hotel if you want a change of scenery. There also seemed to be some nighttime entertainment as well, and a bit livelier atmosphere. The Ihilani is a very quiet resort, a good half hour away from the hubbub of Waikiki, so if you are looking for rest and relaxation, this is the place. It would have been nice if there had been a little combo band playing in the lobby as other resorts have, and perhaps shuffleboard and ping pong for some activity. Regardless, it is a beautiful, top notch resort, and I would not hesitate to stay here again. Aloha and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Rusty_Shackelford
Reviews.Content: We were booked into a terrible place in Makaha and had to get out. I called the Marriott Ihilani and they booked us into a lovely ocean-view room for under $300.0/night. The bed was thick and comfy, there was a great small lanai, a big bathroom with soaking tub, everything was clean and elegant. The bellhops screwed up and took more than hour to find our luggage, but they were on top of it with a reminder call. Overall the staff was great, fast and responsive, never intrusive. This was a great safe place for families with toddlers. The beaches/lagoons are man-made and designed for maximum sand and minimal surf. I prefer something a little more wild, but it's nice to know the kids are alright. This place is the opposite of adventure travel, it's very contained and snug. The room service was notably good and the bar had a good small menu. The breakfast buffet was overpriced and the breakfast menu was nothing to get excited over. The sushi joint on site was expensive and the food was lame. (I've had better sushi from grocery stores.) The fish was flaccid, pale and the portions were small, poorly constructed, and poorly presented.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: MEDRoswell
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a visit to Maui and Oahu and stayed at the Ihilani while on Oahu. The service we experienced was excellent. Our first impression of the hotel was set by the valet who personally handled us from check-in through delivery of bags to the room. When he saw we were traveling with a 4 year old he quickly noted that we should receive a refirgerator for free for our daughters juice (and our wine) and was back in minutes with the fridge. At Azul that first evening we were pampered by our two servers as was our daughter. The food particularly the Snapper was excellent. The prices were typical of traveling in the islands, but there was always a little extra included like a small portion of Ahi Poke to start, fantastic flatbread with marinated artichokes, lychee sorbet, a great Hawaiian spinach in garlic and even cookies, chocolates and a complimentary liquor to finish the meal and all for the price of the entree. The pool and beach areas certainly won't overwhelm, but the poolside service was very good, there was plenty of free shade and the fellow travelers were a pleasure to speak to. The blue vanilla shave ice was a nice perk as well. We contrast the Ihilani with the Grand Wailea which is our usual haunt in Hawaii which has all the activities and water slides, but lacks in service. The Ihilani in our experience is a beautiful property that did not nickel and dime us like other Hawaiian resorts, however we will remember the personal level of service as a highlight of our time on Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service - Elegant Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: TravelRDPMember
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the I'hilani resort and spa. The staff was wonderful, very courteous, and extremely helpful. Although - the bell boys are a bit slow - I would recommend you take your own bags to your room unless you want to wait an hour for your luggage. We were traveling from snowy Michigan, so we were excited to get out of your jeans and into swim wear. I would recommend partaking of the spa services. I opted for a 30-minute massage, where I received a wonderful head-to-toe jasmine-scented therapeutic massage. This was finished off with a beautiful manicure. Spa pricing includes your services and gratuities and tipping is not encouraged in the spa, but is allowed if you have cash on you. And all spa services can be charged to your room. The room was beautiful, we staying the Pacific Suite; very suitable for a romantic vacation. The restaurants at I'hilani were wonderful. Try dinner at Azul, at least one night while you are there. The dining experience was romantic, delicious, and elegant. There are plenty of activities. The concierge will provide you with activities at the resort and off the resort; also, each morning you will receive a list of beach/resort activities delivered to your room each morning. Overall, this was a great spot for a Hawaiian vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort, will visit again”
Reviews.Author: everynameistaken
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at the JW Ko Olina. This is one of the finest hotels we have ever stayed in and we have stayed in a lot. The service was fabulous and began the moment we arrived. We were given a free upgrade to an ocean/pool view. It was gorgeous! The room and lanai were huge and the bathroom is the biggest I've seen in a hotel (bigger than at home). There is a separate spa tub and they provide bath salts. We are a family of four and we had a roll-away in the room with plenty of space. The lagoons were perfect for swimming and we utilized the kayaks and waterbikes for a very reasonable price. The pool bar/food service was great. We never waited more than five minutes for a drink. The pool-side food was good at a reasonable price. Skip the seafood buffet, good, but not worth the price. Room service on the lanai was a perfect way to relax and end a day. The meat pizza and ceaser salad were yummy! Other reviewers complained about having to call for ice, but was not a problem for us. There is an ice machine on the 8th floor and they always brought us a fresh bucket in the evening and when ordering room service. The kids loved the sharks and rays that swim in the shallow ponds of the hotel. The valets were friendly and helpful and provided towels for our trips to beaches. This hotel is away from the crazieness of Waikiki, but only about thirty minutes away. You can visit sights and come back to a tranquil and relaxed atmosphere. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It>>>> !”
Reviews.Author: CUSTOMERSERVICEGURU
Reviews.Content: So you know I do work in the hospitality customer service field and this was one of the worse experience this year overall. After waiting over 3 hours for my room to be ready they finally gave me the Handicap room at 3:30 ! They generally will not let you check in before 3 pm ! be warned. If you have a Suite maybe. The response was they didn't care and I know they had larger rooms ready. There were 25 people waiting in the lobby and the kids looked pretty bored. I did ask for a 11am check in too ! Other things: Worse Valets ever ! Ask to store bag and the guy handed me a bag tag and ran off leaving my bag!!. Valet takes for ever to get your friends car and they have 3 people doing nothing except getting paid on hawaain time. Big Issue here. Pool is only 3 1/2 feet deep and small all the pool chairs are crammed together and its not romantic. no drinks on beach no coffee in rooms As usually they didn't give me a mini bar key no laundry bags atm is hidden in the basement they charge for calling the golf course ? and local calls of course. Lots of construction going on Charged me for parking even though I didn't have a car for stay but my girlfriend did. I think they add this too all bills even if you come in a cab! For the $400 starting price you can do a lot better elsewhere. The beach is nice and the golf course is good except for the greens are very slow. I have stayed at the Hilton Villages too and it's much better but take my word on it and stay at Turtle bay if want golf and sunsets.

Reviews.Title: “What can I say....”
Reviews.Author: adejejon
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed from 21-24th February. What a beautiful place! Even though the Ladies Professional Golfers were in town it never seemed overcrowded. We would have loved to have stayed all week but could not get in for the first few days(see Marriott Waikiki Beach). Food excellent, and bar service round pool more than adequate, at least once every hour. Room huge and kept beautifully clean. Used Naupaka for breakfast and dinner, who could resist being sat outside next to a pool with hammerhead sharks! Did Azul for last evening dinner, and had excellent meal, well served and explained by waiting staff. Poolside grill food also more than adequate. If it wasn't so far from the UK, would try and visit every year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Somewhat Secluded”
Reviews.Author: MindyW
Reviews.Content: The only thing keeping me from giving the hotel 5 stars is the location. It is a little farther from Honolulu than we had expected, which is not terrible but it does mean you will spend some time in traffic if you plan to go to Honolulu/Waikiki. That said, we still managed to see all of the things we wanted (Diamondhead, North Shore, Polynesian Culture Center, Pearl Harbor, etc.) and we had a spectacular honeymoon.
