The room was pretty and the bed was comfortable. Nice view. Everyone at the hotel was super friendly and helpful. The hotel restaurant "Hokulea Lounge" had good dinners with reasonable prices for Hawaii and a great breakfast buffet ($25pp, but you can skip lunch). The beach are is very calm and is clean. While we were there (April 23-30, 2007), the beach was not very crowded, even on the weekend. You will definitely love this hotel if you want to "get away from it all". It is a very relaxing, peaceful area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort! Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Calif0rnia_traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this resort with our two college-age children after spending several nights in Waikiki. What a refreshing change and wonderful way to end our trip! This resort is far from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki - almost like going to another island. We had a corner room on the 14th floor with one lanai overlooking the pool and lagoon and another lanai overlooking the ocean! The service was awesome - from the valet parking attendants (well worth the extra few dollars) to the bell staff to the front desk to housekeeping to the pool/beach attendants. We couldn't have asked for more. Be prepared to spend a lot more than just your room charges, but this is a top tier resort in Hawaii, after all. Rent a cabana on the beach for half a day ($35) to really spoil yourself. Spend some time in one of the hammocks if you want to get a taste of heaven! And don't miss the sunset from the grassy area near the lagoon. The lagoon is great for small children (no waves) and also has pretty good snorkeling. There is free coffee and tea every morning in the lobby, and the coffee shop there has reasonably priced fresh fruit, bagels and pastry, if you don't want a full breakfast in the restaurant. If your stay includes a Saturday night, don't miss the seafood buffet. It's pricey, but well worth it! The concierge arranged a dolphin watching/snorkeling trip on the Ko Olina Cat - one of the highlights of our trip! We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Oahu!

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you are looking for”
Reviews.Author: evanskl4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (both 30) stayed here for 6 nights in May. We originally had booked a mountain view room, but we did not like it so we upgraded to a suite. the suite was very nice, although nothing terribly impressive. The grounds are gorgeous (see photos). While traveling, we checked out some hotels in Waikiki (way too crowded) and also Turtle Bay Resort. While it was nice, I think the Ihilani is the most beautiful place to stay on the island. As others have said, there is not alot to do in the evenings. You can go to dinner onsite, take the shuttle to Roy's nearby, or drive to Honolulu for the evening. We were not terribly impressed with the food. Unlike others, we werent impressed with the breakfast buffett. The food was cold and there were birds all around. Room service breakfast was much better, although pricey. We werent impressed with the sushi place either, maybe b/c we are spoiled and have good sushi restaurants at home. The one restaurant we enjoyed immensely was Azul. It is expensive, but worth it, especially if you sit outside and take in the scenery. The service there is fantastic. We had two great servers there, Stuart and ?. I am a vegetarian and they made a special meal for me. The beach area is very nice and relaxing, and has good snorkeling. The pool was never too crowded while we were there, but the service there is slow. If we were to go back, we would probably not spend the entire time on Oahu. However, if you are going to stay on Oahu, this is the place to do it. Venture to Waikiki for a night, but personally I would rather stay somewhere quiet and lush than in the midst of the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: NICHTEN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mariott from May 10-13 for the first part of our Honeymoon and absolutely loved it. The hotel is located about 30 minutes from Honolulu and in a very quiet area. If you are looking for a lot of Nightlife, this would not be the right place for you. We arrived early afternoon and got our room right away and pad 100.00 for an upgrade ( used points for the rest ) and got a beautiful room on the 15th floor with 2 balconies! The bathroom was huge with 2 separate vanities. The bed was gorgeous and very comfortable. We ordered ice a few times and it was delivered very promptly. The entire staff was VERY friendly and we felt very welcome. The restaurants and bars are very good...expensive, but nothing unusual for that type of hotel. Service was excellent! The pool is kind of small but it didn't bother us , it wasn't that busy. The grounds are beautiful and very well taken care of. They have a breakfast for approx. 26.00 but we bought a croissant at the breakfast bar in the lobby level, and they also had FREE coffee and tea. Perfect place to relax! We will definitely come back. Parking is 18.00 a day..oh well.....>

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to Marriott name...disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lizzie385
Reviews.Content: After a stay on Waikiki, we decided to stay at the Marriott Ihilani for a change of pace. HUGE mistake- we should have continued our stay at the wonderful Hilton Hawaiian Village! To begin with, at check in, they did not have a room with 2 double beds as we requested. Having 2 kids in the room with us, a king simply would not work. We were informed that if a king bed wouldn't work, we would have to find lodging elsewhere. Long story short, we went around and around with the manager and *miraculously* a double oceanfront room was available. My opinion is that they didn't want to give us a free upgrade, even though they screwed up... Then we got to the room.... it had a fabulous view, however, I would compare the decor / furniture to that of a cheap beach house. Sagging wicker sofa, dated looking beds and nightstands. Not what you would expect for a $350-$400 hotel room. The second night, our A/C went out, we were miserable and their solution was to send a tech to our room at 3:45 a.m. when we called. That wasn't going to work with a 1 year old and a 5 year old asleep in the room. Overall, I was seriously disappointed. There are so many other wonderful resorts on Oahu, don't waste your money here.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: JennHtheTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a week long stay at the JW Marriott on Oahu. We were there celebrating our third wedding anniversary and our last big trip before we start a family. The trip was wonderful and the hotel was absolutely perfect. Prior to our arrival, we let management know that we were celebrating our anniversay. Upon arrival, our room was upgraded and a plate of fresh fruit was delivered to our room. The rooms were very spacious and the bathrooms were even better. The hotel grounds were well kept and had every amenity. One of our favorite perks was the walking/ jogging trail that surrounded the 4 lagoons. Most mornings we woke up early and took a jog. It didn't even feel like we were exerting any energy because the views were so perfect. Another delicious perk was the complimentary coffee in the lobby each morning. I brought some Royal Kona home with me, but it just doesn't taste the same on the mainland. A grocery store and some casual dining restaraunts were only about 10 minutes away, so we frequented there to try and save some money on eating out. The food at the hotel was great, but very pricey. The valets were also great. Very friendly and efficient, but also always ready with directions or recommendations. Regarding the construction that previous reviewers have talked about... There is still construction going on at the neighboring condos that are being bult. Some construction noise can be heard and there are cranes in sight. However, we were never bothered by the noise or the sights. Overall, we can't say enough great things about this hotel. We would highly recommend it. And the next time we are back on Oahu, we will be sure to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: MaunaKeaFan
Reviews.Content: Recently completed a four day stay at the Ihilani - wish it could have been longer! Everything - and I mean everything - at this resort is exeptional. The rooms are exceptionally comfortable - lots of space, tasteful furnishings, and incredible beds! The bathrooms are HUGE - large soaking tubs, dual vanities, separate showers. The resort supplied shampoos and soaps are excellent. We ate several meals at the Naupaka Terrace - the sunset specials are excellent and fairly priced. For $25 you get salad, entree, and dessert . Again, the quality and presentation were exceptional. Free Kona coffee in the morning - very greatful for that one!! Pool area is gorgeous. Lagoons are very fun - safe and gentle for the kids . We had some pretty decent snorkeling - even saw turtles. We really enjoyed the beachwalk in the evenings - very pretty setting. The grounds of the resort are gorgeous and impeccably maintained. As long as you're not expecting tons of nightlife - this resort is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “hamburger service at filet prices”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler51
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10 days in an oceanfront room. Before booking through expedia, I called the hotel front desk to make sure that I would get credit for my Marriot rewards. I was assured I would. Upon arrival I again was assured that my stay would be honored and gave my rewards number. Upon checkout, I was then told -no can do! Our luggage was misplaced upon arrival. In addition on our third day we drove into Honolulu. Upon our return our keys didn't work. We were told we were checked out even though we had prepaid for 10 days. Took another 1/2 hour to straighten this mess out. Not only would I not stay here again, I will never stay at a Marriott property!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the beds, the people, the weather everything!”
Reviews.Author: AATISHDISH
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, upgraded to partial oceanview no charge, lovely grounds, though doing construction further down. Great food at restaurant, thoroughly enjoyed our Hawaiian vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Best swimming beach for children I have seen”
Reviews.Author: DenverFred
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at the Ihilani resort for 7 nights. As a family of 6 we reserved two adjacent rooms which were very adequate. The resort itself was outstanding. The facilities and quality of the grounds was top notch as were the rooms. Given a choice, I would recommend ocean view rooms on the sunset side or upper level rooms on the pool side given the noise factor by the pool. My children really enjoyed the shark, ray and tropical fish pools and spent a good deal of time there. The beaches were the best I have ever seen for swimming. The lagoon at the Ihilani is the largest and nicest lagoon, however, be careful venturing out to the center point as there is an undertow. Overall, our experience was outstanding and I would return. I'm concerned about the long term future of this location because of all of the new construction of villas, timeshares and Ritz Carlton hotel. The lack of overcrowding is one of the most appealing features especially as the lagoons are like a gigantic swimming pool with lots of room to spread out. However, until the crowds become overwhelming, it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Near perfect for my family”
Reviews.Author: redbrett
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ihilani for a week with our two sons (aged 4 and 8). The hotel bent over backwards to make each of us feel welcomed, safe, and happy. The supervised childrens activities were all excellent. The property (with private lagoons) itself was wonderful for just playing, and the ocean view room was was an excellent size for us. Roys Hawaiian is practically across the street, and other superior restaurants are nearby if you tire of the good restaurants on the property. On the whole, this hotel was everything we wanted. We will return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise under construction”
Reviews.Author: beachnut2
Reviews.Content: Be warned, although the Ilihani is away from the major construction projects going on in this area, the views from the pool area, beach lagoon and most rooms are of the five major cranes down towards the other lagoons. You may not hear the construction noise, but you will see the cranes and the activity. The pool is round and quite small for a resort of this size and caliber. Everything else is very upscale at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “A Hawaiian Paradise”
Reviews.Author: rraaxx
Reviews.Content: " A Pacific Paradise !! " I can not begin to describe the scenery, food, hospitality and comfort served from within the Ihilani without a blushing radiance. From a personal standpoint, I'm not a person that sits without opinion. I do not "sugar coat" what I have experienced or lived. The week before the trip to the island of Oahu, I read almost every review on the Ihilani and was aware of those both satisfied and dissatisfied. To those who left with ill feelings. I must only conclude, yours was a rarity. Our trip began with the ONLY disappointment. There unfortunately is NO free shuttle service to/from the airport. So after a 11 hour trek from New York to the Islands. It was somewhat frustrating to have a $75 tag for car fare from the airport to the hotel. Travel Tip: RENT A CAR ( Aside from the airport use, A trip from the hotel into Waikiki is $100 one way on a metered cab and more using transport service) Upon arriving the bellhop, Check In and general hospitality was both efficient and comforting. We were directed to the Gold plated elevators that would take us to an ocean view room on the 8th floor. Travel Tip: Join AAA Auto Club. The membership is $10 annually and the perk? The membership lowered the cost per night (6 nights) from 325.00 to 285. for the Deluxe Ocean View Room. Very, Very, Niceee. The room was located on south/west side and simply put was "amazing". The room with a sitting area, grand bathroom with separate tub and glassed shower, Hawaiian decor and a 25 foot long opening to an equaled terrace was captivating. The view below displayed the pool and its mosaic logo. The views ahead brought palm trees, lagoons and the Pacific Ocean. Travel Tip: We have included photos to bring our experience from our eyes to yours. Once Outside the hotel you are greeted with palm trees, hammocks, canopy chairs, tiki sun umbrellas, torch lit walkways and 4 individual lagoons. Travel Tip: To the right of the lagoons is a rock jetty that allows for perfect sunset viewing, snorkeling and a private beach area. careful as the jetty at certain points is quite rough. PS. You can also hear the functions and music from the Paradise Cove Luau directly adjacent from the jetty on most night. In all, Hawaii and its paradise have been perfectly captured.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome - can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1godchick
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 day stay at JWM, and we can't wait to go back!! We got there a couple hours early, but we were able to be upgraded to an ocean view room on the 8th floor! Wow, The room was huge, the bathroom was huge, and the sunsets were so perfect. From the view from the lanai, we could see up and down the beach. There was construction the next lagoon over, but it didn't bother us at all. They gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne (for our anniversary). We got the package deal, so it came with the rental car and breakfast for 2 for $28.00. It was the best buffet we've ever been to. The pool was really crowded with kids, but we also came during Spring Break - it would be crowded anywhere! We enjoyed the lagoon, the hamocks, the long walks, ate dinner at the terrace. We loved the location - away from Waikiki and the crowds and traffic. We went into Kapolei to Chili's one night for dinner, only about a 10 minute drive. If you want paradise and gorgeous sunsets, and no crowds, this is it! We''ve been married 30 years, and celebrating in our room was wonderful, so the fact that it was "away from everything" didn't matter to us. We drove one day up to Turtle Bay Resort - too far - JWM was only about 25 minutes from the airport. The Only negative is that the bathroom shower was gross! Needs new grout, and good scrubbing. For such a huge bathroom, you'd think the shower would be bigger too. We were in the wheelchair capable room, so the shower did have the seat in the shower, but still, it was small and dirty looking. All in all, we're planning to go back next year, if not sooner! The staff, the restaurants, the pool attendants, the valet - everybody was so helpful, and courteous. We'll definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family getaway”
Reviews.Author: azislandgirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 days/4 nights at the Ko Olina. It was a wonderful getaway. I totally agree with Profguy's review, posted 3/31, so instead of repeating what he said, I'm going to mention a few other details. Yes, the breakfast buffet was expensive for adults, BUT it is $10 for kids 5-12 yrs old and free for kids under 5. The Japanese restaurant was wonderful. The buffet was pricey at $40pp ($20 for kids) but it was worth it. Every day but Tues/Wed, though, they also have Sunset Sushi from 5:30 to 6:30. They have a limited selection of rolls and sashimi 1/2 price, and also 1/2 price specialty drinks. So if you're not super hungry, it's a good alternative. And they make their California rolls with real crab! Yum!! The program for feeding the hammerhead sharks and rays was cool, but be aware there is a height restriction. My almost 7-year just made it, and he would have been upset if he hadn't been able to do it with his older brother. Be aware that there are a lot of families--We were there during spring break week, so maybe there were more kids than normal. It was fine for us, but someone looking for romance and quiet time by the pool may have been disappointed. We would definitely stay here again, it's perfect for 4-5 days. Our kids were getting restless by the last day--Although we took a whale watching tour, the rest of our activities were at the hotel. If we were going to stay longer, we'd probably rent a house up on the North shore as we've done before.

Reviews.Title: “So relaxing and soothing - beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: AsiaandPeter
Reviews.Content: We live in Honolulu, but wanted to get away for just one night. We got an ocean side (view) room, but our room was on the ground floor so we weren't really able to see the ocean. But, what we did get was incredible! Our room had a little courtyard area and we had our own private jacuzzi! It was heaven! We spent some of the evening in the jacuzzi, we ordered a bottle of wine and had an assortment of cheese and fresh fruit and relaxed the evening away. Later we stopped in at the bar called "Hokulea" and enjoyed some really wonderful entertainment by a musician by the name of Chris Rego. Now I'm not sure if I was just REALLY drunk or what, but I ate the best tuna salad sandwich at the bar while I was there. It was a fabulous tuna salad sandwich that cost $11, but it was worth it, baby! On our way back to the room, we hopped into a hammock and gently rocked away while listening to the rolling waves. Ahhhhh, total relaxation. The bed was very comfortable and welcoming and the bathrooms are so luxurious and elegant. I never wanted to leave this paradise. The service in the outdoor restaurant was a bit slow the next day, but the food tasted great so that made up for it. Enjoy the property and the amenities. It is heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mroth
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and great rooms......could be even better....staff is great.....and location is superb....definitely recommend......this is a winner

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon @ the JW!”
Reviews.Author: Janor26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW for our honeymoon in 2005 and absolutely loved it! Our rate include a car so we upgraded to a mustage convertable and couldn't have been happier. We loved that the hotel felt a thousand miles away from the more crowded beaches of Wikiki. It was so peaceful and relaxing. The staff was very helpful each time we needed something and our room was super comfy. They even gave us a complementary bottle of champagne on our first night. We had breakfast every morning in the terrace restaurant and they had the yummiest french toast with coconut maple syrup! We also tried the Japanese restaurant and ate their twice. It is a little pricy but so nice and quiet and loved just walking to the lobby and right outside to the restaurant. We thought this was the best place for us since we had the flexibiity of a car. We drove all over the island and always felt like we were a thousand miles from any big city. The drive through the pineapple fields was beautiful, especially just as you crest the last hill and see the ocean just below. There was nice little spot for watching the sunset on the hotel property that was almost secluded. We walked out the lobby towards the ponds and just kept going right until we saw a little walkway heading through some bushes and it ends on a nice little beach with a picturesque view of the sunset. We just loved this place and making plans to head back one day!

Reviews.Title: “Room Broken Into at the JW Marriott Ihilani”
Reviews.Author: regnide
Reviews.Content: During my stay, my suite was broken into while we were asleep! My wallet, digital camera, cell phone and golf clubs were all stolen!! The criminals escaped right through the front door of my hotel room in plain view of security cameras! The hotel did little to help except explain the would conduct a thorough investigation and get back with me in two weeks!! We really felt brushed off by the hotel staff, as if to keep things quite so that other hotel guest would not be alarmed. When in fact they defintely should be alarmed so they can try to protect themselves as much as possible. However, the police were much more helpful in getting me information on how to get home with out a form of identifcation! Overall, we will never stay at this establishment again because eventhough bad sutuations occur, it is how they are handled afterwards that is remembered!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: andrewaw
Reviews.Content: Mar 3-8, 2007 My wife and I stayed at the hotel for our ten year anniversary celebration. we could not have been more PLEASED!!! The staff at the concierge made this stay extraordinarily special. We had an ocean view room, which was just that with a breathtaking view of the pacific as well as the pool. The room was quite spacious, wiht a huge bathroom. The food was tremendous, especially the Japanese restaurant, which had very authentic food. The breakfast buffet was wonderful, and i highly recommend a package that includes this; its a wonderful deal!! The pool was wonderful, and although it looked kind of small at first, it never provided a "crowded" feeling. The beach was gorgeous, and the water really is that aqua tropical color. We rented a car for one day only, and this was enough. The beauty of the resort kept us occupied for the rest of the time. We did venture to Honolulu one night for dinner (ALAN WONGS restaurant, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED AS WELL), and we hired a limo for that for a very reasonable rate. We would absolutely return to this hotel, and plan to do so soon

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiloverChicago
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Ko Olina from Jan 24 - 27. Had a wonderful time. Was upgraded to a pool/Partial oceanview. Everyone was very friendly. The room was nice and especially liked the bathroom. It was a very relaxing place with beautiful lagoons. There isn't a lot of night life so if that's what your interested in, it's not the place for you. Great for walking. The food at the pool grill and terrace restaurant is good for lunch or early dinner. Had a great meal at Roy's which is close by. Food is expensive, especially at the resorts and hotels, but it's that way almost everywhere in Hawaii. We also visited Maui and the big island and it's the same. You can go into Kapolei which is about a 10 min. drive if you want to go to Chili's, Outback, KFC and some chinese restaurants. Didn't care for Zippy's (which some others recommended). Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: ilovetotravel365
Reviews.Content: Some of my family and I stayed at the JW Marriott from Feb. 15 through Feb. 21 and it was fantastic. I was concerned about some of the negative comments I read, but I'm convinced some people can complain about anything. We rented a car and the resort was easy to find off the highway. The staff was very friendly, the rooms were clean and spacious. We were upgraded from a mountain to an ocean view room without asking. The only comment I have about the room is that the shower was clear glass so it prevented my niece & I, who were sharing a room, from using the sink & mirror while the other was showering. The restaurants at the resort were pricy, but so is everything in Hawaii, so we drove about 10 minutes to Kapolei where they have all sorts of fast food restaurants as well as Chili's & the Outback. We did eat at the breakfast buffet at the hotel twice and although it's $25, it carried us through lunch. If you're looking to do souvenir shopping, the Big K (KMart) in Kapolei is a great place to go! Lots of trinkets as well as coffee & chocolate covered macadamian nuts at cheap prices. We also bought water & snacks there rather than going to the hotel gift shop. I never had a problem getting a lounge chair at the beach and I'm not sure what people were talking about when they said the pool was small?? Just an aside, don't waste your money on the luau at Paradise Cove near the hotel. It was really cheesy and cost us $65 pp (and that was the cheapest price). I would recommend this resort to anyone traveling to Oahu. It really is in a beautiful setting and is located in a less developed area of the island.

Reviews.Title: “OK not Great”
Reviews.Author: wndyPaloAlto
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great in many ways but I found the decor so plain it was a bit depressing. Everything is WHITE. Especially the main dining area is plain and dark. However, this resort worked well with our 3 kids ages 6, 8, 10. They did the keiki club for 2 days so my husband and I could golf. They really liked it, even our 8 yr old son who is fussy about kids pgms. But the golf is not great in the area. The Ko olina course was off limits due to an LPGA event and the other 2 courses the conciege set us up with were just OK. The kids loved the fish in the manmade ponds but the swimming lagoons although safe and beautiful were boring compared to natural waves and tide pools. The lagoon/ocean view rooms are large! We got adjoining rooms and it was a lot of space. The restaurant food was great for breakfast/dinner but overpriced. Even though we liked our food, we found ourselves not liking the restaurant, just not an upscale feel for the price. Also did the Paradise Cove luau, fun for the kids but not great compared to others we've been to. Another example of just ok is the outside furniture. The barstools are uncomfortable and make a terrible grating sound when moved - cheapness/lack of attention(?). I wanted to really like this resort after reading the reviews but we didn't love it. But I still give it an above avg rating because its "functional" and works as a family beach resort with some nice touches here and there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Flower46
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ihilani Feb 14th -18th. We got there at 1.00pm and was immediately upgraded to a deluxe ocean view on the 9th floor - the view was breath-taking. We were settled in and by the pool by 2 :00 pm (my only complaint was the water in the pool was way too cold to get in). The service was excellent - the front desk, conceirge service, all hotel staff in general could not do enough for us. It was not too crowded and we mainly saw couples with young children and/or teenages. The hotel is definitely showing it`s age but everything is in excellent working order. The gardens, fountains, etc. was lovely. The spa is excellent - I felt rejuvenated after having a massage from Roxanna?, using the Roman bath, and the hot and cold sauna rooms. Dinner at Roy`s was out of this world. We also had dinner at Azul - one of the best I`ve had. Olas on the North shore has wonderful seafood and is right by the sea. USS Arizona and Pali Look-out point are worth a visit. We plan on returning next year. I`ve learned over the years that not everything you read will happen to you - the bad stuff. I check out all the hotels I will be going to stay at through tripadvisor and I only look at relevant points, so far I`ve been very lucky.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed all expectations...”
Reviews.Author: annasmom73
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews from other people, we were scared about this expensive splurge we decided to take. We got to the hotel and from the first moment, knew it would be special. They were getting ready for the Pro-Bowlers (the NFL rents the hotel out), so everything was sparkling clean and everyone was so helpful. We got an amazing room (Rm 315), it was so private, and HUGE, with a great lagoon view. I have never stayed in a place like this! Yes, it is pricey, but if you want a little splurge at the beginning or end of your Hawaiian vacation (like we did) and want to be away from the dump of Waikiki, this is the place. Yes, as other reviewers have said, it is about 30 mins from Honolulu (with no traffic). We were a little perturbed about there not being a single convenience store, other than 15 mins away, but we dealt with it. If you take the Barber's Point exit, there is a mall, with an Outback Steakhouse, KMart, Starbuck's, Jamba Juice, etc... We had the breakfast package at the hotel, which was great. The breakfast buffet otherwise was $24.99 pp!!!!! Yikes. I wouldn't buy it for that price, but if you can get it as part of your package, do it. There was everything you could think of...there is also complimentary coffee to get you going in the lobby which is also good. We ate at the japanese restaurant one night and had the buffet, which was soooo delicious; there was sushi, sashimi, teriyakis, noodles, and huge shrimp and vegetable tempura (among so many other things) , and the drinks were half price before 6:30 so we loaded up!! We also saw Tiki Barber at the restaurant, so that was cool, too!! :-) Valet and garage parking is $18 a day, which I thought was a little nuts, since you are in the middle of nowhere. I think you can park in the lot just before the entrance and not pay. You pay the $18 whether or not you valet it, so we just did the valet. We also used the mini bar in the room, and then realized the same things (sans alcohol) are available in the store on lower level, for about $2-4 dollars cheaper! So don't use your bar, load up on waters, etc. before you check in and just use the fridge (charges are not weight based, so you can load the fridge up). The beach and pools were nice, too. If you take the walkway to the end, then walk about 50 feet, there is a nice, little stretch of real beach that you can use if the waves aren't too big. The lagoon is nice, too, but if you wanted a little privacy, you could walk to this little beach. The snorkeling wasn't great in the lagoon, the water seemed cloudy, although we did see a nice turtle. The neighborhood is gated and secure, which is nice. You can take a walk at night and feel safe. It is a nice area, don't be disturbed at all the industrial plants you see on the way from the airport! (I was a little scared). All in all, we had a great time. We went to Pearl Harbor one day, GO EARLY!!!!! We got there at 8 am and still had to wait an hour to get in. After Pearl Harbor, we went to the swap meet at the Aloha Stadium (the valet has directions), and got a lot of our souvenirs. This was great! Just booths and booths all the way around the stadium with clothing, magnets, key rings, jewelry, fruits, towels, etc, etc, etc....well worth the stop in our opinions. Then we took a ride to Waikiki to experience it, and promptly turned around and drove back to the Marriott. They also let us have a late check out with out charging us til 2 pm which was great; just ask. We plan to return to the JW Marriott one day after saving our pennies again!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Few Days of Paradise at the JWMarriott!”
Reviews.Author: sellingcincy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days on Marriott points after a week in Maui. Without a doubt the most beautiful room and view we've ever had--and we travel ! Our oceanview room was Huge--bath was what you see in $1M homes--balcony was so nice we ordered room service 3 times! Hey, they even bring your own toaster for breakfast room service.!Order for 1 is plenty of food for 2. Resort is picture-perfect-- Even better all the pro football players -and families-were there for Pro-Bowl! What you'll love--walk around the 4 lagoons is 2.5 miles of ocean views! Stop at Marriott villas' Marketplace for wine,beer,snacks etc. Chairs and hammocks on grass nr beach are fine --pool rest. & bar is handy and friendly. Complaints--check-in -we tried to check-in early afternoon and after repeated 'a little while longer' finally got room 2 hrs later at 3:00. Cabanas--they charge $50! c'mon even the guests on expense accounts can't justify that so the cabanas sit empty! Location--We were just there a few days but longer might get boring without much around. Tips-Drive north to see surfers on Sunset Beach Pipeline! Wow!

Reviews.Title: “Love the JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: nwislander0
Reviews.Content: We spent five days at the Marriott Beach Club, then moved to the JW. The room was hugh, bath and dressing room alone was the size of most rooms. The staff was attentive, we had especially good service for our dinner of appetizers at the bar. If we had small children, the Beach Club would be the best choise, the JW is perfect for adults.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: greggyp45
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week long stay at the Ihilani and our feelings completely echo the review posted on Jan 20th. We arrived on Jan 18th so overlapped slightly with that reviewer. The hotel's location was beautiful with wonderful views of the Pacific. The service was average, with some staff, especially at the poolside bar, uninterested and hardly welcoming. I agree with the comments about the lobby being bland, however, the espresso bar was a welcome addition to the distinctly average food on offer in the restaurants. You can at least get a decent coffee and a toasted bagel without taking out a second mortgage! The construction was the worst and most frustrating part of the stay. There is no way such extensive work should be conducted without guests being informed in advance. What's more, the staff were completely dishonest about the duration and extent of the work. We were told at check-in that the work would be completed the following day only for it to continue for the duration of our trip. The sounds of hammering and drilling don't feature in my vision of paradise. It was surreal to be sitting in such a beautiful position, overlooking the Pacific with workmen wandering past. We thought we had arrived at a Village People convention. The noise was unbearable at times. I would not return to the Ihilani and would strongly advise people to consider other options. From reading other reviews, it is clear that the hotel has lost its way and landed some distance from the high standards it once aspired to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a short getaway”
Reviews.Author: Monterone
Reviews.Content: This is a nice retreat from the frenetic activity of Honolulu and Waikiki, but I wouldn't want to spend more than a couple of days here. It's relaxing, but there isn't a whole lot to do. The lagoons are nice and peaceful. The calm water (with big fish) is perfect for young children or for swimming laps. The pool is crowded, especially since a section of it was closed for construction while we were there. To make up for it, they gave us coupons for free shave ice at the "Lagoon Lawn." But when we got there, the shave ice machine was shut down and remained so the entire time that we were there. Pretty lame. The Japanese restaurant was excellent. We tried the Monday night buffet, and the food was uniformly delicious. They had a ton of different types of dessert (somewhat unusual for a Japanese restaurant) and I enjoyed all of it. The gym is small and poorly designed. It's divided into two small rooms: a weight room, which was empty, and a cardio room, which was overcrowded. My wife and I stayed using our Marriott points, and they gave us a free upgrade to a deluxe, ocean-view room. The view was very nice (especially of the sunset), and the room was spacious. Overall, the hotel feels more like a regular Marriott hotel rather than a fancy "JW Marriott," though -- the lobby has an institutional feel (reminded me a lot of the Hyatt Regency lobby in San Francisco), and there are definitely large groups who stay here. We got to the registration desk right after a big convention group had arrived, so it took us 20 minutes to check in. The room furnishings are fine but not luxurious. The prices are certainly worthy of a "JW," however!

Reviews.Title: “A disapointment”
Reviews.Author: PJMID
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stay at the JW Ihilani. I had read the reviews, seen pictures, and felt prepared for what to expect, but felt disappointed with the property none-the-less. There are some great things about the hotel, don't get me wrong, but I feel the property does not come close to other JW's we'ved stayed at, or the many other hotels we have visited in Hawaii. Overall, I think the property is unimpressive. I am used to the big grand lobby with views out to the ocean, comfy furniture, lush tropical flowers, ponds, etc. The lobby is stark and cold. Nothing impressive about it. Even though I had seen pictures of the pool area, I guess I was expecting more. It is small and crowded and not much fun. You can find the same or better at a condo. Again, NOTHING compared to the meandering pools, lagoons and fun water features of the many other 5 star Hawaiian hotels we've been. Also thought the poolside service was spotty. Some staff great and friendly, others cold and grumpy. We have two young children and thought the lagoons were great. Nice white sandy beaches with calm waters. Perfect for us. There is a really nice path to walk or jog along, but to get anywhere, you need a car. Our room was really nice, with a great ocean front view, but it was such a pain to have to call for ice! I read that in another review and didn't think much of it, but we called for ice everyday at least once (for which you have to wait and are expected to tip.) The food was a total disappointment. Very mediocre at best. We ate at Roy's several times which I think is the only good food option around. The above review does not even take into account the fact that they are doing construction on the hotel (shady portion of pool deck and hot tub closed for 3 days) which is still going on. CALL if you are going soon. The stone work was still being done on the pool deck when we left, as was the work over the lagoons and lobby area. MAJOR construction noise (hammering, pounding, drilling, etc.) which we could hear perfectly from our 10th floor lanai. ARRGH. Biggest issue with that was that we were not informed prior to our visit. But...that's another issue. So....I guess if you want to visit Oahu and avoid crowds, this might be the place for you. I suggest another island completely (try Maui or Kauai first). They're much better!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: notredame2002
Reviews.Content: We spent the first week of our honeymoon at the JW Marriott. This place is wonderful. The staff is awesome and the resort is gorgeous. They have lagoons you can swim in so you don't have to worry about waves. The pool area is clean and has plenty of chairs and towels and a bar with deliscious drinks. What made this resort really stand out was the staff. My husband accidently took a chanpagne cork to the eye on what was suppose to be our last night there before we headed to Maui. The doctor was gone for the evening but security was sent up. They provided us with ice packs and called an ambulance. The ambulance came quickly and looked at him and it was decided we needed to head to the ER. It was dark out and this hotel is in a remote area so I was in no condition to drive behind the ambulance but it was no worry because the hotel offered to pick us up at the emergency room when we were done at no charge. When we were released at 3 in the morning the reosrt brought us a driver who then took us to the only 24 hour drug store near by. He said he would wait for our prescription but it was going to be an hour so I insisted the driver go back and we would take a taxi back. I tried to give him a tip but he refused, stating we have been so much this evening that accepting a tip would not be right. We got back to the resort around 4am where there was still friendly staff to greet you. Four hours later at 7am we had the earthquake which was incredibly scarey. We were suppose to be heading to honolulu to meet with an eye doctor but because of the earthquake we had no idea what to do. We were also suppose to fly out. The concierge kept calling the doctor for me while i sat with my temporarily blind husband. She got in touch with him for me and gave me directions to the hospiatl I had to meet him at. Because of the earthquake and my husbands eye injury we could not fly out and the hotel gave us the hotel room for another night even though someon was suppose to be checking into that room. All I can say is this place is great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great rooms but can get boring!”
Reviews.Author: TheRealMC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in December. This was our ending to a two week vacation in Hawaii (various islands) and we were coming to the hotel after staying in Waikiki for 4 nights. Overall, this is a really nice hotel. Per the previous posters, the location of the hotel is definitely out of the way - it took us about 40 minutes to get to the hotel from Waikiki without any traffic. The rooms are serene and lovely. We had an ocean-view king on the 7th floor. The bed was extremely comfortable, the room was a decent size, and the bathroom was fabulous. A few issues we had included the very frustrating set up of the tv/closet/dresser - very annoying! The bathroom shower seal leaked at the bottom of the shower door, so there were large puddles of water on the floor. The lanai was large and very nice, and the lanai furniture was comfortable but stained. The pool was not huge and COLD - I assume it's not heated? Also, the hot tub was really dirty - sand and dirt on the side walls and in the water. Regarding the beach and lagoons, the sand on the beach was very rough (rocks) and quite dirty (lots of cigarette butts). But the lagoons/water themselves were calm and nice. And the sunsets from the hotel grounds are fabulous! We ate dinner one night at Naupaka Terrace and the food was good, not great, and we thought the prices were decent for a hotel. However, our waiter was quite pretentious and a male chauvinist. He called my husband by our last name ("Mr. XXX") yet did not refer to or talk to me at all, except when he took my order. He even called my husband "Captain" - weird. We are an attractive couple in our early 30's, and our waiter was in his early 30's as well, so who knows where any of his attitude came from. We did get room service for lunch on our last day, and the price was pretty outrageous...$6 for a can of diet coke! Our $55 order consisted of simply a burger, salad and two cokes. The food was fine but way too expensive for what we got. We did go to Roy's one night for dinner and it was wonderful, from the staff to the food. We highly recommend it! So here is our summary about the hotel. It's a very nice place to go if you are going just for the hotel (or to golf or spa, which we did not do), and not to walk around, see sights, tour, do activities, etc. It's quite a distance from Honolulu and I would not want to make that trek every day. It was very relaxing but for us, we could only take it for a few days. If we stayed any longer, we would get really bored quite quickly!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: quickmaxx
Reviews.Content: Right before Christmas, my family and I had a wonderful week long stay at the Ihilani. For the first part of our stay, the hotel was rather quiet which was nice, but as it got closer to Xmas it got more crowded. We had the most gorgeous, ocean view two bedroom suite on the 16th floor. The room couldn't have been nicer. The bathroom was spacious and luxurious. My two children ages 7 and 12 love the pool (though a little on the small side) and beach and there are always tons of kids around to make friends with. This hotel really is a great family hotel. Each morning we enjoyed the breakfast buffet (though costly). The resort area is gorgeous and the 4 lagoons make for a great beach front run. The staff at the beach rentals are helpful and friendly. I do have a couple of problems with the hotel. First of all, it seemed understaffed. It took over an hour and several phone calls to get house keeping to bring extra pillows to the room. Also, the turn down service was sporadic and every request took two phone calls. Second complaint, the food. As we did not rent a car, we were stuck within the resort for dining. The three restaurants on the property are pricey and frankly not that great. They lack variety and imagination. Given the remoteness of this resort, the restaurants always seemed to be unpleasantly crowded. The food at the pool is horrible. The hotel needs some more restaurants. We did dine at Roy's at the golf course twice which was good and we also ate over at the Ko Olina pool once which was actually better than the Ihilani. The spa has high prices and average amenities - a little overrated. Overall, I do like this hotel a lot and probably would stay here again. I like this part of Oahu - it is quiet and away from the craziness of Waikiki, but not as far as the North Shore.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Stay”
Reviews.Author: Phfaktr
Reviews.Content: This is a review from a Marriott Platinum member. I read a ton of reviews and have traveled and stayed at multiple Marriott sites. I do believe that whether or not someone likes/dislikes a particular resort is based on previous experiences and what one is looking to get out of a particular stay. My wife and I celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary in Hawaii. First in Oahu at the JW Marriott and then in Maui, at the Marriott Wailea Resort (see separate rating). We took our children (ages 10 to 21) and we just wanted to relax…and relax we did. The JW Marriott was extremely peaceful (we definitely chose a good time of the year to go (Dec. 16-24th)). The holiday decorations were absolutely gorgeous. Check-in was perfect (Stasia was extremely welcoming). We had already been upgraded to a garden view (did I want more? Sure, but this was fine). We had two rooms side by side and the way the doors worked were perfect (separate doors for each room, and then an outer set of doors for both of our rooms). Our rooms overlooked the gardens (and stingray pool). The staff was incredibly pleasant and professional no matter where we were or what we did. Dinner (the seafood buffet) was very expensive (we expected this based upon the reviews), but incredibly good. My boy and I ate at Roy's for lunch one day and were not nearly as impressed as the reviews led us to believe. We ordered up pizza one evening – exceptional and not a bank killer. Oh, and the free coffee in the morning was one of 'my' favorite things since I am more of an early riser in my family. We all had Spa treatments (except for my 10-year old), and man, what a treat. SO SO SO glad we decided to indulge hear at the JW rather than the Mandarin Spa at the Marriott Wailea in Maui. Again, the staff was amazing! At the end of our 4-day stay here I realized one thing…We should've ended with the JW on our trip, as opposed to starting. The only negatives: Bathroom towels were nothing special, our room was on the 4th floor – right above the restaurant outdoor seating and heard the clatters of dishes throughout the evening, and the Lanai furniture was not that clean. Congrats to the JW Marriott in Ko Olina – you were worth every 'point.' Yes, I used points throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Angela_and_Eduard
Reviews.Content: In late September we stayed a week in this Hotel with Marriott Reward points. Due to plane problems e arrived very late after a 24 hours flight (with UAL plane problem in SFO) and we were very happy to be upgraded to a nice ocean view room on the north east side of the hotel. This was our second stay in Hawaii (it is quite far away from Switzerland) and we did not want to stay again in Waikiki. Sitting on the lanai in the evening with a nice cocktail, hearing the birds in the tree and looking spectacular sunsets is absolutely super. Positive: Big clean room with very good bed ans nice bathroom Very nice and helpful staff Nice swimming bay Very calm Negative: Pool too small Jacuzzi walls very greasy and dirty in the evening Parking too expensive, no possibility for free parking We had dinner in 3 restaurants in the Hotel Naupaka Terrace (medium quality) Ushio-Tei (Japanese buffet with good quality) Azul (very good quality but quite expensive) Outside we had dinner at Roy’s (not very satisfied) Ruth’s Chris Steak house in Honolulu (very good beef) We liked the hotel and we can recommend it in any sense.

Reviews.Title: “repeat traveler review”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveler27
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel many times over the past years. The hotel was pure paradise before Marriott took over (as mentioned in previous posts). The hotel now draws a different type of crowd vs. when it was privately owned. At this time the hotel attracts some conventions and families whereas before it was very upscale and private, not much noise, more of an adult resort. Much more traffic now with visitors also using the hotel ammenities from the time shares next door. As mentioned in many previous posts there is one main (small) pool and is always filled with little ones. For an adults only swimming experience one can walk over to the spa and fitness center where there is another larger pool but you do not have the ocean views. Overnight parking is $15.63 with tax and if you also have a breakfast buffet package there is another add on charge of approx. 2.63 per day that will show on the final hotel bill. So those were the negatives, now for the positives. The breakfast buffet is wonderful and one of the reasons we keep coming back to the Ihilani. Standard rates are $27 per person but as mentioned above one can include the buffet in a room package. Each morning there is an assortment of muffins, breads, waffles, pancakes or french toast. There are also potato/sausage selections as well as a small japanese breakfast with miso soup if desired. One can choose their own fresh fruits and make a smoothie. There is also another large regular fruit station with Hawaiian grown favorites such as mangos, papaya, pineapples, etc. All of the food venues are very good at the hotel. For lesser priced dinners one can drive to the town of Kapolei, about 5-7 minutes away where there is a Zippy's, Chili's, and cheaper restaurants. We love Zippy's! Kapolei also has movie theatres. We had an ocean view room facing the Paradise Cove luau side on the 6th floor. The views were beautiful, not just of the ocean but of the mountains too. There were lovely sounds of birds singing at sunrise and sunset. All of the staff is very friendly. A new feature we learned of since our previous stay is that the spa is now offering daily specials. They generally seem to be 15% off a specified treatment per day. Also there are now daily sales in the gift shops. In the business center internet usage is .50 per minute and the price to print is $1 per page. There is also a shipping service. There are covered canopy chairs at the beach for a fee and standard beach chairs that are free. Also there are a few covered huts, around 8 or so on the beach and grass. The lagoon is very swimable and generally very safe. As mentioned in previous posts driving time from the resort to Honolulu can be anywhere from 25 minutes to an hour depending on traffic. If you are looking for a getaway from the congestion of Waikiki this hotel is a good choice on the island. If you are looking for total quiet without interruption perhaps the Big Island would be better. When visiting this hotel don't forget to check out the sting rays and fish in the hotel's lagoons, there are scheduled feeding times during the day. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place~would love to return”
Reviews.Author: kerri53
Reviews.Content: This is truly one of the best vacation weeks we have ever had! I loved loved loved the JW. The food was great. I thought that $28 was a little stiff for the breakfast buffet though but otherwise prices on par. One of the best spas I have ever been to is housed in this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A unique experience...what you are paying for here is service.”
Reviews.Author: villarancho
Reviews.Content: I sort of have mixed feelings about this place. On the one hand, if i were on my honey moon and just wanted to plant myself somewhere for a 2-3 days, then this place would be great. There is only one pool, but there is a lagoon very close by. There are restaurants, but they are expensive. The room is pretty small if you are going to have any more than 2 people in it. Overall, what you are paying for here is service. When you first check-in, you get a moist towel to freshen up while you wait. Then, at 11am, when the pool bar opens, complimentary shaved ice is passed out. Need something? Call downstair and it is taken care of. Then, you are very close a a sandy lagoon, and the pool is wonderful but often crowded at it is probably one of the main attractions (especially for kids), There is a small shark pool (for viewing only, please)! The bell desk and valet are most helpful. I am content to say that for a price of $300 or more, you are probably better off staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon... nice hotel... but”
Reviews.Author: aliwnec10
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the JW from October 15-22nd for our honeymoon. Okay honest opinions... The hotel is very nice, the staff is very friendly, and the concierge is the best. Our view from our room was a bit less impressive but that's okay. The room was very nice and i LOVED the huge bathroom. However, i hated the fact that there was no mini fridge to use. Yes they had a mini bar in the room... but there was a $25 charge to have them empty it out and for us to use it for our own personal use. That is a rip-off! I also hated the doors on the closet. It was a huge door that had 4 pieces to it that would slide back and forth. But if one side was open, the other side had to be closed. It was very hard to get into the closet, especially if my husband had his side open. It's hard to explain. It was just an annoyance for us. The pool was nothing special. It was a bit disappointing actually. It was just a huge circle pool. The Marriott beach club down the road had an awesome pool though. We absolutely LOVED the restaurant Azul's though (which is in the JW). It was so good!!! We also got the room service pizza... which was SO GOOD by the way. We got that a few times. very yummy! Bottom line... the hotel was okay for us. We loved that it was secluded from Waikiki. Waikiki for us was only about 20-30 minutes away and we went there often. One thing we didn't realize was that they charge you $15 a day for parking in their garage (you have no choice). I just wish i was told this when we checked in because we used valet every day thinking it was cheaper than paying for parking in their garage. We would have rather parked our car ourselves if we knew we were paying for the garage no matter what. I will say that it would be much nicer if there were a few surrounding hotels with other restaurant choices available. We definitely liked the hotel and we had a good experience. But there are a few things i'd change if i could.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull”
Reviews.Author: KrAshton
Reviews.Content: Spent 10/20-10/23 at the Ihilani. It's a gorgeous place. We asked for an oceanview upgrade (as hubby is a platinum member). The room was spectacular, we swung the doors wide open and took a few pictures after we set the luggage down. Then . . . our neighbors w/ young kids stepped onto their lanai . . . kids screaming about the rays, look look look! There was absolutely NO WAY I was staying in a room where screaming-aged children could see into my room. A quick call to the desk scored us a jr. suite. Sweet! Can't say enough about he property, it really is flawless. The valet staff and Bell Captain are priceless. Lots of great help from Tommy, and he's pretty easy on the eyes. I referred to him as Hot Tommy when showing hubby all the places that he suggested on the North Shore. Every one was right on! Giovanni's shrimp truck, Sunset Beach & the Pipline and Ted's Bakery for choc/coconut cream pie! When checking out they loaded our luggage like puzzle pieces. They were great. Overall everyone there was pretty nice. We ate at the bar and the pool and the pool was better. We had a cooler of beer that we tapped into everynight while we sat on the lanai during/after sunsets. We were going to try the Saturday night seafood buffet, but it was loud, crowded and we saw people standing at the buffet w/ plates in their hands waiting for something to be refilled. Not our scene . . . which leads to the not so fabulous points. This place is in the middle nowhere. We took a drive north on Farrington and could not find anywhere to eat, just lots of homeless villages on the beach. To echo previous posters, beautiful, quiet and out of the way, maybe just a little too far out of the way. The rest of the week we stayed on Waikiki, the opposite extreme. :-) Will add pictures soon.

Reviews.Title: “First Anniversary with an Earthquake!”
Reviews.Author: LaurenEk77
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying my husband and I are around 30, with no kids. I basically plan my travel around the reviews on tripadvisor- so I am going to be as detailed as possible, but try to not repeat things I agree with on previous posts! Sorry for the length- but hope it helps! It was very easy to find from the Airport and after we rented a convertable at the airport (I would not do it any other way!) and it took us about 35 minutes to get to the hotel. We checked in and were given fresh towels to cool our hands (no leis to our dismay!). Our room was unbelievable! It is very large, with a couch, chair, coffee table and desk across from the bed. The decor is minimal which is great b/c of the view. There are large window/sliding glass door. Balcony is very roomy. You can either have shutters, screen, or shut the glass doors. Note the nitelite under the nightstands! A nice glow for late at night- the switches are next to you in bed on stand. The bed linens and comforter were AWESOME, but I think Marriott usually has softer beds, so I was surprised it was not as soft. Six pillows on the bed- so have your pick of hard, soft, or med! Plenty of places to unpack your clothes- and around 10 hangers. You also have robes and shoes. We paid for garden view upgrade and they "upgraded" us again for ocean view- which put us over the stingray pool with a partial view of ocean. But we could see the sunset easily which was great. Pool was okay- and unfortunately, it was 8-10 days after a full moon which is when jelly fish come, so lagoons were out for a few days (however people were in them and I did not see anyone get stung). If I could recommend going to the back of the pool area- by the lagoon, the chairs are turned to the lagoons so you get the breeze from the lagoons- but you can have your drinks! No drinking IN pool or down by lagoons. So this spot worked out well for us and no one else seemed to notice how perfect the seats were! They are VERY generous with their towels by the pool and we never had a problem getting any. A beautiful walk in the morning around the lagoons. There are cats and some kind of other animal, like gophers or something that make it even more interesting! Back to the room: water is the DOSS water and pretty expensive- I think $4. We made a trip to Sam's and got lots of bottled water and our own liquor. No one seemed to mind when we kept it in the fridge. We also kept lei's in the fridge the whole time. Now, on a common topic- ICE! I have to say, I have never been offered ice so much in my life. I had the opposite experience as most posters on here. Whenever our room was cleaned, someone came soon after to fill our ice, whenever we got room service, they offered a seperate bucket of ice with it. We never had to ask for it and like I said, we made alot of our own drinks in the room. Great service! Now on service: EXCELLENT!!!!!!!! The front desk was always available and friendly, the cleaning service was amazing and we hardly ever saw them! The concierge was helpful and had a lot of real advice. The wait staff was hit or miss. It seemed to take a LONG time to get a drink no matter where we went. I'll go more into restaurants. First I have to talk about the valet- they were the best valet ever! VERY friendly and like said before- they know the island better than anyone- even concierge. They also give towels out as you are on your way out in case you need them which was a nice bonus! They even always had our top down on our car for us! Naupaka- first night we had Damian as a waiter and he was the best we have ever had. I ordered all of his recommendations and was more than pleased. The second night we ate here- the wait staff was not as helpful and food and drinks took a long time. We got Mike at the end to replace who we had and he made up for the bad service and bad food we had rec'd (we DO NOT recommend the seafood platter for two- shrimp, tuna, oyesters, and crab, it had no taste) But the OPA specialty was great as well as the corn chowder. Mike got us a free piece of pie for our anniversary. The breakfast buffet is GREAT!!!! A bit pricey at $26 pp, but VERY VERY good! We walked down to the sister hotel and paid $16pp, it was a decent buffet, but not as good as Ihilani's. You can also get a sweet breakfast or ham and cheese croissent with your free coffee in the morning (of course the food and latte's aren't free). Azul- pretty much same food as Naupaka, but fancier, better service, more pricey and you can get a great view. More steaks. We did see the management correcting the hostess in front of us which seemed a bit unprofessional. Hokulea Lounge- we only went twice and were not impressed. Took a long time to get a drink and no view. It was okay. Pool bar- better than most pool bars as far as food. we had drinks there the day of the earthquake and I don't think the bartender was too happy he had to work. The waitresses were very nice. Recommend the pork sandwich and a sandwich that was like a cuban but better! They made all this w/o electricity (earthquake day) and it was just as good! Still wish we could have drinks in pool and lagoons, but oh well. As far as the earthquake- I think it was handled very well. It was our first earthquake and we ran downstairs. The friendly face at the front desk said it was a "tremor" when a man behind us laughed and said it was no tremor, but everyone remained calm. The electricity was out, yet they kept Naupaka and pool bar opened and made what they could. They made an announcement when we could expect electricity back on and they were right on. After hearing some nightmare stories from WAikiki, I was glad they handled it so well. I did not give it an excellent, b/c I have to admit my husband and I got BORED! It is pretty far from things and the bar is not "fun". No dancing or anything. We ended up leaving early and heading for Waikiki for some night fun and more daily activities. The first few days were nice for relaxing but we can only relax so much. So if you are looking for a relaxing vacation, this is the place! If you want a little more excitement and not into routine as much, you may want to try Waikiki. As for myself, I think a few days at KoOlina and then a few at Waikiki would be perfect! Do not miss things to do on Oahu- Hawaii Shark Encounters on North Shore, canoe riding on Waikiki, despite some fo the reviews on Paradise Cove (walking distance) we LOVED it!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Hawaii to date”
Reviews.Author: RBerthelot2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Marriott for 4 nights and had a great experience. They upgraded us to an ocean view for our honeymoon, however, besides that we were pleased overall. The beds and pillows were super comfortable, the staff were all super nice, the grounds are beautiful and had a great breakfast buffet. If you're looking to stay in Oahu but away from downtown Honolulu this is the place. The only downside was the dining on the premesis was a slighty under par for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing resort!”
Reviews.Author: SkipperB
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a ten day stay at the Marriott Ihilani, and had a great experience overall. The grounds are lovely. Our daughter loved the stingray/shark ponds and taking walks along the lagoons in the evening. The size of the swimming pool never bothered us - - because we gravitated every day towards the beach and snorkeling in the lagoon. I have no idea why anyone would complain about the rooms being small. They are very generous as well as clean and comfortable. The bathroom was gorgeous and we felt like we were living in the lap of luxury, what with the spa robes and slippers provided and the spectacular views from our lanai. I recommend requesting a ''sunset view'' if possible. There is construction taking place off the other side of the hotel, and three huge cranes are visible. Every employee we encountered was friendly and helpful. The concierge gave excellent directions to any of the sights on Oahu. The parking attendants provided fresh towels and bottled water and were also very willing to offer island info. I would HIGHLY recommend purchasing the breakfast package. The buffet every morning was awesome - - with a wonderful and delicious variety of fruit, waffles, omelets, eggs, etc. A person could live off of it until dinnertime, which is what we usually did! The restaurants at the hotel are expensive, but driving to Kapolei is no big deal .. and there are many options there. The only drawback might be the location. The hotel itself is in an upscale environment .. but just up the coast are miles of beaches inhabited by homeless people living in tents. Don't be tempted to turn left on the highway to explore, you'll regret it! And to the other side of the hotel (heading towards Kapolei) is Barber's Point, which is a big industrial park. Not attractive. But it definitely didn't spoil our trip. The hotel was heavenly and I highly recommend it to anyone in need of rest and pampering.

Reviews.Title: “Better then a Ritz Carlton experience!”
Reviews.Author: affluent_traveler
Reviews.Content: We decided since this is our 3rd time back to Oahu, we will stay off Waikiki. The same time last year,2005 we were at The HALEKULANI. So this hotel had a lot to live up to. Unlike Waikiki hotels, JW Marriott has immense & beautiful grounds. Everything was so spreadout compare to Waikiki. Rooms...The hotel has over 300 rooms and all of them are refurbished with a contemporary Hawaiian look. No awful colorful tropical print bedspreads! The bathroom was huge! Separate tub and standup shower with glass doors. Seaparte water closet. Double sinks on opposite sides on the room. Oh and the patio is huge! Fits 1 huge lounge chair, a table with two big chairs and there is so much room to walk around! We had an oceanviwm room, laid in the bed and saw the sun setting over the ocean. Below our room was the stingray and tropical fish lagoons. Between the JW Marriott & the Beach club they built 4 tremendous man-made lagoons. Soft sand with the non-turbulent water protect by rocks. Great for snorkeling. Pool...just right for the 3hundred something rooms. Lounge chairs has blue cushions. Breakfast buffet was excellent! We had buffet breakfast at The Grand Hyatt in Kauai and it was poorly done compare to this. Azul restaurant was sooooooo good! Service excellent. By the way for hikers that are staying here...The Waimano Pools, for intermediate to novice hikers only! Not for beginners!!!! This hike is not in Oahu Revealed book, ask a local for directions if concerige pretends they have no idea what you are talking about.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable Ko Olina Resort”
Reviews.Author: Jawbreaker5
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fabulous!! Unbelieveable gounds, lagoon area, all you would expect away from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu. Rooms very very nice, comfortable, roomy, clean, guest staff very friendly, knowledgeable. Island paradise. Stayed on Kauia 1 week, wished I would have stayed both weeks at Ko Olina. Has to be one of Marriott's best. Early mornings breathtaking from the lagoon area just feet from the ocean. Very relaxing, uncrowded lagoon beach front, able to relax and enjoy. Outdoor cafe, extremely large pool area, multiple hot tobs outdoor breakfasts beside the garden area adjacent to the pool area, or lagoon side cafe area facing the ocean. You won't believe it until you see it. Long walks from Ihilani to the Ko Olina area spectacular day and night. I would stay here again and plan to in the future. The sunsets are absolutely amazing from the room patios. Again, staff are above expecations, and very helpful and friendly. Wouldn't stay anywhere else. If your wanting paradise in Hawaii, this is it!!

Reviews.Title: “very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: John_in_central_CA
Reviews.Content: I wanted to go to Oahu and see the sights, but I didn't want the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. I'm there to relax - I don't want to be in the city. We booked our room at the Ihilani because it looked far enough away from the city, but close enough to drive in and see the sights during the day - we werent disappointed. The hotel itself is very nice, well appointed, and in an excellent location. The on-site lagoons are great for swimming or snorkling, and there is plenty of space and available lounges to lay out and relax. At some resorts, I've had to get up early to stake out a spot and a chair - not this one. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Overall, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to someone that doesn't want to be surrounded by traffic, high-rises, and crowds. Negatives: Slight extra cost for a refrigerator in the room - didn't deliver it until two days after we requested it - after a second request, and then tried to bill us for it for all of the days. Mistakes happen. When brought to their attention, they apologized and didn't hesitate to remove the charges from our bill. Cost of food at the hotel - hey it's Hawaii - what do you expect? ALL hotels have expensive food. We got the refrigerator and got some snacks at the Safeway in Kapolei - a 5 minute drive from the hotel. Other food in Kapolei: Outback, Chili's, McDonalds, Quizno's, Jack in the Box, Burger King, etc. Plenty of cheaper food options close by - just not in walking distance. Traffic driving into the city - worth the trade off in my opinion. Figure an hour in the morning to get to waikiki, and about a half hour to get to Pearl Harbor during traffic time. Hey, it's vacation - who's in a rush? Overall, I looked at a lot of other hotels while we were there. I didn't see any that made me wish I had stayed there instead. The best place in Oahu for me. The only other option I would go for is the Marriott beach club about a half mile down the beach - only because the rooms have a full kitchen which would have been nice, and a larger pool. Not a big deal for me, but if you have kids, the beach club might be the better option. The Ihilani is a little more suited to quiet adults.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience; A bit far from Waikiki Action”
Reviews.Author: OneOverPar
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best resorts we've stayed at in the US. I'd echo everything the other travellers have said in terms of the quality of the resort. A few other comments: - All hotel services were fantastic. - The pool and the lagoons were average places to "be in the water". - The Breakfast Buffet is to die-for. Make sure you get that in your package. - It is a bit far from Waikiki and more importantly Honololu Downtown. If you are the types that want activities and people, etc. you will end up driving a lot. Not necessarily bad but you may want to be prepared for it.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place to relax and get away from hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: bufalowevr
Reviews.Content: As our first stop on a 10 day tour of Hawaii, we were very happy with our stay at the JW Mariott. When we arrived we spent our first afternoon at the pool and around the beautiful lagoon. Fantastic sunning and swimming. We ate at the restaurant Azul which was fairly good for the price. Our room was fantastic. We had a view of the manta ray pool and could partially see the ocean. One of the things we loved about the property was our lanai. We sat out there and ate breakfast each morning and were able to sleep with the windows open to hear the ocean. Also, the bathroom was very large and had two sinks which is always nice when you're travelling with others. Although a bit far away from island activities, it was a nice retreat. Overall, we had no complaints about the JW and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Oahu Oasis...Ihilani is Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: DallasCouple27
Reviews.Content: We had the privilege of staying at the Ihilani from August 28 to 31, 2006 on the first leg of a two island trip. This is a spectacular property with wonderful service. I specifically booked this property to avoid the congestion of the Waikiki area, and anyone who relishes the feeling of seclusion will appreciate it. This resort is a twenty minute drive west from the Honolulu airport, which is approximately forty-five minutes from Waikiki. The resort is nestled within the gated Ko'Olina resort community. When we pulled up to the resort, we were greated by the valet who said "we'll take care of everything." After an effortless check-in, we received a call from the bell desk asking if we were ready for our luggage. This was an excellent start to a great stay at the Ihilani. We booked an ocean-view room with the breakfast package. (More on the breakfast later). Our immaculate and spacious room (4th floor) overlooked the pool and one of the Ko'Olina lagoons. It was magical. I travel a lot for business, but this trip was our anniversiary and the Ihilani did not dissapoint. The room...is very nice with a separate seating area, a large balcony, and a huge bathroom with his/hers sinks and tub and a separate shower. There is a fully-stocked mini-bar, but beware as there are many goodies which carry a hefty fee. You will have to figure out all the other great features of the rooms when you get there! Dining - The Ihilani has a magnificient Japanese restaurant called "Ushio Tei," which served a fabulous buffet on our first night. The selections were numerous and fresh, including out-of-this-world creme brule. Again, for more detail...go there!!! We wish we could again, and again. They also have the absolute, without a doubt, best breakfast buffet...ever. (There is a scale in your room, which I recommend that you don't pay any attention to while you are there). They have smoked salmon, eggs, fresh fruit, omlettes, etc. (I promise...I don't work for the Ihilani!). The grounds are immaculate, and just the right size. They have a shark and fish pond as well as a pond with manta rays. Note...Manta Rays are not dangerous and we are troubled to hear that people are attacking these poor creates in the wake of Steve Erwin's death since our stay conincided with that tragedy. The Rays at this resort are tame and quite used to the presence of people. We spent most of our three days on activities around Oahu including swimming with dolphins, skydiving, soaking up North Shore sun, etc. We wish we spent more time at this resort and the great lagoons, but get out and explore the wonders of O'ahu. The biggest mistake I hear people make is that they didn't think that there is much to do on O'ahu and they don't allow themselves enough time here. We had read other reviewers complain about the size of the pool, but it was fine as there are huge lagoons to go swim in, as well. I really don't have anything to complain about regarding the Ihilani. We were disappointed in the Turtle Bay, but all was right at the Ihilani. This resort is on the leeward, or dry, side of the island. The surrounding mountains are very brown and not much to look at in late-August / early September. So if you came all the way here to save money on a mountain view room, you may want to cough up the extra money to get an ocean view. Hey, how often do you get to stay in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “A treasure in Oahu”
Reviews.Author: Arteil
Reviews.Content: The hotel and rooms are beautiful and the ocean view rooms are worth every penny. The food is excellent and expensive, but when you are vacationing at a top resort, you expect high food prices and excellent quality. The fresh fruits at the breakfast buffet couldn't have been better. We had delicious dragon fruit for the first time. The staff was extremely courteous. Roy's has good food, but the entire meal took under one hour as the staff seems to want you out so they can get in the next customer. When you are on vacation and your evening activity is dinner, you should not be rushed. It's great to have a Hertz rental counter right there too. The limousine service from the airport was arranged by the hotel and everyone was on time. A really great experience.

Reviews.Title: “No Waikiki Here, Just Hawaii As It Should Be”
Reviews.Author: WorldBeachTraveler
Reviews.Content: I spend about 100 days/yr traveling and stay at Marriott properties on about 90 of these nights. This Hotel is spectacular with great service. We were upgraded to a suite that was fantastic. Call before your trip to request a room on a high floor with a view. Worst rooms are any that face the spa or carport entrance side. There is no coffee in the rooms although they do have a station from 6am to 10am in the lobby that offers complimentary coffee. Nice, large rooms well appointed and very clean. We really liked the remote control for the lights and ceiling fans. Did not like having to order ice, rather than walking to an ice machine. Bathroom was well appointed with giant tub and separate shower. Sign up for the Marine Life Program at the hotel.
