You can feed the sharks and rays in the hotel's ocean ponds that are ironically adjacent to the pool. It's totally safe and the kids will really enjoy this experience. Spa - Nice selection and okay fitness center...a bit small, but good machines and free weights. Food - Typical hotel food is the norm at the JW Marriott, just more expensive. Room service was okay if you have kids, but always skip the Poolside Grill - food is worse than McDonalds. Take a short walk over to Roy's if you want to stay close to the propery or walk over to the Marriott Ko Olina Time Share for breakfast buffet at $12. Visit Sam Choy's in Honolulu, especially if you have kids. Pool - Very small. Go to the beach instead, you're in a tropical paradise. No worries about getting chairs at the lagoons and never too crowded. Some advice for your stay: Rent a car; it's worth it. Stop by one of the K-Mart stores on the way from Honolulu (exit 7 off H1). There's an area in nearby Kapolei with restaurants and you can check your room phone book for coupons, which will yield a lot of deals at local eateries (not in the resort). Jurison's for breakfast, now that's good! sorta like a i-hop or Denny's but way better! Visit Pearl Harbor - Go early in the morning, around 7:00 am. Visit the USS Arizona first, then tour the USS Missouri. Opens at 7:30am. If you get there after 10am the lines can get long and you may spend 1-2 hours in line. Battleship USS Missouri and Submarine USS Bowfin are in the same area. These are about $15 each so you can go or skip them. Look for coupons in brochures for two for one. You can take pictures of them from Arizona Visitors Center and the Arizona tour ferry. Go on the lawn behind the Visitor's Center. You can also walk around the Bowfin Memorial area for free without taking the tour. Its worth the time. Visit the Swap Meet on weekends and Wed. It's only a couple blocks from here at Aloha Stadium, so it is perfect for visiting after seeing Pearl Harbor. Well worth it if you want to save $$$ on gifts. Hanama Bay - O'ahu's most famous snorkeling destination!!! Go early since it's on the other side of the island and it gets crowded. A reminder: The beach park is closed on Tuesdays. If you visit this side of the island, hike to the top of Diamond Head Crater -- The entire family can make this easy 1.4-mile round-trip walk to the top of the 750-foot volcanic cone with its rewarding view of Oahu. Best time is around 8am or around 4pm. In between it can get hot walking to the top.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: akdaley2003
Reviews.Content: This hotel is prefect. Spend the extra money and stay in an ocean view deluxe room. Go to Roy's for dinner. This place is in a great location, about 30 mins away from Downtown Wakikki.

Reviews.Title: “Not again...”
Reviews.Author: manku
Reviews.Content: First time visitor to Oahu, I had booked four nights at Moana Surfrider. Wife was apprehensive about staying in Waikiki, so I got a great deal on two nights here ($220 for both including breakfast each day and dinner one night!)... Plusses: 1. Rooms are huge, great bathrooms and lanais. Do not get an island view. 2. Cool ponds stocked with sharks/tropical fish. Kids loved them. 3. Lagoons, artificial, were good for little kids. 4. Food was pretty good for hotel...of course, it tasted better since we weren't paying for most of it! Cons: 1. It's in the middle of nowhere...drive is past a power plant. Frankly, this might be the ugliest part of the hawaiian islands. It took us 90 minutes to go from Waikiki to hotel during rush hour. 2. Artificial lagoons no substitute for a real beach....felt like disneyworld. 3. Service was mediocre...took two hours to get bags, after calling bell service three times. 4. Pool was boring...a big circle - no nooks, slides or anything else. The only reason I could see staying here is if its free/cheap/poin ts. If you want to be on Oahu and away from Waikiki, got to the Kahala - didn't stay, but toured. It looks awesome - but pricey! Mahalo! Manku

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: zigmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 5 children stayed at this hotel the end of July. The weather was perfect and the accomodations were really great. We have stayed at many 5 star hotels around the country, and the JW was wonderful. Before I begin, I must say the JW in Cancun is my favorite spot by far. The best hotel there. We were so impressed with the Cancun hotel, we had no reservation booking here. My children range in age from 18 to 5, and we were all pleased with everything the hotel had to offer. The rooms are very large. Huge bathrooms and balconies. We spent a lot of time reading and enjoying a wedding below us on the balcony. We were upgraded to an ocean view, but we could see everything happening around the eel pools and gazebo, plus a view of the ocean. We had adjoining rooms which were attached by a main double door which opened up to two individual doors. We were able to get from room to room very easily. Long entry ways into the rooms and like I said huge, marble and travertine tiled bathrooms. Make sure you do the buffet in the morning. A great way to get started. We would eat sort of late, fill up on good quality and well prepared breakfast items, then just eat dinner in the evening. We were able to eliminate lunch all 6 days this way. The breakfast was included in our room rate-a great thing. The fresh squeezed juice was amazing. Try the dragonfruit too. On the north shore hit Matsumotos for great shaved ice and a t shirt. There may be a wait, but it goes fast. Proceed up the north shore and visit turtle beach. A small beach where the turtles come right up to you. My kids had a very close encounter with 2 amazing turtles. We picked the moss off the rocks and hand fed them. There's a white picket fence across the street, and you will most likely see others parked and walking across the highway to thebeach. Visit the Mormon Temple. Beautiful. There is a great little local restaurant right by the temple called the Hukelau (I know I spelled that wrong) right in the middle of a residential area. Closed on Sunday and Monday. The other direction, visit Pearl Harbor. Go early! Also the swap meet is a GREAT place to get local stuff CHEAP. Get all your souveneirs here, for sure. Great prices on unusual beads, t shirts and local Hawaiian gear. Open Wednesdays and weekends. We went twice. All in all the hotel was wonderful. Just get up a little early and go get your loungers. Enjoy the morning with a free cup of coffee. It is absolutely beautiful at 6am by the pool. No one is there, and it's quiet. Kids show up around 9:30, but by then you have had a couple hours of r and r. Beautiful hotel, you wont be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: KayDas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon. The hotel is on a quieter part of the island, and we hired a car to get us from the airport to the hotel - we were glad we did, as we enjoyed using the car to drive around the island's easy to navigate, and breathtaking roads (you can easily get around the island in one day, then take yourself off to an empty cove). At the hotel, there is a nice pool, jacuzzi and a spa that looked great although we didn't use it. The hotel has several man made coves of idyllic white sand and blue sea, with hammocks and loungers to recline in. We had an ocean view room, with balcony, which I would recommend, and it was exceptionally comfortable. Overall, an excellent place to stay on honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort on Oahu!”
Reviews.Author: GoJeannie
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night stay at the JW Marriot Ihilani - In our opinion, one of the best resorts we've stayed at. We stayed in Maui at the Ritz Carlton in Kapalua the last time we were in Hawaii and were pretty sure no other resort could top the Ritz. We were happy to be proven wrong at the Ihilani. Not only are they an exquisite immaculate hotel, they do these little things that just put them head and shoulders above all. For example: -- in the afternoon, they deliver ice to your room. I know this doesn't sound like much, but the Ihilani does not have ice vending machines so having ice is a big deal. I think this is a great service. -- at the pool, they come around offering ice cold face towels with a touch of refreshing essential oils. There is nothing like being offered an ice cold towel when you're out in the sun. -- if you rent a cabana (only $35 for 1/2 day) they bring out a cooler for you with some fruit and ice and bottled water. -- the valet guys know the island like the back of their hands. They will always ask if you need directions somewhere and they give you the best routes to where you want to go. They have copies of the island's map and they will whip one out and mark it up clearly so you don't get lost! It's all about the little things because the big stuff, which they excel at, is what you would expect in a resort of this caliber. The pool is small, that's what everyone says about it, but seriously, you need maybe 10 minutes in that pool before you're "done" with it because right around the corner is the most incredible lagoon you will see! After taking your first dip in the lagoon, you're not going to be interested in the pool! If you want to use the pool for laps, you're much better off swimming in the lap pool on the fitness lanai at the spa -- which I believe is complimentary to all hotel guests along with the gym there. There is a fee to use the tennis courts ($22) but they have a choice of a hard court or a sand-filled synthetic grass court. They bring out iced water and tennis balls, too. We brought our own rackets, but they have rackets for you to borrow as well. Great service, great amenities and a wonderful place to relax. Expect to pay resort prices at their restaurants, but the japanese buffet at Ushio Tei is NOT to be missed -- totally worth it for $39. Lastly, I totally agree with the last reviewer's suggestion to have a Lava Flow. This is my absolute favorite drink in Hawaii and they are made the best on the island at the Ihilani (in a cabana by the lagoon), at $8.50 a pop, it better be good -- and it is!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vacation”
Reviews.Author: vacationer24
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from 12 nights at the JW Marriott resort in Ko Olina - and it was fabulous! The hotel and property were in great condition and the service was impeccable. The pool at first looked small but seemed to accomodate all of the guests who wanted to swim. Yes, there is limited area for lounge chairs shaded from the sun, but when we could not find one we walked down to the beach and lawn area and pulled up a lounge chair there. No problem. Here are a few tips that may help: -Yes, rent a car. Traffic can be a pain at rush hour but there is so much to see on the island. Concierge has great directions to the restaurants they recommend as well as other excursions. If you choose to rent a car on the property and not at the airport (there is a Hertz desk on site), call the concierge before your trip and they will set up a car service pick -up for you. It is $70 and much better than getting a cab - the Marriott does not have a shuttle. -Yes, the resort restaurants are expensive and so are the drinks. However, if you like sushi, the Japanese restaurant has 1/2 price rolls and sushi, as well as 1/2 price drinks such as frozen drinks or martinis from 5:30 to 6:30 for dine-in. There is at least one buffet most nights in the resort and they are all $39 for adults, $19 (I think) for up to 12 and 4 and under free. Again, if you like Japanese, the Japanese buffet is worth looking at. Children's meals are a whopping $8, so definitely choose the buffet for your child 4 and under. -There is a walking/running path along the 4 lagoons that is 3 miles round trip. Try to wake up early at least one morning and take a walk on that path. Hawaii is just as beautiful in the morning as it is in the evening. Wow, what a sight. -The pool area has entertainment every night and on the weekends they have hula dancers. Great for the kids. -Try the drink called the Lava Flow while you're there - no other place can make it like Hawaii can. -Complimentary Kona coffee until 11:00 am daily. It is so good. Our family really enjoyed this vacation - it is peaceful and truly a place that you can wind down and relax. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good resort but not 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: tokyo-venice
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott Ihilani Resort in August for 5 days. I do not know how a resort receives its star ratings but this resort is not a 5 star resort. But it is still a very good resort and I can understand why people will love it. We have stayed at the Halekulani and the Kahala Resort when it was still with Mandarin Oriental. These were 5 star hotels. Very classy, with history and great service. The JW Marriott is on a similar level with the Hilton Hawaiian Village in Waikiki, just not as big. The best thing that it has going for it is the location. It is away from the Waikiki area and has its own beach/lagoon, this is a great advantage. The Halekulani has just a sliver of beach left in front of it, but the pool is nice. The JW Marriott has a limited choice for food and everything is relatively pricey. Azul was very nice but if I had a choice between Azul and restaurants similarly priced in Honolulu, like Alan Wongs, Chef Mavro, Michel's, etc., I would not choose Azul. Service was fine, no complaints there, everyone always had a smile. We booked an ocean view room, having read some of the reivews here, I wanted a sunset view room and also was wary about the industrial park that was supposed to be in view. Well, we got up graded to a deluxe ocean view room. We had a great view of the pool and beach/lagoon area, but we also got a view of the industrial park. But this did not bother us as much as we thought. Also as we have a 9 year old son, our dinner schedule starts around 6 to 6:30, which means we completely miss the sunset, so I guess it worked out well for us. We enjoyed our stay but would probably not go back. We have a condo booked for the rest of our stay in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Ihilani is overpriced, and the staff is untrustworthy.”
Reviews.Author: SVTraveller2
Reviews.Content: The overall stay at the hotel was decent, however very overpriced. The pool deck is very small for a facility of this size, and gaining access to a lounge chair with an umbrella is virtually impossible unless you are willing to get up at 6:30 in the morning to reserve one at the moment they are made available. The crooks at the Ihilani do provide an alternative for those who wish to sleep in. You can pay $50 per day to rent a cabana on the beach. Quite a racket if I do say so myself. Additionally, if you find yourself stuck staying at the Ihilani, bring the manager with you to the room to inventory the mini-bar. The staff either does not restock the mini-bar between guests, or takes things during your stay. The result of this criminal activity was a charge of $73 on my credit card after I returned home. I do not recommend that anyone blow their vacation dollars at an overpriced, guest-unfriendly resort such as this.

Reviews.Title: “Tips and Tricks for Ko Olina Time Share”
Reviews.Author: Brenda C
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of reviews about this property, so I thought I would try and write a few things not covered by the others. First off, we LOVED this place. Secondly, we have twin 6 year olds and were traveling with my sister who has a 22 month old. So we found it GREAT for families with younger children. That said, you should know that there are a LOT of kids at this place and if YOU have kids, that makes it good. If you do not, you may still like this resort (it is VERY nice for a time share). Third: This is a time share resort, obviously researched, planned and built by a company that knows what people want in time shares. I generally do not like time shares as they usually do not have the following, but this one does! - valet - self parking (with a fee) - bell hops - concierge - Ritz level accomodations (seriously!) - huge, fluffy beds and pillows - pool side service for drinks and food Like many timeshares, they also have: - activities for the kids (games, crafts) - huge pools - several jacuzzis (some adult only, which is nice) - beautiful gym with sauna, steam room, showers (VERY nice) - cheezy events to get to know thier vendors (tours, taxis) This is seriously the nicest time share resort I have ever been too, and (unfortunately, in most cases) that has been a lot. I've found they usually don't have hotel ammenities that I really like - (bell service, essential when you are trying to corral several kids and your husband is going to park the car). Also, many time shares look run down and the jacuzzi is mildewy, etc. This one is not like that at all, at least as of July 2006. With all this said, here are a few tips and tricks to make your stay at Ko Olina better. If you get the chance to go here, I would DEFINATLEY go!! (Caveat: other reviews have done a good job telling you restaurants, that you need a car (this is a bit remote), etc. - so I'm trying to write stuff you won't find on other posts). Tips: - They will give you free, beautiful leis here upon your first visit to the concierge - so save yourself $12 at the airport and get one free here. - They have 2 free events where you can meet their vendors, get free mai tais, free coffee (the morning event) and they have drawings and stuff. We didn't go to either one, as they were very crowded (popular), but you could do so and learn a lot and get free drinks. - You don't HAVE to have a car if you plan to stay mostly on property - as they have LEO's transportation and plenty of tours to things like Pearl Harbor. Plus if you drive yourself you have to pay parking each day ($7 self, $9 valet). Next time,we will probably save our $400 and not rent a car. You can walk to Roys and the Ilihana. You can take local transport to Sav On and still be ahead several hundred dollars. - Pearl Harbor requires tickets, that are free -- but you gotta show up in person early that morning. We tried and didn't get tickets (we showed up at 10:30 am -- too late) - so next time we will do a tour anyway, and they make sure you get in. Special Fun Things for Kids - The "kiddie" pools are GREAT for kids! One has a "real" beach entry pool with real sand. Its only about 18" deep and ALL the little kids had a ball. SPECIAL TIPS: I would STILL put my kid in one of those floaty suits, as they can get into the bigger part of the pool. There are no life guards. I saw several little ones go too close to the bigger pool for my comfort level, especially when you knew their parents were drinking Mai Tais or reading a book... - The "real beach" pool has pretty "gritty" sand (large grains) so I would also put my kids in water socks or those pool shoes. These are great for the beaches and snorkeling too - as there always seems to be coral around. Invest in them. - The other pool also has HUGE "Baja shelves" - only a few inches deep to 2' deep. So there is a LOT of room for the little ones to play - as well as deep areas for adults and older kids. But its unusual to find so much for the toddler set. It was nice. - Next to the beach pool is a little play structure (slide, climby thing) also fun for the little ones. - The resort offers a LOT of fun activities for the kids - crafts, temporary tatoos, shaved ice ($3), video games, group games like tag, marco-polo, bubbles and more. We often just sat on our butts and watched the resort staff play on the big lawns with our kids (and about 30 others). It was VERY nice as a parent! Some are free, others require a small fee. - If you go on the time share offer, they do have a nice child care area for kids over 3. Video games, sodas, cookies, crafts, etc. Our kids didn't want to leave. Tricks - Their is fish feeding done at the 1st bay each morning. If you show up at 7:30 the guy will give you a fish finder (lamenated card) and you can identify several who literally fly out of the water to eat the fish food. - Bring your snorkel gear and you can watch this fun event from below the surface! - If you get a spa visit at the Ilhiania spa you can charge it back to your villa and get 10x Marriott miles. The spa was awesome. - The 4th lagoon is heavily visited by locals and my kids had fun playing with "real Hawaiian" children (which were actually from all over the USA, due to the military bases there). Very fun. - You can rent kayaks, snorkels, water trampoleens and a paddle boat (called a baracudda) at the 1st and 3rd lagoon and charge them to your room. The rates seemed very reasonable to us (like $10 or $15 per hour). - If you have to check out early in the day, but your flight is later, they will give you lockers in the timeshare spa. We stayed all day and played, took showers at five, drove to Waikiki and ate dinner and still made our 9:45 pm flight out. It is a wonderful benefit to be able to use the showers after all day. Hope you go! I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, love the Ihilani!!!”
Reviews.Author: Veronicah
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a 10-day stay at the Ihilani, booked through Costco Travel. Although we booked a mountain view room, we were upgraded to ocean view right off the bat. The rooms are absolutely gorgeous, with huge marble bathrooms, big lanais and comfortable beds and sitting areas. We found all of the staff to be very friendly and helpful, showing us the way to little breakfast spots (We liked the Hapa Grill in nearby shopping center) and directing us to cheap spots for gear like Safeway and Kmart. During the mornings, we enjoyed the bran muffins and lattes at the espresso bar, which serves very good FREE coffee every morning. I'm a sushi fan and very picky about what I eat, and I very much enjoyed the sushi bar on the premises. Go there during their happy hour and it's half off! A great value for very fresh fish. They made up fresh ahi steaks for the kids, even though it wasn't on the kids menu. The only bad thing was they wouldn't make my favorite spicy scallop hand rolls; not sure why but they said they couldn't do it. The poolside bar was expensive, but of good quality. The fish burgers were exceptional, with really yummy homemade tartar sauce. The mai tais were excellent! We usually ate at the Napuaka Terrace, where I really enjoyed the grilled vegetable wrap with cilantro hummus. So good, and so healthy!!! The only bad experience we at Naupaka Terrace for dinner. There was a bone chip in my husband's filet, and the avocado in the mango spring rolls was totally rubbery and not ripe. I think they were going through some kitchen changes, as we saw a culinary applicant being interviewed at the coffee shop that morning. We quiety told the manager and he fixed the problem straight away by taking those items off our bill. The Ihilani Iced Tea, made with a special blend of passion fruit juices and Pekoe tea, is stellar and a must-try. Gourmet magazine has featured the recipe in a past issue. The poster who complained there were no refills doesn't realize that this is a signature drink that takes some trouble to make and is not simply made of tea bags and water. I do agree about the ice situation; it was never filled daily as it was supposed to. And yes, they did expect a tip for bringing it up. It was annoying. But still, it was easier to tip for free ice than to head over to Safeway every day and pay for it. Perhaps they are trying to save water?? The lagoons are perfect for families, where there are fish, sea turtles, jumping crabs and other little critters. Our children loved the pool and swam in it every day. It's only about 3 feet deep at the center and was always a good temperature. The spa was on the cooler side, but after mentioning something, they heated it up the next day. I had a spa treatment during our stay, which was a therapeutic massage and absolutely wonderful! There is a roman bath and nice sitting area. Not as lavish or big as other spas I've been to, but I still enjoyed it very much. Roy's was absolutely wonderful and we ate there three times. Ask for Suzi, one of the best servers and friendliest women we've ever met. She was so attentive and wonderful. The seared ahi was great, as was the macadamic crusted fish. We also ordered the appetizer boat, scrumptious! They are very kid-friendly with a whole menu for children that starts out with quesadillas followed by veggies and dip, main course and yummy homemade cookie ice cream sandwiches for dessert. A great value for kids and a great menu for mom and dad! In all, I highly recommend this resort. I liked that it was away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. A nice quiet place if you have to stay on Oahu, and close to the North Shore. We will return again!!! PS: If you're driving around, don't mistakenly travel toward Makaha, where there are hundreds of homeless people living in tents on the beach. Scary.

Reviews.Title: “Some Great, Some Good. All Expensive.”
Reviews.Author: bagoda1
Reviews.Content: Myself, my wife and 2 kids, ages 4 and 7, stayed for 5 nights. The grounds were nice. For luxury Hawaii, it was average, but on the whole it was good. The room for 4 was average sized. The best part was the large balcony with a table, chairs and lounge. With 4 people crowded into one room, the balcony was a welcome respite. We could also watch the nightly entertainment at the pool from our balcony. My biggest complaint is that nothing other than 2 double beds were available. "Double" is a misnomer. It is difficult for 2 average sized adults to sleep comfortably in a double bed. If you regularly sleep on a queen or king bed, you will have trouble trying to squeeze in to a double bed. The view was amazing. We had an ocean view room, directly facing the lagoon. Perfect. The pool area is small, as many have remarked. It is also kids, kids, kids. From prior reports we were aware of this (which is one of the reasons we selected this resort for a trip with our kids). But if you are a couple looking for a quiet romantic time, I would suggest elsewhere. The pool is round, so kids were everywhere. There is no "shallow end" or "kids end" which could provide some corner for adults. In our opinion, the finest part of this resort is the lagoon. Well manicured, lots of loungers. No waves. Just wonderful clean, warm sea water. It remains shallow well into the water, so the kids had lots of room to play. Our kids ran in and out of the water all day. Be advised: There is no bar service and no alcohol is allowed on the lagoon beach. We like the pampering of bar service, so that was an issue for us, albeit not a major one. The cost of everything is off the charts. While Hawaii is expensive as a whole, the cost of food at this resort is outrageous. Unfortunatley, this resort is well off the beaten path, so the food options are quite limited. Be prepared to drop a bundle on food. We had our kids in the kid's club one morning. It is nothing other than glorified babysitting. Not worth the investment unless you are desperate for some adult alone time. Certainly this place is nice, hence my 4 star opinion. But it is expensive, and with such expense comes expectations. That's where the resort fell a little short. All in all, a nice place. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “NOT IMPRESSIVE and OVERRATED”
Reviews.Author: weeweewee
Reviews.Content: Here's the scoop on this hotel. My husband and I stayed in the JW Ilihani Marriott last week for 10 days. First if all, the fact that we had to ASK for ice each time from housekeeping was very inconvenient and were expected to tip the person that brought the ice to the room. RIDICULOUS. We just didn't tip because of principle. Talking to other guests we realized that many guests were annoyed with the ice situation. We were supposed to get ice each day with the room service but found that ice was not even given to us although they said they would. Just poor service and hospitality. In addition, the valet parking department were annoyingly phony with the guests and ofetn would team up to unload our bags which we then had to tip both guys and found that to be simple robbery. We didn't tip both guys just one and that they were upset but we didn't care. Anyway, the ONLY worhty restaurant was AZUL-excellent. The breakfast buffet was mediocre at best. The Japanese restaurant was always empty.....tells you a lot about that establishment. The concierge make mistakes. Be careful. Check your bill daily. Watch out for extra charges. The time share representative was very rude to us. Pushy and rude. Don't waste your time going to the 90 minute tour. WASTE OF TIME. The reception area/check-in staff was unfriendly and were not able to answer questions regarding Marriott Rewards. Come on...no one can answer our questions? Those guys need to do their homework. Our advice is avoid the poolside bar. Overpriced for sure and below average food. The hamburgers were cold and disgusting. We refused to pay for them and sent them back. There are great places to eat on the island and nearby the hotel. Roy's was fabulous and worth every penny. Outback Steakhouse was a 3 minute drive and well worth it. Buying cold cuts and fresh bread from Safeway nearby was worth it. Make your own sandwiches and eat them on the beach. AVOID the poolside bar.THe lagoons at Ko Olina are fun. Nice concept. Very appropriate for kids. Overall, the hotel is not a good representation of a JW calibur hotel. It's average and expensive. You are far from Waikiki. Traffic is always bad. Gas is expensive. Better to stay in Waikiki since the Marriott Ilihani is not all it's cracked up to be. We share this opinion with other fellow travellers. Read these reviews and avoid the nonsense of the JW Ilihani Marriott at Ko Olina. Good Luck. I recommed the Hilton Hawaiian Village in Waikiki. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Ko Olina well worth the cost!”
Reviews.Author: esser83
Reviews.Content: After a cruise on Pride of America we spent five days at the JW Marriott Ko Olina in June before culminating our vacation in Waikiki. The Ko Olina is a wonderful place, expensive in some ways and a few disappointments (for instance, no coffee pot in the room--is it really necessary to compromise convenience for luxury??? A coffe pot is in the room at most budget hotels!) The coffee was free downstairs in the lobby and it was excellent, but it required getting dressed respectfully enough to go get it. One of the best features was the Hawaiian children's dance performances on Saturday and Sunday late afternoons on the pool deck. These young people were extremely talented, the costumes were so professional and the band was wonderful. Go to the lounge (HuKilau sp??) -- when we were there the window was open and the moon was full--with the palm trees shining in the moonlight it looked like a postcard. Overall, a wonderful place and we definitely will return.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the J.W was 8days june28-july6th, upon arriving, we were upgraded to a deluxe ocean view room, which was beautiful, the view was spectacular. The grounds are well maintained, with wonderful walking trails. All the staff were most freindly, even remembering our names, we ate at all the resturants, Azul being our favorite, it was quiet and romantic, excellent service, food wonderful. Roy's being the biggest dissaapointment, the food and service was less to be disired. Have'n eaten at Roy's in San fransisco, we thought it would be a sure bet. NOT. Prices were a little on the high side, but we already expected that, so there was no sticker shock for us. We did not use the pool, as the lagoons were much more inviting, the snorkling was great, on our last day even saw the turtles. As posted by other readers and vistors, we did not find it hard to get loungers at the pool or on the beach, infact we always had a choice of where to catch some sun or shade. If you want nightlife, this is not the place, if relaxation and accoustic guitar in a comfortable lounge/bar is what you want, then I would recommend, it was exactly what we were looking for. Whilst there, we did check out the other contenders Turtle bay and the Kahala manderin, I must say, we were glad we chose the JW, after comparing the three Cant wait to go back. Oh, you definatly will need a car, if you want to go anywhere else, parking is $15.00 a day regardless if you valet or park yourself, if you call before you leave your room, your car will be waiting with air on, by the time you get to the front door. Waikiki hmmmmm. hated it. Pearl harbour crowded. Botanical gardens on north shore worth the trip. poly culture centre crowded. East shore beautiful JW a little piece of paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Elegance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Comfort and Elegance would be my description of the Marriot Ihilani Resort and Spa. After a 10 plus hours traveling direct from New York, we were greeted by the limo driver from the Ihilani. He was on time and had the limo stocked with beverages. During the ride he pointed out some interesting sights and was very pleasant. The hotel has a modern elegance and the staff was very personable. We were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary and my parents came with us to celebrate their 50th wedding Anniversary. The Ihilani Resort sent to each room a chilled bottle of champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries and hand written greetings. The lovely rooms are spacious and the bathrooms are like mini spas. Our room (1218) had a magnificent view and large lana'i. The sunsets were beautiful, on the last night we ordered room service and had private dining on the lana'i. The pool is clean and the pool lounge chairs all have padded cushions. We all enjoyed the pool bar/grill, the strawberry coladas are the best! Even the pool area bathroom is clean and decorated well. The lagoons are truly lagoons. They are for swimming and calm water activities. There are no waves, just in case you thought surfing was on your list. You will have to go north for that. The walking path ( 3 miles round trip ) through the complex was a fun walk and you pass by all of the lagoons. Our 10 year old daughter enjoyed a day at the kids club and made some crafts to bring home. We did rent a car and spent a full day seeing the sights. The Dole Pineapple farm has great pineapple muffins. The ease and comfort of the Ihilani made for a very relaxing time together. The restaurant staff was always cheerful and greeted us by name. I would highly recommend this resort for a relaxing getaway. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: jbs1114
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days at the JW Marriott Ihilani last week, as the first part of a two-week Hawaiian trip, centered around Maui. Originally, the plan was to explore the island of Oahu, and save our beach relaxation days for Maui. However, upon reaching the JW, we could not bring ourselves to move. The lagoons are a great idea. They are so calm, it is possible to swim from one shore to the other, and, if it wasn't for the terrific snorkeling, you might think that it was a pool. Speaking of which, I have three kids in my family, all of whom were apprehensive about the conspicuous lack of pool at the hotel. Trust me: the pool looks small, but, even at full occupancy, it is never crowded, and perfectly adequate. Even the restaurants here are decent: Ushio Tei has great sushi, and the Napauka Terrace is diverse in menu and taste. I steered clear of Azul: it looked too sterotypically overrated and overpriced, and I did not enjoy Roy's quite as much as everyone on this site. Other than the hotel restaurants and Roy's, there are not many places to eat here, though the drive to Waikiki is manageable for a dinner. When I drove into Honolulu, and saw just how tacky it had become, I was pleased with my choice, and remain so. The JW is quiet and relaxing on an island that is anything but. Its service is not quite up to the level of a Four Seasons or a Ritz, but its facilities definitley are. In conclusion, a perfect place to spend a week or less. PS: rooms are great. Spacious lanais and clever building design = enjoyable ocean views. The two adjoining rooms the five of us shared were so impeccable, my kids did not believe that it was not a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Ihilani”
Reviews.Author: Jenn65
Reviews.Content: Our family has just returned from 4 nights at the lovely JW Marriott. We have stayed in many of the top hotels on the islands and found the JW Marriott to be very enjoyable and relaxing. The grounds are just beautiful with walking trails along the 4 lagoons and plenty of room to spread out and not feel crowded by other travelers. The pool is small - and the pool attendants could be more agressive about clearing up deserted towels so that more seats around the pool could be available. But all in all the pool was very enjoyable. We swam a little during the day - but mostly swam in the evenings after dinner. Not many people in the pool at that hour and the pool is open until 10pm. The lagoon was pretty and very calm for swimming and wading. What we liked was that there were always plenty of lounge chairs that could be moved around on the sand or the grass surrounding the lagoon. Our delux King room on the 4th floor was beautiful. Very spacious with a large deck that was extremely private. We looked at the water side away from the lagoon and loved out view. Nice furniture on the decks also. The bathroom was wonderful and very large. The bedding was terrific. We could not have been happier with the room in general. The open air restaurant by the pool was good. We had a buffet breakfast with our room and enjoyed it each morning. We also had lunch there twice and found the food good and the service very nice. We also ate at Azul - and found the service to be perfect... but the food a little lacking. But they were so nice that I cannot fault the place at all. When they noticed that my son did not eat much of his dinner they presented him with a free dessert to make up for his dinner. It was a very pleasant surpise. The drive to downtown Honolulu and to Pearl Harbor could not have been more than 20 minutes. We did not find a traffic problem at all. I would not let the distance of this hotel from Waikiki to be a deterant. We liked being away from the crowds... but I don't think I would stay there for more than 3-4 days. We followed up with 4 days at the Halekulani on Waikiki. I will also add that the spa at the Marriott was very nice. The employees were terrific to me and the services were very nice. They even remembered me by name the following day when I stopped back in the spa shop.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Lynette51
Reviews.Content: Our stay was from May 13-May 19th. I do a lot of research before booking a trip and I'm glad this was my choice for Oahu. We prefer to stay away from the hustle & bustle of the main tourist areas as our main goal is to relax. Upon check-in, we were upgraded to a corner oceanview room from our leisure room booking. And it was beautiful. Room was immaculate and bathroom huge. Service was great. Valets always asked where we were off to to give us instructions & a map. We'd still get lost but that's our MO. And they'd recommend out of the way eating spots as well. Very prompt in bringing the car. You can call ahead from your room phone to have the car waiting as well. The grounds were kept immaculate. All staff were always smiling and saying hello. The pool is not spectacular but there was always plenty of seating and towels. Poolside service was great. They would remember what you drank & made sure you were never empty! One problem around the pool area would be people would leave towels on chairs to reserve them or had left for the day but didn't return their towels, so you were never sure of what chair was available. But I noticed staff would go around every once in awhile & remove the towels. We ate one lunch & one breakfast at the hotel & it was very good. We tend to explore outside of resorts to eat. And there are plenty within a 10 minute drive. Traffic in downtown Waikiki can be very busy and we had a hard time finding parking to walk around town. The hotel is out of the way from the main attractions and nightlife, but if this is what you want then definitely stay here. There were a few children at the resort, but they were well behaved. Very quiet in the evenings. We did go before school is out, so maybe during the high summer season it gets busier with children. There is free coffee every morning from 6 am to 11 am along with a daily paper delivered to your door. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Luxurious and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: itching2travel
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Ko Olina Resort twice, once in March 2004 and in October 2005. On my first visit, I was upgraded to their luxury Ko Olina Suite. It was given to us without us even inquiring! The staff told us that once we stayed in the suite, we would never want to leave...they were'n't kidding! It was the absolute nicest, most luxurious room I've ever stayed in. It had two very large lanais, one overlooking the more quiet part of the beach and the other with a view of the green mountains. It had a huge marble bathroom with a jacuzzi, a sitting area with a nice furniture and a desk and a very large bedroom with a very comfortable king bed. The whole place was stunning. It was very generous of the staff to upgrade us and give us this experience. The second time I stayed, I made my reservation late and could only get a mountain view room. Once I arrived, I asked for an ocean view and they were more than accommodating, considering I didn't have a reservation for one. They gave me a wonderful room with 2 beds and a very large lanai overlooking the lagoons. It had the same beautiful marble and elegant features throughout. The rooms are extremely spacious, light, airy, clean and modern. I love their beautiful, large bathrooms. The linens on the bed and in the bathroom are really soft, new and comfortable. We ate at all of the restaurants there during our stay. The food served by the poolside is very good and great for a casual lunch. The brunches are delicious, whether you choose the buffet (excellent spread) or choose a single menu item. Their signature restaurant is also very good. They make very fruity, great cocktails and drinks. I had a massage in their spa, which is also wonderful and worth making a reservation at. My friends and I went swimming in the lagoon at 2 a.m., and no one ever bothered us. That's one of the special things about Ko Olina...you can stroll on the beach at all hours and have so much space around you. It's never too crowded and it feels like you have the whole beach to enjoy to yourself. While it is a 45 minute drive, it's well worth it if you want to get away from overcrowded Waikkiki. I recommend that you rent a car, just to get you to and from the airport and any where else if you desire. I never had problems with traffic like the previous reviewer mentioned, and we drove at all times of the day, weekday and weekends. He also mentioned a refinery nearby...you can see it in the distance to the south, but you can choose to focus on this one thing far away or choose to revel in the beauty of what's close at hand in the midst of the property. Ko Olina and Turtle Bay Resort are my two most favorite hotels on Oahu...Ko Olina is more upscale and Turtle Bay, while very nice, is more casual. They both share in common seclusion, privacy, quietness, and being gorgeous properties right on the beach without any other hotels close by. I recommend staying at either (or both) if you want to get away from the noise & crowd and actually be on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, But Not Worth the $$$$”
Reviews.Author: TheLastUnicorn17
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many 5 star hotels across the world, and while the Ihilani is very pretty and scenic, I wasnt that impressed. Sorry for the long review, but I want to be thorough. Here's the blow-by-blow: (1) Hotel is located in the (gated)Ko Olina area. You need to go through "security" each time you enter the area by car. I guess they want to weed out the hoodlums :-) (2) Hotel entrance, while nice, very bland. We actually drove past it. Once you drive down the alley way, you come across the main entrance. The hotel charges $15 per day for parking whether you valet or self-park. This is a racket. (3) The inside of the hotel (atrium, front desk, etc) is as sterile as a hospital. I did not feel like I was in Hawaii at all....felt like I was in a local library or office building. It was such a let down. (4) We had a deluxe ocean view room, and I must say, it was nice. Nice touch with the ceiling fan and buffet in the "foyer". I would say, the rooms were great...very homey and comfortable. I felt like I was in my own bedroom, rather than a hotel. Large lanai, although the furniture was yucky and had some stains on it. The hotel made sure to point out that the fridge in the room is for the mini-bar and not for personal storage of items. If they notice that their items had been removed to store personal items, they will charge you, even if you dont consume the item. I disregarded that and just made sure I put their items back each morning before housekeeping showed up. (5) Pool and surrounding pool area are small, crowded, and very UNimpressive. Lounge chairs are crammed in, with only a few inches between them. If youre claustrophobic, stay out of the pool area. Also, it was overrun with kids. I didnt expect to see so many young kids (and babies) at a resort like this. I dont think I saw one adult using the pool my entire 5 day stay. (6) Lagoons are OK. nice and relaxing. If you want a spot under one of the "huts", be sure to get out there by 7am. Please note that it is a man-made lagoon, NOT a beach, meaning no real waves. Just think of it as a gigantic natural swimming pool. If you snorkel, you can see one or 2 turtles in Lagoon 2, but thats about it. We brought our own equipment. If you dont have your own, you can rent snorkel gear for $15 an hour or $20 per day (again, another racket) (7) I cant comment on dining because we didnt eat there. All I know is that the food is godly expensive, though it didnt surprise me. My husband and I spent our evenings in Waikiki so we ate there. We ate breakfast at the Hapa Grill in Kapolei which is 10 min from the hotel. Their pancakes and omelettes are very good! (8) Service is pretty good, nothing outstanding, but sometimes not consistent. One time I got ice delivered in 10 minutes, other times I had to wait almost 30. Turn down service occured 3 of the 5 days I was there. (9) In case you havent realized already, I hate being nickeled and dimed when I'm paying close to $500 per nite to stay somewhere. They charge you for every little thing. For example, some of the beach chairs had hoods on them, kind of like a pseudo-cabana. I thought cool, since all of the little umbrella huts were taken. I walk up to them and see a huge sign saying that those particular chairs must be rented on an hourly basis. why? because someone glued some cardboard and cloth on it? another example, coffee is free from 6am - 11am. I asked the lady behind the counter if I could have some vanilla syrup in my coffee. After squirting some in my cup, I say thank you and start to walk away. She hollers back to me that she has to charge me 50 cents for the added flavor. This is crazy, but it's not her fault so I choose not to argue. I hand her 2 quarters. As I start to walk away, she chases me down, now saying I owe her 2 pennies because of tax. WTF??? so overall, hotel is OK, but unimpressive. definitely not worth the expense. I read in Travel+Leisure that this hotel is one of the top rated in the world. I can only wonder who's doing those reviews. If youve never stayed anywhere else, then yes, you'll be blown away in awe. But if youve done a bit of travelling, stayed in other high quality resorts, then you'll see that the ihilani is nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Good Food, Clean Rooms and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Bridgets40
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel my first being 10 years ago. I love this hotel for the very fact that it is further away from the general population then most, I think I must be the lucky one, no traffic it took 20 minutes to get to Waikiki. I wouldn't want to stay in Waikiki because the beach is so small, and the area loud. It depends on what you're going to Hawaii for. I went to have a relaxing quiet time with my husband mixed with tooling around, shopping etc. Rooms: Clean and they clean your room daily, changing sheets etc (other hotels do not do this unless you call and request it and even then its a hassle) No dust on ceiling fans or phones no stain marks mildew or anything like I had in the 4 star resort in Maui Pool- No big deal. I don't go there for the pool but for the beach and water Grounds- Beautiful, large, green. Theres an ocean trail that leads towards the oil refiinery that the other person noted however thats at least 4 miles away and theres a channel in between for boats. Staff- My biggest pet peeve at hotels. The staff here were amazing, friendly, polite etc. As far as valet goes no problem Food- My husband and I usually grab a picnic lunch and tool around the island. The breakfest at the hotel is fresh good and healtly, dinners are again good. Another reader mentioned Roys well my friend ate there and was sick for 3 days of her vacation because of bad shrimp, but again to each his own. I went for 14 days to 4 different islands stayed at the Grand Wailea in Maui(hated it especially the staff, rooms were very dirty and rats outside our room), Hilton village on the Big Island (okay but doing work at the hotel and rooms needed major cleaning) and Hyatt on Kauai (loved loved this hotel). The Marriott food is much better then any of the other hotels with maybe the exception of the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if you are looking to get away from it all”
Reviews.Author: TwoHavlesofCoconuts
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is a wonderful place if you are looking for the qualities it has to offer so do your homework. If you are not looking for what is decribed below, don't go. If you are looking for this, then the place is a slam-dunk. The JW Marriott if perfect for those wanting to get away. Away from the hustle and bustle and away from people. It is a tranquile place of beauty. The rooms are 4-5 star with bathrooms of marble, a balcony with table, chairs and lounge chair. The bedroom is very clean and the bed comfortable. The linen is a bit stiff. The grounds a emaculent. There are pools with sting rays, sharks and reef fish which gives the place a nice touch. The staff are very friendly, helpful and prompt. The resort is full service. The spa is very high quality in terms of staff, services and equipment. The spa has a fitness center, lap pool and tennis courts. The resort pool is clean the attractive with nice relaxed atmosphere with a full bar. The resort offers 3 restaurants. Not the highest quality, but for resort restaurants (which are usually not the best) are good. Don't expect value, but then again don't expect value anywhere. Roy's is a half mile away and had good food. The butterfish and scallops are excellent. Tell them it's a birthday or anniversary and you'll get a free desert (chocolate cake). The resort has a 4 lagoons with a beach. The good thing about the lagoons is the water is calm. You don't have to worry about you or your kids being swept out to sea by a rip tide or knocked down by waves unless you venture about beyond the boundries. The downside is there are not mile long streches of sugar sand beaches. The vistors at the resort are made up mainly of honeymooners and thirty-somethings with one or two young kids. I found the children to be well-behaved. Pearl Harbor is about 25minutes away. If you go there be sure to stop at the Dixie Grill on Kam' highway. Wonderful barbeque and crab legs in a festive atmosphere and one of the very few places of high value and excellent food. Not fancy but really fun. Honolulu is a haul. About 30-40 minutes. If you want to spend a lot of time there, this is probably not the place. You can reach the westward side and north shore in about the same amount of time. My wife and I had a wonderful time and would recommend it anyone looking to get away from it all. If you are looking for night life, this is not the place. If you like crowds, this is not the place. If you want shopping and plenty of fine dining, this is not the place. But again, if you are looking for a beautiful and relaxed atmosphere, you will be hard pressed to do any better.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Marvelous!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, I think I died and went to Heaven. Ok, that might be pushing it but it was pretty darn close. I just checked out of the JW Marriott this morning (I'm at the Turtle Bay resort as I type this, on the North Shore), and all I can say is I now know where I'll be staying from now on when I am on the other side of the island. Keep in mind, I am starting to visit Oahu every 3 months because my daughter just moved here and have tried quite a few different hotels. In fact of the top 10 hotels listed on trip advisor, I have stayed at 6 of them and none are remotely comparable to this hotel. So let's get into some details.... - The hotel is mostly couples and or families. I saw few singles here as most of them seem to want to be closer to that Waikiki night life. As for me....no thanks, been there, done that. When I go on vacation, it's to recharge my batteries and this place is perfect because it's between 30 to 45 minutes away from the main strip at Waikiki. It's very relaxing and there's none of that hectic feeling of being right on the strip of shopping and hotel row. The grounds are gorgeous and if you're a golfer, you can play right here. It's also perfect for those exercise fanatics like myself that want a good outdoor jog in the morning. - The rooms are all spacious and nicely designed with modern furniture and all the amenities you could need. Most offer nice views -They have 3 nice restaurants and a bar in the pool area - The pool is a nice size and has plenty of loungers and umbrellas - Parking is $15 a day whether it's valet or self parking (however, the self parking gate was always open, so we used that after the first day and ended up not being charged for parking at all) -There is a 24 Hour Safeway located about 5 to 7 minutes away in case you want to stock up your room with any goodies. -They have a decent gym with 3 treadmills, some quality bikes (similar to what you would find in a spinning class), a variety of resistance machines and free weights. They also offer yoga classes at a nominal fee and some other classes. -I didn't partake in any spa treatments but they do have a full service spa. -Internet access is free in their business service center. There are only 2 computers but they did have 17 inch screens. -They have wonderful, piping hot coffee that is complimentary every day between 5 and 11. There is also a bakery that sells nice morning pastries. -Our price was $299 before tax. There service was definitely 5 star across the board. I'm probably leaving something out, but you get the idea. Try it out....you'll like it. No wait, you'll love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not 5 star - Would not revisit, even if you paid me!”
Reviews.Author: RJB1000
Reviews.Content: Firslly apologies this is one of those annoyingly long reviews but it does have a summary at the end. Whenever I read a low score in Trip adviser amongst high scores I think its a one off and always you will have people who are never satisfied. However I've come to the conclusion it's not, its probably more to do where your accustomed to staying. I have just returned from staying at the hotel for 11 nights during late April, which is a reasonable stay, given I didn't see the same people twice during that whole time. I'm a regular traveller and stay at really good hotels both on business and leisure. Why I origninally choose to stay here: A few of the other 5 star hotels seemed to have issues, All the 5 star trip advisor ratings which were given, it wasn't in downtown Waikiki where there is development working happening, it was a JW resort which are supposed to be 5 star and above what the standard of a typical Marriott. Finally because I could also use my Marriott rewards which I had accumulated. Why now I wish I had saved those rewards for somewhere else: Location: I previously read from someone who had stayed there that it was 45 drive minutes from Honolulu, they must have been driving at 3am in the morning. We're fast drivers but generally the trip took an hour minimum. The traffic generally was pretty busy all the time.from Koolina side. When we found the hotel it was located virtually slap bang next to a large industrial park about 1 mile away, with what looked like a large oil refinery/storage park, not what you concure up as a mental picture of Hawaii. Hotel Modern, clean but frankly downright dull, it has an interior attrium which cuts through the 17 floors but so do many hotels now. The lobby etc I felt were souless and dull, there was no ambience at all I felt I may aswell have stayed at an Airport Marriott or somewhere in a city centre. It wouldn't take alot to brighten up but clearly no one has bothered here for years. Put it this way if you're looking for a wow factor and you regularly stay at good hotels you won't find it here. Rooms Had booked an Ocean View room but as I'm a platinum Marriott rewards card holderI was pleased to get an upgrade to a Deluxe Ocean View room which overlooked the lagoon. The room was big, with large bathroom, wardrobe and balcony space. Overall it was fine, I woulnd't say it was out of this world and given it felt about 7 years old I wouldn't want to stay here in 2 years time. Service: Very patchy. Occaisionally it was very good, like the waitress at the pool bar or room service but generally if was mixed and just ok. The worst I thought were the valet's whom I thought were actually building our car rather than retreiving from the car park, best service oddly enough was laundry service which was the best I'ver ever come accross. Food I'm never a fan of 4-5 star chain hotel restaurants often the food is overpriced and bland. Again it depends what you're accustomsed too. Here was no exception though. Breakfast was just ok as was the choice. It was lierally like staying in a Marriott at an airport or somewhere in a city, the only difference was that this place had an ommelette station and you get faster and more effeicient service at the airport Marriott. Lunch: Don't know, if you want anything you have to go to pool bar, nothing available in the lobby, not even coffee!!! The coffee shop closes at 10am, its partly why the lobby area is souless. Dinner: Two of our party went to the main restaurant which was £40 for an italian buffet, they described it as OK but they wouldn;'t be going back. The have another restaurant which charges £40 for an entree we didn't go as it looked like somewhere I'd be happy spending $25 in not in reality probably £80 per head. The only hotel bar apart from the one at the pool was very small for the size of the hotel and again lacked ambience is was just ok, if you've stayed at the Grand Hyatt in Kauai the seaview bar there is 10 times better than this one. In the end we went to Roys at Ko Olina gof club which is 2 minutes away and which produced excellent food and value for money. Worth booking ahead, each time we went it was busy. Apart from that there aren.t any really good restaurants in the area we drove to the Orchid restaurant at the Halekulani hotel in Honolulu instead, which was excellent. There are a few tony roma style steakhouses a few miles away but you could go there anyime you don't want to go there on holiday. Activities: The hotel has a fantastic man made lagoon and beach which no one would deny had crystal blue water and was excellent for swimming and kids. The reef experience...mmm 3 pools with a few baby sharks and a few (and I mean only a few) tropical fish, nice but so what, once you've looked at them when you arrive for 10 minutes you don't automatically get drawn to think again oh I must look at those pools again. Value: When at reception one day another guest standing next to me asked to upgrade their room to the same level as mine the Deluxe Ocean View, I couldn't believe he was quoted $585 by them, I don't know if he paid it but I wouldn't pay any more then £350 tops even only for 3 days. Who will like this hotel: Those who have young kids and want sand/safe sea will love it, I think teenagers may get bored. Those who only want to stay in Oahu for 3 days and don't want Waikiki Those who like to go to a hotel and not leave it, some do and some don't. Those who want to pay stupid prices to pay a round of golf its on your doorstep Those who want to be an hour from general civilization. Those who don't mind a lack of hawaian ambience Finally those happy with 4 star hotel at 5 star prices Who will not like this hotel Those wanting 5 star hotel Those staying longer than a few days. Those wanting an oil refinery in the distance as a view. Those wanting to do alot of driving driving during their holiday. Those expecting a wow or even just a feeking your in a really really nice hotel Those wanting to eat in good restaurants. Those wanting a coffee during the day without having to sit at a packed pool. Those who want the choice between relaxing at a pool but with the option of going to civilization within 15-20minutes. Summary: if I was visitng Oahu again in the near future and wanted something 5 star, if I was staying less than 4 days I would stay at the Halekulani in Waikiki and if I was staying longer then I'd stay at the Khala Resort instead. During my stay at the Marriott I visited both, even though both have the odd minor disadvantage, they would have been better places to stay overall without a doubt. I wish I had booked one of those and saved my Marriott points for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Takemetoaspa
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for our honeymoon. This is by far the classiest hotel I have ever stayed in. We had a gorgeous view from our balcony of the pool and ocean. It was quiet, relaxing and beautiful. The service was excellent. They brought us cold towels while sitting by the pool. The marble bathrooms with seperate tub and shower and dual sinks were a real luxury. The food was expensive, but this is Hawaii where the food everywhere is expensive. I would definitely stay there again and look forward to visiting other JW Marriott hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ilihani”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful vacation at the Ihilani Resort and Spa. Everything was excellent. We arrived a day late because of airline delays and the Ihilani more than made up for it. They immediately upgrated our room to an Ocean view deluxe. The service throughout the hotel, from the bell boy to restaurant staff, was outstanding. The food in the hotel restaurants, although expensive, was delicious. My twelve year son and seven year old daughter had a vacation they will never forget. The pool and lagoons were perfect. We are planning a return trip next year!

Reviews.Title: “Best place on the island to stay”
Reviews.Author: EDboys
Reviews.Content: First of all I have to say that we absolutely loved our vacation at this hotel. If you use Trip Advisor a lot you already have read the great things about this property. We did get an upgrade to a partial ocean view room 730 which actually faced the sunset. I think this view was better then just a direct ocean view were you would not see the sunset if you wanted to. Here are some practical pointers for those who are practical people like me. 1.Go to the Grocery store in the town before the Ko Olina and stock up on a few things that I refused to pay for at the hotel. $3.50 for one bagel, $10 for drinks by the pool, $8 for a kids hot dog, etc. We bought 6 bagels for $3 and some PB & J for our little boy who is 3 ½. We would get our free coffee from the lobby and just sit on our Lanai enjoying our view without spending a lot of money just for breakfast. 2.Walk down to the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club and check out their buffet menu for the week. For some reason the prices over at the Beach Club were less the JW. On Saturday night they had a seafood buffet for $33.95 at the hotel the same seafood buffet was $42.95? The buffet at the Beach club was really good and I think the view was even nicer. 3.I was actually looking forward to getting a babysitter for one night or even putting our son in their kids club. Forget that at $16 an hour with a 4 hour minimum just to go out for dinner for an hour and a half was not worth it to me. Even the kids club at around $50 a day I thought was way too pricey. 4.If you valet or park it your self you get charged $15 a day which I guess if your spending the money for the hotel what’s $15. Except last year when we stayed at the Marriott in Kappalua Bay (which has been shut down for renovation) you at least got something for your parking. They called it a resort fee which got you an appetizer in the bar each # and a discount in the restaurant. 5.If you can bring your own snorkel gear. It’s not the best of snorkeling so why pay to rent their equipment when you can bring your own. Overall, a great place to relax, highly recommend it…

Reviews.Title: “just returned...ignore the negative”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Okay, having read so many reviews about the Ko Olina, I was a bit nervous about our stay there. Having traveled AROUND the world and stayed at places such as the Ritz, St Regis, and the Fairmont, I was somewhat concerned. So here are my thoughts about what everyone has been saying. 1) It is far out but when you look at the description on Marriot's site, you get that feel. If you want Waikiki, then stay there. The beauty of this resort is the fact that you are secluded from Honolulu and Waikiki. Yes, the traffic is AWFUL in the am but knowing that, leave early, get your sites seen in the morning and go back to the resort for a relaxing afternoon. If you want hustle and bustle, stay in Waikiki, if you want to relax, stay here. 2) Kids, yes, they are everywhere but I have noticed that trend in all of my travels. And there is nothing that you can do about it. We do not have kids nor do I want to be around them on my vacation, so we went to the beautiful adjoining lagoon instead. And to be honest,the lagoon is so breathtaking that you feel guilty for not taking advantage of it to go sit by the pool. Bottom line, I wish I could go to a resort where kids were not allowed but unfortunately we have to co exist....outside of the pool, I didn't seem to notice. We were also there Easter week. 3) Breakfast...no, I would not spend 50.00 on a bufffet either for two people but they do offer a lobby cafe that has a variety of pastries, toasts, fruit, smoothies, coffee, and juice. Having read the reviews I was expecting that there would be no options, but there is. So for those going - do not worry. Or eat later in the am and combine it with lunch (which we did one day), you will be stuffed till dinner. 4) Restaurants, having lived in NYC for over ten years, I consider myself a food snob to say the least. However, we ate the hotel every night and never once was I dissapointed. If you are looking for a cheaper meal, the lounge has great pub fare and there is even sunset sushi where they discount the food (and some drinks) 50%. And for those that might not know this HAWAII IS VERY EXPENSIVE. Yes, a sandwich (BTW, the tuna fish sandwich is so yummy and fresh) was 13.00 at the pool bar but it was everywhere we went in Hawaii. I paid 8.00 for a smoothie at Pearl Harbor. Even truck stop plate lunches (with are supposed to be the thing in Hawaii) were 10.00. There are cheaper places on the island but not by that much. And what you will save in the meal, you will spend in gas getting there. PS- AZUL is unbelievable and the staff was terrific. Overall, this hotel is first class ALL the way. We had an oceanfront view on the fourth floor and was amazed by the beauty of our view. The bathroom is every woman's dream. Bring candles for your evening bath and really relax. And everything in the room was NEW and tastefully done. And there are so many little touches (along with an accomodating staff) which make this hotel a definite in my book! This hotel is great and truly worth going....Marriot, if the only things people are complaining about are price of breakfast and children, then Marriot, you are doing just fine! The only way I would even consider going back to Oahu would be just to go back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “A 4 Star advertised as a 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HAPPYBIRDJZ
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 days at the Ihilani. Overall, it was a nice experience. The room was very clean with a very comfortable bed and oversized bathroom. Service was also very good. However, for a hotel this expensive, I just didn't experience what I call the "Wow!" factor. I have traveled extensively, and for the price, this hotel was just "very nice". It didn't pack the punch that your expect when booking a 5 star hotel and paying 5 star prices. I have stayed previously at the Sheraton Moana in Waikiki, also the Hilton Waiakoloa on the Big Island and the Westin on Maui. This hotel didn't rate above any of these hotels, which are billed as 4 star hotels. My biggest gripe is about the pool area. The pool was constantly overrun with children, sometimes 20 or more. The pool is small to start with. We were unable to utilize the pool at all. The entertainment was also at the pool, so to watch it, you had to peer between the children who were constantly running around and jumping into the pool during the entertainment. Of course the parents were oblivious. Just try to enjoy a drink and some entertainment in the evening, go ahead. The hotel desperately needs to build a separate pool with a water slide AWAY from the bar area, so maybe the adults can enjoy a drink and a swim and the entertainment. Only had dinner there once, it was also just ok. Breakfast and lunch were better. Also, Melvin at the water activity shack was very helpful--great service-loved Melvin. Too many children at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, service and location!!!”
Reviews.Author: hrhweezie
Reviews.Content: I just got back yesterday and I really enjoyed this hotel. The entire staff was friendly and helpful. Check-in was smooth and I was upgraded to an ocean view without asking. I was in 1008 and the room was HUGE with a very large bathroom. It overlooked the pool and lagoon. The cleaning staff was excellent every day. The valet staff was also great. They gave us great recommendations for restaurants and directions to everything we asked for. I ate at the pool bar a few times and the food was great. I loved the ahi tuna salad. I also ate in the bar a few times and enjoyed the burger, pizza, and desserts. Since I attended a wedding here – I spent a lot of time at the hotel. They did a great job with the actual wedding which was on the lawn by the ocean in the late afternoon. The reception and brunch the following day were great. Overall, I loved the location of this hotel. Ko Olina is fabulous because it is more secluded which made my trip relaxing. I visited Waikiki and wouldn’t want to stay there – too busy and commercialized. This hotel is close the H1 so it was a quick trip to anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoTAMember
Reviews.Content: Peggy and I just got back from a six day, five night stay at the JW Marriott Ihilani. Despite the constant rainy weather, we had a very enjoyable time. The staff was uniformly cheerful and went out of their way to accomodate us. They seemed genuinely interested in making sure we had a great time. I've traveled extensively and the only hotel that matched this level of service is the Broadmoor Resort in Colorado Springs. Our standard ocean-view hotel room (room 621) was spacious and well appointed, with a beautiful bathroom and a large balcony. The free morning coffee in the lobby was of good quality and very much appreciated. The resort is very well laid out and we enjoyed wandering the grounds. We had a great view of the three large manta rays from our balcony. The pool was okay and all the lagoons were great. If you like to snorkel, you can see many interesting varities of fish in Lagoon 2. Dining was a mixed experience. We very much enjoyed the breakfast buffet, but the surf and turf evening buffet in the main restaurant was disappointing. I found the prices a bit high but as other reviewers have noted, there are many good inexpensive restaurants within a 10 minute drive to Kopelie or a little farther in Ewa - at exit 5 off the H1 highway. And our favorite dining experience was at Roy's at the Ko Olina Golf Club. If you read more than a few reviews, you will understand why you must try Roy's on your vacation. Ditto what others have said about the need for a rental car. The Ko Olina is beautiful but there is much to see and do elsewhere, especially if you get caught in a rainy week like we did. We enjoyed trips to Wakiki, the north shore, and the windward shore. The Arizona memorial at Pearl Harbor was a particularly moving experience since my dad served in the US Navy during WW II. I also recommend a visit to the USS Missouri where you can walk in the footsteps of Pres Truman, Gen MacArthur, and Admirals Nimitz and Halsey. It is amazing that in one morning you can experience the spot where the war started (the bombing of the Arizona) and ended (the signing of the surrender documents on the deck of the Missouri). Like many other reviewers, we took the 90 minute tour at the Ko Olina Beach Club. They give you the choice of several valuable incentives and as promised, it was a low-key presentation without the pressure that is known to be part of the time share industry. And although we went in with no intention of buying, we liked what we saw and after talking to many owners, we joined the club. Not all, but many of the people who have stayed at both the Beach Club and hotel actually prefer the Beach Club. Based on our experience at the JW, this is saying a lot. We look forward to future visits to the Ko Olina.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: tgw5631
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to stay at Ihilani. We stayed 4 years ago on our honeymoon and I couldn't wait to go back. The resort is still so beautiful. The people there are very courtesy and are there to help you with whatever you need. The coffee bar, which is free, has the best coffee I've ever had. The restaurants and room service were a little more expensive this time, but the meals are so large, it's easy to share one. The hot tub was broken while we were there, which was a bummer. We were there 6 nights and there has been A LOT of rain in Hawaii, so it was wonderful staying at a place like Ihilani were you didn't mind being at the resort just relaxing. We will definitely go back someday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and spa!!”
Reviews.Author: calisummer
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3 night stay at the Ihilani and loved it! We got the "Paradise Plus" package, which included a breakfast buffet each morning. Breakfast was pretty good--cereals, hot items (bacon, sausage, fish, miso soup, french toast, pancakes), fruit, juice and an egg/omlett station... The room itself was wonderful--we wern't able to get upgraded to a "sunset view" room, but it wasn't even sunny while we were there, so that was ok. It had a huge lanai, spacious bathroom (loved it!), and a nice living room/bedroom area. The lagoons were beautiful and we didn't see many people at lagoon 1 or 2. Lagoon 3, next to the Beach Club had the most families there. We saw some people snorkeling and fishing out along the rocks...at the resort they have a smaller lagoon area with rays, sharks and other fish in it! Their pool was also nice--great place for kids! I'm sure during sunny days, the lagoon and pool areas are filled, but during our stay, there were about 25-40 people at the pool; maybe 10-20 people at the lagoons... We also signed up for their timeshare presentation and got $100 for our time! I used it towards their spa--heavenly! The service there was excellent! We would definately stay here again once we save up enough money!

Reviews.Title: “Surprises at Ko Olina”
Reviews.Author: Phillychef
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ko Olina for six days. Very beautiful and acessible. The rooms are very large with large Lanais and huge, very clean bathrooms. The view was tremendous from our room EXCEPT, major pigeon problem!!! Somedays it was so filthy we could not go out there, the hotel was very obliging in cleaning it up but very inconvenient and patience trying (and the noise of the pigeons starting about 6:00 a.m., one had laid her egg in our flower box so if you do not want this problem ask for a room without, every other floor has them.) Housekeeping was very nice and polite but many spoke very little English. Ko OLina is expensive but some of the amenities are worth it. The food is very satisfactory not outrageously priced but not cheap ex: drinks are from 8.00-10.00 frozen and mai tais ect.. tuna wrap 11.00 burger 9.00) The lagoons are beautiful but a little artificial, excellent for small children, which there seemed to be alot of. The walking path is nice as is the marina. It is easy to get everywhere from here and wonderfully quiet. The pool is nice, towels are plentiful, hot tub good in evenings for happy hour when they have drink specials, otherwise a lot of children. The golf course is nice, fairly challenging(Michelle Wie's home course) about 160.00 per round. MAJOR TURNOFFS: 12.95 per day for internet access, they have computers available for .15 a minute (we had just stayed in a much lesser hotel where it was free and free dvd player in room) ALSO Tennis is 22.50 per hour but worse than that 12.00 to hit the ball against the wall!!! Parking your car there is 15.00 a day. MAJOR PERKS: Free coffee in lobby from 5:30a.m. to 10:00 a.m. also and this is really nice; if you have a late flight you can check out, they will store your stuff and come back and use the hospitality room or spa to shower and change after the beach or pool.This I thought was great. We did not spend a huge amount of time during the day and only ate lunch once and dinner twice, there's a 40.00 buffet in one of the rest. on Sat. nite ,worth it only if you can eat that much. Valets are great and have printed directions to almost anywhere(you can self park too). Overall I would say above average to excellent, staff very friendly and helpful, very clean.Enjoyed it very much overall.

Reviews.Title: “Not ready for prime time, yet.”
Reviews.Author: akasomethingelse
