Checkout day we were able to stay in the room until 2:00p without additional charge and could have made use of the hospitality suite for 45 minutes at no charge later in the day. They also held our luggage at the front until our car picked us up at 4:30p. Overall I was extremely impressed with the quality of this hotel. Even though the building is a bit aged it is well maintained and they seem to be cleaning the place constantly. A lot of the common areas are open to the outside and makes for a nice atmosphere. All of the staff were exceedingly professional and well mannered. Housekeeping never knocked on the door but the room was always fresh, all phone calls throughout the hotel were answered using our name in the greeting, and other trivial things that made that stay the much more perfect. Bar and restaurant service (even the buffets) were well above average. We will stay there again. Summary Pros -it's not near Waikiki (which we loved) -pretty much everything Cons -it's not near Waikiki (which you may not love) -pool is on the small side and can have lots of children -food is expensive, even for a resort View more full resolution pictures at our website: www.lisaandadam.com/lisaandadam/pictures/ Look in the Vacations album.

Reviews.Title: “The Not So Shiny Side Of The 4 Star Resort....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading so many reviews that listed this hotel as "One Of Best", I booked a four night stay here to get away from the busy Waikiki Strip. Here's some things the reviews don't tell you. If you are planning on staying at this hotel for relexation and do not have kids, Do Not Come Here. Family Friendly means kids running and screaming all over this resort. They have only one pool for this huge complex. It was overrun with kids from sun up to sun down. Throwing footballs, splashing and just plain rough housing around. Now, they list that they have 4 lagoons in addition to the pool. There's a reason for this...If you are planning on walking the beach and looking for shells or sea glass, you wont find it here. The beach is basically non existent due to large black, sharp lava rocks. This isn't an option on this side of the island. There's also another problem with the lagoons....They are open to the public. There is nothing more frustrating than paying over $400.00 a night and having to share your experience with everyone and their brother. This also creates a problem in the parking garage. They make you pay $12.00 a day to park in the park garage, yet they have no problem also allowing everyone in the community into the parking garage. So, after leaving to go to the USS Missouri, I came back to a full parking garage and no where to park, yet I had a $400.00 plus a night room. The parking attendant was not helpful. He was oblivious to the fact that the garage was full and he still allowed people to keep pouring in. I did get a nice room with a view, and that's the one thing that I can say did come without a nominal fee. Nominal fee ended up being my joke after my 4 days here. The concierge was not helpful. She gave me some information and said I would have to call to check availability. Funny isn't that what a concierge is for? (She might have done it for a nominal fee, I should have asked.) Anyway, the staff was not friendly. I spent my first 3 days at The Ritz In Maui and wish I had stayed there. No one at Ihilani spoke, no one was helpful and no one really seemed to care that I was there and had money to spend. Because of the location and being so far out, you will find yourself at one of the resaurants. Breakfast for (2) will cost you $60.00 each time. That's the buffet. Dinner / Snack and a drink will cost you $60.00 at the pool. A nice dinner and drink will cost you $120.00. It's pretty pricey and gets a little hard to spend these kinds of amounts on food when the rest of the experience isn't real pleasant. I learned a lot from this experience. I learned that reviews need to be read and pondered. Questions still need to be asked. Remember, when a review doesn't mention customer service, it probably doesn't offer that.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: coecpa
Reviews.Content: Wonderful - we stayed at a Ritz in Maui and this was far and above better. Well worth the trip - we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can Be Wonderful If...”
Reviews.Author: SouthPasRef
Reviews.Content: We (me, my wife and my 12-year old son) just returned 3 days ago from a week at the Ihilani and came away with mixed feelings. The hotel was terrific, spotlessly clean, beautifully appointed with a cheerful and accommodating staff and wonderful creature conforts. We were promptly greeted upon our arrival and told that we were given an upgraded room. That turned out to be a mixed blessing. We had a gorgeous north facing ocean view, but unfortunately we also had a lot of noise all day long from the adjacent pavillion and otherwise. In the morning, we had to listen to the live rock band playing for the exercise class; at midday, we heard the music from the teen activity program; at night, we heard all of the noise from the luau until 10:00 PM and from the clean-up afterwards until around 11:30 PM. To top it off, the hotel is close to the highway, and starting around 5:00 AM each weekday (we slept with the balcony door open to enjoy the sound of the ocean, when we could hear it), we heard the noise of trucks and cars making their way into Honolulu. This was NOT what we came to Hawaii for. I have a feeling that if we were on the other side of the triangular shaped hotel, we would not have had this issue, but frankly, it tended to ruin our time sitting on our balcony to enjoy a drink and watch the beautiful sunsets. Beyond that, the hotel was incredible, with lots of privacy (i.e., away from the crowds) and wonderful manmade lagoons that had very good snorkeling (more than 2 dozen varieties of good sized fish swimming in no more than 6 feet of water near the rocks). Stop by one of the K-Mart stores on the way from Honolulu (exit 7 off H1 is the one we went to) and buy your own snorkeling equipment. We paid under $20 each to buy a mask and snorkel for my wife and me, and for $25 got a mask, snorkel and fins for my son, which more than beat the $15 for two hours that the hotel charged to rent a single mask and snorkel, particularly if you plan on snorkeling at the many other places around the island, like Hanamua Bay, which I recommend. The restaurants at the hotel are good but few and a tad pricey. If you are into the local fare, try En Fuego, which is ten minutes from the hotel in Kapolei. It's primarily a take out place, but you can eat in, and the Salmon Salad ($7.50), Pork LauLau ($7.50), and Hawaiian Sampler ($8.50) were all delicious and reasonably priced. Another hint if you are traveling with a family or just want to eat simply in your room one evening is to order a pizza from Papa John's in Kapolei, but pick it up as they estimate 1.75 hours to deliver to the resort. A final tip is to check your room phone book for coupons, which will yield a lot of deals at local eateries (not in the resort). The hotel staff was very willing to offer suggestions for restaurants outside the resort, and all were good. And, check the Honolulu Star Bulletin that is delivered to your room every day, as it is currently featuring a "Deal of the Day" at some local restaurant. On balance, this is a great hotel, but be insistant on choosing the location of your room if you can and you want peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “The Very Best!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Short & sweet! We went to Oahu last July for the first time. We had avoided Hawaii, as we felt nothing was worth the 12 hour flight. We have traveled extensively for both business and pleasure, and have stayed in some wonderful hotels. However, the JW Marriott at Ko Olina is without question... THE VERY BEST!!!!!! It is rated as one of the top 5 resorts in the world, and we rate it #1! How much did we enjoy it??? We are returning this July!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, did we get this right!”
Reviews.Author: pookies-mom
Reviews.Content: I use Trip advisor for all family vacations and my business trips, even when planning business conferences for hundreds of attendees. I've instructed my staff to select hotels to preview by reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. It hasn't failed me yet, and this vacation was no exception. We've been looking forward to this trip since a brief visit to this property two years ago. We've been reading the updated reviews on Trip Advisor to make sure it's remained as terrific a place as we remember. We're a busy family, and vacations together don't come often enough - we can't risk our time or money on a vacation that's not a sure thing. Boy did we get this one right - Thank you Trip Advisor! Our family of four just returned form the greatest vacation we've ever had. 8 nights at JW Marriott Ihilani, and we can't wait to return. A nine hour plane ride from Minneapolis, it was worth every minute. *Outer-island feel with the convenience of Oahu *Family friendly and comfortable luxury *Two of the four family members REALLY needed relaxation, and got it. Mom read five books on the beach, and Dad took lessons from the golf pros at Ko Olina. *Two of the family members needed lots of fun in the sun, there's no better place for kids and parents to vacation. The lagoons are so safe for children, there's plenty of sand for the most palatial sand castles, and catching the crabs with Hale of Keiki Club was a blast *Kids and adults all enjoy the pool and hot tub *We loved being serenaded each night with live beautiful guitar music and the waves breaking on the beach *Comfy, comfy beds *The BATHTUBS! Ahhhh............. The poolside evening entertainment was top-notch. Only problem is our daughter now wants to be a Hula dancer when she grows up. It's going to be hard to pull off in Minnesota. Very warm and helpful service, from the front-desk (THANK YOU for the room upgrade!), to the valet, housekeeping, room service, restaurants, gift shops, Keiko Club (Hi Hale!), beach staff. It went too fast. Looks like we'll be buying a Ko Olina time share, but worry that we'll miss the Ihilani. All this and Roy's Restaurant too (try the szechwan pork ribs, passion fruit sorbet). What a amazing restaurant, and with warm, efficient service -incredible! Went too fast, sorry it's over. We miss Ihilani! We'll be back soon! Take: golf-clubs sun screen inflatable beach toys - or get them at KMart in Kapalei - try the Thai restaurant while you're there for great Satay and Phad Thai. Chilis restaurant was terrific too. Walking shoes - the paths along the lagoons are great for a power walk. Change for tips - valet and housekeeping - you'll really want to tip these folks, they are so helpful By the way, if your little ones are worn out after a day at the lagoon, the kid's room service menu is great. Ours loved the spaghetti. Do the time-share preview art Ko Olina- it's a lovely property, no pressure whatsoever, and friendly sales staff. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Do Research and start planning......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Start doing some rearch about what this hotels has to offer..... It's funny how you read the reviews of this hotel. I recently stayed here at the Ihilani with my 2 children and husband. We loved it. I originally booked this resort through expedia and thought that being it is my 3rd trip here to the islands that I would try somewhere other then Waikiki. Waikiki is okay but when you book with the Ihilani it's kinda nice being away from the "action". Waikiki is like a Tokyo, Japan so many people everywhere all hours of the day. We first made the reservation and needed transportation to the resort. I never been on that side of the island and hearing that the hotel is in a upcoming residential side of the island I needed to do some research. I emailed the hotel at ---- and within 1 day someone from the Concierge emailed me back and started assisting me with a lot of questions. (whom by the way knows what they are doing...) to ask what my transportation options where. i knew from research that they were quite a way's from the airport 35 minutes to be exact (w/o traffic) the Concierge mentioned to me that there were 3 options to get there: 1-airport taxi there waiting 2- Their taxi company Koalini Transportation 3- Car rental My husband and I decided to have the Concierge book our transportation. We were quouted aboiut $60 ++ to get there but it was a flat rate for a sedan. I believe they said that it would be a towncar. Or they could send out a limo for $80. Now who wouldn't want to be picked up by a LIMO!!!! The driver was great very courteous and very attentive. We were very happy that the driver was ontime and waiting for us at the airport. Plus we could charge it to the room! Fabulous! Arrived at the resort to be greeted by the front desk with some wet cooling towel with a ecualiptis scent. Fabulous! That really woke us up after a 5 hour flight there! The staff was very friendly. They did advise us upon check in that the room wa not available as it was not chck in but seeing our jet-lagged children they upgraded us complimentary! Sweet gesture! We checked into our beautiful ocean room on the 15th floor a corner room. Perfect! Sunrise and sunset views. Thanks front desk!! Yes there is an industrial park near the resort as mentioned in other "negative comments" but why focus on the industrial park when you can watch children playing in the half empty lagoons, people on a catamaran sailing by, or even the spinner dolphins swimming right outside the lagoons, visble from our room. I don't understand how people could say anything bad about this hotel. About the fee's for parking, Yes $12 a day weather you self park or Valet. Waikiki $15-$20 a day...Hello! Just for self park! And about their being no off properwty restaurants! uh! yes! there are nmot much choices for food. You are in Hawaii, an island!! Not New York! You need to be able to go without the New York Food and eat what the locals call "Take Out". The bellmen directed us to the nest town over to our resort call Kapolini??? There was a place called En Fuego, a local take out place. They have entree's for less then $10. I mean food made with Love! the staff there was fabulous. Yes the restaurants there at the resort are a bit pricey especially if you have children who eat like birds. One of the Concierge directed us to a place in that same town to a little restaurant called Jurison's for breakfast, now that's good! sorta like a i-hop or denny's but way better! They do have a unmanned business center and 2 shops in the hotel as well as 3 major restaurants, 1 pool grill and 1 lounge which only stays open to 12 mid night, which is nice. No big activities will pick up at the hotel so plan to rent a car. We rented a car with Hertz there at the hotel. Expect the price for car rental is a little high, but you are paying for them to bring the car to you(: They do have shuttles to Waikiki and to the Arizona. But Arizona is on a first come first served basis. There are fee's for the shuttle as it is an outside company that runs it, not the hotel. Keep in mind you are 45 minutes or so away from Waikiki so the shuttle is cheaper. But of course the daily rate on a car is even cheaper. It's easy to drive arounf, the Concierge had really good driving directions, some with little maps on them. i found that a big help as I am the visual an my husband audio! This hotel is very beautiful and worth the drive, I mean who could ask for anything more, but a beautiful hotel and almost secluded lagoons! Go there and enjoy! 3-4 day's is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but...”
Reviews.Author: Annie46
Reviews.Content: Nice room (we did not have an ocean view but it was still very plesant with a delightful balcony), extremely cheerful and attentive staff, lovely property (don't miss seeing the rays swimming in the pools!), nice walking trails, and man-made lagoons where you can swim without being overwhelmed by the surf. Went snorkeling there and encountered a number of fish and even a large sea turtle - lots of fun. So what's the "but..."? We were there on a business convention and were frankly astonished to find that although they offer in-room broadband, they want to charge $13 a day for it! When much more modestly priced chains offer the same service either free or for a nominal charge, we found this cost way out of line. For our five night stay it would have cost more than we pay for business DSL in a month. And associates who DID sign up for it, said it was barely any faster than ordinary dial-up service. A place that is trying to cater to business conventions needs to change this policy. Also the room frig was not accessible for any of our own food. (You would have to pay $25, according to the sign, to have it emptied out so you could use it - so our leftovers brought back from a lunch on the north end of the island just went to waste, and we felt badly about that.) The property is lovely, the staff is delightful, but some bean-counter in the back office needs to be laid off so this property can delight its guests the way it ought to.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Lagoon”
Reviews.Author: VideoOne
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 just returned from the JW Marriott at Ko Olina. My wife and I and our 6, 7, and 11 year old girls. We usually stay in Waikiki but decided to get away from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu. Travelocity originally messed up our reservationa and told JW Merriott that we were a party of 3. We were given a room with a King size bed for five people. After 3 hrs with customer service they wouldn't fix the problem except to send in two rowaway beds or put us in a room with 2 double beds if available. When we got to the JWM, they were able to move us to a room with 2 double beds. I couldn't believe the size of the room. The 9th floor ocean view room was magnificent. I decided I could sleep on the sofa while my wife and kids occupied the double beds. The sun set perfectly in the middle of our Lanai wall to wall windows. The bathroom was twice as big as my baths at home with 2 vanities. The next morning the manager Joy stopped us at the lobby and not only remembered our names but offer us an upgrade to their specialty room with two bedrooms, and 2 TVs. The kids loved the 2 TVs since they can watch their programs. It was on a lower floor and mountain view but the size of the rooms offset the scale over the view. The staff was great and the valets knew the best places to eat. They tipped us to a place called En Fuego that had the best local cuisine anywhere in Hawaii. If you love Poke or Sashimi, this is the place! You can even order a 4 LB platter in advance if you want. The curry Katsu was great. 10 times better than L & L's another local resturant that I liked. Even the hot spot Sam Choy's, that everyone visits can't match the quality of the food. Very reasonably priced and big portions! Parking is the same cost valet or no valet. We tried self parking it and found the walk with 3 kids too much, so we used valet from that point on. A small tip is advised but you do what you think is right. The lagoon and pool is great for swimming. The kids just loved it and it was hard to get them out each time. The poolside entertainment was good and if you're like my daughter, she watch it front row viewing from inside the pool. We will never stay at Waikiki again! Thank you JW Marriott for your warm aloha hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott at Ko'Olina”
Reviews.Author: poinsda
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is a beautiful hotel. The decor/grounds are in wonderful shape. The atmosphere is friendly and relaxed. Pros: The seafood buffet on the weekends; Golf course Cons: You definitely need a rental car to get anywhere

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: HWlovesmaui
Reviews.Content: We've traveled to Hawaii 6 times and stayed at various resorts and islands. We loved the Ihilani. Yes, it's removed from the "excitement" of Waikiki, but we'd been there and done that. This hotel is beautiful and the rooms are very spacious and decorated very tastefully. The lanai is large with comforatable furniture. Our only complaint was the two double beds for our family of four- queen size would have been appreciated. The pool was clean and refreshing, the beach and ocean water were very warm and inviting. The kids enjoyed the waterways around the hotel and the variety of sea life in them. We were surprised to look out of our hotel window one day and see an octopus swimming down below in the hotel lagoon. The hotel was full, as this was Easter weekend, so the pool chairs and poolside bar/restaurant were both over-crowded. They have the same problem that I've seen in many places, with people saving chairs early in the day and not really even using them. Not sure if they need more chairs, a bigger pool bar- or if it was just a problem due to it being "high" season. I loved their hotel gift shops too- really pretty things that I didn't see anywhere else. We will stay here again if we have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “just as great the second time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned to the hotel for our 6 month anniversary after going there on our honeymoon. A week before our return the concierge sent us an e-mail asking if there was anything they could do for us. They even put us up in the same room as our honeymoon! Many of the staff members remembered us, especially the great people at the front desk of the spa. Yes, food at the hotel can be expensive but when you look at the hotel and the surrounding grounds, you can see why. If the breakfast buffet is too expensive for you, you can go down to the timeshare property and have their buffet which is about $12.00 cheaper and still charge it to your Ihilani room. Yes, the hotel is far away from everything but that is the beauty of it. We have been to many places during our relationship and this hotel is where we are the most comfortale and relaxed. The man-made lagoons are perfect for families as the water is clean and the waves are very minimal. You also have fish swimming with you in the lagoons. The large bathrooms are great because they allow you enough space for more than one person to get ready at the same time. The separate shower stall is a godsend and the rooms are very clean. Also, apply for a Marriott rewards card, so that you can earn 10 points for every dollar you spend on the property. It is a great way to earn free hotel stays. My husband and I are planning on returning next year!

Reviews.Title: “surly staff who then tell you "aloha!" on your way out”
Reviews.Author: hawaiichick
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and like the neighbor island feel enough to put up with some odd staff attitude, love the spa (where the staff is wonderful), & was planning on staying for a wedding next month, but now think it's worth my time to drive back into town instead of staying. We stopped by the hotel for drinks & late lunch, and the two choices were the very-crowded pool grill or Naupaka. The hotel has a strange set-up, where there is only one direct oceanview restaurant & it doesn't open till evening. In fact, Ko Olina is not ocean-oriented at all, more about showy walkways but not comfortable lounging in the hotel. The pool grill is fine but it's really a place to eat when you don't want to leave the pool or go too far from the lagoon. We went to Naupaka & asked to be seated at an ocean-view table. There were only four other parties there. The hostess refused, saying there was only one server for the rest of the afternoon and it was too much trouble for him if we didn't sit right next to the other tables. This was stupid, since the table we pointed at was actually on the way from the kitchen to the lower dining area, actually saving him steps. So she grumpily seated us at a table that was right next to the others and jammed up against a wall - clearly last choice, walking away without a word. We asked the server if he'd mind us moving & we had no problem with slow service, as we were there to enjoy & take our time. He said, you know people say they don't mind but then they do, and I don't make any money. Fine - we smiled, said don't worry. Not so fine is what he then said - I'm here to make money, you know. Lovely, we didn't think you were here for your health but who in the world says that at what's supposed to be one of the best resorts on the island. He also rolled his eyes when we asked a very simple menu question when we ordered drinks, and said "okaaaay, then." The server did end up being very nice, and the service was faster than could be expected, although apparently the designated late afternoon menu is only completely available until the cook leaves about 1/2 hour into the time. But grumpy hostesses and waiters who roll their eyes (no matter how nice they are after they calm down) is NOT when I want in a hotel. I don't care what the cook's hours are - if you offer it on the late afternoon menu, it should available unless you've run out. Staff's convenience comes first here, not yours. To top it off, the hostess who had stomped past us clearly annoyed during our meal then said a big "aloha!" when we left. We'll save our money, drive home after weddings, and only come here for the spa.

Reviews.Title: “THE best!”
Reviews.Author: groovynp
Reviews.Content: We thought this was THE most wonderful beautiful hotel ever. The front staff was a little snooty, but everyone else was awesome. Also, there were WAY too many kids. But that is the way it was on every island we went to. We still don't understand lugging babies around! Oh well...we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Responding to wanna be treated third class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the beautiful resort in Kapolei with my husband and 2 children. I thought the staff there was so immaculate. I was a little skeptical on what to expect at the resort after reading a comment titled "wanna be treated like a third class". My husband had asked if we ould extend an extra day. We originally booked for the last night in Waikiki at the Hyatt. But optd not to stay there. This hotel has beautiful practically empty 4 lagoons. The front desk staff was very friendly and shared the warmth of Aloha all around us. We recieved a lei greeting when we checked in and we recieved a complimentary room upgrade from a Ocean View to a Deluxe Ocean view. It was fabulous. We could see whales swimming in the morning right from our room. There really isn't much for a 3 year old but the beaches and the pool. But for my 6 year old he enjoyed feeding the sharks and stingrays. That was the best thing. We also went out on the Koolia Cat which the Concierge desk had recommended. It was the best. We snorkeled and watched the whales upfront. Seeing the smiles on my childrens faces was the best feeling. Dining at Naupuka Terrace was fabulous. The service and staff we very much on top of things. Making sure that my children were entertained. I highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Get prepared to be pampered”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a very discerning traveler and opt to spend my money on accommodations...always. The Ihilani resort was great. My husband and I were in HI for a wedding, but decided to make a vacation of it. The room was more than acceptable. Superb view of the water. Excellent, unobtrusive cleaning service. Great restaurant optiona. Immaculate grounds. Spectacular golfing. Awesome spa. We really like the location in that it was away from the hustle and bustle of the island, but not too far. You'll certainly need a car if you want to explore the island. However, if you're visiting to simply relax or just enjoy some quiet time, good food, good company and beautiful surroundings...skip the car, book the room and get prepared to be pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel... and whale season -- oh wow!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Back from an amazing vacation. The J.W. hotel was just superb. I golfed several times in the same trip; my wife had her run of the spa. We saw whales from our balcony! We also went on a boat to experience whale-watching at sea. The Ko Olina Cat was our choice. Incredible crew and attentive to detail -- plus we saw the whale show of a lifetime. The resort is nice -- out of the way of the city but that's a good thing.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful serene location; friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful three nights in an ocean view room. They upgraded us (upgrade is $30 per level - levels are mountain vw, garden vw, ocean vw, prime ocean vw). The pluses: 1) Manicured lawns, not too many people, easy to find a chair and lounge by the sea, or walk. Lagoons were nice though we didn't swim in them. 2) Paradise cove is next door so its easy to get to the luao quickly and get a good seat. The luao has nice games including a short canoe ride. The entertainment itself is okay. 3) The spa is amazing. $20 day pass would be worth it. Nice Roman pool inside and great sauna, steam room and needle shower. Massage is okay. 4) Staff is very friendly. Rooms are large with great bed and pillows, and bathrooms are spacious and well appointed. 5) We ate at the Napauka once (dinner buffet) and it was fine - we were happy. There was also an outdoor band playing with dancing that evening. The minuses: 1) There is construction nearby but far enough not to be noisy - though some rooms have a view of part of it. 2) The hotel is expensive Important points: Unless you want to spend the entire vacation at the Ihilani, make sure to rent a car. The hotel is 30 minutes drive from the airport and longer during rush hour which is every morning from ~ 7 am onwards. I would say a car is essential. We had a great trip because we planned our activities beforehand and had AAA maps and a car : in ~ 2 days, we visited the Arizona memorial (close to the airport - read the reveiws about getting there early etc.), made use of the Ihilani Spa, went to the paradise cove Luao, drove to and snorkelled in Hanauma Bay (1.5 hours from Ihilani), had a great buffet lunch at Kahala Mandarin, drove to Pali lookout and through to Lanikai beach (beautiful!! - though sometimes rainy), hiked lovely Diamond Head and visited the Waikiki Aquarium (the sharks there are spectacular - amazing!). Also shopped at Hilo Hattie.

Reviews.Title: “dont leave any personal items behind...”
Reviews.Author: arubadive
Reviews.Content: just got home this morning from the ihilani after a week stay and noticed while unpacking that I left a very expensive pair of shoes behind there in the closet. The closet doors were not working properly so I could not see them when I left. Just called the hotel and they are already gone, the house keeper and the maintence personnel did not turn them into lost and found!!! rude treatment when I called them and very unhelpful which pretty much sums up the stay there.pool area way to small and quite loud, public areas not up to any first class hawaiian resorts that I have stayed in. Very sparce with greenery and seemed cold.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location at Ko Olina”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want luxury and excellent service surrounded by views over sculpted lagoons, the ocean or mountains, peacefully located away from the crowds of Waikiki and Honolulu, then the Ihilani at Ko Olina may be for you. I loved my time here. The rooms are described well in other reviews so I won't repeat what they say. Our room was spacious (we had a wheelchair accessable room facing west with a perfect view of the sunset) and well appointed, as was the bathroom. We were initially given a smaller room and there was no problem having it changed. The staff at the front desk and especially at the concierge are warm, professional and obliging. I know that should be a given, but we also know that it isn't always the case. I mentioned the location first of all because it's a huge selling point... at least to me. We rented a car at the airport because you almost have to for convenience since most tours run from Waikiki and taxi fare there is $72.50 1 way. The hotel does have it's own shuttle for $20 per person each way, however (booked in advace). If you do rent a car, it's only about 25 miles and it's an easy drive. However, it's important to know where to park so that you don't get charged huge fees: The Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center is a good bet, just buy something in the center and have your ticket stamped. Having spent some time sightseing and shopping in Waikiki I was more than ready to get out of town & back to the tranquility of Ko Olina. For me, staying in Waikiki would be like being in downtown Chicago. But if you want to be closer to the city and don't want to drive, then I'd say don't go to Ko Olina. Some tour operators will come out & pick you up from there but they'll ask in the region of $45 per person each way. The restaurants have excellent service with a great breakfast buffet, however expensive at $21 per person. Dinner was a somewhat limited menu and just good, not excellent. My one complaint was that coffee and tea are only available free of charge for limited hours in the morning before 10.00am. After that, it's $3.50 per cup in the restaurants/bars (included with breakfast buffet). That's tough if you need your coffee or tea on a regular basis. The best coffee was in the lounge bar in the evening. I have to disagree with the complaint of the pool being to small. I only ever saw a few people even using the pool to swim in, I'd imagine because the lagoons are so close by. It is not a deep pool so would suit children. This hotel was a perfect vacation resort and location for me. Wonderful golf and tennis facilities and spa and the walkways past the lagoons are nice if you like to walk. Overall, this is upscale luxury in picturesque surroundings. I'ts aesthetically beautiful and you won't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Lewisville
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a week at the JW Marriott Ihilani and had an excellent experience. I had purchased some nights through a package (garden view) and then added an extra night with ocean view. Upon check in, the hotel graciously upgraded us to an ocean view room for all of the nights. The room was spacious, with a large marbled bathroom, and the beds were outstanding. Our room was also well insulated and generally of excellent quality. The lagoon is steps away from the hotel and great for swimming. Both the lagoon and pool were clean and well kept up, and had a wholesome mixed crowd of young couples, retirees, families, Americans and Europeans. We spent much of our vacation just relaxing at the pool and soaking up the sun on the padded chaise lounge chair. The staff at the poolside bar was outstanding, and even offered complimentary ice waters every so often. This was a much appreciated service that I haven't seen at other resorts. We tried several menu items over the week and liked everthing. We saw several wait staff over the week and they were all friendly and attentive. Another great service was the valet parking. There was a daily fee for this (I think $10 or $12) but it was certainly very convenient. The valets were always extremely fast in retrieving our car. On one occasion, the valet gave us a written directions sheet to a shopping center we were trying to find. I used the gym equipment a few times, and was pleased that the basic fitness area was free of charge. The resort is definately away from Waikiki and Honolulu, and gets quiet in the evenings. We found this to be a benefit, but it may not suit everyone. Beware of heavy traffic in and out of Honolulu, especially in the afternoons and early evenings during the week! We went into town a few times but were always glad to get back to the Ihilani. In terms of dining options, the poolside bar was excellent, and we also had a good experience with the Terrace restaurant. We did not try Azul or the Japanese restaurant. The $21 breakfast buffet initially seemed expensive, but it offered lots of high quality entrees such as baked whitefish, eggs benedict, an omelette station, as well as mizo soup, waffles, eggs, bacon, sausage, fruit, etc. etc. so I actually found the price to be worth it. We had a late breakfast and it sufficed for lunch as well. While you would definately not describe the dining prices as "bargain," they were in line with what we have seen elsewhere in Hawaii and the food and service were always good. We were offered a $100 discount off our hotel bill if we took a tour at the nearby Ko Olina Beach Resort where they were selling timeshares, but we were having such a relaxing time at the pool that we didn't want to take the 90 minutes out of our schedule. We did walk over there one evening and it looked like a great condo resort. There were 1 or 2 buildings done and at least 1 more under construction. In summary, we had a very enjoyable stay at the Ihilani and would love to go back. I would have no reservations recommending this resort!

Reviews.Title: “they do not treat locals well”
Reviews.Author: hopelee
Reviews.Content: We live in Kaneohe, but wanted to stay on the other side of the island for our birthday weekend. My Fiance was told by a friend that this was the best new resort area on the island. He called and explained that we live here and would be driving in after work on Friday. For over $200 a night (supposedly with a Kama'aina discount), we got a room facing a construction site. We asked for an ocean view, we were told all the ocean view rooms were taken. The hotel was empty! When I made this observation to the desk clerk, we were told that although there were no guests using them, the rooms are reserved by the airlines and travel agents for airline personnel etc and they never know when they might suddenly need them (I think by 7pm on a friday night, they'd know). By the time we got finished with work, packed, then drove over, it was about 7pm. We were astonished to find everything was closed. The restaurants, the activities, etc, I think maybe a Japanese-Eurasian restaurant might have still been open for a little while but dinner orders were no longer being taken or something--- we had to drive to Kapolei to have dinner! The room was pretty, but the view was terrible, as I mentioned, and the bed was so hard we tossed and turned all night. The construction view and dust was awful... lucky it was the weekend or it would have been even noisier. Our room was above the front entrance so we heard cars driving and car doors slamming all night. The next morning we went down to the poolside cafe for breakfast... after waiting at the maitre 'd station for about 20 minutes, we were seated then a woman came over and told me I was not dressed for the dress code, I had to go upstairs and change. First, I was wearing a bikini and a wrap to sit at what they call a "poolside cafe" ( I was going to take a dip in the pool after breakfast)....which made it misleading. Second, they could have told me while I stood there in front of the entrance for 20 minutes waiting, instead of embarrassing me at the table ( not to mention I had 20 minutes to go back up to the room and change ). At that point I was pretty mad. The hotel was still empty, and yet we asked again and were denied an oceanview room, at any price. Then we went to the activities desk to sign up for some activities... but we were told that they were all filled and usually need to be signed up for at least 24- 28 hours in advance. How can you do anything during a weekend stay? AND why didn't anyone tell us this when we called and made the reservations? Well, we checked out and went out to Yokohama Bay for the rest of the day---- I wasn't paying another $200 a night to be treated like a second class citizen. At least when you pay $45-50 a night to stay at the Cheap-o Makaha Surfside, you get what you paid for....

Reviews.Title: “Must be something they put in the water”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got back from a FABULOUS 9 nights at the Ihilani. We arrived to be informed we had been upgraded to an oceanview room, which was excellent and unexpected. We slept with the lanai doors open every night! The staff was constantly attentive and very very friendly, we especially loved the valet...Abe in particular. There were plenty of activities at the resort (ukulele lessons, lahaula weaving etc.), we explored all 4 lagoons (*a must do if you want to avoid the influx of families on Friday and Saturday), the restaurants at the resort were overall "good" if not a bit expensive, though Ray's was outstanding. The property itself was stunning and vast. We kept joking that Ko Olina must mean "nice digs" in Hawaiian. The spa was nice, though not your Canyon Ranch, though I was dissapointed to learn that the mens spa had a cold dip pool whereas the womens did not! Overall fabulous, glad even though they did have timeshares we never felt pressured...nothing can ruin a vacation like a semi-constant sales pitch! Just great!...we even toured the island and took a look at Turtle Bay, my husband turned to me and said "I'm so glad we are staying where we are staying", that I think speaks volumes. Also fantastic as we were only 20 minutes from the oppresive swarm of Waikiki...and to think we could have stayed with 40,000 screaming kids for the same price!

Reviews.Title: “It was nice, but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott at Ko Olina was beautiful - the staff very polite and friendly - especially the bell staff (Tommy is the man - a Houston Texans fan in Hawaii!!), and the gal at the Hertz desk that gave us a car for $39.00 for the day - what a sweetheart. The rooms were beautiful, especially the bed and bathroom. But I have to forewarn you - the food at the resort is mega-expensive ($21/person for the breakfast buffet - come on!). We wound up going into Kapolei, like someone on Trip Advisor had advised, and shopped at the Safeway for breakfast and lunch food. We did eat at Roy's two nights and enjoyed it immensely. We thought that Azul's was overpriced but nice. The beach is pretty too. No ice machines was totally inconvenient. Would I go back? Maybe, but I'd want to go to Kauai and the big island first.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful way to end our honeymoon...”
Reviews.Author: Shellybells82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I island hopped through our honeymoon 12/21 to 12/30. We spent our final 3 nights at the JW Marriott Ihilani. Upon booking this hotel, neither of us had been to Oahu. We both agreed that we did not want to be anywhere near the hustle of Waikiki Beach. We are so happy that we chose here. We had a garden view and the view was still spectacular with a wonderful view of the ocean. We loved the lagoons and one morning even had a private beach to ourselves at Lagoon #2. The room service is quite pricey, as the restaurants, but there are near by towns for restaurants as well. The resort is about 25 minutes from Waikiki where we walked around one day. The service here was great and the sunsets were beautiful. Maybe one day we will return. After the not-so-great experience in Kona the prior days, staying here was a wonderful way to end our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and classy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved it. The hotel has beautiful white marble through out and neat little beaches which are wonderful for lounging or children playing. The grounds are manacured with a world-class golf course and Roy's restraurant in the resort area. A touch of old Hawaii the way it should have been. CK Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “We loved it... didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: clmmbs
Reviews.Content: Like I said, we loved it and we REALLY didn't want to leave. Now that I'm back, and have had a chance to catch up on the reviews that I've missed (one really not good), I've decided that there isn't much I can ad to the most recent review which was pretty thorough. We were originally given a room with a "Refinery view" a.k.a. "Ocean view", but with a quick call to the front desk with a request for a "quieter Ocean view", we received a much nicer view of ocean and mountains that they refer to as their "Sunset view". Perfect! Lovely room, very clean, comfortable BIG (King) Bed with nice linens and comfy full-sized pillows (something you don't see much anymore). Beautiful patio, and yes a very large bathroom, but not as huge as some people make it out to be. It certainly wasn't as big as the bedroom, which was very nicely appointed and had a very relaxed "spa" feeling. Most people will say that you don't spend much time in your room, however I don't agree, and I do like to have a nice place to come home to, to dress for dinner, and enjoy a nice nap, or place to read in the afternoon. This room was a welcomed retreat. The pool is small, but the beach area is incredible. Some have made a negative point of the Man-made lagoons, but they were incredibly beautiful, groomed each morning, and had a fabulous walkway that runs 1.5 miles around the four lagoons. A great place for a morning walk. In addition, I have to say that the staff seemed very friendly, all the personnel, from front desk to wait staff seemed very happy to be there and very happy to help. I don't think we passed an employee that didn't take the time to great us. One more thing, it was probably one of the best morning buffets that we've ever enjoyed. Everything was delicious and fresh! We were there for only four days, and loved every minute of it! Then on to the Marriott in Kauai (see my review of that resort). Best wishes for a happy visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Worth 4 stars, but not 5.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The bathrooms were huge. The bedrooms were not. I agree with one over reviewer who said that they could stand to take some of the space from the bathroom to add it to the bedroom. The bedroom area did feel slightly cramped with a sofa, a coffee table, and a desk, but they utilized the space well and we were never uncomfortable. The rooms were very well decorated and there was a console on the phone that allowed you to control virtually everything in the room, including the “do not disturb” sign. The verandahs were a very nice size. We had a “mountain view” room that overlooked the stingray pool, and we could actually see bits of the ocean over the tree tops. I’m surprised that they didn’t call it a “partial” ocean view room, which most hotels would have done. The service was not something we would remember – good or bad. The staff was friendly, but there was nothing extraordinary about the service. (To read between the lines here, if you are someone who needs to be waited on hand and foot, this is probably not the place for you, but at the same time, if you hate overbearing, in-your-face service then it is perfect. We are somewhere in between, but the service here was just fine and we have no complaints.) The location was great – away from Waikiki and the crowds. The downside was having to drive down H1 to get there and back – at the wrong time of day, this could take quite a long time, as H1 is one of the worst freeways we’ve been on during rush hour (and we live in DC and have lived in LA – two of the worst cities for traffic in the country). We had no problems finding the resort. The people who said it was hard to find must be navigationally challenged. The hotel itself was very nice and the grounds were well maintained and very nice. The pool was small but it was pretty and adequate for us – we don’t go on vacation to swim laps and there were never that many people actually swimming in it. The beach was huge, but as another reviewer stated, they could stand to have some more chairs. They actually had more (and better) chairs down at the timeshare resort that Marriott is building a few lagoons over. The food was decent, but probably not up to “food snob” standards (and I say that tongue in cheek – there’s nothing wrong with having gourmet tastes, but I get irritated at people who just complain and moan and moan and complain about food.) Also, every single resort hotel review for ANY resort I’ve ever read complains about the food prices. I think people just need to deal. It’s a resort. They hike up prices because they can. You pay for convenience. Ever been to a movie theater or a theme park before and paid 5 bucks for a soda? Same concept. Get over it. I would say from the standpoint of knowing that it is a resort and the prices would be a bit higher, they were actually on par with most other resorts to which we’ve been, if not a bit cheaper. To give you some context regarding our “standards” so that you have something on which to base this review, we’ve stayed at the Four Seasons on Maui, the Hilton Waikoloa on the Big Island, and the Mandarin Oriental Kahala. Each had its plusses and minuses. Our favorite by far was the Four Seasons on Maui. Then we would rank the Mandarin Oriental a close second and the JW would fall a somewhat distant third. (We loved the Hilton’s lagoon and the large pools, but the rooms were not very deluxe and the hotel was so huge that it was a hike to the rooms and there was no real beach.) Regardless, we had a great time at ALL of these resorts and in most cases, you get what you pay for and so based on what we paid for these resorts, we knew what to expect. I think many people don’t, which is why they are disappointed. I go on vacation to relax and have fun and if you start sweating the small stuff (like not having anyone acknowledge your anniversary), then you may need to reassess your priorities (granted, if you find yourself encountering bigger problems like broken shower doors, then sometimes it’s hard not to start sweating the small stuff). What we paid at the JW was easily less than half the price of what we paid the Four Seasons or the Mandarin Oriental. I think it’s a great hotel for the price. So, overall, this isn’t a “rave” review, but we had a great time. We’d definitely recommend the hotel and would consider returning. It was beautiful and relaxing, and in reality, what more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my brief vist!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this hotel? Yes it is a little remote, as I have read other reviewers say, but frankly, that is the charm of this property. After spending 4 nights at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, this was a welcome break! The front door staff were very friendly, however, the bell staff were slow to deliver my luggage. Front desk . . .GREAT, friendly check in procedure. Some of my paper work was not in order, and the clerk ensured me that she would take care of it. I was sent up the 12th floor to a deluxe ocean view room. Based on the reviews that I have read, if you can do it, a deluxe ocean view room is the way to go. All I can say is ahhhhh, when I walked into my well-appointed room with truly majestic views of the ocean and mountain range. The bathroom, large, and wonderful! My first stop was off to the concierge to get my 3 days sorted out. I think her name was Sherri? What a delight, very helpful. Let's now get to the spa! Great staff that was very very very accommodating to my needs. With only 2 hours to closing, I was able to fit in the best Hawaiian style message ever and not to mention block a number of other treatments. There was a miss communication for one of my treatments a few days later; however, the staff did their best to fix the situation. I did not get what I originally requested, but a fair discount on a good substitute. The spa area it's self is ok, I did not spend a lot of time lounging, but it looked as if that those who were enjoyed it. I found the setting a little bright. Softer, more intimate lighting would have been more appealing to me. Yes, the pool area is small, however, the lagoons are great! They are where you need to spend your time. There were not a great deal of beach chairs, I was lucky, but a few had to settled in the sand and did not seem pleased. Unfortunately, no food and beverage service at the lagoon directly in front of the hotel, that sucks, but I got over it. I will say that the service as the pool area was a little lack luster at best. Not the bar, they were fine. I felt the need to prompt the wait staff for service, once they got going it was ok. With regard to the eating outlets, I did have room service, which was fine. I also had breakfast in the dining area near the pool and that was wonderful. Other than that I did not have the chance to eat on property. Over, all a great experience and a wonderful place to call home while you are out an about touring the island. I will also say that the front door staff turned out to be wonderful. Always prompt with my vehicle, and eager to offer directions each time I left the hotel. I will be back, and would recommend this hotel to my friends and colleagues. You must know that I am in travel business (I do not work for a hotel and I am not a travel agent), and am super critical as I am in the business and can recommend to my customers just about any where for thier meetings and incentive travel needs. Service, service, service, is more often the deal breaker for me. I will also say you learn when to have very high expectations and when not too. With research and experience you can make any travel venture a great one. You just have to know what you getting into and have an open mind. That is why I love this site!

Reviews.Title: “no 5* experience and Green hair too!”
Reviews.Author: lesleymaui
Reviews.Content: If you scroll past the first page of reviews to the next several pages- start with October 18th reviewer from California-- and you will have a MORE ACCURATE picture of this resort. Bottom line, if they put you in a beautiful ocean view room, then great. BUT we got a room like the 10/18 folks, and it was very dismal before they changed us to an ocean view after complaint. I'm sorry , for 5* this place is more hype, just doesn't deliver! Here's an excerpt of my email to Marriott re our stay this past weekend : My husband, 6 year old daughter and I spent last weekend at this resort, in celebration of our 7th wedding anniversary. I booked through costco travel and paid in advance, as I wanted a car as well, not to mention the rooms were a better rate than using my marriott rewards membership and kamaaina discount. (Hawaii resident rate). When I checked in they asked for my 'costco voucher' ..as if they were insinuating the 'po folks' are here! And they were not friendly, no warm smile, no welcome to the Marriott, no happy anniversary. NOTHING> They managed to nearly ruin our weekend because from the instant we arrived the 'greeting' or should I say 'lack of', from valet and front desk was downright unfriendly. It is very difficult to find this resort, we got lost, we were hot and tired and irritable so we just wanted to shower and maybe use the pool before dinner. We realize check-in is NORMALLY 3 pm, even though we arrived at 2 pm we hoped to just get in our room right away. But we were told quite rudely that our room was still being cleaned & that check-in is 3 pm! and to go 'somewhere' and they'd call us on our cell phone. I asked if there was a hospitality room so we could change/clean up get bathing suits and find a pool, and was simply told NO. Since when???? Anyway we hauled our bags out to the pool area bar, ordered drinks and sweltered. We finally got our room, just before 3 pm, (SO MUCH for Mr.Marriott's clean room in 1/2 hour 'SOP' according to that book in the room.) First impression:pretty seafoam blue painted walls, pretty bedding, a long hall leading to huge beautiful bathroom. I entered bed area and saw the 'mountain view'-- in fact--looked down onto a very ugly rooftop (#638-why doesn't someone put potted palms and bouganvillea on that rooftop out there to at least make it look decent?!) ...our main view was 'kitty-corner' into another guest's room/balcony! HOW scenic is that??? I almost cried right then, this was a surprise weekend for my husband, and so far it was going from bad to worse. As I had mentioned when I booked that it was our Anniversary, I expected to see maybe some SMALL acknowledgement-hell even a dandelion in a wine jug would have showed SOMEBODY cared; APPARENTLY at this resort if you don't book 5 nights, you are merely considered a nuisance. (And believe me after 9-11 lHawaii hotels were begging for local business, I guess they don't 'need' us anymore? FACT: Just moments before, a guest checking in when I did was told she was getting a "complimentary upgrade to ocean view." Imagine her surprise? well Imagine MY surprise when I asked the girl helping me if we were possibly getting an ocean view room as I had requested when booking- she said It's $60 a night if YOU want it!" HOW rude is that??? So, very upset, I called the front desk, from my 'mountain view' room, I was eventually offered by a front desk manager the "LAST" ocean view room they had...(yeah right) #405 and believe me when they say LAST we believed it once we settled in-more like "last resort "ocean view", lol. ...well we took that room gratefully; at first it seemed great compared to that other room, much Brighter, same pretty blue walls, but definitely smaller (I think the other room was larger and had 2 televisions, probably to make up for lack of scenery??) same huge bathroom. But the view was part ocean part ROOFTOP (again!!!) only this time the roof of the Hokulea Bar! Ironically the MUSIC that played for hours that evening came not from there but from the pool deck area, right below us. We enjoyed it but eventually shut our doors/shutters. Also the AC was really erratic, hot then freezing too complicated to figure out on a short stay. After we settled in we determined to NOW enjoy our short weekend. Again, a NICE HUGE beautiful bathroom. Love it, good hairdryer, makeup mirror, lots of drawers. Like a cathedral BUT at the expense of decent sized beds and living area...try sleeping with your spouse in a double bed crammed against the closet door. OR the other one crammed between night table and window. Is a bathroom the size of an airplane hangar REALLY NECESSARY?? At half this size it would still be gorgeous. How about bigger beds? that would help. Our first disaster-upon opening the minibar cabinet to get some bottled water, the DOOR fell off it's obviously broken hinge and my husband grabbed it before it crashed to the floor or hit my child...I said Forget it, I'm not calling downstairs, if we complain they may throw us out on the street at this point. Well, later that evening while opening the VERY HEAVY glass shower door, it ALSO came off one hinge and was dangling and I had some time righting it before it hit me in the head! My husband (an engineer by the way) carefully set it back in place. It was apparent it had been repaired before. At dinnertime, as we prepared to go out, the maid came to FINALLY bring us ICE (no machines here- how ridiculous they do come check but once a day in our experience and a bit late!) we pointed out these door problems to her. She was shocked but told US to call for an engineer to fix it, we did not, assuming that SHE ?? would take care of that, being as this was our 'vacation' and we were heading out to dinner. And being as the front desk people had been SO RUDE when we checked in. We just decided to make the best of what time we had, use the tub. And leave the minibar cabinet door Open. Lastly: the chlorine in the pool turned my daughter's light blonde hair green. It is STILL streaked with green which I find very disturbing. Living on Maui, we go swimming several times a week at pools and that NEVER happens here. I don't know what they are putting in that water, and the fact that there is NO poolside shower is absurd, as well as the small size of the only pool for so many guests. So, I am very upset at the way we were treated, I thought this might be a place we could add to our list of favorites. We could just as easily have stayed on Maui and gone to the Wailea Outrigger or Grand Wailea, where they act as if they are HAPPY to see us! We just stayed at Anaheim Marriott for xmas last year and it was wonderful! Even my mom agrees the staff at Maui Hotels are nicer than Honolulu. anyway this resort has potential but NOT worth all the aggravation of getting there and the surly/unhappy staff you have to put up with. They make you feel like they really HATE their jobs and don't do any more than they have to. Hospitality biz? I gues they hate living out that way? or their commute must be a pain...I sent an email to Marriott last night, am hoping to hear from someone at Marriott ...This was an expensive weekend, and a special occasion and they really put a damper on our celebration. So much so, that we canceled our dinner reservations at their fine dining restaurant AZUL (VERY expensive) and went to ROY'S restaurant down the street instead! (and THEY actually sent us a complimentary dessert with HAPPY ANNIVERSARY FROM ROYS piped on it in chocolate.) We had their best champagne and didn't feel angry spending big bucks there at least! Maybe the IHILANI staff needs to be retrained by ROY...lol) Bottom line: I emailed Marriott last night and I called today and STILL have not received a call back re these issues. PS YES there are good things there: kid's program, scenery. fish taco poolside delicious, drinks good and about same cost as other resorts in Hawaii in our opinion and we go to hotels on weekends whenever we can. BUT still no 5 stars experience here!

Reviews.Title: “Second visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the Ihilani about nine years ago. To compare the two stays is very difficult as so much has changed. I am glad the Marriott corporation has kept the standard at the hotel so high, but it's not as wonderful as the Japanese group that operated it prior. This area is really beautiful. The amount of development is unbelievable. They plan a Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton hotel to be built soon. The spa is a must for your trip. Very restful and relaxing. The staff is friendly and helpful. Our only problem was NO coffee maker in the room, although there is free coffee in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely spot”
Reviews.Author: WarmthSeeker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a mountain view room for November 4-8, 2004. When we finally arrived (through pouring rain, in the dark, in horrible traffic) we found we had been upgraded to an ocean-view room. What a nice surprise! The room was gorgeous - muted tones, amazingly comfortable king bed, sumputous marble bathroom with separate toilet room, and a fabulous view. It took us a day or so to realize that our A/C and lights could be controlled through the telephone! We ate at the Japanese restaurant (way expensive) and the Napuka restaurant (twice), and by the pool twice. All the meals were delicious, and memorable. The grounds of the resort are picturesque; we saw half a dozen wedding parties during our 4 day stay. We saw many families, and wondered how they could afford to stay there! On both of our beach days they had posted jellyfish warning signs, but people were swimming anyway. We went in, and as luck would have it, I did get stung through my bathing suit. It was six little puncture wounds, not bleeding, and I left it alone and soon it didn't hurt any more. At its worst it felt like a mild abrasion. If you want to be outside the madness of Honolulu, but close enough to sample what it has to offer, this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Ihilani exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: travelwithSTP
Reviews.Content: To read more about our trip to Hawaii visit www.allsetinmass.blogs.com After a 10+ hour flight to Honolulu, we were eager to arrive at Ihilani – the first stop on our honeymoon. We hit terrible rush hour traffic on what was supposed to be about a 30 minute drive from the airport to the hotel (on the western side of the island) and were hot and exhausted when we finally drove through the gated entrance to the resort. Instantly, we knew that Ihilani would exceed our expectations (and many of the reviews we’d read). The lawns were perfectly manicured, the buildings freshly white washed, and the lobby constructed of elegant marble. But the view from our 8th floor room was the real treat. A large sliding glass door led to a spacious lanai with spectacular views of the pool and the hotel’s notorious three lagoons. We honestly couldn’t have asked for a better view. During our three night stay in the hotel, we often kept the sliding glass doors open, allowing fresh breezes to seep into the room. In the morning, we watched the sunlight illuminate the turquoise water in the lagoons, and in the evening, we enjoyed live music from poolside performances as we got ready to go out to dinner. The bedroom itself wasn’t huge, but it was certainly adequate - with modern beach decor (but not cheesy or cheap) and a feather king-sized bed that was extraordinarily comfortable. The bathroom was almost the size of the bedroom and featured a large tub and a marble stand-up shower (my husband’s favorite feature was the bench in the shower). The double sinks were a nice addition, although we predominantly used one of them to chill champagne. We ate at the Japanese restaurant the first night, and while it was certainly convenient, the food was pretty average. (Note to future travelers: We found out after the fact that a Roy's had just opened up around the corner - a MUCH better option). The breakfast breakfast included fresh local fruit and juices but otherwise wasn’t memorable. The good news was that the hotel was relatively affordable overall -- the full brunch was only between $20-25, and lunch at the hotel pool averaged between $10-15/sandwich. The hotel pool food was surprisingly delicious, but the real culinary highlight of the J.W. Marriot was the Pina Colada. This was literally the best Pina Colada we’ve ever had – rich and creamy with great flavor (and just the right amount of rum). We were also impressed with the resort's spa, which was located in a separate building across from the hotel. By signing up for a single spa treatment, you get free access to the entire facility, which includes a sauna, steam room with eucalyptus (incredibly soothing), whirlpool, and needle shower. The spa was definitely a fabulous way to relax, and the long list of treatments were unique and professional. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone who stays on Oahu. It's a bit out of the way, but it's tranquil and first-class in every respect. The staff is friendly, the guests enthusiastic, and the prices aren't completely obnoxious. The restaurants are the biggest drawback, but the ocean view rooms and nightly sunset strolls by the lagoons more than make up for it! To read more about our trip to Hawaii visit www.allsetinmass.blogs.com

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! This was my first time in Hawaii and I will never stay anywhere else in Oahu. If you like being around tons of people and all the action, this will not be your cup of tea. This resort was far removed from the touristy areas (Waikiki). I went from June 3-8, 2004. You definitely need to rent a car if you plan to explore the island. The second you exit the freeway, you see nothing but beautiful ,tall palm trees welcoming you into Ko Olina. I felt like I was entering Beverly Hills or something...I checked in around noon. There was a breathtaking view as you enter the lobby... The rooms were very spacious and they were more than I needed. The bathrooms were big as well. The service was excellent. Everyone was very friendly. I noticed a lot of families here. The lobby ladies' bathroom was my favorite. Great views from there. If you want a sneak peak of the resort, rent "Blue Crush." The girls in the movie work at this hotel. I found this out after I went. Kinda cool...I went with my mom and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to paradise!”
Reviews.Author: markthomas
Reviews.Content: This place is paradise! When you arrive into Honolulu your initial thoughts may be that you've landed in the midst of a mad, sprawling, city.... Then you'll take the freeway towards Ko Olina and wonder if you're heading out to the middle of nowhere - you'd be right! (it takes 20-25 minutes on a good day) Our room was huge - the bathroom was as big as our bedroom at home. The views over the shark pool, ray pool and the ocean was superb. The lagoon is perfect. The fly in the ointment was food. The choice was limited and expensive - but hey, it's a Marriott! In summary - this place is a little piece of paradise just outside madness in the middle of nowhere. Come here for some good R&R, not a jumping club scene. PS Don't wander around North of Ko Olina - unfortunately a small proportion of the locals don't like 'white people'!

Reviews.Title: “Love KoOlina”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our honeymoon and we stayed on 3 islands. This was one of the best hotels we stayed at. We were on our honeymoon and they upgraded our room to ocean view and sent up a bottle of wine. What ever we needed was at our service. They had the greatest lighting system on the phones which allowed you to make your room private without one of those signs on your door.. The bathroom wa beautiful and the tub was great for two!!! The room was very preety an spacious..The pool could have been better. it is only 3 feet deep. The food was okay except for the Japenese Restaurant which was great and not over priced.. The drinks at the pool were way to expensive and not worth it.. The lagoon was pretty and not to crowded. I like that it was out of the way it made it more relaxing. The grounds are perfect, the sunsets amazing and the over all look of the the hotel was great. The people who say that this is not a nice resort have no taste. If you do not have something just ask and you will receive..They are moer than willing to please you.. The front desk was very nice.. The ice thing was annoying but the brought it up within 5 mins. The 10.00 for the parking , well you get that everywhere you go and you have to option to self park. I recommend this hotel and will return again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: KlingonWarrior
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the JW Marriott in Ko Olina from August 11-17. Overall the experience was pleasant but but far from expected given the hype and the price. Our room was very spacious (in excess of 700 sq ft) but very dark because of its layout facing inward toward another wing of the building. The bathroom was very nice (marble and glass everywhere). The main problem was the lack of service. The maid only showed up once a day (usually early morning just in time to wake you up too early) and was told to return later; this happened every day so apparently they didn't recognize a pattern here. We asked for turn-down service on day one and this was done on day two ONLY. Sheets and pillowcases were not changed throughout the stay. Happily they were very good about refreshing the bathroom and towels. The bell-boy told us the maids would restock the ice-bucket twice a day with ice since there were no ice dispensers on the floors. This NEVER happeded. The one bright spot in service were the valet guys who were fast, courteous, and good with directions (pre-printed to all the major attractions!) The pool was small and populated with small children, definitely not a prime place for anyone over the age of twelve. Even worse, there was NO poolside service for drinks, either alcoholic or not! What kind of resort is this?! Needless to say there was no beach service of ANY kind. This lack of personal attention at the pool and beach is so glaring especially compared to the resorts in Mexico. Food is horrible and outrageously over-priced. I'm sure that if you asked, that most of these shortcomings could be met, but the point of an expensive, so-called 5-star resort, is that service, EXCELLENT SERVICE, should be a given, not a request. Our next trip to Honolulu will be at the Halekulani (rated #1 by many sources for service) even though the infrastructure may be somewhat old. Marriott, you need to get over the economy "Marriott" mindset if you want to play in the elite level.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room, Stunning lagoon, Terrible food.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here on business with a large group of people. All had similar experiences. Loved the room and view, very disappointed with food and dining choices. The Seafood Buffett was overpriced and not good. The Sushi Buffet was also not good. The room service menu was way overpriced ($50 for 2 Hamburgers). The pool bar stopped serving food at 8pm. (The bartenters were rather rude and short tempered.) We were all very frusterated by our dining experience. Only bright spot was Roy's, which we discovered on our last night there. I would only eat at Roys if I were to return. It was expensive but absolutely delicious. The Luau down the road at Paradise Cove was a real tourist trap and a rip off. I am not sure I would go back to this hotel , unless they improved the food and the serving hours. It appears they know they have you captive (due to their remote location) and don't really care. They have a stunning location, with an absolutely gorgeous lagoon. With the exception of the pool bartenters the rest of the staff was friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Very small pool and poor dining choices.”
Reviews.Author: PacificTraveler2012
Reviews.Content: As others have gushed about the hotel it is lovely and modern. The staff is good and the resort is well maintained. As this really is a destination type of hotel (it is well away from any other tourist activities) you will be largely limited by what the hotel has to offer. My number one issue with this property is that the pool is very small. It is no more than 4 feet deep and is circular in shape and about 40 feet in diameter. It is a very noisy pool because of the small deck area, the lack of heavy landscaping, and the proximity of the hotel building which reflects noise back to the pool area. For a true resort hotel, this pool is a major short comming. The artificial lagoon is lovely and safe for swimming. The hotel does not have any services on the beach though so you are on your own to fight over the limited chairs, drag them to your location etc. Few hotels have great restaurants. However, in this location you really rely on the hotel dining because there is so little else available in the area. We found the food disappointing and ordinary. This will change soon as Roy's (the infamous euro/asian fusian restaurant) is opening a branch down the street. While there have been a number of positive reviews about this resort in the past, and I dont doubt their sincerity, I feel that they are not adequately comparing this resort to what else is available. I suppose at some price point, the compromises at this resort make it worth it. I am not a traveler to compromise especially when it comes to the adequacy of the pool. If you are like me then you should not stay here. If the price is right and the compromise is acceptable, then you will enjoy this lovely resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great for couples and families”
Reviews.Author: LungdocNC
Reviews.Content: We spent our 25th anniversary here and had the time of our lives. We had 14th floor deluxe ocean view which was great(ocean, mountains, sunsets) ($359/night). Get breakfast package ($20 extra vs $42 +tax/tip without). Long promenade, clean open lagoons with pristine uncrowded beaches. We visited Waikiki and were so glad not to have stayed there. We had room service or ate at the moderatedly priced restaurant. Other restaurants at exit 3 or 7 if you want to save money. Excellent gym and spa. I ran into my cousin's husband there whom I hadn't seen in 27 years. They're local members and love the place. They recomment it to their families. I met a UH student at a ball game in Phoenix and she also recommends the place. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful place. We just returned from a one week stay. We began our vacation with a trip to the spa for some relaxation and an excellent massage. The perfect way to relax from a long flight. The room on the 16th floor with a partial ocean view was spectacular. Big, about 600 sq ft I was told. Some might be put off by the Campbell Industrial Park in the far distance, but I enjoyed watching the occassional cargo vessel coming and going, and at night the lights are quite pretty. The service was great. Friendly and professional. The food was great. I think I gained 5 lbs. The pool is a little on the small side, but the lagoon is fabulous. If jet planes bother you, you might not like this place as it is under the landing pattern to Honolulu International. But, the jets are still relatively high and quiet, and like the ships, I actually enjoyed watching them "float by" overhead. Honolulu is a short 30 minute drive (if traffic is moving). The sunset cruise was lovely. Capt. Doug and his crew were great fun. I also could go on and on..... And yes, we bought the time share too! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed one night at the jw marriott ihilani spa and resort after spending 8 nights in the North Shore - very nice accomodations. small pool crowded with children. huge bathroom and beautiful lanai. be aware - they charge for everything like $1.00 access charge on local telephone calls. has an honor bar but will charge you once you break open the seal. $10 parking fee daily. nice lagoons for families with children. pricey restaurants but that's to be expected in a resort. advise you to have your own car so that you can drive into Kapolei and they have so much more choices in restaurants and much cheaper like Zippy's, KFC, Taco Bell, Subway, etc... and also many other Japanese, Chinese and Hawaiian foods as well. be careful of the ocean front rooms - can be located in front of the pool and can be very noisy. we had the room facing the manta rays - very quiet area and was still able to see the ocean. would recommend this hotel based on price and the quality of service.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible stay at the Ihilani”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding on the Ihilani grounds at Paradise Cove. It was absolutely wonderful. We stayed in the "King's suite" and let me tell you, that's exactly how you felt while you were there, a King! This was the single most incredible hotel room we had ever stayed in. Breathtaking view of the cove, and every luxury you could imagine. If you have the means, be sure to do yourself a favor and visit the JW Marriott, you may never want to leave! Top notch in every aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Room!”
Reviews.Author: LenoreA
Reviews.Content: Came to this resort on business and was quite pleased. I was upgraded to a huge oceanview room with lanai, king bed, sitting area and marble bath with two marble sink vanities.
