Be aware that a more pricey oceanfront room overlooks the pool, the music and frolicking kids; makes for more noise. My more peaceful lanai overlooked a garden and the edge of the property. The other side is the home of the Paradise Cove Luau which hosts up to 600 a night. I only heard some loudspeaker noise but didn't drown out the waves. The hotel was built for the Japanese market & is clean and exquisite. My only complaint is that the breakfast buffet is very simple and the dinner food in the cafe is rather bland. Be prepared for high island prices. Other than that, the pool and beach met my expectations. The spa, tho' small, is clean and very beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful bathroom!!”
Reviews.Author: Sophie_Linn
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Hawaii & a stay at Ihilani. Beautiful resort with very nice rooms & the bathroom is great! You can have room service out on the lanai with white tablecloth & great food, but the price....$$$$$$. Buffet breakfast is very good & staff efficient, but not overly friendly. Pool is not large enough for such a big hotel & was overrun with kids running & jumping into the pool from all sides. They were not discouraged. Impossible for adults to enjoy the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in every respect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ko Olina during our honeymoon. Expedia messed up the date of our reservation but then the staff at Ko Olina not only honored it but then went a step further and upgraded us to a suite and then threw in breakfast for two. We were hesitant about staying here as we had read the Hawaii for Dummies book which complained about the service here. All of our meals were excellent...be early for breakfast though otherwise you may have to wait a bit. Prices were high but what do you expect at a resort in Hawaii...we found the service and quality were worth it. The beach here is an excellent place to swim and there was plenty of space for everyone without feeling crowded. Overall...we will definitely stay here in the future and recommend it for anyone going to Oahu instead of staying in Waikiki. Kudos to the front desk staff!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: MarkN
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a one week stay at the JW Marriot Ihilani Resort in Ko Olina. What a fabulous place. I can not say enough good things about the fantastic service and friendliness of the staff. I have travelled extensively for a long time and stay in over 100 hotels each year. The JW Marriott Ihilani Resort is among the top hotels I have ever stayed at in terms of room quality, cleanliness, service, and friendliness of staff. The hotel itself is approx 30 minutes of Honolulu, in an area that was/is to be developed as the next Kaanapali. That has'nt happened yet. There is only the JW Marriott and the adjacent timeshare hotel so far on the four man made lagoons. The lagoons are marvelous, provididng safe swimming and so-so snorkeling. And, unlike Waikiki, very uncrowded. The pool at the resort is not very large, but a simple circle that is only a meter deep. Fine for me. If you're looking for nightlife, this is not the place to go. The place is deserted by 10pm, with the pool bar closing at 8pm during the week, but the Holuke'a stays open till 11pm. To me, the only negatives were that there are no other fine dining restaurants in the area outside of the hotel. You need to venture into Honolulu for that. The onsite restaurants are excellent (three of them), but somewhat pricey (although everything is pricey here). We had an ocean view room on the fourth floor. The hotel offered to upgrade us to a higher floor, but I refused since I have a thing for heights. the room itself was spotless, and was very large. Wait till you see the bathroom (it's about as big as the bedroom). The bed was the most comfortable one I have ever slept in. Open the balcony doors to fall asleep to the ocean waves was heavenly. The view was spectactular, overlooking the pool and lagoon. The shark and ray pools were really cool. I have nothing really bad to say about this hotel. Fabulous! I will definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Our best vacation ever!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What an adventure! The four of us (my wife and I, 2 daughters, 10 and 13) thoroughly enjoyed every experience. Starting with top notch room service and food in the morning, beautiful surroundings during the day, and fine dining in the evening, we only wish that our stay was longer. We prearranged our daily excursions, and can highly recommend the paradise cove luau, which is just a short walk or shuttle ride from the hotel. Also a must do is the Ko'Olina Cat snorkel ride. Beautiful boat and great service. We have to give a tip of the hat to Capt. Todd and his crew. They put us right into the middle of an incredible school of dolphins and boy was the show all that you would hope for! I could go on and on... Suffice to say, the staff and facilities are 5 star, we will go back to enjoy them again ( I guess we have to, we bought into the time share!!) Our family highly recommends the whole experience, beautiful surroundings, great hotel, and NOT CROWDED, like downtown Honolulu. Just go! You will enjoy it too!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Jellyfish at the Ihilani”
Reviews.Author: dei4
Reviews.Content: We spent two days at the hotel in August 2003. The rooms are great, large and airy but, depending on which side of the hotel you stay you have a view of the construction site right next door. We loved the idea of the lagoons but the days we were there you could not swim in the water due to jellyfish! I don't think that was a "one off", has something to do with the cycle of the moon and tides so if you have young children that is something to ask about before booking. Japanese restaurant was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, peaceful setting”
Reviews.Author: dmouse
Reviews.Content: Such a beautiful, peaceful setting. We just got back a few days ago, and I could have stayed another week. The rooms are good-sized, the bathrooms are palatial. Everything is expensive, but this is not the Best Western. Service was very good, and the valets remembered our names! Even though it was the peak of high season, staff was relaxed and efficient. A thousand miles from Waikiki, it seemed. I don't think it's so bad getting around the island. We returned to "old haunts" around the North Shore (not to be missed: Giovanni's white shrimp truck at Kahuku) without rushing. Oahu is only so big. Yep, we bought the timeshare at the Ko Olina Beachclub. Can't wait to try the same location with a kitchen this time (then we can afford a second week!). Oh, for a reasonably priced dinner, try Jurison's in Kapolei. Creative, friendly and relaxed. Skip Chili's.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place, We'd do it again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ihalani Resort Feb. 18-21, 2004. The Resort and Spa were wonderful. The scenery was outstanding and the resort staff was magnificant. I'll start with the staff first. The resort staff can make or break your vacation. I have to say that the entire staff that we delt with was absolutely incredible. Friendly, helpful and most ccommodating and may I add, all were very polite. These are only a few complements I have about the resort staff. A+ on the people! The accommodations were very nice. The rooms were spacious and the view was incredible. We had a pool side room on the 4th floor with a great view of the pool area, the lagoon and the ocean. Noise was not a problem. Everything closes up by 10:00 at night and there was never a problem with outside noise after 10:00. A- on the room. If you stay on the pool side of the building, you may be able to see a refinery or something similar in the distance which really didn't fit in with the rest of the scenery but try and ignore it. With the rest of the beautiful scenery, we were able to look past one unplesent thing. We thought that the food was a bit overpriced but enjoyed the variety and taste. There are a few resturants about 3 miles away on the main road coming to the resort from Honolulu. We enjoyed the Catamaran sunset cocktail cruise as well. What a fun time and to see the beautiful sunset was wonderful. The golf course looked very nice although we didn't play this time.Would we recommend this resort to our friends and family? Most definately! We hope to return some day and enjoy, once again the people, the weather and the hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but expensive food and drink”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The service at this place is the best I have ever seen. Anything you need done is taken care of for you and everyone is so friendly and nice. The rooms were large and offered great views from the balconies. The only problem I had with this place was the price of their food. $4.00 for barely a 12 oz beer is a rip-off. If you eat dinner on the resort expect to pay at the minumum $90.00 for 2 people. The only thing worth eating at the resort was the breakfast buffet and at the poolside bar that served up some good food. We spent most evenings leaving the resort to eat dinner at other establishments that were less expensive and served better food.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Dream Property great for kids too!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous. Great property, with the hammerhead shark lagoons, the Hawaiin reef fish, the singrays, my sons loved our room, sharing a look over the lagoons and the ocean. We never noticed the maids come in, yet each evening we had a wonderful lei turndown service and fresh ice in the bucket, how they can do it.The lagoons are perfect for those with small kids. So peacefule away from the congestion of Waikkiki. This is the perfect escape and a perfect dream vacation.

HotelInfo.Name: JW Marriott Ihilani Resort and Spa
HotelInfo.Address: 92-1001 Olani Street, Kapolei, Oahu, HI 96707
